text: But when the husbandmen saw the son , they said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and let us seize on his inheritance .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa tsˈiaaⁿ quia ntyˈiaana jnda nquii patromˈñeeⁿ , jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : “ Luaaˈ jnda nquii patrom . Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ nnaaⁿˈaⁿ tyuaawaa . Cwa nlacua ̱ a ̱ ˈa jom cha nljo ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ lua ̱ a ̱ jaa . ”

text: And they caught him , and cast him out of the vineyard , and slew him .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈuena jom , tjeiiˈna jom nnom ntjom . Joˈ joˈ jlaˈcueeˈna jom .

text: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh , what will he do unto those husbandmen ?
text2: Quia joˈ taxˈee Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom : — Quia na nncwjeeˈnndaˈ nquii tsˈaⁿ na ˈnaaⁿˈ ntjomˈñeeⁿ , ¿ ljoˈ cwilatiuuˈyoˈ na nntsˈaaⁿ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa tsˈiaaⁿ nnom tyuaaⁿˈaⁿ ?

text: They say unto him , He will miserably destroy those wicked men , and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen , which shall render him the fruits in their seasons .
text2: Jluena nnoom : — Xocˈoom na wiˈ tsˈoom naⁿˈñeeⁿ , maxjeⁿ nntseicwjeⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ na jeeⁿ tia nnˈaⁿndyena . Ndoˈ nñequiaaⁿ ntjoomˈm luee ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na joo nñeˈquia na tantjom tyuaaⁿˈaⁿ quia na nncueˈ ntjom .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Did ye never read in the scriptures , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner : this is the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: Quia joˈ seineiⁿti Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ cwii ñˈoom na seijoomˈñe cheⁿnqueⁿ na tsjo ̱ ˈ na ya jom . Tsoom : — ¿ Aa tijoom ñejlaˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsonaˈ ? : Majuuto tsjo ̱ ˈ na tixocwilˈue nquiu luañe na cwilˈa tsiaⁿtsjo ̱ ˈ , jnda ̱ mawacatyeeⁿnaˈ nqui tsiaⁿtsjo ̱ ˈ . Nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom seijndaaˈñê na ljoˈ . Ndoˈ jeeⁿ cwijaaweeˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na cwintyˈiaaya na luaaˈ tuii .

text: Therefore say I unto you , The kingdom of God shall be taken from you , and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof .
text2: Joˈ chii candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , juu na laxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ nayaˈñeeⁿ lueeˈyoˈ , ndoˈ nñequiaaⁿ na ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ nlaxmaⁿna juunaˈ .

text: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken : but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Ndoˈ mati cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjo ̱ ˈwaaˈ na seina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na tileicatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na toomñe na tiooñe nacjooˈ tsjo ̱ ˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tsˈaⁿ na tiñeˈcatseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ maxjeⁿ nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ jom quia na nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nncuˈxeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ . Quia joˈ nntseijomnaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na tioo cwii tsjo ̱ ˈ tˈmaⁿ nacjooˈ na seitiuujnda ̱ a ̱ naˈ juu .

text: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables , they perceived that he spake of them .
text2: Ndoˈ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ fariseos , jnda ̱ na jndyena ñˈoom tjañoomˈmeiⁿˈ na seineiⁿ Jesús , jlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na cantyja ˈnaaⁿna tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ ñˈoomwaaˈ .

text: But when they sought to lay hands on him , they feared the multitude , because they took him for a prophet .
text2: Joˈ chii seijmeiⁿˈnaˈ joona na ñeˈcatˈuena jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ nquiaana nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye . Ee naⁿˈñeeⁿ cwitjeiiˈna cwenta na jom cwiluiiñê profeta .

text: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables , and said ,
text2: Cwiicheⁿ cwii ndiiˈ seineiⁿnndaˈ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ fariseos . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na :

text: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king , which made a marriage for his son ,
text2: — Juu na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nandye cañoomˈluee , matseijomnaˈ juunaˈ chaˈna cwii rey na tˈmaⁿ xuee sˈaa na ncoco tiˈjnda .

text: And sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding : and they would not come .
text2: Jñoom mosoomˈm na ˈoocaˈmaⁿna chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ jndye na nnquiolaˈjomndye . Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ tiñeˈquiontyjaaˈna .

text: Again , he sent forth other servants , saying , Tell them which are bidden , Behold , I have prepared my dinner : my oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready : come unto the marriage .
text2: Jñomnnaaⁿˈaⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ mosoomˈm , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : “ Canduˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tˈmaaⁿyâ na nlaˈjomndyena na jnda ̱ maya waa . Jnda ̱ seicwja ̱ quiooˈndyo ñequio ntˈom quiooˈ na jnda ̱ seicaˈma ̱ ⁿ . Chaˈtso jnda ̱ teiñˈoomˈ , joˈ chii quiona na nlaˈjomndyena na macoco tiˈjndaaya . ”

text: But they made light of it , and went their ways , one to his farm , another to his merchandise :
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ na tyˈecwaⁿ mosoomˈm tîcalanˈoomˈndyena jom . Tyˈena tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿna . Cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tjaaⁿ ranchoomˈm . Cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tjaaⁿ , tjacajna ̱ a ̱ ⁿ ˈnaⁿ .

text: And the remnant took his servants , and entreated them spitefully , and slew them .
text2: Ndoˈ ntˈom naⁿˈñeeⁿ tˈuena mosoomˈm , cwajndii tjaaˈna joo hasta jlaˈcwjeena mosoˈñeeⁿ .

text: But when the king heard thereof , he was wroth : and he sent forth his armies , and destroyed those murderers , and burned up their city .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii reyˈñeeⁿ chiuu tjoom mosoomˈm jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ seiliooˈñê . Jñoom sondaro ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na cˈoolaˈcwjee nnˈaⁿ na lˈa nata ̱ ˈ mosoomˈm . Ndoˈ nlaˈcona tsjoom naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then saith he to his servants , The wedding is ready , but they which were bidden were not worthy .
text2: Ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈom mosoomˈm : “ Jnda ̱ teijndaaˈya chaˈtso cantyja na nleitˈmaaⁿˈ na nncoco tiˈjndaaya sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tqua ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa na nlaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , tacatsonaˈ na cwii nntseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ joona .

text: Go ye therefore into the highways , and as many as ye shall find , bid to the marriage .
text2: Jeˈ catsaˈyoˈ nqui nantaa ntˈmaⁿ , joˈ joˈ caˈmaⁿˈyoˈ ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ na nliuˈyoˈ , canduˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na na quiontyjaaˈna ja na macoco tiˈjndaaya . ”

text: So those servants went out into the highways , and gathered together all as many as they found , both bad and good : and the wedding was furnished with guests .
text2: Quia joˈ jluiˈ mosoˈñeeⁿ tyoˈoona nqui nantaa . Jlaˈtjomna chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na jliuna . Ñˈeeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na tia nnˈaⁿndye ndoˈ ñˈeeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na ya nnˈaⁿndye . Ndoˈ laaˈtiˈ seicatooˈnaˈ wˈaa ñequio nnˈaⁿ na jlaˈjomndye na toco jnda reyˈñeeⁿ .

text: And when the king came in to see the guests , he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment :
text2: ’ Jnda ̱ chii tjaquieeˈ rey quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na nncwaaⁿ joona . Ljeiiⁿ ñˈeⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na ticwee liaa chaˈxjeⁿ liaa cwicweeˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye quia na macoco tsˈaⁿ .

text: And he saith unto him , Friend , how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment ? And he was speechless .
text2: Tsoom nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ ˈU re , ¿ chiuu tuiiyuu na jndyoˈtseiˈjomndyuˈ ndoˈ ticweˈ liaa chaˈxjeⁿ na cwicweeˈ nnˈaⁿ quia na macoco tsˈaⁿ ? ” Sa ̱ a ̱ tîcanda ̱ a ̱ nncˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then said the king to the servants , Bind him hand and foot , and take him away , and cast him into outer darkness ; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Quia joˈ nquii rey tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ mosoomˈm : “ Calatyeⁿˈyoˈ ncˈeeⁿ ñequio lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Catjeiˈyoˈ jom chˈeⁿ yuu na jaaⁿñe . Joˈ joˈ nntyˈioom ndoˈ nneiⁿnqueeⁿ ndeiˈnˈoom . ”

text: For many are called , but few are chosen .
text2: Seintycwii Jesús ñˈoom , luaa tsoom : — Majndyendye nnˈaⁿ mˈaⁿ na macwaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , sa ̱ a ̱ tijndye nnˈaⁿ na macwjiiˈñê cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Then went the Pharisees , and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk .
text2: Quia joˈ tyˈe nnˈaⁿ fariseos , tyoˈmaⁿ cheⁿnquieena chiuu ya nlˈana na nncˈomna jom ñequio ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ .

text: And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians , saying , Master , we know that thou art true , and teachest the way of God in truth , neither carest thou for any man : for thou regardest not the person of men .
text2: Joˈ chii jñoomna nnˈaⁿ ˈnaaⁿna ñequio ntˈom nnˈaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ Herodes na cˈootaˈjndoondyena Jesús . Tyˈe naⁿˈñeeⁿ , jluena : — ˈU Maestro , manquiuuyâ na ˈu tsˈaⁿ na xcweeˈ tsˈomˈ , ndoˈ tiquiquiuˈnnˈaⁿˈ ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ natooˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ mati meiⁿ tjaa na cochˈeenaˈ ˈu ljoˈ cwilaˈtiuu nnˈaⁿ oo meiⁿljoˈcheⁿ na cwiluiindyena .

text: Tell us therefore , What thinkest thou ? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar , or not ?
text2: Catsuˈ nndya ̱ a ̱ yâ . Chiuu matseiˈtiuuˈ : ¿ Aa matyˈiomnaˈ na catio ̱ o ̱ ⁿya tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ ya nnom tsaⁿmatsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ tsjoom Roma , oo aa ticatyˈiomnaˈ ?

text: But Jesus perceived their wickedness , and said , Why tempt ye me , ye hypocrites ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Jesús seiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ natia na cwilaˈtiuuna . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu na ñeˈcalˈaˈyoˈ xjeⁿ ja , ˈo nnˈaⁿ na tixcwe cwitsamˈaⁿˈyoˈ ?

text: Shew me the tribute money . And they brought unto him a penny .
text2: Catˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿ na cwitiomˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Quia joˈ tjeiiˈna cwii denario , tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿna juunaˈ nnoom .

text: And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ?
text2: Jnda ̱ na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ ˈndyoonnom ñoom nacjooˈ tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿwaa ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ xueeˈ ljeiimeiiⁿ ?

text: They say unto him , Caesar ' s . Then saith he unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar ' s ; and unto God the things that are God ' s .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — ˈNdyoonnom tsaⁿmatsˈiaaⁿ luaaˈ ndoˈ xueⁿˈeⁿ ñoom . Quia joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catiomˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ nnom tsaⁿmatsˈiaaⁿ yuu na tseixmaⁿnaˈ na nncoˈñoom . Ndoˈ quiaˈyoˈ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom yuu na tseixmaⁿnaˈ cwentaaˈ nqueⁿ .

text: When they had heard these words , they marvelled , and left him , and went their way .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndyena na luaaˈ , jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ tjaweeˈ nˈomna . Mana ˈndyena jom , tyˈena .

text: The same day came to him the Sadducees , which say that there is no resurrection , and asked him ,
text2: Mañejuu xueeˈñeeⁿ tquieˈcañom nnˈaⁿ saduceos na mˈaaⁿ Jesús . Nnˈaⁿ saduceos cwilaˈyuˈtyeⁿna na xocatandoˈnndaˈ nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ . Joˈ chii jluena cwii ñˈoom nnoom :

text: Saying , Master , Moses said , If a man die , having no children , his brother shall marry his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: — ˈU Maestro , waa ñˈoom na ˈndii Moisés lua ̱ a ̱ ya na matsonaˈ xeⁿ tueˈ cwii tsaⁿsˈa ndoˈ tjaaˈnaⁿ ntseinaaⁿ , quia joˈ tyjee tsˈooˈñeeⁿ cocoom ñˈeⁿ scuuˈ xioom . Nncˈom ntseinaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ yuscuˈñeeⁿ cha nntseinoomñê na tjaa ntseinda xioom tˈom .

text: Now there were with us seven brethren : and the first , when he had married a wife , deceased , and , having no issue , left his wife unto his brother :
text2: Ndoˈ quiiˈntaaⁿ jâ tyomˈaⁿ ntquieeˈ naⁿnom na ñenquii tsˈaⁿ ntseinda . Juu tsaⁿtquiee tocoom , ndoˈ tyuaaˈ tueeⁿˈeⁿ . Tjaaˈnaⁿ ntseinaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ scoomˈm . Quia joˈ ljoñe scoomˈm lˈo ̱ tiˈtyjeeⁿ .

text: Likewise the second also , and the third , unto the seventh .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ majoˈti tjom tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ we , tjaaˈnaⁿ ndana ñˈeⁿ yuscuˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ tueeⁿˈeⁿ . Mati tjom tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ndyee ndoˈ malaaˈtiˈ hasta tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ntquieeˈ .

text: And last of all the woman died also .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ tja ̱ chaˈtsondye naⁿˈñeeⁿ mati tueˈ yuscu .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven ? for they all had her .
text2: Joˈ na ñeˈcataˈxˈa ̱ a ̱ yâ njomˈ , Ta , quia na nntandoˈxco nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ , ¿ cwaaⁿ cwii na ntquieeˈndye joona scuuˈ jom ? Ee jom ñetˈoom scuu chaˈtsondye naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Ye do err , not knowing the scriptures , nor the power of God .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO tixcwe cwitjeiˈyoˈ cwenta , ee meiiⁿ na cwilaˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na waa sa ̱ a ̱ ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljoˈ maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ meiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ .

text: For in the resurrection they neither marry , nor are given in marriage , but are as the angels of God in heaven .
text2: Ee quia na nntandoˈxco nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ , taxocunconndaˈna , meiⁿ naⁿnom , meiⁿ naⁿlcu . Ee quia joˈ nlaˈxmaⁿna chaˈna ángeles na mˈaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: But as touching the resurrection of the dead , have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God , saying ,
text2: Ndoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na nntandoˈxco nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ , ¿ aa tijoom ñejlaˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ? Luaa matsoom :

text: I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? God is not the God of the dead , but of the living .
text2: “ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaaˈ Abraham , ndoˈ Isaac , ndoˈ Jacob . ” Joˈ chii caliuˈyoˈ na cwitaˈndoˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ ee jom cwiluiiñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaa nnˈaⁿ na cwitaˈndoˈ , nchii cwentaa lˈoo .

text: And when the multitude heard this , they were astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye , quia na jndyena ñˈoommeiⁿˈ na tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , jeeⁿ tjaweeˈ nˈomna .

text: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence , they were gathered together .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndye nnˈaⁿ fariseos na jnda ̱ seicheⁿ Jesús nnˈaⁿ saduceos , quia joˈ jlaˈtjomndyena .

text: Then one of them , which was a lawyer , asked him a question , tempting him , and saying ,
text2: Ndoˈ cwiindye joona , tsˈaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés taˈxˈeeⁿ cwii ñˈoom nnom Jesús cha catˈuiinaˈ juu . Tsoom :

text: Master , which is the great commandment in the law ?
text2: — ˈU Maestro , naquiiˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na tqueⁿ Moisés , ¿ cwaaⁿ ñˈoom na tˈmati cwiluiiñenaˈ ?

text: Jesus said unto him , Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom : — “ Cˈoomˈ na candyaˈ tsˈomˈ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaˈ , ñequio na xcweeˈya tsˈomˈ , ñequio chaˈwaa na jnda ntyjiˈ , ndoˈ ñequio chaˈwaa na jndo ̱ ˈya tsˈomˈ . ”

text: This is the first and great commandment .
text2: Ñˈoomwaaˈ jndati tseixmaⁿnaˈ ndoˈ tˈmaⁿti matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ .

text: And the second is like unto it , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: Ndoˈ ñˈoom na jnda ̱ we matseijomnaˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ , luaa matsonaˈ : “ Cˈoomˈ na wiˈ tsˈomˈ xˈiaˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na jnda ntyjiˈ ñequio nncuˈ . ”

text: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets .
text2: We ñˈoommeiⁿˈ laxmaⁿnaˈ xˈee chaˈtso ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio ñˈoom na tyoñeˈquia profetas .

text: While the Pharisees were gathered together , Jesus asked them ,
text2: Yocheⁿ na tyootˈoomˈndye nnˈaⁿ fariseos , taxˈee Jesús cwii ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: Saying , What think ye of Christ ? whose son is he ? They say unto him , The Son of David .
text2: Tsoom : — ¿ Chiuu cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nquii na cwiluiiñe Cristo ? ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ jnda jom ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — Nluiiñê tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ .

text: He saith unto them , How then doth David in spirit call him Lord , saying ,
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mayuuˈ . Ndoˈ nquii David , ncˈe na tˈmo ̱ ⁿ Espíritu Santo naquiiˈ tsˈoom seiljeiⁿ cwii ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Cristo . Tsoom na juu cwiluiiñe na matsa ̱ ˈntjom jom . ¿ Ljoˈ maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na luaaˈ tsoom ? ee seiljeiⁿ :

text: The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool ?
text2: Nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsoom nnom juu Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom ja : “ Cajmaⁿˈ ntyjaaˈa ntyjaya yuu na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ˈu hasta xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ tsa ̱ ˈa nnˈaⁿ na jndoo ˈu na cˈomna nacje ˈnaⁿˈ . ”

text: If David then call him Lord , how is he his son ?
text2: Ncˈe na luaaˈ matso ljeiiˈñeeⁿ , joˈ mawaxˈa ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : “ ¿ Chiuu waayuu na cwiluiiñe Cristo tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ ee manquiiti David tsoom na juu cwiluiiñe Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom jom ? ”

text: And no man was able to answer him a word , neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwiindye joona tîcanda ̱ a ̱ nncˈo ̱ ˈñom meiⁿ ñeˈcwii ˈndyoo ñˈoom . Ndoˈ xuee na tja tjatinaˈ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ tîcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈ tsˈom na nncwaxˈeeti ñˈoom ˈñom .

text: Then spake Jesus to the multitude , and to his disciples ,
text2: Quia joˈ seineiⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye ñequio nda ̱ a ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , tsoom :

text: Saying , The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses ' seat :
text2: — Nquiee nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio nnˈaⁿ fariseos toˈñoomna tsˈiaaⁿ na ñeseixmaⁿ Moisés na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿna ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ .

text: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe , that observe and do ; but do not ye after their works : for they say , and do not .
text2: Joˈ chii queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta ñˈoom na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿna . Ndoˈ calˈaˈyoˈ chaˈtso na cwitsa ̱ ˈntjomna na calˈaˈyoˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tintsantyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ chaˈna cwilˈana , ee joona ya ñˈoom cwiñeˈquiana sa ̱ a ̱ nquieena ñoomñoom na cwilˈana .

text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne , and lay them on men ' s shoulders ; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers .
text2: Ee joona cwiqueⁿna ñˈoom na jndeiˈnaˈ na catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñe tsˈaⁿ . Matseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom cwilaˈtyeⁿna cwii xuu na jaaˈ na cwitioona cantyaˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nquieena nchaaˈ lˈuu nntiiˈndyena meiiⁿ ñeˈcwii nda ̱ a ̱ lueena na nnteiˈjndeiina naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: But all their works they do for to be seen of men : they make broad their phylacteries , and enlarge the borders of their garments ,
text2: Chaˈtso na cwilˈana lˈue nˈomna na cantyˈiaa nnˈaⁿ . Ee cwilˈana na jeeⁿ ntmeiⁿ ntjaⁿ na chuuˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwiwityeⁿ cantaana ñequio lueena . Ndoˈ mati teincooti nmaⁿ ˈndyoo liaateincoo na cwicweeˈna nchiiti liaa ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ .

text: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts , and the chief seats in the synagogues ,
text2: Cwiqueⁿ nˈomna na nquieena nncwindyuaandyena nacañoomticheⁿ quia na cwiweeˈ ncuee . Ndoˈ naquiiˈ lanˈom cwilaˈyuunda ̱ a ̱ na ntsula ̱ nacañoomcheⁿ yuu na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñetinaˈ joona .

text: And greetings in the markets , and to be called of men , Rabbi , Rabbi .
text2: Jeeⁿ cjaaweeˈ nˈomna na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ joona quia cwiwincwindyena tsˈom nataa yuu na jndooˈ nnˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ lˈue nˈomna na nlue nnˈaⁿ na maestro joona .

text: But be not ye called Rabbi : for one is your Master , even Christ ; and all ye are brethren .
text2: ’ Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo ticalˈueendyoˈ na nlue nnˈaⁿ na maestro ˈo ee chaˈtsondyoˈ ñecwii tmaaⁿˈ cwilaxmaⁿˈyoˈ ndoˈ ñecwii na cwiluiiñe Maestro ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ , juu Cristo .

text: And call no man your father upon the earth : for one is your Father , which is in heaven .
text2: Meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue ticalatˈmaaⁿˈndyoˈ na nnduˈyoˈ nnom na tsotyeˈyoˈ juu chaˈna quinduˈyoˈ na Tsotyeˈyoˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ee ñeˈcwii mˈaaⁿ na cwiluiiñe Tsotyeˈyoˈ , nqueⁿ na mˈaaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: Neither be ye called masters : for one is your Master , even Christ .
text2: Ndoˈ meiⁿ tiñeˈquiandyoˈ na nlue nnˈaⁿ na ˈo cwitsajndyeeˈyoˈ ee ñecwii mˈaaⁿ na wjaajndyee jo nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , nquii Cristo .

text: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant .
text2: Juu tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiitˈmaⁿñeti quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ maxjeⁿ matsonaˈ na candiˈntjoom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased ; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiwendyeñe cheⁿnquii , maxjeⁿ nntseiquioo Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na majuˈñecje , maxjeⁿ nntseiwe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: But woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye shut up the kingdom of heaven against men : for ye neither go in yourselves , neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ ee cwilaˈñˈeeⁿˈndyoˈ nnˈaⁿ cha xocanda ̱ a ̱ nncˈooquieeˈndyena cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ncjoˈyoˈ tiñeˈcatsaquieeˈndyoˈ na jom nntsa ̱ ˈntjoom ˈo , meiⁿ tiñeˈquiaˈyoˈ na nncˈooquieeˈndye ntˈom ncˈiaˈyoˈ cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayer : therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ . ˈO mantyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ ˈnaaⁿ lˈoo na cweˈ ñeˈcatjeiˈtoˈyoˈ luee yolcu na jnda ̱ tja ̱ sˈaa . Sa ̱ a ̱ majuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ teincoo ñˈoom cwilaneiⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha ticaˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na wiˈndyoˈ . Cweˈ joˈ na tˈmaⁿti nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ ˈo quia na nncuˈxeeⁿ ˈo .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte , and when he is made , ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ . ˈO jeeⁿ tquia maˈnomˈyoˈ hasta ndaaluee cwiwityˈiooˈyoˈ na cwilˈueˈyoˈ meiiⁿ ñeˈcwii tsˈaⁿ na nntseijomñe ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ lˈaˈyoˈ na wjaantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chaˈna cwilˈaˈyoˈ quia joˈ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na cwajndiiti nntsˈaaⁿ . Ndoˈ na ljoˈ , tˈmaⁿti nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ jom quiiˈ bˈio , nchiiti ˈo .

text: Woe unto you , ye blind guides , which say , Whosoever shall swear by the temple , it is nothing ; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple , he is a debtor !
text2: ’ Ndoˈ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ , mati nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee laxmaⁿˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom nchjaaⁿˈyoˈ . Cwinduˈyoˈ tityeⁿ ñˈoom na maqueⁿtyeⁿ tsˈaⁿ nacjoomˈm quia na macwjeeⁿˈeⁿ xueeˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tyeⁿti ñˈoom na nncwjiˈ tsˈaⁿ xueeˈ sˈom cajaⁿ na ñˈeⁿ teichjoomnaˈ .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gold , or the temple that sanctifieth the gold ?
text2: ˈO jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ ntjeiⁿndyoˈ , laxmaⁿˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿˈyoˈ . ¿ Cwaaⁿ cwii na we nmeiⁿˈ tˈmaⁿti tseixmaⁿnaˈ ? ¿ Aa sˈom cajaⁿ na ñˈeⁿ teichjoom watsˈom oo aa nquii watsˈom ? Juu watsˈom tˈmaⁿti tseixmaⁿnaˈ ee cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juunaˈ maqueⁿljuˈnaˈ sˈom cajaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And , Whosoever shall swear by the altar , it is nothing ; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it , he is guilty .
text2: Mati cwinduˈyoˈ na tityeⁿ ñˈoom na cweˈ xueeˈ tio naquiiˈ watsˈom nncwjiˈ tsˈaⁿ . Tyeⁿti ñˈoom cwinduˈyoˈ quia na nncwjiˈ tsˈaⁿ xueeˈ seii quiooˈ na cwitioo nnˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Ye fools and blind : for whether is greater , the gift , or the altar that sanctifieth the gift ?
text2: ˈO jeeⁿcheⁿ nchjaaⁿˈyoˈ . ¿ Cwaaⁿ na we nmeiⁿˈ tˈmaⁿti tseixmaⁿnaˈ ? ¿ Aa seii quiooˈ na cwitioo nnˈaⁿ nacjooˈ tio , oo aa juu tio ? Tˈmaⁿti tseixmaⁿ nquii tio yuu na cwicantyjo seiˈñeeⁿ ee ncˈe juunaˈ maqueⁿljuˈnaˈ seiˈ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nncoˈñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar , sweareth by it , and by all things thereon .
text2: Ee tsˈaⁿ na maqueⁿtyeⁿ cwii ñˈoom nacjooˈ nquii na macwjiˈ xueeˈ tio naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , nchii macanda ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tioˈñeeⁿ maqueⁿtyeⁿ ñˈoom , maxjeⁿ mawˈatˈmaⁿtonaˈ chaˈtso ˈnaⁿ na cwicantyjo nacjooˈnaˈ .

text: And whoso shall swear by the temple , sweareth by it , and by him that dwelleth therein .
text2: Ndoˈ juu tsˈaⁿ na maqueⁿtyeⁿ cwii ñˈoom nacjooˈ nquii na macwjiˈ xueeˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , nchii macanda ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juunaˈ maqueⁿtyeⁿ ñˈoom , maxjeⁿ mañˈoomnaˈ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ee jom macˈeeⁿ joˈ joˈ .

text: And he that shall swear by heaven , sweareth by the throne of God , and by him that sitteth thereon .
text2: Ndoˈ juu tsˈaⁿ na maqueⁿtyeⁿ cwii ñˈoom nacjooˈ nquii na macwjiˈ xueeˈ cañoomˈluee nchii macanda ̱ cweˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ cañoomˈluee maqueⁿtyeⁿ ñˈoom , maxjeⁿ mañˈoomnaˈ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñequio tio yuu na mawacatyeeⁿ .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin , and have omitted the weightier matters of the law , judgment , mercy , and faith : these ought ye to have done , and not to leave the other undone .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ . Ee cwiñeˈquiaˈyoˈ diezmo cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwiweˈ ntjoomˈyoˈ hasta meiⁿ cweˈ tscojñom tsˈoomjndya ñequio tscolcoo ñequio lqueeⁿ cameiⁿnom sa ̱ a ̱ ticalacanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na tˈmaⁿti naquiiˈ ñˈoom na tqueⁿ Moisés . Ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ chiuu na cˈomˈyoˈ cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ ndoˈ cˈomˈyoˈ na wiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ ndoˈ calacanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na cwinduˈyoˈ . Maxjeⁿ matyˈiomyanaˈ na cwiñeˈquiaˈyoˈ diezmo sa ̱ a ̱ mati calacanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ na tˈmaⁿti na sa ̱ ˈntjom Moisés .

text: Ye blind guides , which strain at a gnat , and swallow a camel .
text2: Matseijomnaˈ ˈo chaˈna nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈcwˈaaⁿˈndye ndaatioo na cwiwe cha caˈndiinaˈ quiooˈ na cajnda ̱ a ̱ sa ̱ a ̱ tiqueⁿna cwenta na jo nandye njom cwii quiooˈ tˈmaaⁿñe na jaato ̱ ˈ . Ee jeeⁿ cwiqueⁿndyoˈ na ñeˈcalaˈcanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na niom nchˈunchˈu sa ̱ a ̱ tiñeˈcalaˈcanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na tˈmaⁿti na macaⁿnaˈ . Joˈ chii ˈo laxmaⁿˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ nato nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaˈyoˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ncjoˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom na nchjaaⁿˈyoˈ na tiñeˈcatsaˈjndyeeˈyoˈ natoˈñeeⁿ .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter , but within they are full of extortion and excess .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ ee yaya cwilaljuˈyoˈ naxeⁿˈ waso ñequio xio na cwiwilˈueeˈndyoˈ sa ̱ a ̱ tsˈomnaˈ cwajndii . Ee nantquie na cwicwaˈyoˈ cwicañjom joˈ , laˈxmaⁿnaˈ ˈnaaⁿ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ na cwintyˈueeˈyoˈ ee na tiñeˈqueⁿˈ cheⁿncjoˈyoˈ xjeⁿ na cwilaqueeⁿ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: Thou blind Pharisee , cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter , that the outside of them may be clean also .
text2: ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos cwiluiindyoˈ chaˈcwijom naⁿnchjaaⁿ . Cataˈndyoˈxcweˈyoˈ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom quia joˈ nntsˈaanaˈ chaˈcwijom na cwilaljuˈyoˈ tsˈom waso ñequio xio . Ndoˈ na ljoˈ nntseiljoyunaˈ na ljuˈ tsˈomnaˈ ñˈeⁿ naxeⁿˈnaˈ .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres , which indeed appear beautiful outward , but are within full of dead men ' s bones , and of all uncleanness .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ . Matseijomnaˈ ˈo chaˈna ndeiˈluaa na jeeⁿ canchiiˈ lˈa nnˈaⁿ , na cweˈ nacjooˈnaˈ nntyˈiaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na jeeⁿ neiⁿncooˈ sa ̱ a ̱ naquiiˈnaˈ tooˈ ndeii nnˈaⁿ ñequio chaˈtso nnom na tsˈiaaⁿ .

text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men , but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity .
text2: Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ee jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ ndooˈ xeⁿ matyˈiomyanaˈ ljoˈ cwilˈaˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ñenquiiˈcheⁿ na we waa na cwilˈaˈyoˈ ndoˈ tooˈñˈeⁿ mˈaaⁿ natia .

text: Woe unto you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! because ye build the tombs of the prophets , and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous ,
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñˈeⁿ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo ee cweˈ cwilˈaˈyaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya nnˈaⁿndyoˈ . Ee cwilˈaˈyoˈ ndeiˈluaa profetas ndoˈ cwilachjoomndyoˈ ndeiˈluaa ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na ñelˈa cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ .

text: And say , If we had been in the days of our fathers , we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii cwinduˈyoˈ : “ Xeⁿ jaa mamˈaaⁿya ncuee na ñetˈom welooya teiyo , tixocalajomndyo ̱ na jlaˈcwjeena profetas . ”

text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves , that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets .
text2: Ndoˈ na luaaˈ cwinduˈyoˈ cwitjeiˈyuuˈndyoˈ cheⁿncjoˈyoˈ ñˈoom nacjoˈyoˈ na ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ tsjaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿ nquiee nnˈaⁿ na tyolaˈcwjee profetas .

text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers .
text2: Joˈ chii calacanda ̱ ˈyoˈ chiuu waa na to ̱ ˈ jndyee nnˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ na tuiindyoˈ .

text: Ye serpents , ye generation of vipers , how can ye escape the damnation of hell ?
text2: ’ ˈO cwiluiindyoˈ chaˈcwijom nda canduulja na jeeⁿ tia cwilˈaˈyoˈ . Chiuu nlˈaˈyoˈyoˈ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nluiiˈndyoˈ nawiˈ na cwitjoom nnˈaⁿ na cwiˈoo bˈio .

text: Wherefore , behold , I send unto you prophets , and wise men , and scribes : and some of them ye shall kill and crucify ; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues , and persecute them from city to city :
text2: Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , ja njño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya profetas na nncˈom naquiiˈ ntaaⁿˈyoˈ ndoˈ na nlaˈneiⁿna cantyja na jndo ̱ ˈ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ na nntˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿna ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo nlaˈcwjeˈyoˈ cwantindye naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ ntˈom naⁿˈñeeⁿ nntyˈiomˈyoˈ nˈoomˈnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ ntˈom nntjaˈyoˈ naquiiˈ lanˈom ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ ntˈomndye joona nleiˈntyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ cwii ndoˈ cwii tsjoom .

text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth , from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias , whom ye slew between the temple and the altar .
text2: Joˈ chii choˈnqueⁿˈyoˈ jnaⁿ cantyja nawiˈ na nntjoom naⁿˈñeeⁿ , ndoˈ mati cantyja na tja ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na nchii jnaaⁿna hasta xjeⁿ na tuii tsjoomnancue . Nnaⁿnaˈ na waa jnaⁿˈyoˈ xjeⁿ na seicueeˈ Caín tyjeeⁿ Abel , tsaⁿ na tyotseixmaⁿ na matyˈiomyanaˈ , nndyowanaˈ hasta na tueˈ Zacarías jnda Berequías lˈa weloˈyoˈ xcwe quiiˈntaaⁿ tio tˈmaⁿ ñequio ta watsˈom .

text: Verily I say unto you , All these things shall come upon this generation .
text2: Nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , mayuuˈcheⁿ nntˈuiinaˈ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ jeˈ cantyja chaˈtso nawiˈmeiⁿˈ na tjoom naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , thou that killest the prophets , and stonest them which are sent unto thee , how often would I have gathered thy children together , even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings , and ye would not !
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ Jerusalén , cwilacwjeˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwiñeˈquia ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ cwijñomˈyoˈ ljo ̱ ˈ nnˈaⁿ na majñoom na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ . Majndye ndiiˈ ñentyjaaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na nntseitjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo na nncˈomˈyoˈ cwentaya chaˈxjeⁿ matseitjom caxtixquie ntseinaaⁿ nacjeeˈ ntsqueeⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo cwaaⁿ tquiandyoˈ .

text: Behold , your house is left unto you desolate .
text2: Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , maˈndii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈo . Taxocˈoomñê watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: For I say unto you , Ye shall not see me henceforth , till ye shall say , Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ na taxocantyˈiaˈyoˈ ja hasta na nncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nnduˈyoˈ : “ Matioˈnaaⁿñenaˈ nquii na macwjeeˈcañoom ñequio najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . ”

text: And Jesus went out , and departed from the temple : and his disciples came to him for to shew him the buildings of the temple .
text2: Jluiˈ Jesús watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na mawjaⁿ . Ndoˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê squieˈcaño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ jom . To ̱ o ̱ ˈâ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ chiuu waa na jeeⁿ neiⁿncooˈ lˈaa cwentaaˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ .

text: And Jesus said unto them , See ye not all these things ? verily I say unto you , There shall not be left here one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — ¿ Aa cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ ya chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ ? Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ na mayuuˈcheⁿ tixocaˈndiinaˈ cwii tsjo ̱ ˈ nacjooˈ xˈiaaˈnaˈ . Nntyuiiˈñˈeⁿ lˈaameiⁿˈ .

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives , the disciples came unto him privately , saying , Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign of thy coming , and of the end of the world ?
text2: Quia joˈ saayâ ta na jndyu Olivos . Ndoˈ quia jnda ̱ tacatyeeⁿ Jesús joˈ joˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê saantyjaaˈâ jom cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nlana ̱ a ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê na ñencjo ̱ o ̱ yâ . Lˈuuyâ : — Catsuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ cwaaⁿ nluii na nmeiiⁿˈ . Ndoˈ ¿ cwaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿ na nleitquiooˈ na mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na manndyoˈnndaˈ ndoˈ na nntycwii tsjoomnancue ?

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , Take heed that no man deceive you .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — Calˈaˈyoˈ cwenta na tjaa ˈñeeⁿ nnquiuˈnnˈaⁿ ˈo cantyja ˈnaaⁿ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Ee jndye nnˈaⁿ nñequiona ñequio xueya na nluena : “ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii Cristo ” , na nñeˈquioˈnnˈaⁿna nnˈaⁿ .

text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars : see that ye be not troubled : for all these things must come to pass , but the end is not yet .
text2: Ee nntyˈiaˈyoˈ na nndyocwjeeˈcañoom ntiaˈ ndoˈ nleicˈuaa ñˈoom na cwiluii ntiaˈ cwiicheⁿ ntyja . Sa ̱ a ̱ tiñeˈquiandyoˈ na nlacatyuendyoˈ ee maxjeⁿ jndeiˈnaˈ na nmeiⁿˈ cwinomjndyee . Sa ̱ a ̱ ndicwaⁿ tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntycwii tsjoomnancue .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be famines , and pestilences , and earthquakes , in divers places .
text2: Nlaˈwendye nnˈaⁿ cwii ndyuaa nacjoo nnˈaⁿ cwiicheⁿ ndyuaa . Ndoˈ cwii tsaⁿmatsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ nntseiweñê nacjooˈ cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿmatsˈiaaⁿ . Jndye joo nncˈoom jndoˈ tˈmaⁿ ndoˈ nnconom ntycu na wjaatcuuñenaˈ ndoˈ jndye jo jndeii nntsˈeii .

text: All these are the beginning of sorrows .
text2: Chaˈtso nawiˈmeiⁿˈ cweˈ weˈyandyo laˈxmaⁿnaˈ . Quia nlquieˈntyjo ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ nawiˈ na jaaˈti .

text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted , and shall kill you : and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name ' s sake .
text2: ’ Jndye nnˈaⁿ hasta ndiocheⁿ tsjoomnancue nncˈomna na jndoona ˈo ncˈe na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya . Joˈ na nlaˈquioo nnˈaⁿ ˈo luee nnˈaⁿ na nntaˈwiˈna ˈo , ndoˈ nlaˈcwjeena ˈo .

text: And then shall many be offended , and shall betray one another , and shall hate one another .
text2: Jndye nnˈaⁿ nntjeiiˈndyena cantyja na cwilaˈyuˈya nˈomna . Nncˈomna na jndoondye ntyjeena hasta na nlˈueeˈndyena ñˈoom na nntˈuiinaˈ ncˈiaana .

text: And many false prophets shall rise , and shall deceive many .
text2: Ndoˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ nluena na profeta joona sa ̱ a ̱ tiyuuˈ ñˈoom cwiñequiana . Ndoˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ nñeˈquioˈnnˈaⁿna .

text: And because iniquity shall abound , the love of many shall wax cold .
text2: Ndoˈ ncˈe na nncjaantyˈee nncjaantyˈee natia , juunaˈ nntsˈaanaˈ na tawiˈ nˈomndye ntyjeena .

text: But he that shall endure unto the end , the same shall be saved .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na tyeⁿ cwiljooˈñe cantyja ˈnaⁿya hasta na macanda ̱ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿñê .

text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations ; and then shall the end come .
text2: Chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue nncˈoo nnˈaⁿ na nñeˈquiana ñˈoom nayawaañe cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Juunaˈ nncwjiˈyuuˈñenaˈ chiuu calˈa nnˈaⁿ cwii cwii ndyuaa , quia ljoˈcheⁿ nncueˈntyjo ̱ na nntycwii tsjoomnancue .

text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation , spoken of by Daniel the prophet , stand in the holy place , ( whoso readeth , let him understand : )
text2: ’ ˈÑeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na matseiˈnaaⁿˈ ñˈoommeiiⁿ , catseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ ljoˈ ñecatsonaˈ . Juu profeta Daniel , seiljeiⁿ ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu na jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ tiaaˈ na nntseityuiiˈ chaˈtso . Quia na nntyˈiaˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ mamˈaaⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ yuu na ljuˈti na cwiluiiñenaˈ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ,

text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains :
text2: quia joˈ chaˈtsondyoˈ na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea catsaleiˈnomˈyoˈ quiiˈ ntsjo ̱ .

text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house :
text2: Juu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ ˈñeeⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ljo nacjooˈ waaˈ ticandyocueeⁿ na nncjaaqueⁿˈeⁿ joˈ na nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes .
text2: Ndoˈ tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ , na machˈee tsˈiaaⁿ , ticjaalcweeⁿˈeⁿ na nncjaacachoom liaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck in those days !
text2: Ndoˈ joo ncueeˈñeeⁿ jeeⁿ wiˈ nntjoom yolcu na ndeiindye ñequio yolcu na ˈndaandye ndana .

text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter , neither on the sabbath day :
text2: Calˈaˈyoˈ tyˈoo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nchii xcwe ncuee na teiⁿ , meiⁿ nchii xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ na nlcaⁿnaˈ na caleiˈnomˈyoˈ nawiˈñeeⁿ .

text: For then shall be great tribulation , such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time , no , nor ever shall be .
text2: Ee quia ljoˈcheⁿ nnquioo cwii nawiˈ na tˈmaⁿticheⁿ na meiⁿjom ndiiˈ tyootjoom nnˈaⁿ cantyjati xjeⁿ na tuii tsjoomnancue hasta jeˈ . Ndoˈ xuee na cwii wjaatinaˈ , meiⁿ tajom cwii nluiinndaˈ cwiicheⁿ nawiˈ chaˈna juunaˈ .

text: And except those days should be shortened , there should no flesh be saved : but for the elect ' s sake those days shall be shortened .
text2: Ndoˈ xeⁿ ticatsˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na tijndyeti xuee na nncˈoom nawiˈñeeⁿ quia joˈ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ xocaluiˈnˈmaaⁿñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe na wiˈ tsˈoom nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjeiiˈñê cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ , nntsˈaaⁿ na tijndyeti xuee na nncˈoom nawiˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then if any man shall say unto you , Lo , here is Christ , or there ; believe it not .
text2: ’ Joˈ chii xeⁿ nntso cwii tsˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : “ Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ ljo mˈaaⁿ nquii na cwiluiiñe Cristo ” , oo nntso tsˈaⁿ : “ Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ , laˈñeⁿ mˈaaⁿ ” , tilayuˈyoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: For there shall arise false Christs , and false prophets , and shall shew great signs and wonders ; insomuch that , if it were possible , they shall deceive the very elect .
text2: Ee maxjeⁿ nlquieˈcañom nnˈaⁿ ˈo na nluena joona cwiluiindyena Cristo . Ndoˈ nluena na profeta joona sa ̱ a ̱ tiyuuˈ ñˈoom na cwiñeˈquiana . Nlˈana jndye nnom ˈnaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ ñequio jndye nnom tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ na nncjaaweeˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ cha xeⁿ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nlˈana na nñequioˈnnˈaⁿna nnˈaⁿ na macwjiˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Behold , I have told you before .
text2: Matyuaaˈti matseicandiiya ˈo cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluii joonaˈ cha calˈaˈyoˈ cwenta .

text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you , Behold , he is in the desert ; go not forth : behold , he is in the secret chambers ; believe it not .
text2: Quia joˈ xeⁿ nlue nnˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : “ Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , laˈñeⁿ mˈaaⁿ ndyuaa yuu tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈoom ” , tintsaˈyoˈ joˈ joˈ . Ndoˈ xeⁿ na nluena : “ Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ , luaaˈ mˈaaⁿ naquiiˈ wˈaa ” , tilayuˈyoˈ na ljoˈ .

text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east , and shineth even unto the west ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Ee ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee quia na nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa nleitquiooˈndyo ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue , chaˈxjeⁿ na cwiwixuee chomtsuee yuu na macaluiˈ ñeˈquioomˈ hasta wjaantycwiinaˈ ntyja na majaacue ñeˈquioomˈ .

text: For wheresoever the carcase is , there will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nawiˈñeeⁿ na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ na nntjomˈyoˈ , maxjeⁿ ticwinomˈnaˈ ee queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , meiⁿyuucheⁿ na meindyuaa ˈnaⁿ to ̱ ˈ , joˈ joˈ nntjomndye cantˈeiⁿ .

text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened , and the moon shall not give her light , and the stars shall fall from heaven , and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken :
text2: ’ Quia na jnda ̱ teinomncue nawiˈ tˈmaⁿ ncueeˈñeeⁿ , nleijaaⁿñe ñeˈquioomˈ , ndoˈ mati chiˈ taxocwixueeñe . Nntquiaandye cancjuu . Ndoˈ chaˈtso na cwilaˈxmaⁿ najnda ̱ na mˈaⁿ tsjo ̱ ˈluee nntyuiiˈ .

text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven : and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn , and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory .
text2: Quia joˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , nleitquiooˈ ˈnaaⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya . Ndoˈ nntseityˈioonaˈ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue . Ee nntyˈiaana ja , tsaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na nluiiˈa joˈ joˈ . Nndyo ̱ cua ̱ naquiiˈ nchquiu ñequio najndeii na matseixmaⁿya ndoˈ ñequio na neiⁿncooˈ nacaxuee na cwiluiitˈmaⁿndyo ̱ .

text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet , and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds , from one end of heaven to the other .
text2: Ndoˈ njño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ángeles ˈnaⁿya na jndeii ntjo ̱ ˈna ndu na nncˈoona chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue , na nlaˈtjomna nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjeiiˈndyo ̱ cwentaya .

text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree ; When his branch is yet tender , and putteth forth leaves , ye know that summer is nigh :
text2: ’ Calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ˈnaaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈoom higuera . Quia na cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na cwinnteiˈ lˈo ̱ naˈ ndoˈ cwicaluiˈ tsco ˈndaa juunaˈ , quia joˈ cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na majnda ̱ jaawindyooˈ ncueesuaˈ .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall see all these things , know that it is near , even at the doors .
text2: Ndoˈ majoˈti quia na cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na cwiluii chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , quia joˈ calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ teindyooˈ mˈaaⁿnaˈ . Manncwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿnndaˈa .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass , till all these things be fulfilled .
text2: Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , mayuuˈcheⁿ na xocwjeñˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ jeˈ hasta xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ seicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ chaˈtso ñˈoommeiⁿˈ .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away , but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Tsjo ̱ ˈluee ñˈeⁿ tsjoomnancue nntycwiiñˈeⁿnaˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ñˈoom ˈnaⁿya tijoom xuee nntsˈaanaˈ na xotseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ .

text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man , no , not the angels of heaven , but my Father only .
text2: ’ Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ ticaljeii cwaaⁿ xuee ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ xjeⁿ na nluii chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ . Meiⁿ nquiee ángeles na mˈaⁿ cañoomˈluee ticaliuna , meiⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ticaljeiiya . Macanda ̱ ñenquiicheⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya ntyjeeⁿ .

text: But as the days of Noe were , so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: ’ Chaˈxjeⁿ na tyomˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ ncuee quia ñetˈoom Noé , maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na nlˈa nnˈaⁿ quia na nncwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking , marrying and giving in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark ,
text2: Ee ncueeˈñeeⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na seicatsuu ndaaluaˈntyˈa tsjoomnancue tyomˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Tyocwaˈna , tyowena , tyowuncona , tyoñeˈquiana ndana na nncˈunco hasta juu xuee quia na tjaquieeˈ Noé wˈaandaa tˈmaⁿ .

text: And knew not until the flood came , and took them all away ; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tiqueⁿna cwenta na waa na teincuuˈ hasta matsˈia joˈ tyjeeˈ ndaaluaˈntyˈa . Tyjeeˈ candaa , tjachuunaˈ chaˈtsondye naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na nntjoom nnˈaⁿ quia na nncwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: Then shall two be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Ee juu xueeˈñeeⁿ nntseijomnaˈ mˈaⁿ we nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa tsˈiaaⁿ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ . Cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na mˈaaⁿya ndoˈ cwii maˈndiinaˈ .

text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Nntseijomnaˈ mˈaⁿ we yolcu na cwitua . Cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na mˈaaⁿya ndoˈ cwii maˈndiinaˈ .

text: Watch therefore : for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come .
text2: ’ Joˈ chii ñequiiˈcheⁿ cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ ee na ticaliuˈyoˈ cwaaⁿ xuee nncwjeeˈcañoom nqueⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom ˈo .

text: But know this , that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come , he would have watched , and would not have suffered his house to be broken up .
text2: Ñˈoomwaa calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ : Xeⁿ ntyjii tsˈaⁿ cwaaⁿ nlquie naⁿcantyˈue waⁿˈaⁿ , tixocatsom meiⁿ xonquiaaⁿ na nncˈooquieˈna na nntjeiiˈna ˈnaⁿ .

text: Therefore be ye also ready : for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh .
text2: Joˈ chii mati ˈo cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ ee juu xjeⁿ na ticalaˈtiuuˈyoˈ , majuuto xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ nncwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: Who then is a faithful and wise servant , whom his lord hath made ruler over his household , to give them meat in due season ?
text2: ’ Calˈuu mˈaaⁿ cwii moso na jndo ̱ ˈ tsˈom ndoˈ matseicanda ̱ , jom nlcoˈjndyee patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na catsa ̱ ˈntjoom chaˈtso ntˈomcheⁿ moso wˈaaˈñeeⁿ na nñequiaaⁿ nantquie nda ̱ a ̱ na quia na maweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ .

text: Blessed is that servant , whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing .
text2: Quia na nncwjeeˈ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na tja cwii joo ndoˈ nljeii na jeeⁿ ya cwenta machˈeeⁿ , tˈmaⁿ nñequiaanaˈ na neiiⁿˈ .

text: Verily I say unto you , That he shall make him ruler over all his goods .
text2: Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , mayuuˈcheⁿ na chaˈtso ˈnaⁿ na matseixmaⁿ patromˈñeeⁿ , nntioom cwenta lˈo ̱ mosoomˈm .

text: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart , My lord delayeth his coming ;
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ calˈuu na juu mosoˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê na tia tsˈaⁿñê ndoˈ nntseitioom naquiiˈ tsˈoom na taxocwjeeˈ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na tyuaaˈ ,

text: And shall begin to smite his fellowservants , and to eat and drink with the drunken ;
text2: ndoˈ nnto ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na nncwjaaⁿˈaⁿ ntyjemosoñe na mˈaⁿ nacje ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Nlcwaˈjndooˈñê ndoˈ nntseijomñê nncˈom ñequio naⁿcandyee .

text: The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him , and in an hour that he is not aware of ,
text2: Matsˈia joˈ nncwjeeˈ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ cwii xuee na ticˈomcˈeⁿ ndoˈ hora na ticatseitioom na nncwjeeˈ .

text: And shall cut him asunder , and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Cwajndii nntseiseiˈ patrom jom , jnda ̱ nncjuˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jom yuu na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cweˈ cwilˈaya na ya nnˈaⁿndye . Joˈ joˈ nntyˈioom ndoˈ nneiⁿnqueeⁿ ndeiˈnˈoom .

text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins , which took their lamps , and went forth to meet the bridegroom .
text2: ’ Seineiⁿti Jesús ñˈoom tjañoomˈ cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cañoomˈluee . Tsoom : — Tyomˈaⁿ qui yolcundyua tyˈechona xjocanti ˈnaaⁿna na ntyjo chom na cwico seitye . Jluiˈna , tyˈecatjomndyena juu tsaⁿsˈa na macoco .

text: And five of them were wise , and five were foolish .
text2: ˈOmndye joona tijndo ̱ ˈ nˈomna ndoˈ ˈomndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ majndo ̱ ˈ nˈomna .

text: They that were foolish took their lamps , and took no oil with them :
text2: Joo yolcu na tijndo ̱ ˈ nˈom quia na tyˈechona xjocanti ˈnaaⁿna , taticˈoochotina seitye na nlco .

text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ yolcu na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom tyˈechona xjocanti ˈnaaⁿna na ntyjo chom ndi ñˈeeⁿ lioo na ñjomti seitye .

text: While the bridegroom tarried , they all slumbered and slept .
text2: Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na meindooˈna nquii tsaⁿsˈa na macoco , jnaⁿnaˈ na maˈoondana ndoˈ mana jndana .

text: And at midnight there was a cry made , Behold , the bridegroom cometh ; go ye out to meet him .
text2: Quia tueeˈ xcwe tsjom , teicˈuaa na matseixuaa tsˈaⁿ . Matso : “ Cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ , macwjeeˈcañoom tsˈaⁿ na macoco . Quioˈyoˈ na nlajomndyoˈ ñˈeⁿñê . ”

text: Then all those virgins arose , and trimmed their lamps .
text2: Quia joˈ teiˈcantyja yolcuˈñeeⁿ . Jlaˈyo ̱ na nmaⁿ na ntyjo chom xjocanti ˈnaaⁿna .

text: And the foolish said unto the wise , Give us of your oil ; for our lamps are gone out .
text2: Ndoˈ joo yolcu na tijndo ̱ ˈ nˈom jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom : “ Jeeⁿ ˈo leii , cateijndeiˈyaˈyoˈ seitye na cwileiˈñˈomˈyoˈ ee majaanduuˈ chom ˈnaaⁿyâ . ”

text: But the wise answered , saying , Not so ; lest there be not enough for us and you : but go ye rather to them that sell , and buy for yourselves .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ yolcu na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ Xonda ̱ a ̱ , ee xeⁿ nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na xocwijndeii na nleilˈueeˈndyo ̱ ncjo ̱ o ̱ yâ ndoˈ mati ˈo . Yati catsalajndaˈyoˈ na nleilˈueeˈndyoˈ . ”

text: And while they went to buy , the bridegroom came ; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage : and the door was shut .
text2: Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na tyˈelaˈjnda naⁿˈñeeⁿ seitye , tyjeeˈcañoom nquii tsaⁿsˈa na macoco . Quia joˈ joo yolcu na mˈaⁿcˈeendye tyˈequieˈna quiiˈ wˈaa ñˈeⁿñê yuu na nleitˈmaaⁿˈ na macocoom . Jnda ̱ joˈ ta ̱ ˈ ndyueelˈa .

text: Afterward came also the other virgins , saying , Lord , Lord , open to us .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii mati tquieˈcañom ntˈomcheⁿ yolcundyuaˈñeeⁿ . Jluena : “ Aa ndiˈ ta , catseicanaaⁿndyuˈ ˈndyootsˈa . Aa ndiˈ ta . ”

text: But he answered and said , Verily I say unto you , I know you not .
text2: Tˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : “ Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ticwajnaⁿˈa ˈo . ”

text: Watch therefore , for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh .
text2: Ndoˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na ñˈoommeiⁿˈ cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿnaˈ na cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ , ee ticaliuˈyoˈ cwaaⁿ xuee ndoˈ cwaaⁿ hora na ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee nncwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo .

text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country , who called his own servants , and delivered unto them his goods .
text2: ’ Nntseina ̱ ⁿtya ̱ nnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cwiicheⁿ ñˈoom tjañoomˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cañoomˈluee . Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na seijndaaˈñe na wjaa cwiicheⁿ tsjoomnancue na tquia . Tqueeⁿˈñê mosoomˈm ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na na nlˈana tsˈiaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ joonaˈ .

text: And unto one he gave five talents , to another two , and to another one ; to every man according to his several ability ; and straightway took his journey .
text2: ’ Nnom cwii joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ tquiaaⁿ ˈom meiⁿ sˈom . Nnom cwiicheⁿ tquiaaⁿ ñeˈwe meiⁿ ndoˈ nnom cwiicheⁿ ñeˈcwii meiⁿ cwii tquiaaⁿ . Tquiaaⁿ nnom cwii cwii joona cantyjati na seiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa . Jnda ̱ joˈ jlueeⁿˈeⁿ , tjaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same , and made them other five talents .
text2: Juu tsˈaⁿ na toˈñom ˈom meiⁿ sˈom mantyjacheⁿ tyochˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ joonaˈ . Ndoˈ tantjomtyeeⁿ cwiicheⁿ ˈom meiⁿ .

text: And likewise he that had received two , he also gained other two .
text2: Mati juu tsˈaⁿ na toˈñom we meiⁿ , tyochˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ joonaˈ ndoˈ tantjoom cwiicheⁿ we meiⁿ .

text: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth , and hid his lord ' s money .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na ñecwii meiⁿ toˈñom , tjaaⁿ tjacaˈñeeⁿ quiiˈ tyuaa , joˈ joˈ tantyˈioom sˈom ˈnaaⁿˈ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh , and reckoneth with them .
text2: ’ Majndye xuee tjacaanaˈ ndoˈ tyjeeˈnndaˈ patrom ˈnaaⁿna . Seijndaaˈñê na nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ cwenta ñˈeⁿndyena cwanti tueˈntyjo ̱ taˈntjomna ñˈeⁿ sˈom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents , saying , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me five talents : behold , I have gained beside them five talents more .
text2: Tyjeeˈcañoomjndyee juu tsˈaⁿ na toˈñom ˈom meiⁿ sˈom . Maleichuuñˈeeⁿ sˈomˈñeeⁿ , mandi ñˈeⁿ ˈom meiⁿ na tantjoom . Tquiaaⁿ joonaˈ nnom patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Tsoom : “ ˈU ta , tquiaaˈ ˈom meiⁿ sˈom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Cantyˈiaˈ jeˈ luaa cwiicheⁿ ˈom meiⁿ na jnda ̱ tantjo ̱ ⁿya . ”

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , thou good and faithful servant : thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Tso patrom nnoom : “ ˈU moso ˈnaⁿya , ya saˈ . Tquiooˈ na tjooˈ tsˈomˈ ndoˈ na seicanda ̱ ˈ . Meiiⁿ cweˈ cwii tsˈiaaⁿ na cachjoo sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu seicanda ̱ ˈ . Jeˈ nlqua ̱ a ̱ ⁿya ˈu na tˈmaⁿti tsˈiaaⁿ nntseixmaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ wendyo ̱ nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na neiiⁿya . ”

text: He also that had received two talents came and said , Lord , thou deliveredst unto me two talents : behold , I have gained two other talents beside them .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii tyjeeˈcañoom juu tsˈaⁿ na toˈñom we meiⁿ sˈom . Tsoom : “ ˈU ta , tquiaaˈ we meiⁿ sˈom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Cantyˈiaˈ jeˈ luaa cwiicheⁿ we meiⁿ na jnda ̱ tantjo ̱ ⁿya . ”

text: His lord said unto him , Well done , good and faithful servant ; thou hast been faithful over a few things , I will make thee ruler over many things : enter thou into the joy of thy lord .
text2: Tso patrom nnoom : “ ˈU moso ˈnaⁿya , ya saˈ . Tquiooˈ na tjooˈ tsˈomˈ ndoˈ na seicanda ̱ ˈ . Meiiⁿ cweˈ cwii tsˈiaaⁿ na cachjoo sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu seicanda ̱ ˈ . Jeˈ nlqua ̱ a ̱ ⁿya ˈu na tˈmaⁿti tsˈiaaⁿ nntseixmaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ wendyo ̱ nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na neiiⁿya . ”

text: Then he which had received the one talent came and said , Lord , I knew thee that thou art an hard man , reaping where thou hast not sown , and gathering where thou hast not strawed :
text2: Quia joˈ na macanda ̱ tyjeeˈcañoom juu moso na ñeˈcwii meiⁿ sˈom toˈñom . Tsoom nnom patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ : “ ˈU ta , mantyjiiya na ˈu tsˈaⁿ na jeeⁿ majñoomˈ ˈndyoˈ moso ˈnaⁿˈ . ˈU cweˈ matseiˈweˈ cantyja na cwiweˈ ntjom ˈnaⁿˈ , meiⁿ na nnomˈ , meiⁿ na nntseicueendyuˈ . Macanda ̱ nencjo ̱ o ̱ yâ moso ˈnaⁿˈ jeeⁿ cwilajnda ̱ a ̱ yâ .

text: And I was afraid , and went and hid thy talent in the earth : lo , there thou hast that is thine .
text2: Cweˈ na nquiaya ˈu , joˈ chii tjo ̱ , tjo ̱ catyˈiuya sˈom ˈnaⁿˈ quiiˈ tyuaa . Luaa juunaˈ , coˈñomˈ . ”

text: His lord answered and said unto him , Thou wicked and slothful servant , thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not , and gather where I have not strawed :
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ nnoom : “ ˈU re moso na tia tsˈaⁿndyuˈ ndoˈ na nchqueⁿˈ , cwa maxjeⁿ ntyjiˈ na matseiwa ̱ ya ntjom meiiⁿ nchii nnco ̱ jno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈa , ndoˈ mawantjo ̱ ⁿya meiiⁿ nchii nnco ̱ matseicatsuundyo ̱ .

text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers , and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ yati xeⁿ ˈu seiweˈ sˈom ˈnaⁿya wˈaa banco yuu na cwileiweya sˈom ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ , quia joˈ toˈño ̱ ⁿ sˈom ˈnaⁿya ñequio tsˈiaaⁿnnomnaˈ quia na tyja ̱ . ”

text: Take therefore the talent from him , and give it unto him which hath ten talents .
text2: Ndoˈ tso patrom nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ mosoomˈm : “ Catjeiˈyoˈ cwii meiⁿwaaˈ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ quiaˈyoˈ juunaˈ lˈo ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na maleiñˈoom qui meiⁿ .

text: For unto every one that hath shall be given , and he shall have abundance : but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath .
text2: Ee cantyjati na matseixmaⁿ ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ , xeⁿ ya tsˈiaaⁿ machˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿ juunaˈ quia joˈ nncoˈñomtyeeⁿ na nleilˈueeˈñê . Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na tisˈa tsˈiaaⁿ machˈee , nluiˈ cantyjati chjoowiˈ na maleiñˈoomtyeeⁿ .

text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Cweˈ joˈ catueˈyoˈ moso nchqueeⁿˈmˈaaⁿˈ chˈeⁿ yuu na jaaⁿñe . Joˈ joˈ nntyˈioom ndoˈ nneiⁿnqueeⁿ ndeiˈnˈoom . ”

text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory , and all the holy angels with him , then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory :
text2: ’ Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa ñequio chaˈtso ángeles ˈnaⁿya , na nntsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya . Quia joˈ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ja na nncjo ̱ cajmaⁿ ntio ˈnaⁿya na jeeⁿ neiⁿncooˈ caxuee na nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿya nnˈaⁿ .

text: And before him shall be gathered all nations : and he shall separate them one from another , as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats :
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue nntjomndyena jo no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Quia joˈ nnto ̱ ⁿˈa joona chaˈxjeⁿ na mato ̱ ⁿˈ cwii pasto canmaⁿ ñequio canchˈioo ntsmeiiⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand , but the goats on the left .
text2: Nntsˈaaⁿ na nncwintyjeeˈ canmaⁿ ntyjaaⁿˈaⁿ ntyjaya ndoˈ canchˈioo nntsˈaaⁿ na nncwintyjeeˈ ntyjatymaaⁿˈ .

text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand , Come , ye blessed of my Father , inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world :
text2: Maluaaˈ nntsˈaa ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya . Nntsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ ntyjaaˈa ntyjaya : “ Quioˈyoˈ ˈo nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ jndaˈyoˈ na matioˈnaaⁿñe Tsotya ̱ ya ˈo . Catoˈñoomˈyoˈ naya na mañequiaaⁿ na mati ˈo cwilajomndyoˈ ñequio na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom . Ee luaaˈ teiyoti seijndaaˈñê cwentaˈyoˈ quia na tqueeⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me drink : I was a stranger , and ye took me in :
text2: Ee tyomˈaaⁿya na ñejndo ̱ ˈa ndoˈ tquiaˈyoˈ na tcwaaˈa . Tyomˈaaⁿya na ñeˈcˈua ndaa ndoˈ tquiaˈyoˈ na tˈua . Tyomaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿya cwii cwii tsjomˈyoˈ yuu na ticataˈjnaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ ja ndoˈ toˈñoomˈyoˈ ja naquiiˈ lˈaˈyoˈ .

text: Naked , and ye clothed me : I was sick , and ye visited me : I was in prison , and ye came unto me .
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿya na ntsaandyo ̱ ndoˈ ˈo jlaˈtsaaⁿˈndyoˈ ja . Tyomˈaaⁿya na wiiˈa ndoˈ ˈo tyotsacajndoˈyoˈ ja . Tyomˈaaⁿya pra ̱ so ndoˈ tyotsantyjaˈyoˈ ja . ”

text: Then shall the righteous answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , and fed thee ? or thirsty , and gave thee drink ?
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ ntyjaaˈa ntyjaya na laˈxmaⁿna cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ nntˈo ̱ o ̱ na , nluena : “ Ta , ¿ cwaaⁿ ntyˈiaayâ ˈu na ñeˈjndoˈ ndoˈ tquiaayâ na tcwaˈ , oo ntyˈiaayâ ˈu na ñeˈcˈuaˈ ndaa ndoˈ ñetquiaayâ ndaatioo na tˈuaˈ ?

text: When saw we thee a stranger , and took thee in ? or naked , and clothed thee ?
text2: ¿ Cwaaⁿ ntyˈiaayâ ˈu na tyomaˈnoomˈ yuu na ticataˈjnaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ ˈu ndoˈ toˈño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ˈu quiiˈntaaⁿyâ , oo na ntyˈiaayâ ˈu na ntsaandyuˈ ndoˈ jlaˈtsaaⁿˈndyô ̱ ˈu ?

text: Or when saw we thee sick , or in prison , and came unto thee ?
text2: ¿ Cwaaⁿ ntyˈiaayâ ˈu na wiˈ oo na mˈaaⁿˈ pra ̱ so ndoˈ sacajndo ̱ o ̱ ˈâ ˈu ? ”

text: And the King shall answer and say unto them , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren , ye have done it unto me .
text2: Quia joˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya nntsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , meiⁿquia na lˈaˈyoˈ na teijndeiˈyoˈ cwii nnˈaⁿya nmeiiⁿ na titˈmaⁿ cwiluiiñe , nnco ̱ teijndeiˈyoˈ . ”

text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand , Depart from me , ye cursed , into everlasting fire , prepared for the devil and his angels :
text2: ’ Jnda ̱ chii , ja na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya nntsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ ntyjaaˈa ntyjatymaaⁿˈ : “ Quindyo ̱ o ̱ ˈyoˈ nacañomya ˈo nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tso Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na catˈuiiwiˈnaˈ ˈo . Jeˈ jeˈ nntsaˈyoˈ quiiˈ chom na tijoom canduuˈ na juu joˈ seijndaaˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaaˈ tsaⁿjndii na nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ jom ñequio ángeles ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: For I was an hungred , and ye gave me no meat : I was thirsty , and ye gave me no drink :
text2: Ee tyomˈaaⁿya na ñeˈjndo ̱ ˈa sa ̱ a ̱ tînquiaˈyoˈ na nlcwaaˈa . Tyomˈaaⁿya na ñeˈcˈua ndaatioo sa ̱ a ̱ tînquiaˈyoˈ na nncˈua .

text: I was a stranger , and ye took me not in : naked , and ye clothed me not : sick , and in prison , and ye visited me not .
text2: Tyomaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿya yuu na ticataˈjnaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ ja sa ̱ a ̱ tîcatoˈñoomˈyoˈ ja . Tyomˈaaⁿya na ntsaandyo ̱ sa ̱ a ̱ tîcalaˈtsaaⁿˈndyoˈ ja . Tyomˈaaⁿya na wiiˈa sa ̱ a ̱ tîcatsajndoˈyoˈ ja . Tyomˈaaⁿya na pra ̱ so sa ̱ a ̱ tîcatsantyjaˈyoˈ ja . ”

text: Then shall they also answer him , saying , Lord , when saw we thee an hungred , or athirst , or a stranger , or naked , or sick , or in prison , and did not minister unto thee ?
text2: Quia joˈ nntˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , nluena : “ Ta , ¿ cwaaⁿ ñentyˈiaayâ ˈu na ñeˈjndoˈ , oo na ñeˈcˈuaˈ ndaa , oo na ñetoˈnoomˈ yuu na ticataˈjnaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ ˈu , oo na ñetˈoomˈ na ntsaandyuˈ , oo na ñeteiwiˈ , oo na ñetˈoomˈ pra ̱ so sa ̱ a ̱ tîcateiˈjndeiiyâ ˈu ? ”

text: Then shall he answer them , saying , Verily I say unto you , Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these , ye did it not to me .
text2: Quia joˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ncˈe na tîcateijndeiˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿya nmeiiⁿ na titˈmaⁿ cwiluiindye , matyˈiomnaˈ nnco ̱ tîcateiˈjndeiˈyoˈ . ”

text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment : but the righteous into life eternal .
text2: Ndoˈ nncˈoo naⁿˈñeeⁿ yuu na tijoom cantycwii na nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ joona . Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ nntoˈñoomna na tijoom cantycwii na nntaˈndoˈna .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had finished all these sayings , he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Jnda ̱ na seineiⁿ Jesús chaˈtso ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , seineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover , and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified .
text2: Tsoom : — ˈO nquiuˈyoˈ na we xuee cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ ndoˈ nncueeˈ xuee pascua . Ndoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee maquialjoˈ nñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ na nntyˈioomna ja tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ .

text: Then assembled together the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders of the people , unto the palace of the high priest , who was called Caiaphas ,
text2: Ndoˈ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom , mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tjomndyena tachˈeeⁿˈ wˈaa tˈmaⁿ , waaˈ tyee na cwiluiitquieñe na jndyu Caifás .

text: And consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty , and kill him .
text2: Tyoˈmaⁿna ñˈeⁿ ncˈiaana chiuu nlˈayoona na nñequioˈnnˈaⁿna Jesús cha ntˈuena jom , ndoˈ na nlaˈcueeˈna jom .

text: But they said , Not on the feast day , lest there be an uproar among the people .
text2: Jlaˈtiuuna , jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — Sa ̱ a ̱ ticatˈua ̱ a ̱ ya jom xcwe ncuee cha ticalaˈwendye nnˈaⁿ nacjooya .

text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany , in the house of Simon the leper ,
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ Jesús tsjoom Betania waaˈ Simón , tsaⁿ na ñechuu tycu lepra .

text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment , and poured it on his head , as he sat at meat .
text2: Wacatyeeⁿ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ndoˈ tueeˈcañoom cwii yuscu na maleiñˈoom cwii tsioo na tuiinaˈ ñˈeⁿ tsjo ̱ ˈ canchiiˈ na jndyu alabastro . Tsiooˈñeeⁿ ñjom ncheⁿˈ cachi na jeeⁿ jnda . Tuˈnquioom joonaˈ xqueⁿ Jesús .

text: But when his disciples saw it , they had indignation , saying , To what purpose is this waste ?
text2: Ndoˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , quia na ntyˈiaayâ na luaAˈ , jlaˈliooˈndyô ̱ , lˈuuyâ : — Jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ cweˈchi tsuu ncheⁿˈ .

text: For this ointment might have been sold for much , and given to the poor .
text2: Yati xeⁿ teilˈuanaˈ ee jndye sˈom nncwjiˈnaˈ na nluii naya ndyeñeeⁿˈ .

text: When Jesus understood it , he said unto them , Why trouble ye the woman ? for she hath wrought a good work upon me .
text2: Quia seiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ Jesús na luaaˈ cwilˈuuyâ , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — ¿ Chiuu na cwilaˈliooˈndyoˈ ñˈeⁿ yuscumˈaaⁿˈ ? ee jeeⁿ tjacanjoomˈ nayawaaˈ na sˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: For ye have the poor always with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Ee ja nchii ñequiiˈcheⁿ nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ndyeñeeⁿˈ ñequiiˈcheⁿ mˈaⁿna quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body , she did it for my burial .
text2: Yuscumˈaaⁿˈ na tuˈnquioom ncheⁿˈ nacjoya , matseijndaaˈñenaˈ na nncjaacantyˈiuuˈndyo ̱ .

text: Verily I say unto you , Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world , there shall also this , that this woman hath done , be told for a memorial of her .
text2: Mayuuˈcheⁿ nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , meiⁿyuucheⁿ na nñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ ñˈoom naya ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue , maxjeⁿ nlaˈneiⁿna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ naya na sˈaa yuscumˈaaⁿˈ cha ticatsuu ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Then one of the twelve , called Judas Iscariot , went unto the chief priests ,
text2: Ndoˈ cwii jâ nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwendyô ̱ , juu tsaⁿ na jndyu Judas Iscariote , tjaaⁿ na mˈaⁿ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye .

text: And said unto them , What will ye give me , and I will deliver him unto you ? And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Cwanti nncwantjo ̱ ⁿ nlˈaˈyoˈ , nñequia cwenta Jesús lueeˈyoˈ ? Jlaˈjndaaˈndyena , tquiana ntquiuu nchooˈ qui sˈom xuee .

text: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him .
text2: Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ , tyolˈueeˈñê chiuu ya nntsˈaaⁿ na nñequiaaⁿ cwenta Jesús lueena .

text: Now the first day of the feast of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus , saying unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover ?
text2: Tueeˈ xuee na cwiwityeⁿ ncuee na cwicwaˈ nnˈaⁿ tyooˈ na tjaa ndaaljoˈ tjaquieeˈ . Jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿ Jesús jlaˈcandyooˈndyô ̱ na mˈaaⁿ , lˈuuyâ : — ¿ Yuu lˈue tsˈomˈ na nntsalajndaaˈndyô ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ xuee pascua na nleiñˈoomˈ na nlquiˈ catsmaⁿ ?

text: And he said , Go into the city to such a man , and say unto him , The Master saith , My time is at hand ; I will keep the passover at thy house with my disciples .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — Catsaquieˈyoˈ quiiˈ tsjoom , canduˈyoˈ nnom juu tsˈaⁿ na nliuˈyoˈ : “ Ndiˈ matso Maestro tsˈaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ na majnda ̱ jaaweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ jom . Lˈue tsˈoom na nnteijndeiˈ waˈ na nleijndaaˈ na nlcwaaⁿˈaⁿ , nlqueeⁿ catsmaⁿ na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñê xuee pascua ñequio jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê . ”

text: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them ; and they made ready the passover .
text2: Ndoˈ lˈaayâ chaˈxjeⁿ na tsoom . Jlajndaaˈndyô ̱ na nlcwaaˈâ natmaaⁿ xuee pascua .

text: Now when the even was come , he sat down with the twelve .
text2: Jnda ̱ na teinco ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ncue , tjawacatyeeⁿ Jesús nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñequio jâ na canchooˈwendyô ̱ .

text: And as they did eat , he said , Verily I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na cwicwaaˈâ to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ , seineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , cwiindyoˈ ˈo nñequiaa cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ .

text: And they were exceeding sorrowful , and began every one of them to say unto him , Lord , is it I ?
text2: Ñˈoomwaaˈ jeeⁿ ndyaaˈ seichjooˈnaˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ . To ̱ o ̱ ˈâ cwii ndoˈ cwiindyô ̱ taˈxˈa ̱ a ̱ yâ nnoom , lˈuuyâ : — Ta , ¿ aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na ja ?

text: And he answered and said , He that dippeth his hand with me in the dish , the same shall betray me .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — Cwii tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjoom xiowaa ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nñequiaaⁿ cwenta ja .

text: The Son of man goeth as it is written of him : but woe unto that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed ! it had been good for that man if he had not been born .
text2: Ndoˈ maxjeⁿ nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee chaˈxjeⁿ na matso ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Sa ̱ a ̱ jeeⁿ ntyˈiaaˈñe juu tsˈaⁿ na nñequiaa cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ . Yati xeⁿ tîcaluiiñe tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then Judas , which betrayed him , answered and said , Master , is it I ? He said unto him , Thou hast said .
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ Judas , tsaⁿ na nñequiaa cwenta jom . Tso : — ˈU Maestro , ¿ aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na ja ? Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnoom : — Majoˈndyo chaˈxjeⁿ jnda ̱ tsuˈ .

text: And as they were eating , Jesus took bread , and blessed it , and brake it , and gave it to the disciples , and said , Take , eat ; this is my body .
text2: Yocheⁿ na cwicwaaˈâ toˈñom Jesús tyooˈ , seitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ . Tyjeeⁿ juunaˈ , tquiaaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ . Tsoom : — Catoˈñoomˈyoˈ cwaˈyoˈ tyooˈwaa , ee cwiluiiñenaˈ seiiˈa .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and gave it to them , saying , Drink ye all of it ;
text2: Mati toˈñoom cwii waso na ñjom ndaa winom , tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Jnda ̱ chii tquiaaⁿ juunaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — Luaa cweˈyoˈ . Caluiˈ cjaanaˈ .

text: For this is my blood of the new testament , which is shed for many for the remission of sins .
text2: Ndaa winomwaa cwiluiiñenaˈ nioomˈa na ñequio juunaˈ maqua ̱ ⁿtya ̱ ⁿya ñˈoom xco cha nnda ̱ a ̱ ntseitˈmaⁿ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jnaaⁿ jndyendye nnˈaⁿ .

text: But I say unto you , I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine , until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father ' s kingdom .
text2: Nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , xuee na cwii wjaatinaˈ taxocˈuanndaˈa ndaa winom hasta quia jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ na mamatsa ̱ ˈntjom Tsotya ̱ . Quia ljoˈcheⁿ nncˈuaxco ̱ juunaˈ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ yuu na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom .

text: And when they had sung an hymn , they went out into the mount of Olives .
text2: Taayâ cwii luantsa , jnda ̱ chii jluiiˈâ joˈ joˈ . Saayâ ta na jndyu Olivos .

text: Then saith Jesus unto them , All ye shall be offended because of me this night : for it is written , I will smite the shepherd , and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Tsjom jeˈ chaˈtsondyoˈ ˈo nntjeiˈndyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Ee ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom matsonaˈ : “ Nlaˈcueeˈ nnˈaⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na machˈee cwenta canmaⁿ . Ndoˈ canmaⁿ ntsmeiiⁿˈeⁿ nntˈoomˈndyeyoˈ . ”

text: But after I am risen again , I will go before you into Galilee .
text2: Ndoˈ tsotyeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Ja quia na jnda ̱ mawando ̱ ˈxco ̱ na jnda ̱ tyˈio ̱ , nncjo ̱ jndya ̱ a ̱ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea , xeⁿ jnda ̱ nntsantyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: Peter answered and said unto him , Though all men shall be offended because of thee , yet will I never be offended .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ Pedro nnoom , tso : — Meiiⁿ chaˈtsondye naⁿmˈaⁿˈ nntjeiiˈndyena ñˈeⁿndyuˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ja tijoom cwjiˈndyo ̱ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ .

text: Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , That this night , before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnoom , tso : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ , tsjom jeˈ , cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseixuaa caxtijndyo , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ macwjiˈndyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: Peter said unto him , Though I should die with thee , yet will I not deny thee . Likewise also said all the disciples .
text2: Tso Pedro nnoom : — Meiiⁿ na nncjuˈnaˈ na cˈio ̱ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ sa ̱ a ̱ tijoom cwjiˈndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ majuu ñˈoom tˈo ̱ o ̱ yâ na chaˈtsondyô ̱ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane , and saith unto the disciples , Sit ye here , while I go and pray yonder .
text2: Ndoˈ squia ̱ a ̱ yâ cwii joo na jndyunaˈ Getsemaní . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Cwindyuaandyoˈ ñjaaⁿñe yocheⁿ na jo ̱ luaaˈ na nntseina ̱ ⁿya nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee , and began to be sorrowful and very heavy .
text2: Quia joˈ tjatyeeⁿ , tjañˈoom Pedro ñequio we ntseinda Zebedeo . Jnaⁿnaˈ na tˈmaⁿ matseiˈndaaˈnaˈ ntyjeeⁿ , ndoˈ jeeⁿ matseichjooˈnaˈ tsˈoom .

text: Then saith he unto them , My soul is exceeding sorrowful , even unto death : tarry ye here , and watch with me .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaaˈ matseichjooˈnaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ hasta jom ndyoweˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Caljooˈndyoˈ ljoo . Cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ , calajomndyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , nchii cwindaˈyoˈ .

text: And he went a little further , and fell on his face , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if it be possible , let this cup pass from me : nevertheless not as I will , but as thou wilt .
text2: Quia joˈ tjatjatyeeⁿ chjoowiˈ . Tjawanquioom na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tyochˈeeⁿ tyˈoo nnom , tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya , xeⁿ aa waa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nluii , quiaaˈ na tincwino ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nawiˈwaa na matseijomnaˈ cwii na jeeⁿ ja . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na luaaˈ macaⁿˈa , caluii chaˈxjeⁿ na lˈue tsˈomˈ nncuˈ , nchii chaˈxjeⁿ na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ja .

text: And he cometh unto the disciples , and findeth them asleep , and saith unto Peter , What , could ye not watch with me one hour ?
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ jndyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ na mˈaⁿ ndyee naⁿˈñeeⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê . Ljeiiⁿ na cwindana . Tsoom nnom Pedro : — ˈU Pedro , ¿ aa tîcanda ̱ a ̱ nlaquii nˈomˈyoˈ meiiⁿ ñeˈcwii hora na ticandaˈyoˈ na nlajomndyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ?

text: Watch and pray , that ye enter not into temptation : the spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
text2: Chaˈtsondyoˈ cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ na calaneiⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha ticjaachuunaˈ ˈo xjeⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ quia wiˈ cwitjomˈyoˈ . Mayuuˈ , jeeⁿ mˈaaⁿcˈeeˈ tsˈom tsˈaⁿ na nntsˈaa yuu na macaⁿnaˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe na tsˈaⁿ tseixmaaⁿ , tileicanaⁿñê .

text: He went away again the second time , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if this cup may not pass away from me , except I drink it , thy will be done .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tjannaaⁿˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ we ndiiˈ na nntseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya , xeⁿ xocanda ̱ a ̱ na nncwinomˈnaˈ nawiˈ na nntjo ̱ ⁿya , ñecuaa , caluii chaˈxjeⁿ na lˈue tsˈomˈ nncuˈ .

text: And he came and found them asleep again : for their eyes were heavy .
text2: Jndyonnaaⁿˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ljeiiⁿ maxjeⁿ cwindana , ee jeeⁿ tyeⁿ maleichuu tsaⁿtsjom joona .

text: And he left them , and went away again , and prayed the third time , saying the same words .
text2: Quia joˈ ˈñeeⁿ joona , tjannaaⁿˈaⁿ na seineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ . Mañejooti ñˈoom tyotseityˈooñê .

text: Then cometh he to his disciples , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Tyjeeˈcañoomnnaaⁿˈaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Aa maxjeⁿ ndicwaⁿ cwindaˈyoˈ ? Ya na mañjom cwitaˈjndyeeˈyoˈ . Cwa jeˈ cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ , ee jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Jeˈ mañequiaa tsˈaⁿ cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ na wiˈndye .

text: Rise , let us be going : behold , he is at hand that doth betray me .
text2: Quicantyjaˈyoˈ , cjaaya . Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ luaaˈ mandyocwjeeˈcañoom juu tsˈaⁿ na mañequiaa cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ .

text: And while he yet spake , lo , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
text2: Ndicwaⁿ matseineiⁿ Jesús ndoˈ tyjeeˈcañoom Judas , cwii jâ nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwendyô ̱ . Jndyochom jndye nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ndoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom . Cwileiˈcho naⁿˈñeeⁿ ncjo espadas ñequio nˈoom nchˈio .

text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he : hold him fast .
text2: Ndoˈ Judas , tsaⁿ na tquiaa cwenta Jesús , jnda ̱ tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ˈnaaⁿ chiuu waa na nntsˈaaⁿ . Tsoom : — Tsˈaⁿ na nncˈua ntsmaⁿˈ maxjeⁿ juu na cwilˈueˈyoˈ . Mana catˈueˈyoˈ jom .

text: And forthwith he came to Jesus , and said , Hail , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Mañoomˈ tyjeeˈcañoom nacañoomˈ Jesús . Tsoom nnom : — Xmaⁿndyuˈ Maestro . Ndoˈ tˈom ntsmaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Friend , wherefore art thou come ? Then came they , and laid hands on Jesus , and took him .
text2: Tso Jesús nnoom : — Xmaⁿndyuˈ . Tsˈiaaⁿ na jndyoˈ , mana catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyuˈ . Quia joˈ tquieˈcañom naⁿˈñeeⁿ Jesús , tˈuena jom . Jlaˈtyeⁿna jom .

text: And , behold , one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand , and drew his sword , and struck a servant of the high priest ' s , and smote off his ear .
text2: Ndoˈ cwiindyô ̱ jâ na ñˈa ̱ a ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús , tjeiˈñoomñe xjooˈ . Tyjee tsuaˈqui mosooˈ tyee na cwiluiitquieñe .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Put up again thy sword into his place : for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nnoom : — Cwjaaˈndyuˈnndaˈ xjoˈ naquiiˈ tjaⁿwaaˈnaˈ . Ee juu tsˈaⁿ na machˈee nata ̱ ˈ quio xjo mañequio joˈ nncueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father , and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels ?
text2: ¿ Aa ticatseitiuuˈ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nlcaaⁿˈa nnom Tsotya ̱ ndoˈ jom mañoomˈ njñoom meiⁿcheⁿ ntmaaⁿˈ ángeles na nnteiˈjndeiina ja ?

text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled , that thus it must be ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ na nmeiⁿˈ nntsˈaa , ¿ chiuu nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñeyuunaˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na matsonaˈ na tseixmaⁿya na catjo ̱ ⁿya na luaa ?

text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes , Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me ? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple , and ye laid no hold on me .
text2: Ndoˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ : — Jndaˈjom ñˈeⁿ ncjo espadas ñˈeⁿ nˈoom nchˈio tquiocatˈueˈyoˈ ja chaˈcwijom tquioˈyoˈ nacjooˈ cwii tsaⁿcanchˈue . ˈIo ndii ˈio ñetaˈcatya ̱ ⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na ñetˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ tîcatˈueˈyoˈ ja .

text: But all this was done , that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples forsook him , and fled .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso na matjo ̱ ⁿ nmeiiⁿ cwicaluiˈyuuˈ ñˈoom ndyuee profetas . Quia joˈ chaˈtsondyô ̱ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿ Jesús jleiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ , ˈndya ̱ a ̱ yâ jom na ñenqueⁿ .

text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest , where the scribes and the elders were assembled .
text2: Quia joˈ nquiee nnˈaⁿ na tˈue Jesús , tyˈeñˈomna jom waaˈ Caifás , juu tyee na cwiluiitquieñe . Joˈ joˈ jnda ̱ tjomndye nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom .

text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest ' s palace , and went in , and sat with the servants , to see the end .
text2: Ndoˈ Pedro tquiacheⁿ tquia tjantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naxeⁿˈ Jesús . Tueⁿˈeⁿ waaˈ tyee na cwiluiitquieñe . Tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ tachˈeeⁿˈ wˈaaˈñeeⁿ . Tjacjom quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta watsˈom , cha nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ chiuu nncjaajuˈyuunaˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: Now the chief priests , and elders , and all the council , sought false witness against Jesus , to put him to death ;
text2: Ndoˈ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom ñequio chaˈtsondye ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ , tyolˈueena nnˈaⁿ na calue ñˈoom cantu nacjooˈ Jesús cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nleijndaaˈ jnaaⁿˈaⁿ na cueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: But found none : yea , though many false witnesses came , yet found they none . At the last came two false witnesses ,
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na jndye nnˈaⁿ jlue ñˈoom cantu nacjoomˈm na waa jnaaⁿˈaⁿ maxjeⁿ ticaluiˈyuuˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ . Jnda ̱ chii wendye naⁿˈñeeⁿ tjoomˈ cantu jluena :

text: And said , This fellow said , I am able to destroy the temple of God , and to build it in three days .
text2: — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ ñetsoom jom nntseityueeⁿˈeⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ndoˈ ñendyee xuee na nntsˈaaxcoom cwiicheⁿ .

text: And the high priest arose , and said unto him , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Quia joˈ nquii tyee na cwiluiitquieñe teintyjeeⁿˈeⁿ , tsoom nnom Jesús : — ¿ Aa maxjeⁿ meiⁿcwii ñˈoom ticˈo ̱ ˈ ? ¿ Chiuu waayuu na nmeiiⁿˈ ñˈoom cwitjeiˈyuuˈndye naⁿmˈaⁿˈ nacjoˈ ?

text: But Jesus held his peace . And the high priest answered and said unto him , I adjure thee by the living God , that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ , the Son of God .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Jesús meiⁿcwii ñˈoom ticˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Quia joˈ nquii tyee na cwiluiitquieñe tso nnoom : — Ñequio xueeˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na wandoˈ , tyeⁿ matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈu , catsuˈ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ . Catsuˈndyeyuˈ nndya ̱ a ̱ yâ , ¿ aa ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Cristo , Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thou hast said : nevertheless I say unto you , Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnoom : — Majoˈndyo ñˈoom na matsuˈ . Ndoˈ mati matseicandiiya ˈo na ˈio cha xuee na cwii wjaatinaˈ nntyˈiaˈnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na mˈaaⁿndyo ̱ yuu na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ja ntyjaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ntyjaya . Jom tseixmaaⁿ chaˈtso najnda ̱ . Ndoˈ nntyˈiaˈyoˈ ja na nnaaⁿ cañoomˈluee na nndyo ̱ cua ̱ nndaˈa ñequio nchquiu .
