text: There was in the days of Herod , the king of Judaea , a certain priest named Zacharias , of the course of Abia : and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron , and her name was Elisabeth .
text2: Ncuee quia tyomˈaaⁿ Herodes tsaⁿmaⁿtsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea , tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tyee cwentaa nnˈaⁿ judíos na jndyu Zacarías . Jom tyocañˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿ tmaaⁿˈ ntyee na seicajndyunaˈ Abías . Scoomˈm jndyu Elisabet , cwii tsˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ Aarón .

text: And they were both righteous before God , walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless .
text2: Wendye joona , tyolˈana na matyˈiomyanaˈ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Meiⁿcwii na chaˈtso ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tîcwiˈnomˈna , tyolaˈcanda ̱ na juunaˈ .

text: And they had no child , because that Elisabeth was barren , and they both were now well stricken in years .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tjaaˈnaⁿ ndana ee Elisabet tîcˈoom jnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ jeeⁿ jnda ̱ tquiendyena .

text: And it came to pass , that while he executed the priest ' s office before God in the order of his course ,
text2: Quia na tueˈcañoomnaˈ tmaaⁿˈ ntyee na ñˈeⁿ Zacarías na nndyeˈntjomna jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ,

text: According to the custom of the priest ' s office , his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord .
text2: chaˈxjeⁿ na waa ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee , tyoˈoona xˈiaa , ˈñeeⁿ nleijnoomˈ na nncjaaquieeˈ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Zacarías teijnoomˈm na nncjaaqueⁿˈeⁿ na nntsˈaaⁿ tsioom suu . Quia joˈ tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ ndoˈ to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na matseicoom suu .

text: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense .
text2: Yocheⁿ na machˈeeⁿ tsioom suu jndye nnˈaⁿ mˈaⁿ tachˈeeⁿˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na cwilaˈneiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense .
text2: Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ teitquiooˈñe cwii ángel cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnoom . Meintyjeeˈ ángelˈñeeⁿ ntyjaaˈ tio ntyjaya yuu na cwico suu .

text: And when Zacharias saw him , he was troubled , and fear fell upon him .
text2: Seiñˈeeⁿˈnaˈ Zacarías quia na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ juu . Jeeⁿ seicatyˈuenaˈ jom .

text: But the angel said unto him , Fear not , Zacharias : for thy prayer is heard ; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son , and thou shalt call his name John .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tso ángel nnoom : — Tintyˈueˈ , Zacarías . Majnda ̱ jndii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈoom na macaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ scuˈ Elisabet nntseincueⁿ yuˈndaa ndaˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ nntseicajndyuˈ juu Juan .

text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness ; and many shall rejoice at his birth .
text2: Cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu nñequiaanaˈ na jeeⁿ neiⁿˈ ndoˈ nncjaaweeˈ tsˈomˈ . Mati jndye nnˈaⁿ nncˈomna na jeeⁿ neiiⁿna na nluiiñê .

text: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord , and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink ; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost , even from his mother ' s womb .
text2: Ee jom tˈmaⁿ nntseixmaaⁿ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tixocˈom winom meiⁿ nta na wjeeti . Ndoˈ chaˈwaa naquiiˈ tsˈoom nncˈoom Espíritu Santo meiiⁿ na ndi njoom tsˈom tsiaaˈ tsoñeeⁿ .

text: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God .
text2: Cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ jom jndyendye nnˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ Israel nlcweˈ nˈomna jo nnom Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaana .

text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias , to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just ; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord .
text2: Jom nndyojñeeⁿ jo nnom Ta Jesucristo cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nndyo . Ndoˈ nndiˈntjoom nnom ñequio najndeii na ñejndiˈntjom Elías . Nntsˈaaⁿ na caljoya nˈom nnˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿ ndana cha nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈquieˈ nˈom , nnquiooˈ nˈomna cantyja na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa yuu na matyˈiomyanaˈ . Luaaˈ nntsˈaaⁿ cha nntseijndaaˈñeyanaˈ naquiiˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ na nncˈom cwentaaˈ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Zacharias said unto the angel , Whereby shall I know this ? for I am an old man , and my wife well stricken in years .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Zacarías nnom ángel : — ¿ Chiuu nntsˈaayuunaˈ na luaaˈ nluii ? Ee ja luaa jnda ̱ tquiendyo ̱ ndoˈ mati scuya jnda ̱ tquieñê .

text: And the angel answering said unto him , I am Gabriel , that stand in the presence of God ; and am sent to speak unto thee , and to shew thee these glad tidings .
text2: Tˈo ̱ ángel nnoom , tso : — Ja jndyuya Gabriel na mandiˈntjo ̱ ⁿya nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Jom jñoom ja na catseicandiiya ˈu ñˈoom nayameiiⁿ .

text: And , behold , thou shalt be dumb , and not able to speak , until the day that these things shall be performed , because thou believest not my words , which shall be fulfilled in their season .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ queⁿˈ cwenta , jeˈ nnta ̱ ˈ na matseiˈneiⁿˈ jnaaⁿˈ na ticatseiyuˈ ñˈoom na matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ . Ndoˈ nnaaⁿnndaˈ na nntseineiⁿˈ juu xuee quia na nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoomwaaˈ .

text: And the people waited for Zacharias , and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple .
text2: Ndoˈ joo nnˈaⁿ na tyomeindooˈ Zacarías , jeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿˈ nˈomna chiuu waa na jeeⁿ yo tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ .

text: And when he came out , he could not speak unto them : and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple : for he beckoned unto them , and remained speechless .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na jlueeⁿˈeⁿ taleicatseineiiⁿ , joˈ na jlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na waa na tcoˈnaˈ ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom . Cweˈ tyotsˈo ̱ o ̱ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Ee jnda ̱ ta ̱ ˈ na matseineiiⁿ .

text: And it came to pass , that , as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished , he departed to his own house .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ xuee na mandiˈntjoom naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived , and hid herself five months , saying ,
text2: Jnda ̱ nquia teitquiooˈ na jndeiiñe scoomˈm Elisabet . Tyomˈaaⁿcheⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wˈaana cwii ˈom chiˈ .

text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me , to take away my reproach among men .
text2: Quia joˈ tso juu Elisabet : “ Luaa naya machˈee Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Seijndaaˈñê na cantycwii na cwicaluiˈjnaaⁿˈndyo ̱ jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na tjaaˈnaⁿ jndaaya . ”

text: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee , named Nazareth ,
text2: Joˈ joˈ chiˈ na jnda ̱ yom na teitquiooˈñe ángel Gabriel nnom Zacarías , ndoˈ majñomnndaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom cwiicheⁿ tsjoom na jndyu Nazaret , tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea

text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph , of the house of David ; and the virgin ' s name was Mary .
text2: na mˈaaⁿ cwii yuscundyua na jndyu María , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ mawaa ñomcaaⁿˈaⁿ ñequio cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jndyu José tsjaaⁿ David .

text: And the angel came in unto her , and said , Hail , thou that art highly favoured , the Lord is with thee : blessed art thou among women .
text2: Jnda ̱ tjaquieeˈ ángel yuu na mˈaaⁿ , tso nnoom : — Xmaⁿndyuˈ , ˈu na tˈmaⁿti naya na macandaˈ . Nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿñê ñˈeⁿndyuˈ . Quiiˈntaaⁿ chaˈtso ntyjelcuˈ , ˈu matioˈnaaⁿñetyeeⁿ .

text: And when she saw him , she was troubled at his saying , and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be .
text2: Ndoˈ María quia na jñeeⁿ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , jeeⁿ seiñˈeeⁿˈñenaˈ jom ndoˈ jeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿˈ tsˈoom ljoˈ maˈmo ̱ ⁿ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ .

text: And the angel said unto her , Fear not , Mary : for thou hast found favour with God .
text2: Quia joˈ tso ángel nnoom : — María , tintyˈueˈ . Ee ˈu tˈmaⁿ naya jnda ̱ teijnomˈ na macandaˈ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And , behold , thou shalt conceive in thy womb , and bring forth a son , and shalt call his name JESUS .
text2: Luaa nluii , nndeiindyuˈ ndoˈ nntseincuiˈ cwii tyochjoo ndoˈ nntseicajndyuˈ juu Jesús .

text: He shall be great , and shall be called the Son of the Highest : and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David :
text2: Jom nluiitˈmaⁿñê . Nntseicajndyunaˈ jom Jnda nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ . Ndoˈ nñequiaaⁿ na nluiiñe rey chaˈxjeⁿ ñeseixmaⁿ David na tyotsa ̱ ˈntjom .

text: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever ; and of his kingdom there shall be no end .
text2: Maxjeⁿ nljotyeⁿ na nntsa ̱ ˈntjoom ntseindacantyjo Jacob , ndoˈ tijoom cantycwii cantyja na nntsa ̱ ˈntjoom .

text: Then said Mary unto the angel , How shall this be , seeing I know not a man ?
text2: Tso María nnom ángel : — ¿ Chiuu nntsˈaayuunaˈ na nluii na luaaˈ ? Ee tyoomˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿsˈa .

text: And the angel answered and said unto her , The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee , and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee : therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God .
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ ángel nnoom , tso : — Juu Espíritu Santo nntsˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ . Ndoˈ juu na jndeii na matseixmaⁿ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ , nncˈoomnaˈ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ . Ee joˈ na nluiiñe yuˈndaa na ljuˈ tsˈom , ndoˈ nntseicajndyunaˈ juu Jnda nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And , behold , thy cousin Elisabeth , she hath also conceived a son in her old age : and this is the sixth month with her , who was called barren .
text2: Ndoˈ queⁿˈ cwenta , mati nomnnˈaⁿˈ Elisabet meiiⁿ na jnda ̱ tquieñê majndeiiñê cwii tyochjoo . Jeˈ chiˈ na jnda ̱ yom na jndeiiñê . Ndoˈ jom tsˈaⁿ na cwilue nnˈaⁿ na tileicˈoom jnda .

text: For with God nothing shall be impossible .
text2: Ee tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii nnom na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Mary said , Behold the handmaid of the Lord ; be it unto me according to thy word . And the angel departed from her .
text2: Ndoˈ tso María nnom ángel : — Ja tsˈaⁿ mandiˈntjomtyeⁿ nnom Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Catsˈaanaˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ chaˈxjeⁿ ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tsuˈ . Quia joˈ mana jluiˈ ángel na mˈaaⁿ .

text: And Mary arose in those days , and went into the hill country with haste , into a city of Juda ;
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ seijndaaˈñe María , seityuaaⁿˈaⁿ tjaaⁿ . Tjaaⁿ cwii tsjoom naquiiˈ ntsjo ̱ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judá .

text: And entered into the house of Zacharias , and saluted Elisabeth .
text2: Tueⁿˈeⁿ waaˈ Zacarías . Tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ na xmaⁿñe Elisabet .

text: And it came to pass , that , when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary , the babe leaped in her womb ; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost :
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii Elisabet jndyeeˈ María na tquiaa na xmaⁿñê , quia joˈ seijndeii yuˈndaa tsˈom tsiaⁿˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tjaquieeˈ Espíritu Santo chaˈwaa naquiiˈ tsˈoom .

text: And she spake out with a loud voice , and said , Blessed art thou among women , and blessed is the fruit of thy womb .
text2: Ndoˈ jndeii seineiiⁿ , tsoom : — Quiiˈntaaⁿ chaˈtsondye tyja ̱ a ̱ lcuuya , ˈu na matioˈnaaⁿñeti Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ matioˈnaaⁿñê yuˈndaa na njom tsˈom tsiaˈ .

text: And whence is this to me , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ja , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyo ̱ na jndaˈjom nncuˈ na cwiluiindyuˈ tsondyee quii Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom ja tyjeeˈcañoomˈ jndyocandoˈ ja ?

text: For , lo , as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears , the babe leaped in my womb for joy .
text2: Ee quia na jndiiya na matsuˈ na xmaⁿndyo ̱ , quia joˈ mantyjacheⁿ seijndeii yuˈndaa tsˈom tsiaya na neiiⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And blessed is she that believed : for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord .
text2: Matioˈnaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈu . Ee matseiˈyuˈ na nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoom na seicañeeⁿ ˈu , na tso ángel njomˈ .

text: And Mary said , My soul doth magnify the Lord ,
text2: Quia joˈ tso María : Ñequio na xcweeˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ matseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ,

text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour .
text2: ndoˈ neiiⁿˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jom , ee cwiluiiñê na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê ja .

text: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden : for , behold , from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed .
text2: Ee tyˈoom na wiˈ tsˈoom ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , meiiⁿ tsˈaⁿ na cweˈ cwantindyo ja na mandiˈntjo ̱ ⁿtya ̱ ⁿ nnoom . Ndoˈ jeˈ jeˈ , xuee na cwii wjaanaˈ , chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ na wjaawicantyjooˈ nluena na matioˈnaaⁿñê ja .

text: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things ; and holy is his name .
text2: Ee nqueⁿ na chaˈtso najndeii matseixmaaⁿ , tˈmaⁿ naya jnda ̱ sˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Jom ljuˈ cwiluiiñê , ndoˈ maxjeⁿ joˈ joˈ xueⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And his mercy is on them that fear him from generation to generation .
text2: Chaˈwaa na ndyowanaˈ , mˈaaⁿ na wiˈ tsˈoom chaˈtsoti nnˈaⁿ na cwii wjaawicantyjooˈ na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye jom .

text: He hath shewed strength with his arm ; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts .
text2: Ee cantyja na sˈaaⁿ , tˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ chiuu waa najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ . Sˈaaⁿ na tˈoomˈndye nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye cheⁿnquiee cantyja na cwilaˈtiuu .

text: He hath put down the mighty from their seats , and exalted them of low degree .
text2: Tyotseitˈmaaⁿˈñê nnˈaⁿ na cweˈ cwantindyo ndoˈ tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na waa najnda ̱ na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ .

text: He hath filled the hungry with good things ; and the rich he hath sent empty away .
text2: Teijneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ na nquiu na tjo ̱ o ̱ ndye jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na nquiu na tjaa ljoˈ cotseitjo ̱ o ̱ naˈ joo , tîcateijneiⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: He hath holpen his servant Israel , in remembrance of his mercy ;
text2: Tyoteijneiⁿ welooya , nnˈaⁿ Israel na tyondyeˈntjom nnoom , cha caˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na mañjom tsˈoom na nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñê ñˈoom na tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na na nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: As he spake to our fathers , to Abraham , and to his seed for ever .
text2: Ee tsoom na tijoom cantycwii na wiˈ tsˈoom chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ Israel , majuu Abraham ñequio nnˈaⁿ na tuiindye tsjaaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And Mary abode with her about three months , and returned to her own house .
text2: Ndoˈ ljooˈñe María chaˈna ndyee chiˈ ñequio Elisabet . Jnda ̱ chii tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Now Elisabeth ' s full time came that she should be delivered ; and she brought forth a son .
text2: Tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntseincuii Elisabet , quia joˈ seincueⁿ cwii tyochjoo .

text: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her ; and they rejoiced with her .
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaaⁿˈaⁿ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nndyooˈ jndyena na jeeⁿ wiˈ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom . Joˈ chii tˈomna na neiiⁿna ñˈeⁿñê .

text: And it came to pass , that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child ; and they called him Zacharias , after the name of his father .
text2: Xuee na jnda ̱ ñeeⁿ na tuiiñe yuˈndaa , tjomndyena na nlaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena costumbre na waa jo nda ̱ a ̱ na na cwilˈana ñˈeⁿ yoˈndaa na naⁿnom . Ndoˈ tyolˈana na nlaˈcajndyuna jom xueeˈ tsotyeeⁿ , Zacarías .

text: And his mother answered and said , Not so ; but he shall be called John .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tˈo ̱ tsoñeeⁿ , matso : — Nchii joˈ , maxjeⁿ Juan njñoom .

text: And they said unto her , There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name .
text2: Jluena nnoom : — ¿ Chiuu na luaaˈ ? ndoˈ tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii nnˈaⁿˈyoˈ na luaaˈ jndyu .

text: And they made signs to his father , how he would have him called .
text2: Quia joˈ sˈo ̱ o ̱ lueena nnom tsotye yuˈndaa na cwitaxˈeena chiuu lˈue tsˈoom na njndyu jnaaⁿ .

text: And he asked for a writing table , and wrote , saying , His name is John . And they marvelled all .
text2: Ndoˈ jom tcaaⁿ cwii tsom nda ̱ a ̱ na . Seiljeiⁿ nacjooˈnaˈ : “ Juan xueeˈ yuˈndaamˈaaⁿˈ . ” Ndoˈ chaˈtsondyena tjaweeˈ nˈomna .

text: And his mouth was opened immediately , and his tongue loosed , and he spake , and praised God .
text2: Mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ , jnaaⁿ na matseineiⁿ Zacarías , seitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them : and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea .
text2: Jeeⁿ ndyaaˈ tyueneiiⁿ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nndyooˈ ñˈeⁿndyena . Tˈom ñˈoom chaˈwaa naquiiˈ ntsjo ̱ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea cantyja na nmeiiⁿˈ tuii .

text: And all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts , saying , What manner of child shall this be ! And the hand of the Lord was with him .
text2: Ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na tyondye ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , jeeⁿ tyolaˈwena ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ naquiiˈ nˈomna . Jeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿˈ nˈomna , tyotaˈxˈeena nda ̱ a ̱ ntyjeena : — ¿ Ljoˈto cwiluiiñe yuˈndaamˈaaⁿˈ ? Ee jlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ tsˈo ̱ nacjooˈ yuˈndaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost , and prophesied , saying ,
text2: Ndoˈ Zacarías , tsotye yuˈndaa , tooˈ quiiˈ tsˈoom mˈaaⁿ Espíritu Santo . Tyoñequiaaⁿ ñˈoom na tquiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom naquiiˈ tsˈoom . Tsoom :

text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel ; for he hath visited and redeemed his people ,
text2: Catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaa jaa nnˈaⁿ Israel , ee jnda ̱ jndyoteijneiⁿ jaa nnˈaaⁿˈaⁿ ndoˈ tiomlˈuaaⁿ jnaaⁿya .

text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David ;
text2: Quiiˈntaaⁿ jaa jnda ̱ tqueeⁿ nquii na tjacantyja cwiluiitˈmaⁿñe na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe nnˈaⁿ . Cwiluiiñe tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ na ñejndiˈntjom nnoom .

text: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets , which have been since the world began :
text2: Teiyo tsoom na luaaˈ nntsˈaaⁿ ñequio ñˈoom ndyuee profetas cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ na ljuˈ nˈom .

text: That we should be saved from our enemies , and from the hand of all that hate us ;
text2: Na nncwjiiˈñê jaa luee nnˈaⁿ na jndoo jaa , ndoˈ ñequio luee nnˈaⁿ na ticueeˈ nˈom jaa .

text: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers , and to remember his holy covenant ;
text2: Ndoˈ nncˈoom na wiˈ tsˈoom welooya na ñetˈom teiyo . Macañjom tsˈoom ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ na seijndaaˈñetyeeⁿ na ljuˈ tseixmaⁿnaˈ .

text: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham ,
text2: Juu ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ tsoom na nntsˈaaⁿ nnom welooya Abraham na ñetˈoom teiyoticheⁿ .

text: That he would grant unto us , that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear ,
text2: Joˈ na nntseicandyaañê jaa luee nnˈaⁿ na jndoo jaa cha nndya ̱ ˈntjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nnoom ñequio na tiˈmaaⁿˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya .

text: In holiness and righteousness before him , all the days of our life .
text2: Ndoˈ chaˈwaati xuee na cwii mˈaaⁿtya ̱ a ̱ ya , nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya naquiiˈ na jnda ̱ tqueⁿljoomˈm jaa . Nndya ̱ ˈntjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nnoom cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ .

text: And thou , child , shalt be called the prophet of the Highest : for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways ;
text2: Ndoˈ ˈu jndaaya , nluiindyuˈ profeta cwentaaˈ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ . Ee ˈu nncjaˈjndyeeˈ jo nnom Ta na nncwjiˈyuuˈndyuˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na matseijndaaˈñe nato , cha mamˈaⁿcˈeendye nnˈaⁿ quia nncueeˈcañoom .

text: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins ,
text2: ˈU nñequiaaˈ na nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ na macwiluiˈnˈmaaⁿndyena ncˈe na matseitˈmaⁿ tsˈoom jnaaⁿna .

text: Through the tender mercy of our God ; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us ,
text2: Ncˈe na tjacantyja na wiˈ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jaa , juu na nnaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ , njñoom juu na nntseixueeñe jo nda ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: To give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death , to guide our feet into the way of peace .
text2: Juu nntseixueeñe nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ najo ̱ o ̱ ⁿñe na manchjenaˈ joo na wiˈ na cwitjoom . Ndoˈ nncjaachom jaa nato na ya nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel .
text2: Tjawijndeii tyochjoo Juan . Tjawijndo ̱ ˈ tsˈoom cantyja najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ quia na tueˈntyjo ̱ na tsaⁿsˈa jom , tyomˈaaⁿ jo ndoˈ yuu tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈoom hasta xjeⁿ na seicaˈmo ̱ ⁿñê nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ Israel .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus , that all the world should be taxed .
text2: Joo ncueeˈñeeⁿ tqueⁿ Augusto César ñˈoom na nleiljeii ncuee chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na chaˈtso ndyuaa na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom .

text: ( And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria . )
text2: Luaaˈ najndyee na teiljeii ncuee nnˈaⁿ . Maquialjoˈ tyomˈaaⁿ Cirenio gobiernom ndyuaa Siria .

text: And all went to be taxed , every one into his own city .
text2: Joˈ chii chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tyoˈoona tsjoomna na nleiljeii ncueena .

text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee , out of the city of Nazareth , into Judaea , unto the city of David , which is called Bethlehem ; ( because he was of the house and lineage of David : )
text2: Joˈ jnaⁿ José tsjoom Nazaret , tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Tjawaaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea , tsjoomˈ David na jndyu Belén . Ee juu José cwiluiiñê tsjaaⁿ David .

text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife , being great with child .
text2: Tjaaⁿ ñequio María , tsaⁿ na waa ñomca ñˈeⁿñê na nleiljeii ncueena . Ndoˈ juu majndeiiñe , jnda ̱ teinndyooˈ na nntseincuii .

text: And so it was , that , while they were there , the days were accomplished that she should be delivered .
text2: Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na mˈaⁿna Belén , tueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nntseincuii María .

text: And she brought forth her firstborn son , and wrapped him in swaddling clothes , and laid him in a manger ; because there was no room for them in the inn .
text2: Seincueⁿ jnaaⁿ na cweˈ jndyee . Tyochjoo juu . Seityjooñê liaa juu , chii tqueeⁿ juu tsˈom ˈnaⁿ na quicanjom na cwicwaˈ quiooˈ . Ee ticwanaaⁿ lˈaa yuu na cweˈ cwiquieya nnˈaⁿ .

text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field , keeping watch over their flock by night .
text2: Ndyooˈ tsjoom Belén jo ndoˈ jnda ̱ a ̱ , tyomˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta quiooˈ njmeiⁿˈ natsjom .

text: And , lo , the angel of the Lord came upon them , and the glory of the Lord shone round about them : and they were sore afraid .
text2: Ñejomto teitquiooˈñe cwii ángel cwentaaˈ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jo nda ̱ a ̱ na , ndoˈ juu nacaxuee na matseixmaaⁿ seixueeñenaˈ nacañoomna . Ndoˈ tˈmaⁿ waa na jlaˈcatyuendyena .

text: And the angel said unto them , Fear not : for , behold , I bring you good tidings of great joy , which shall be to all people .
text2: Ndoˈ tso ángel nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Tilaˈcatyuendyoˈ , mañequiaya ñˈoom na jeeⁿ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Juunaˈ nntsˈaanaˈ na jeeⁿ neiiⁿ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour , which is Christ the Lord .
text2: Ee tsjom jeˈ naquiiˈ tsjoomˈ David tuiiñe cwii tsˈaⁿ na nncwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe ˈo . Majuu Cristo na cwiluiiñê na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom .

text: And this shall be a sign unto you ; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes , lying in a manger .
text2: Luaa waa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ jom . Nliuˈyoˈ yuˈndaaˈñeeⁿ na chuˈtyjooñê liaa ndoˈ njoom yuu cwicwaˈ quiooˈ .

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God , and saying ,
text2: Ndoˈ matsˈia joˈ teitquiooˈ cwii tmaaⁿˈ ángeles ñequio ángelˈñeeⁿ . Cwilcwiiˈna Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Cwiluena :

text: Glory to God in the highest , and on earth peace , good will toward men .
text2: Catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ . Catsˈaanaˈ na tjaa ñomtiuu cˈom nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue jo nnoom , ee jeeⁿ cjaaweeˈ tsˈoom joona .

text: And it came to pass , as the angels were gone away from them into heaven , the shepherds said one to another , Let us now go even unto Bethlehem , and see this thing which is come to pass , which the Lord hath made known unto us .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tyˈelcweeˈ ángelesˈñeeⁿ cañoomˈluee . Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta quiooˈ njmeiⁿˈ jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — Cjaaya Belén . Tsaacantyˈiaaya chiuu waa na jnda ̱ tuii na luaaˈ maˈmo ̱ ⁿ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: And they came with haste , and found Mary , and Joseph , and the babe lying in a manger .
text2: Ndoˈ jlaˈtyuaaˈna , tyˈena . Quia na tquiena , jliuna María ñequio José ñˈeⁿ yuˈndaa na njoom yuu cwicwaˈ quiooˈ .

text: And when they had seen it , they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child .
text2: Jnda ̱ na ntyˈiaana na luaaˈ , jlaˈcano ̱ o ̱ ⁿna chiuu waa na jnda ̱ jndyena cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ yuˈndaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds .
text2: Chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na jndye ñˈoom na jluena , sˈaanaˈ na jeeⁿ tjaweeˈ nˈom .

text: But Mary kept all these things , and pondered them in her heart .
text2: Ndoˈ María jeeⁿ tyoqueeⁿ cwenta chaˈtso na tuii . Wjaawa , wjaacue na tyotseitioom .

text: And the shepherds returned , glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen , as it was told unto them .
text2: Quia na tyˈelcweeˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta quiooˈ njmeiⁿˈ , tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tyolcwiiˈna jom cantyja chaˈtso na jnda ̱ jndyena ndoˈ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaana chaˈxjeⁿ na tso ángel nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child , his name was called JESUS , which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb .
text2: Jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ ñeeⁿ xuee na tuiiñe yuˈndaa , quia joˈ chii jlaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena costumbre na waa jo nda ̱ a ̱ na na cwilˈa nnˈaⁿ judíos ñˈeⁿ yoˈndaa na naⁿnom . Ndoˈ jlaˈcajndyuna jom Jesús . Ee luaaˈ jnda ̱ tqueⁿ ángel xueⁿˈeⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nndeiiñe María jom .

text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished , they brought him to Jerusalem , to present him to the Lord ;
text2: Jnda ̱ teinom wenˈaaⁿ xuee na seincuii María , tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntjeiˈljuuˈndyena chaˈxjeⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés . Quia joˈ tyˈena Jerusalén , tyˈeñˈomna Jesús na nlqueⁿna juu lˈo ̱ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: ( As it is written in the law of the Lord , Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord ; )
text2: Ee luaa tso ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ : “ Ticwii cwii tyochjoo na nluiiñejndyee , queⁿ tsotyeeⁿ , tsoñeeⁿ jom cwentaaˈ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . ”

text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord , A pair of turtledoves , or two young pigeons .
text2: Joˈ chii tyˈena na nñeˈquiana quiooˈ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Quiooˈñeeⁿ nlaˈcwjee ntyee chaˈxjeⁿ na tˈmaⁿ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Tsonaˈ : nñequiana cwii ljo xencoo oo we cantuˈ ndyua .

text: And , behold , there was a man in Jerusalem , whose name was Simeon ; and the same man was just and devout , waiting for the consolation of Israel : and the Holy Ghost was upon him .
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jndyu Simeón tsjoom Jerusalén . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿ cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ ndoˈ jeeⁿ xcweeˈ tsˈoom ñˈeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ñequio na ntyjaaˈ tsˈoom tyomeinomˈm na nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ nquii na nntseinjoomˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ Israel . Ndoˈ tyomˈaaⁿ Espíritu Santo ñˈeⁿñê .

text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost , that he should not see death , before he had seen the Lord ' s Christ .
text2: Jnda ̱ tˈmo ̱ ⁿ Espíritu Santo nnoom na xocueeⁿˈeⁿ cwitjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ nquii Cristo na tqueⁿ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nndYo .

text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple : and when the parents brought in the child Jesus , to do for him after the custom of the law ,
text2: Sˈaa Espíritu Santo naquiiˈ tsˈoom na nncjaⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Ndoˈ maxjeⁿˈñeeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na nda yuˈndaa Jesús tyˈeñˈomna juu joˈ joˈ na nluii ñˈeⁿñê chaˈxjeⁿ waa costumbre na matsa ̱ ˈntjom ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés .

text: Then took he him up in his arms , and blessed God , and said ,
text2: Quia joˈ toˈñom Simeón yuˈndaa , teiˈcaljoom juu lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Tyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tsoom :

text: Lord , now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace , according to thy word :
text2: Ta , juu ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tsuˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , jnda ̱ seicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ . Jeˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ moso ˈnaⁿˈ , quiaaˈ na nncˈio ̱ to ̱ na meiⁿcwii ñomtiuu ticˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya .

text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation ,
text2: Ee na jnda ̱ mamantyˈiano ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nquii na nncwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe nnˈaⁿ .

text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people ;
text2: Majuu na jnda ̱ tqueⁿˈ jo nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ .

text: A light to lighten the Gentiles , and the glory of thy people Israel .
text2: Juu cwiluiiñe naxuee na mˈmo ̱ ⁿ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na nchii judíos . Ndoˈ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ ˈnaⁿˈ , nnˈaⁿ Israel , nntsˈaaⁿ na nluiitˈmaⁿndyena cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him .
text2: José ñequio tsondyee Jesús jeeⁿ tjaweeˈ nˈomna chaˈtso ñˈoom na seineiⁿ Simeón cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: And Simeon blessed them , and said unto Mary his mother , Behold , this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel ; and for a sign which shall be spoken against ;
text2: Ndoˈ Simeón seitˈmaaⁿˈñê joona , tsoom nnom María , tsondyee Jesús : — Queⁿˈ cwenta , yuˈndaamˈaaⁿ , maqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom na ntˈom nnˈaⁿ Israel nntsuundyena ncˈe na ticalaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê . Ndoˈ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ Israel nluiˈnˈmaaⁿndyena ncˈe na nlaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê . Mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chiuu waa na matyˈiomyanaˈ na calˈa nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ñˈeeⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ nntioˈñˈoomna jom .

text: ( Yea , a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also , ) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed .
text2: Ndoˈ na luaaˈ nlˈana , nntseicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿnaˈ ñˈomtiuu ˈnaaⁿna . Ndoˈ ˈu jeˈ , quia na nntyˈiaˈ na ljoˈ , nntseiˈndaaˈnaˈ ntyjiˈ chaˈcwijom na nncwicandiˈ espada ˈu .

text: And there was one Anna , a prophetess , the daughter of Phanuel , of the tribe of Aser : she was of a great age , and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity ;
text2: Ndoˈ joˈ joˈ tyomˈaaⁿ cwii yuscu na jndyu Ana , jom cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ na tyoñequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda Fanuel , tsaⁿ na cwiluiiñe tsjaaⁿ na jndyowicantyjooˈ Aser . Xjeⁿ na scundyua jom tocoom , tˈoom ñequio saaⁿˈaⁿ ntquieeˈ chu ,

text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years , which departed not from the temple , but served God with fastings and prayers night and day .
text2: jnda ̱ chii ljoñê na tueˈ saaⁿˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ jnda ̱ tquieñê , jnda ̱ ñequieenˈaaⁿ nchooˈ ñequiee choomˈm . Ndoˈ tîcalueeⁿˈeⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Tyondiˈntjoom nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom naxuee ndoˈ natsjom . Tyotseicwejndoˈñê ndoˈ tyotseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord , and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem .
text2: Majuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ na matseineiⁿ Simeón , seicandyooˈñe Ana nacañoomna . Tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ yuˈndaa Jesús . Jnda ̱ chii tyotseineiiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ Jerusalén ñequio nnˈaⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ njoom na cwimeindooˈ na nndyaandye na cwilaxmaⁿ jnaⁿ .

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord , they returned into Galilee , to their own city Nazareth .
text2: José ñˈeⁿ María quia na jnda ̱ jlaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena chaˈtsoti na matso ljeii na tqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tyˈelcweeˈna tsjoomna Nazaret , tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , filled with wisdom : and the grace of God was upon him .
text2: Tjawijndeii tyochjooˈñeeⁿ , tjawitquiooˈ na wandoˈ tsˈoom ndoˈ canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya tjawijndo ̱ ˈ tsˈoom . Ndoˈ tˈmaⁿ waa na matseixmaaⁿ naya ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover .
text2: Ticwii chu tyocaa José ñˈeⁿ María Jerusalén quia cwiweeˈ xuee pascua .

text: And when he was twelve years old , they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ canchooˈwe chuuˈ Jesús , tyˈewana ñˈeⁿñê Jerusalén chaˈxjeⁿ waa costumbre na quiˈoona xuee pascuaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And when they had fulfilled the days , as they returned , the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem ; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it .
text2: Jnda ̱ teinom xuee , José ñequio tsondyee Jesús macwiˈoolcweeˈna . Sa ̱ a ̱ tiqueⁿna cwenta na ljooˈñe tyochjoo Jesús Jerusalén .

text: But they , supposing him to have been in the company , went a day ' s journey ; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance .
text2: Jlaˈtiuuna na ñˈeeⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na macwiˈoolcweeˈ na tyˈe xuee . Meiiⁿchaaˈ xuee tyocañjomndyena nato . Jnda ̱ chii to ̱ ˈna , tyolˈueena jom quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaaⁿna ñequio nnˈaⁿ na taˈjnaaⁿˈna .

text: And when they found him not , they turned back again to Jerusalem , seeking him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ na tîcaliuna jom , joˈ chii tyˈelcweeˈnndaˈna Jerusalén , na cwilˈueena jom .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days they found him in the temple , sitting in the midst of the doctors , both hearing them , and asking them questions .
text2: Xuee na jnda ̱ ndyee , ndoˈ jliuna jom naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Wacatyeeⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ñˈoom na tqueⁿ Moisés . Maqueeⁿ cwenta ñˈoom na cwilaˈneiⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ mawaxˈeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers .
text2: Chaˈtsondyena na tyondyena ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ , jeeⁿ tyojaaweeˈ nˈomna na cjee matseiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ majoˈndyo ñˈoom matseilcweeⁿˈeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And when they saw him , they were amazed : and his mother said unto him , Son , why hast thou thus dealt with us ? behold , thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing .
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na nda jom quia na ntyˈiaana , jeeⁿ seiñˈeeⁿˈnaˈ joona . Tso tsoñeeⁿ nnoom : — ˈU jndaaya , ¿ chiuu na luaaˈ saˈ ? Ja ñˈeⁿ tsotyeˈ ñequio na chjooˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ cwilˈua ̱ a ̱ yâ ˈu .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye sought me ? wist ye not that I must be about my Father ' s business ?
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu waa na cwilˈueˈyoˈ ja ? ¿ Aa ticaliuˈyoˈ na tseixmaⁿya na cˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya naquiiˈ waaˈ Tsotya ̱ ?

text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ñˈoom na seilcweeⁿˈeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And he went down with them , and came to Nazareth , and was subject unto them : but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart .
text2: Quia joˈ tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena tsjoom Nazaret . Ndoˈ tyomˈaaⁿñê na ndyaañê nda ̱ a ̱ na . Jeeⁿ tyocañjom tsˈom tsoñeeⁿ chaˈtso na tuii .

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature , and in favour with God and man .
text2: Jesús tjawijndo ̱ ˈti tsˈoom ndoˈ tjawijndeiityeeⁿ . Tjaweeˈ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈeⁿñê ndoˈ mati nnˈaⁿ .

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar , Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea , and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee , and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis , and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene ,
text2: Chu na jnda ̱ quinˈoom na mˈaaⁿ Tiberio César tsaⁿmaⁿtsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ tsjoom Roma , quia joˈ tyomˈaaⁿ Poncio Pilato gobiernom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea . Ndoˈ Herodes tyomˈaaⁿ gobiernom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Tyjeeⁿ Felipe tyomˈaaⁿ gobiernom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Iturea ñequio tsˈo ̱ ndaa Traconite . Lisanias tyomˈaaⁿ gobiernom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Abilinia .

text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests , the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness .
text2: Ndoˈ Anás ñequio Caifás , joona ntyee na tyoluiitquiendyena nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee quia joˈ . Ndoˈ Juan jnda Zacarías , xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tquiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈoom nnoom quia na mˈaaⁿ yuu tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈom .

text: And he came into all the country about Jordan , preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins ;
text2: Tyomanoom chaˈwaa ndyuaa na nndyooˈ jndaa Jordán . Tyoñequiaaⁿ ñˈoom na calcweˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ jnaaⁿna cha nntseitˈmaⁿ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joona , ndoˈ nleitsˈoomndyena .

text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Tuii na luaaˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na matso ljeii libro na chuu ñˈoom ˈndyoo profeta Isaías . Matso ljeiiˈñeeⁿ : Mˈaaⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseineiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ yuu tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈom . Matso tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ Calaˈjndaaˈndyoˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom cwii nato na juu joˈ nndyocwjeeˈcañoom nquii na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom ˈo . Cataˈndyoˈxcweˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom cwilayo ̱ ˈyoˈ nato na nñoom .

text: Every valley shall be filled , and every mountain and hill shall be brought low ; and the crooked shall be made straight , and the rough ways shall be made smooth ;
text2: Maxjeⁿ nntseicatooˈnaˈ ticwii cwii cantmaⁿˈ ndoˈ ticwii cwii sjo ̱ ñequio ta nleisunaˈ . Nanto na cancˈeeⁿ , nntseiliuunaˈ , ndoˈ nanto na cwajndii nntseiyo ̱ naˈ .

text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God .
text2: Quia joˈ nntyˈiaa chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ Nquii na maqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nncwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê joo . ”

text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Jndyendye nnˈaⁿ tyoˈoontyjaaˈna Juan na nntseitsˈoomñê joona . Quia joˈ tyotsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO tsjaaⁿ canduulja , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ tˈmo ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ na caleiˈnomˈyoˈ na nndyocwjeeˈcañoom na nntseiwˈii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈo ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance , and begin not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: Cˈomˈyoˈ na ndyaandyoˈ cha mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na mayuuˈcheⁿ cwilcweˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ ticalaˈsˈandyoˈ cheⁿncjoˈyoˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na nnduˈyoˈ : “ Jaa cwiluiindyo ̱ tsjaaⁿ Abraham . ” Nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , meiiⁿ cweˈ ljo ̱ ˈmeiiⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ nntseicwaqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nluiindyenaˈ tsjaaⁿ Abraham , quia joˈ nˈndiinaˈ ˈo .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: ˈO matseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom nˈoom na tisˈa ta ̱ cwilˈa . Ndoˈ manquiuˈyoˈ nˈoom na ticalˈa ta ̱ na ya , maxjeⁿ nntˈuaˈnaˈ . Ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ nntioom nnˈaⁿ joonaˈ quiiˈ chom . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na nntsˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈeⁿndyoˈ ˈo xeⁿ ticalˈaˈyoˈ yuu na ya .

text: And the people asked him , saying , What shall we do then ?
text2: Quia joˈ taˈxˈee naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — ¿ Chiuu macaⁿnaˈ na calˈaayâ xeⁿ yuuˈ na ljoˈ ?

text: He answereth and saith unto them , He that hath two coats , let him impart to him that hath none ; and he that hath meat , let him do likewise .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Tsˈaⁿ na maleiñˈoom we cotom , quiaa cwii nnom tsˈaⁿ na tjaa na cuaa . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ na waa nantquie , catsˈaa naya tsˈaⁿ na tjaaˈnaⁿ chiuu ya .

text: Then came also publicans to be baptized , and said unto him , Master , what shall we do ?
text2: Mati nnˈaⁿ na cwitoˈñoom sˈom cwentaaˈ gobiernom tquiona namˈaaⁿ na nleitsˈoomndyena . Jluena nnoom : — Ta , ¿ chiuu macaⁿnaˈ na calˈaayâ ?

text: And he said unto them , Exact no more than that which is appointed you .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Tancwinomˈyoˈ na cwitjeiˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Cataⁿˈyoˈ tomti na matsonaˈ na nntioomna .

text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him , saying , And what shall we do ? And he said unto them , Do violence to no man , neither accuse any falsely ; and be content with your wages .
text2: Mati taˈxˈee sondaro nnoom : — Ndoˈ jâ jeˈ , ¿ chiuu macaⁿnaˈ na calˈaayâ ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Talacatyˈueˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ talaco ̱ ˈyoˈ cantu joona cweˈ cha na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntjeiˈyoˈ sˈom ˈnaaⁿna . Caljoya nˈomˈyoˈ cwanti na cwitantjomˈyoˈ .

text: And as the people were in expectation , and all men mused in their hearts of John , whether he were the Christ , or not ;
text2: Chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ jeeⁿ tyocantyjaaˈ nˈomna na nncwjeeˈ juu Cristo . Joˈ chii tyomˈaaⁿˈ nˈomna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Juan , ¿ aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na jom cwiluiiñê Cristo ?

text: John answered , saying unto them all , I indeed baptize you with water ; but one mightier than I cometh , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire :
text2: Joˈ chii tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtsondyena , tsoom : — Ja matseitsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿndyo ̱ ˈo ñequio ndaatioo , sa ̱ a ̱ mandyontyjo ̱ nqueⁿ na nntseitsˈoomñê ˈo na nñequiaaⁿ Espíritu Santo naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomndyoˈ ˈo nntsˈaanaˈ chaˈcwijom nntseitsˈoomñê ˈo ñequio chom ee na nntˈuiityeⁿnaˈ ˈo cantyja jnaⁿˈyoˈ . Nqueⁿ tˈmaⁿti cwiluiiñê nchiiti ja . Meiⁿ ticatseixmaⁿya na cweˈ ja na nntseicanaⁿˈa lcoomˈm .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and will gather the wheat into his garner ; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable .
text2: Jnda ̱ wjaawindyooˈ na nntuˈxeⁿndyoˈ . Ee ˈo laˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom lqueeⁿ na ndicwaⁿ cwajndii . Luaa tsˈiaaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ lqueeⁿ . Matseicueeñe tsˈaⁿ lqueeⁿ trigo , cha ya ya nljuˈnaˈ . Quia na jnda ̱ ljuˈya lqueeⁿˈñeeⁿ , mana nntseiweeⁿ joonaˈ tsˈom tsa ̱ ˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ lqueeⁿ lueˈ ñˈeⁿ toˈ njñoom chom joˈ . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na machˈee Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Nnˈaⁿ na ya cwilˈa macoˈñoom joona sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na tisˈa cwilˈa , nntseicoom joona ñequio chom na tijoom canduuˈ .

text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people .
text2: Nmeiⁿˈ ñˈoom na tyotseijndo ̱ ˈ Juan nˈom nnˈaⁿ ñequio jndye ntˈomcheⁿ ñˈoom na tyotseicañeeⁿ joona ñˈoom naya .

text: But Herod the tetrarch , being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip ' s wife , and for all the evils which Herod had done ,
text2: Herodes , tsaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ gobiernom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea , jom cweˈ mˈaaⁿyaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ Herodías , scuuˈ tyjeeⁿ Felipe . Joˈ na seitiaˈ Juan jom na ticatsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ na ljoˈ machˈeeⁿ ndoˈ ñequio chaˈtso natia na jnda ̱ ñesˈaa tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Added yet this above all , that he shut up John in prison .
text2: Luaa seicwaljooˈtyeeⁿ nacjoo chaˈtso natia na sˈaaⁿ , na tjoomˈm Juan wˈaancjo .

text: Now when all the people were baptized , it came to pass , that Jesus also being baptized , and praying , the heaven was opened ,
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ teitsˈoomndye jndye nnˈaⁿ , mati teitsˈoomñe Jesús , xcwe na matseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ seicanaaⁿñenaˈ tsjo ̱ ˈluee .

text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him , and a voice came from heaven , which said , Thou art my beloved Son ; in thee I am well pleased .
text2: Jndyocue Espíritu Santo nacjoomˈm chaˈcwijom catuˈ . Ndoˈ teicˈuaa na seineiⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cañoomˈluee , matso : — ˈU cwiluiindyuˈ Jndaaya na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya . Jeeⁿ neiⁿya ˈu .

text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age , being ( as was supposed ) the son of Joseph , which was the son of Heli ,
text2: Ndoˈ Jesús chaˈna ntquiuu nchooˈ qui choomˈm quia na to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom . Tyolue nnˈaⁿ jnda José jom . Ndoˈ José jnda Elí ,

text: Which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi , which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Janna , which was the son of Joseph ,
text2: Elí jnda Matat , Matat jnda Leví , Leví jnda Melqui , Melqui jnda Jana , Jana jnda José ,

text: Which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Amos , which was the son of Naum , which was the son of Esli , which was the son of Nagge ,
text2: José jnda Matatías , Matatías jnda Amós , Amós jnda Nahum , Nahum jnda Esli , Esli jnda Nagai ,

text: Which was the son of Maath , which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Semei , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Nagai jnda Maat , Maat jnda Matatías , Matatías jnda Semei , Semei jnda José , José jnda Judá ,

text: Which was the son of Joanna , which was the son of Rhesa , which was the son of Zorobabel , which was the son of Salathiel , which was the son of Neri ,
text2: Judá jnda Joana , Joana jnda Resa , Resa jnda Zorobabel , Zorobabel jnda Salatiel , Salatiel jnda Neri ,

text: Which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Addi , which was the son of Cosam , which was the son of Elmodam , which was the son of Er ,
text2: Neri jnda Melqui , Melqui jnda Adi , Adi jnda Cosam , Cosam jnda Elmodam , Elmodam jnda Er ,

text: Which was the son of Jose , which was the son of Eliezer , which was the son of Jorim , which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi ,
text2: Er jnda Josué , Josué jnda Eliezer , Eliezer jnda Jorim , Jorim jnda Matat ,

text: Which was the son of Simeon , which was the son of Juda , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Jonan , which was the son of Eliakim ,
text2: Matat jnda Leví , Leví jnda Simeón , Simeón jnda Judá , Judá jnda José , José jnda Jonán , Jonán jnda Eliaquim ,

text: Which was the son of Melea , which was the son of Menan , which was the son of Mattatha , which was the son of Nathan , which was the son of David ,
text2: Eliaquim jnda Melea , Melea jnda Mainán , Mainán jnda Matata , Matata jnda Natán ,

text: Which was the son of Jesse , which was the son of Obed , which was the son of Booz , which was the son of Salmon , which was the son of Naasson ,
text2: Natán jnda David , David jnda Isaí , Isaí jnda Obed , Obed jnda Booz , Booz jnda Salmón , Salmón jnda Naasón ,

text: Which was the son of Aminadab , which was the son of Aram , which was the son of Esrom , which was the son of Phares , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Naasón jnda Aminadab , Aminadab jnda Aram , Aram jnda Esrom , Esrom jnda Fares , Fares jnda Judá ,

text: Which was the son of Jacob , which was the son of Isaac , which was the son of Abraham , which was the son of Thara , which was the son of Nachor ,
text2: Judá jnda Jacob , Jacob jnda Isaac , Isaac jnda Abraham , Abraham jnda Taré , Taré jnda Nacor ,

text: Which was the son of Saruch , which was the son of Ragau , which was the son of Phalec , which was the son of Heber , which was the son of Sala ,
text2: Nacor jnda Serug , Serug jnda Ragau , Ragau jnda Peleg , Peleg jnda Heber , Heber jnda Sala ,

text: Which was the son of Cainan , which was the son of Arphaxad , which was the son of Sem , which was the son of Noe , which was the son of Lamech ,
text2: Sala jnda Cainán , Cainán jnda Arfaxad , Arfaxad jnda Sem , Sem jnda Noé , Noé jnda Lamec ,

text: Which was the son of Mathusala , which was the son of Enoch , which was the son of Jared , which was the son of Maleleel , which was the son of Cainan ,
text2: Lamec jnda Matusalén , Matusalén jnda Enoc , Enoc jnda Jared , Jared jnda Mahalaleel , Mahalaleel jnda Cainán ,

text: Which was the son of Enos , which was the son of Seth , which was the son of Adam , which was the son of God .
text2: Cainán jnda Enós , Enós jnda Set , Set jnda Adán , Adán jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan , and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness ,
text2: Mawjaalcweˈ Jesús tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea na jnaaⁿ jndaa Jordán . Ndoˈ chaˈwaañˈeⁿ naquiiˈ tsˈoom tooˈ mˈaaⁿ Espíritu Santo . Tjañˈoom Espíritu jom cwii joo yuu na tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈoom .

text: Being forty days tempted of the devil . And in those days he did eat nothing : and when they were ended , he afterward hungered .
text2: Joˈ joˈ wenˈaaⁿ xuee tyolˈueeˈñe tsaⁿjndii chiuu nntsˈaaⁿ cha catseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñe Jesús . Chaˈwaati xueewaaˈ meiⁿchjoo ticwaˈ Jesús , jnda ̱ chii tyjeeˈ na ñeˈjnoomˈm .

text: And the devil said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , command this stone that it be made bread .
text2: Quia joˈ tso tsaⁿjndii nnoom : — Xeⁿ mayuuˈ ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , cwa catsa ̱ ˈntjomˈ tsjo ̱ ˈwaaˈ na catseicwaqueⁿnaˈ tyooˈ .

text: And Jesus answered him , saying , It is written , That man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word of God .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , tsoom : — Ja xocatsˈaa na ljoˈ ee waa ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsonaˈ : “ Nchii cweˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nantquie na wandoˈ tsˈaⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ chaˈtso ñˈoom na mañequiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . ”

text: And the devil , taking him up into an high mountain , shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii tjañˈoom tsaⁿjndii jom xqueⁿ cwii sjo ̱ nandye . Ndoˈ mantyjacheⁿ tˈmo ̱ ⁿ nnoom chaˈtsoti nˈiaaⁿ ntˈmaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: And the devil said unto him , All this power will I give thee , and the glory of them : for that is delivered unto me ; and to whomsoever I will I give it .
text2: Ndoˈ tso nnoom : — Lˈo ̱ ˈ ˈu nntio ̱ o ̱ cwenta chaˈtso najnda ̱ nmeiⁿˈ na cwilaˈxmaⁿ naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ ntˈmaⁿ ñequio chaˈtso na cwiluiitˈmaⁿndyena . Ee lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya jnda ̱ ljonaˈ ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nñequiaya joonaˈ nnom .

text: If thou therefore wilt worship me , all shall be thine .
text2: Xeⁿ ˈu nlcoˈ xtyeˈ na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈndyuˈ ja , quia joˈ chaˈtso joonaˈ maˈnaⁿˈ .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Get thee behind me , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , tsoom : — Quindyo ̱ o ̱ ˈ nacañomya , ˈu Satanás . Ja tijoom nntseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ ˈu ee waa ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsonaˈ : “ Macanda ̱ nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaˈ catseitˈmaaⁿˈndyuˈ ndoˈ macanda ̱ nnom jom nndiˈntjomˈ . ”

text: And he brought him to Jerusalem , and set him on a pinnacle of the temple , and said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down from hence :
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tjañˈoom tsaⁿjndii Jesús tsjoom Jerusalén ndoˈ tqueⁿ jom xqueⁿ tsiuˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Tso nnoom : — Xeⁿ ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , cwa cjuˈndyuˈ jo nacje ,

text: For it is written , He shall give his angels charge over thee , to keep thee :
text2: ee waa ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na matsonaˈ : Nñequiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈu luee ángeles cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ na calˈana cwenta ˈu .

text: And in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: Ndoˈ nntyjeeˈ lueena ˈu cha tincjaañjom ljo ̱ ˈ ncˈeˈ .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , It is said , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , tsoom : — Ja tijoom catsˈaa chaˈna matsuˈ luaaˈ ee mati waa cwiicheⁿ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsonaˈ : “ Tintsaˈ xjeⁿ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaˈ . ”

text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation , he departed from him for a season .
text2: Quia jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ chaˈtso nnom na tyochˈee tsaⁿjndii na nntsˈaaⁿ xjeⁿ Jesús , ˈñeeⁿ juu hasta jnda ̱ nquiacheⁿ nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ aa nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee : and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about .
text2: Ndoˈ tjalcweˈ Jesús tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Juu najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Espíritu Santo , canda ̱ a ̱ ˈñˈeⁿ tyotseixmaaⁿ joˈ . Ndoˈ tˈom ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ chaˈwaa ndyuaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And he taught in their synagogues , being glorified of all .
text2: Tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ naquiiˈ lanˈom ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos , ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ jeeⁿ tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena jom .

text: And he came to Nazareth , where he had been brought up : and , as his custom was , he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and stood up for to read .
text2: Tjaaⁿ Nazaret yuu na tjawijneiⁿ . Xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ , tjaaⁿ watsˈom chaˈxjeⁿ na quichˈeeⁿ . Ndoˈ teicantyjaaⁿ na nntseiˈnaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias . And when he had opened the book , he found the place where it was written ,
text2: Quia joˈ tquiana ljeii lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na seiljeii profeta Isaías , seicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ ljeiiˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ tueˈcañoom yuu na matsonaˈ :

text: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me , because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor ; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted , to preach deliverance to the captives , and recovering of sight to the blind , to set at liberty them that are bruised ,
text2: Nquii Espíritu cwentaaˈ Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿñe ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Ee nqueⁿ jnda ̱ tqueⁿño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ja na nñequiaya ñˈoom naya nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na ntyˈiaaˈndye . Ndoˈ jnda ̱ jñoom ja na jndyo ̱ o ̱ na catseinjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈa nnˈaⁿ na chjooˈ nˈom . Ndoˈ catseicandiiya nnˈaⁿ na matseicandyaandyo ̱ joona jnaaⁿna na waa . Ndoˈ catsˈaaya na nleitquioo nnˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿ . Ndoˈ catseicandyaandyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ na manchje nawiˈ .

text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord .
text2: Ndoˈ catseicandiiya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tiempo na tqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nluiˈnˈmaaⁿndye añmaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ .

text: And he closed the book , and he gave it again to the minister , and sat down . And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ seilcwiiñe Jesús tsom na chuu ljeiiˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ seilcweeⁿˈeⁿ juunaˈ nnom tsˈaⁿ na mandiˈntjom . Jnda ̱ chii tjacwacatyeeⁿ . Ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na tooˈndye watsˈomˈñeeⁿ jeeⁿ tyontyˈiaana nnoom .

text: And he began to say unto them , This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears .
text2: Quia joˈ to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ tyotseineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Ndoˈ tsoom : — Maxuee jeˈ matseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ljeiiwaaˈ yocheⁿ na cwindyeˈyoˈ na matseiˈnaⁿya juunaˈ .

text: And all bare him witness , and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth . And they said , Is not this Joseph ' s son ?
text2: Chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ tyolue ñˈoom ya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Tjaweeˈ nˈomna na jeeⁿ cajnda ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ . Tyoluena : — Cwa cweˈ jnda José tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ .

text: And he said unto them , Ye will surely say unto me this proverb , Physician , heal thyself : whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum , do also here in thy country .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jeˈ jeˈ nnduˈyoˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ñˈoomwaañe na cweˈ wjaañoomˈ na matsonaˈ : “ ˈU tsˈaⁿ na machˈee nasei , catseinˈmaⁿndyuˈ cheⁿnncuˈ . ” Ndoˈ cwaaⁿti nnduˈyoˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ : “ Tsˈiaaⁿ na cwindya ̱ a ̱ yâ na ñesaˈ tsjoom Capernaum , mati catsaˈ joonaˈ ñjaaⁿñe ndyuaa tsjomˈ . ”

text: And he said , Verily I say unto you , No prophet is accepted in his own country .
text2: Quia joˈ tsotyeeⁿcheⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , tixocalaˈljo nnˈaⁿ cwii profeta na mañecwii ndyuaana ñˈeⁿñe na mañequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: But I tell you of a truth , many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias , when the heaven was shut up three years and six months , when great famine was throughout all the land ;
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , jndye yolcu na jnda ̱ ljondye tyomˈaⁿ ndyuaa Israel joo ncuee na ñetˈoom Elías . Ncueeˈñeeⁿ ndyee chu waljooˈ xcwe tîcuaˈ , ndoˈ teijndoˈ chaˈwaa ndyuaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: But unto none of them was Elias sent , save unto Sarepta , a city of Sidon , unto a woman that was a widow .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii na mˈaaⁿ cwii joo naⁿlcuˈñeeⁿ jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom Elías , jñomyom juu na mˈaaⁿ cwii yuscu na jnda ̱ ljoñe tsjoom Sarepta ndyuaa Sidón .

text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet ; and none of them was cleansed , saving Naaman the Syrian .
text2: Ndoˈ mati jndye nnˈaⁿ na tyoleiˈcho ntycu lepra tyomˈaⁿ ndyuaa Israel joo ncuee na tyomˈaaⁿ profeta Eliseo . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwiindye naⁿˈñeeⁿ ticatseinˈmaaⁿ , macanda ̱ quii Naamán , tsˈaⁿ ndyuaa Siria .

text: And all they in the synagogue , when they heard these things , were filled with wrath ,
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia jndyena na luaaˈ tso Jesús , quia joˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na tooˈndye watsˈom , jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaˈ jlaˈwjeena .

text: And rose up , and thrust him out of the city , and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built , that they might cast him down headlong .
text2: Jlaˈtyuaaˈna , tjeiiˈna jom nnom tsjoom . Tyˈeñˈomna jom xqueⁿ ta yuu waa tsjoomna cha nlaˈcwatyuˈna jom .

text: But he passing through the midst of them went his way ,
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom jluiiˈñê quiiˈntaaⁿna , mana tjaaⁿ yuu na wjaⁿ .

text: And came down to Capernaum , a city of Galilee , and taught them on the sabbath days .
text2: Tjacue Jesús Capernaum , cwii tsjoom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Joˈ joˈ tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos xuee na cwitaˈjndyeena .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for his word was with power .
text2: Ndoˈ jeeⁿ tjaweeˈ nˈomna ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ , ee tyoˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na waa najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ .

text: And in the synagogue there was a man , which had a spirit of an unclean devil , and cried out with a loud voice ,
text2: Naquiiˈ watsˈomˈñeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na mˈaaⁿ jndyetia naquiiˈ tsˈom . Jndeii seixuaⁿ ñˈoom ˈndyoo jndyetiaˈñeeⁿ .

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art ; the Holy One of God .
text2: Tsoom : — Caˈndiiˈ jâ ˈu Jesús tsˈaⁿ Nazaret . ¿ Ljoˈ nntsaˈ ñˈeⁿndyô ̱ jâ ? ¿ Aa jndyoˈ na nntseityuiiˈ jâ ? Mawajnaⁿˈa ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyuˈ . ˈU cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na ljuˈ tsˈomˈ .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him . And when the devil had thrown him in the midst , he came out of him , and hurt him not .
text2: Seitiaˈ Jesús juu , matsoom : — Catseicheⁿˈ ndoˈ caluiˈyoˈ naquiiˈ tsˈom tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ . Ndoˈ jnda ̱ na seiquioo jndyetia juu quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ , mana jluiˈ jndyetia ñˈeⁿ naⁿjndii naquiiˈ tsˈom . Ndoˈ meiⁿcwii nata ̱ ˈ tîcalˈana ñˈeⁿñe .

text: And they were all amazed , and spake among themselves , saying , What a word is this ! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits , and they come out .
text2: Jeeⁿ tyue chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na ljoˈ sˈaa Jesús . Jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — Ñˈoommeiⁿˈ cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿnaˈ na cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ na maqueⁿ xjeⁿ . Ee waa najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom meiiⁿ jndyetia , meiiⁿ naⁿjndii , cwicaluiˈ .

text: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about .
text2: Tjantyˈee ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ chaˈwaa ndiocheⁿ ndyuaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And he arose out of the synagogue , and entered into Simon ' s house . And Simon ' s wife ' s mother was taken with a great fever ; and they besought him for her .
text2: Quia joˈ teicantyjaaⁿ , jlueeⁿˈeⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈomˈñeeⁿ . Tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ waaˈ Simón . Ndoˈ Simónˈñeeⁿ jeeⁿ nioom matseiconaˈ sta ̱ xeeⁿˈeⁿ . Lˈana tyˈoo nnom Jesús na catseinˈmaaⁿ juu .

text: And he stood over her , and rebuked the fever ; and it left her : and immediately she arose and ministered unto them .
text2: Joˈ chii tjantyjaaⁿˈaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , sa ̱ ˈntjoom na caˈndii tycuˈñeeⁿ juu . Ndoˈ mañoomˈ tcoˈyanaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Mana teicantyja , seiñˈoomˈñe na tcwaˈna .

text: Now when the sun was setting , all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him ; and he laid his hands on every one of them , and healed them .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ tmaaⁿ na manndyooˈ wjaacue ñeˈquioomˈ , chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nnˈaaⁿna na jndye nnom ntycu cwitjoom , tquiochona joo na mˈaaⁿ Jesús . Tioom lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nacjoo ticwii cwii joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ , mana nˈmaaⁿ .

text: And devils also came out of many , crying out , and saying , Thou art Christ the Son of God . And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak : for they knew that he was Christ .
text2: Mati jndyendye nnˈaⁿ sa ̱ ˈntjoom na caluiˈ jndyetia naquiiˈ nˈom . Tyolaˈxuaa jndyetiaˈñeeⁿ , tyolue : — ˈU cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Sa ̱ a ̱ jom seitiaaⁿˈaⁿ jndyetia , tinquiaaⁿ na nlaˈneiⁿ , ee manquiuna na jom cwiluiiñê Cristo .

text: And when it was day , he departed and went into a desert place : and the people sought him , and came unto him , and stayed him , that he should not depart from them .
text2: Quia jnda ̱ teincoo jlueeⁿˈeⁿ quiiˈ tsjoom . Tjaaⁿ yuu na wataaⁿˈ quiiˈ jnda ̱ a ̱ . Tyˈecalˈuee nnˈaⁿ jom ndoˈ jliuna yuu mˈaaⁿ . Ñeˈcalaˈtsaaⁿˈndyena jom na wjaatyeeⁿ , cha ticaˈñeeⁿ joona .

text: And he said unto them , I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also : for therefore am I sent .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mati macaⁿnaˈ na nñequiaya ñˈoom naya cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ njoom . Ee maxjeⁿ joˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na jñoom ja .

text: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee .
text2: Ndoˈ tyojaanquiaaⁿ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ naquiiˈ lanˈom tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea .

text: And it came to pass , that , as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God , he stood by the lake of Gennesaret ,
text2: Cwii ndiiˈ tyomˈaaⁿ Jesús ˈndyoo ndaaluee chjoo na jndyu Genesaret . Jeeⁿ tyonchjenaˈ jom na jlaˈcantoˈndye nnˈaⁿ nacañomˈm cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nndyena ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And saw two ships standing by the lake : but the fishermen were gone out of them , and were washing their nets .
text2: Ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ we wˈaandaa ˈndyoo ndaalueeˈñeeⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwitjeiiˈ calcaa jnda ̱ jluiˈna joˈ joˈ . Macwitmaaⁿna nlquiˈ ˈnaaⁿna .

text: And he entered into one of the ships , which was Simon ' s , and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land . And he sat down , and taught the people out of the ship .
text2: Quia joˈ tjacuo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ tsˈom cwii wˈaandaaˈñeeⁿ . Wˈaandaa ˈnaaⁿˈ Simón joˈ . Tcaaⁿ na cjaañˈoomti tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ juunaˈ chjoowiˈ cha nˈndiinaˈ tyuaatcwii . Ndoˈ tjacjom . Tquiaaⁿ ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ xjeⁿ na wacatyeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈom wˈaandaa .

text: Now when he had left speaking , he said unto Simon , Launch out into the deep , and let down your nets for a draught .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ jnda ̱ seineiiⁿ , tsoom nnom Simón : — Catsaañˈomˈyoˈ wˈaandaawaa , wjaawjaatya ̱ a ̱ ya yuu na njoomti . Ndoˈ catueˈyoˈ nlquiˈ ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ na nntjeiˈyoˈ calcaa .

text: And Simon answering said unto him , Master , we have toiled all the night , and have taken nothing : nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Simón nnoom : — Ta , meiiⁿchaaˈ tsjom ñelˈaayâ tsˈiaaⁿ ndoˈ meiⁿcwii catscaa tîcatjeiiˈâ . Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja ñˈoom ˈndyoˈ ˈu nncjuˈnndaˈa tsquiˈ .

text: And when they had this done , they inclosed a great multitude of fishes : and their net brake .
text2: Jnda ̱ na lˈana na ljoˈ , jeeⁿ jndye calcaa tyˈoomnaˈ tsˈom tsquiˈ ˈnaaⁿna hasta ñeˈcatyˈiooˈnaˈ .

text: And they beckoned unto their partners , which were in the other ship , that they should come and help them . And they came , and filled both the ships , so that they began to sink .
text2: Joˈ chii sˈo ̱ o ̱ lueena nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ ncˈiaana na ñjomndye cwiicheⁿ wˈaandaa na quioteiˈjndeii naⁿˈñeeⁿ joona . Tquio naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ jlaˈcatooˈna we wˈaandaa ñˈeⁿ calcaa , hasta ncuencue na cˈuˈnaˈ joonaˈ .

text: When Simon Peter saw it , he fell down at Jesus ' knees , saying , Depart from me ; for I am a sinful man , O Lord .
text2: Quia jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaˈ Simón Pedro na luaaˈ , tcoomˈm xtyeeⁿ jo nnom Jesús . Tsoom : — Ta , ticatyˈiomyanaˈ na nñˈeⁿˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ee ja tsˈaⁿjnaⁿ .

text: For he was astonished , and all that were with him , at the draught of the fishes which they had taken :
text2: Ee jeeⁿ ndyaˈ seicatyˈuenaˈ jom ñequio ntˈomcheⁿ ncˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na ñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿ calcaa na tjeiiˈna .

text: And so was also James , and John , the sons of Zebedee , which were partners with Simon . And Jesus said unto Simon , Fear not ; from henceforth thou shalt catch men .
text2: Majoˈti tjom Jacobo ñequio Juan , ntseinda Zebedeo . Joona mañecwii tˈmaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ cwilˈana ñequio Simón . Quia joˈ tso Jesús nnom Simón : — Tintyˈueˈ , jeˈ mamanaⁿtonaˈ na nnˈaⁿ nntseitjomˈ na nlaˈjomndyena ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , tachii cweˈ calcaa .

text: And when they had brought their ships to land , they forsook all , and followed him .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tquiena tyuaatcwii ñˈeⁿ lˈaandaa , mana ˈndyena tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿna . Tyˈelajomndyena ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: And it came to pass , when he was in a certain city , behold a man full of leprosy : who seeing Jesus fell on his face , and besought him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Quia na tyomˈaaⁿ Jesús cwii tsjoom , tyjeeˈcañoom cwii tsaⁿsˈa na chaˈwaañe chuu tycu lepra . Quia na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ Jesús , tjacwanquioom nomtyuaa , sˈaaⁿ tyˈoo , tsoom : — Ta , ntyjii na ˈu nnda ̱ a ̱ nntseinˈmaⁿˈ ja , xeⁿ lˈue tsˈomˈ .

text: And he put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will : be thou clean . And immediately the leprosy departed from him .
text2: Quia joˈ Jesús seintyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ tyeⁿnquioomˈm tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Tsoom nnom : — Maxjeⁿ lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na canˈmaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ mantyjacheⁿ nˈmaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And he charged him to tell no man : but go , and shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing , according as Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii tsoom nnom : — Tintseineiⁿˈ nnom meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ na luaaˈ tuii . Sa ̱ a ̱ cjaˈ , catseicaˈmo ̱ ⁿndyuˈ nnom tyee ndoˈ quiaaˈ quiooˈ na nncueˈ cantyja na jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na sa ̱ ˈntjom Moisés . Na nntsaˈ na luaaˈ nluiˈyuuˈnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿˈ .

text: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him : and great multitudes came together to hear , and to be healed by him of their infirmities .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tjantyˈeeti ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús . Ndoˈ jndyendye nnˈaⁿ tyoˈoontyjaaˈ na nndye ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ . Mati ñeˈcanˈmaaⁿna ntycu na wiina .

text: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness , and prayed .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom teiño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , tjaaⁿ jo yuu na ñenqueⁿ . Joˈ joˈ tyotseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And it came to pass on a certain day , as he was teaching , that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by , which were come out of every town of Galilee , and Judaea , and Jerusalem : and the power of the Lord was present to heal them .
text2: Cwii xueeˈñeeⁿ maˈmo ̱ ⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Joˈ joˈ meindyuaandye ntˈom nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés . Naⁿˈñeeⁿ jnaⁿna chaˈtso njoom nchˈu tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea ñequio Judea ndoˈ mati tsjoom Jerusalén . Ndoˈ juu najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿnaˈ ñˈeⁿ Jesús na matseinˈmaaⁿ nnˈaⁿwii .

text: And , behold , men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy : and they sought means to bring him in , and to lay him before him .
text2: Mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tquieˈcañom ntˈom naⁿnom na chona tsuee na ndiiˈ tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ teintjeiⁿ ncˈee na teiˈcaljoo tycutqueeⁿ . Tyolˈueeˈndyena chiuu ya na nncˈooñˈomna tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ naquiiˈ wˈaa na nlqueⁿna jom jo nnom Jesús .

text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude , they went upon the housetop , and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tîcaliuna chiuu ya nlˈana ee na jeeⁿ jndye nnˈaⁿ . Joˈ chii tyˈewana nacjooˈ wˈaa , tjo ̱ o ̱ na nquioo , jlaˈcˈo ̱ ⁿna jom na njoom tsuee . Tqueⁿna jom quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ jo nnom Jesús .

text: And when he saw their faith , he said unto him , Man , thy sins are forgiven thee .
text2: Quia na ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús na cwilaˈyuˈya nˈom naⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom : — ˈU re , matseitˈmaⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jnaⁿˈ na matseixmaⁿˈ .

text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason , saying , Who is this which speaketh blasphemies ? Who can forgive sins , but God alone ?
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio nnˈaⁿ fariseos to ̱ ˈna na tiya nquiuna ñˈeⁿñê . Tyolaˈtiuuna naquiiˈ nˈomna : “ ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ cwiluiiñe tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na tiˈmaaⁿˈ tsˈoom na matseineiⁿ ñˈoom na wjaanaˈ nacjooˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ? ”

text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts , he answering said unto them , What reason ye in your hearts ?
text2: Seiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ Jesús ñˈomtiuu ˈnaaⁿna . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu na ticuaaya nquiuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ?

text: Whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Rise up and walk ?
text2: ¿ Cwaaⁿ ñˈoom na tijndeiˈtinaˈ na catsjo ̱ o ̱ ya ? ¿ Aa na nntsjo ̱ o ̱ : “ Matseitˈmaⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya chaˈtso jnaⁿˈ ” , oo aa na nntsjo ̱ o ̱ : “ Quicantyjaˈ , cjaˈcaˈ ” ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins , ( he said unto the sick of the palsy , ) I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy couch , and go into thine house .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cha caliuˈyoˈ na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee ndoˈ na waa najndeii na matseixmaⁿya nnom tsjoomnancuewaa na catseitˈmaⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ , quia joˈ tsoom nnom tsˈaⁿ na ntjeiⁿ ncˈee : — ˈU re , matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya njomˈ , quicantyjaˈ , catseilcwiindyuˈ tsueˈ cjaˈtoˈ waˈ .

text: And immediately he rose up before them , and took up that whereon he lay , and departed to his own house , glorifying God .
text2: Mañoomˈ teicantyja tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na jndooˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ . Seilcwiiñê tsuee ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na ñetuaaⁿ . Mana tjaaⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ . Jeeⁿ matseitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And they were all amazed , and they glorified God , and were filled with fear , saying , We have seen strange things to day .
text2: Ndoˈ tyueneiiⁿ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ . Tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Jluena ñequio na tyueneiiⁿna : — Xuee jeˈ ntyˈiaa nda ̱ a ̱ ya cwii na jeeⁿ tˈmaⁿ , na meiⁿjom tiquintyˈiaaya .

text: And after these things he went forth , and saw a publican , named Levi , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he said unto him , Follow me .
text2: Jnda ̱ tuii na luaaˈ , jluiˈ Jesús joˈ joˈ . Ljeiiⁿ cwii tsaⁿcoˈñom sˈom na jndyu Leví . Wacatyeeⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wˈaa yuu na cwiˈoocatioom nnˈaⁿ sˈom tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ na cwentaaˈ gobiernom . Quia joˈ tsoom nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Candyoˈntyjo ̱ ˈ naxa ̱ ⁿˈa .

text: And he left all , rose up , and followed him .
text2: Mantyja teicantyja Leví , tjeiˈñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ , chii tjatseijomñê ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house : and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them .
text2: Ndoˈ seiñˈoomˈñê cwii nantquie tˈmaⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ cwentaaˈ Jesús . Seitjoom jndye ncˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na ñequio ñetoˈñoom sˈom tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ cwentaaˈ gobiernom . Teindyuaandyena nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñˈeⁿñê ndoˈ ñˈeⁿ Jesús ñequio ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ .

text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples , saying , Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés tyolaˈncjooˈndyena nacjoo nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿ Jesús . Jluena nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — ¿ Chiuu na cwicwaˈyoˈ ndoˈ cwiweˈyoˈ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitoˈñoom sˈom cwentaaˈ gobiernom , ndoˈ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈtjo ̱ o ̱ ndyena nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ?

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , They that are whole need not a physician ; but they that are sick .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Nnˈaⁿ na tiwii titjo ̱ o ̱ ndyena tsˈaⁿ na machˈee nasei , sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na wii tjo ̱ o ̱ ndyena jom .

text: I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Ja nchii jndyo ̱ o ̱ ya na nncwaⁿya nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ . Ja jndyo ̱ o ̱ ya na nncwaⁿya nnˈaⁿjnaⁿ na calcweˈ nˈomna .

text: And they said unto him , Why do the disciples of John fast often , and make prayers , and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees ; but thine eat and drink ?
text2: Quia joˈ tyoluena nnom Jesús : — Nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿ Juan , jndye ndiiˈ cwilaˈcwejndoˈndyena ndoˈ cwilaˈneiⁿna nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ majoˈti cwilˈa nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos . Sa ̱ a ̱ joo nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿndyuˈ cwicwaˈna ndoˈ cwiwena . ¿ Chiuu na luaaˈ cwilˈana ?

text: And he said unto them , Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Aa ndyaˈ nnduˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na tquiolaˈjomndyena na macoco tsˈaⁿ na calaˈcwejndoˈndyena yocheⁿ na ndicwaⁿ mˈaaⁿ nquii tsaⁿsˈa na macoco quiiˈntaaⁿna ?

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nncwjiˈnaˈ jom quiiˈntaaⁿna , ncueeˈñeeⁿ nlaˈcwejndoˈndyena .

text: And he spake also a parable unto them ; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old ; if otherwise , then both the new maketh a rent , and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old .
text2: Mati seineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na ñˈoom na wjaañoomˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ñˈoom xco na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Tsoom : — Tjaaˈnaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ nntyjee cwii taⁿˈ liaaˈ , liaa xco na nntseiyo ̱ liaa ntsaa ñˈeⁿ juunaˈ . Ee xeⁿ luaaˈ nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ , nntseiˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ liaaⁿˈaⁿ liaa xcoˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ nchii macanda ̱ joˈ , mati tixocatseixˈiaaˈñenaˈ ñequio liaa ntsaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles ; else the new wine will burst the bottles , and be spilled , and the bottles shall perish .
text2: Meiⁿ tjaa ˈñeeⁿ juu nntiom winom xco nˈom ntjaⁿ teindyo . Ee xeⁿ na ljoˈ nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ , nntyˈiooˈnaˈ nlˈa winom xcoˈñeeⁿ , mana cwiwiˈndaaˈ winom ndoˈ mati ntjaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: But new wine must be put into new bottles ; and both are preserved .
text2: Joˈ chii macaⁿnaˈ na nncˈoocue winom xco nˈom ntjaⁿ xco cha meiⁿ ntjaⁿ xcoˈñeeⁿ ticwiˈndaaˈnaˈ ndoˈ meiⁿ winom .

text: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new : for he saith , The old is better .
text2: Ee tsˈaⁿ na maˈuu winom tquie , meiⁿchjoo ticaˈnaⁿ ntyjii winomxco . Ee matsoom na joo winom tquie , joˈ caˈnaⁿti .

text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first , that he went through the corn fields ; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn , and did eat , rubbing them in their hands .
text2: Luaa tuii cwii xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ judíos . Mawinom Jesús yuu na niom ntjom lqueeⁿ trigo . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê , tyˈiooˈndyena xuˈlqueeⁿ . Tyˈueeˈndyena joonaˈ nˈom lueena jnda ̱ chii tquiina .

text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them , Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days ?
text2: Quia joˈ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos jluena : — ¿ Chiuu na cwilˈaˈyoˈ cwii na ticatsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ ?

text: And Jesus answering them said , Have ye not read so much as this , what David did , when himself was an hungred , and they which were with him ;
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO , ¿ aa tyoolaˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoom chiuu sˈaa David quia na tˈoom na ñeˈjnoomˈm , ndoˈ mati nnˈaⁿ na ñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿñê ?

text: How he went into the house of God , and did take and eat the shewbread , and gave also to them that were with him ; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone ?
text2: Tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ watsˈom cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tcaaⁿ ntyooˈ na jnda ̱ tqueⁿ nnˈaⁿ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ ntyooˈñeeⁿ macanda ̱ ntyee wanaaⁿ na nlcwaˈna joonaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tcwaˈ David joonaˈ ndoˈ mati tquiaaⁿ na tcwaˈ nnˈaⁿ na ñˈeeⁿ ñˈeñê .

text: And he said unto them , That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee waa na jndo ̱ na nntsjo ̱ o ̱ ljoˈ calˈa nnˈaⁿ meiiⁿ xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath , that he entered into the synagogue and taught : and there was a man whose right hand was withered .
text2: Cwiicheⁿ xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ , tjaquieeˈ Jesús watsˈom chjoo . Tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ joˈ joˈ mˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jnda ̱ tjateii tsˈo ̱ ntyjaya .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him , whether he would heal on the sabbath day ; that they might find an accusation against him .
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio nnˈaⁿ fariseos , jeeⁿ tyoqueⁿna cwenta xeⁿ na nntseinˈmaⁿ Jesús tsˈaⁿwiiˈ xuee na cwitaˈjndyeena , cha quia joˈ nnda ̱ a ̱ nñeˈquiana jnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: But he knew their thoughts , and said to the man which had the withered hand , Rise up , and stand forth in the midst . And he arose and stood forth .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ mantyjeeⁿ chiuu cwilaˈtiuuna , joˈ chii tsoom nnom tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjateii tsˈo ̱ : — Quicantyjaˈ , cwintyjeˈ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ teicantyja tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , teintyjeeⁿˈeⁿ xcwe .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , I will ask you one thing ; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good , or to do evil ? to save life , or to destroy it ?
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Nncwaxˈa ̱ cwii ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya , ¿ aa wanaaⁿ na cateijndeii tsˈaⁿ xˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na wiˈ matjom oo aa ticateijneiⁿ juu ? ¿ Aa cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê xˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ cha ticueˈ oo aa caˈñeeⁿ na cueˈ ?

text: And looking round about upon them all , he said unto the man , Stretch forth thy hand . And he did so : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ , tsoom nnom tsˈaⁿwiiˈ : — Catseiliuuˈ tsˈo ̱ ˈ . Sˈaa tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na ljoˈ ndoˈ tcoˈyaˈñˈeⁿnaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ .

text: And they were filled with madness ; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus .
text2: Jnaaⁿˈ joˈ jeeⁿ jlaˈwjeena Jesús . Ndoˈ tyoˈmaⁿna ñˈeⁿ ncˈiaana ljoˈ nnda ̱ a ̱ nlˈana jom .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that he went out into a mountain to pray , and continued all night in prayer to God .
text2: Joo ncueeˈñeeⁿ tjawa Jesús cwii ta naquiiˈ jnda ̱ a ̱ na nntseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ meiiⁿnchaaˈ tsjom tyotseineiiⁿ nnom .

text: And when it was day , he called unto him his disciples : and of them he chose twelve , whom also he named apostles ;
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ teixuee , tcwaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê . Quiiˈntaaⁿna tjeiiˈñê canchooˈwendye nnˈaⁿ na seicajñoom joona apóstoles , nnˈaⁿ na majñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ .

text: Simon , ( whom he also named Peter , ) and Andrew his brother , James and John , Philip and Bartholomew ,
text2: Nmeiiⁿ ncueena : Simón , tsaⁿ na seicajñoom Pedro , ñequio tyjee tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , Andrés , ñˈeⁿ Jacobo ñequio Juan , ñˈeⁿ Felipe ñequio Bartolomé ,

text: Matthew and Thomas , James the son of Alphaeus , and Simon called Zelotes ,
text2: ñˈeⁿ Mateo ñequio Tomás , ñˈeⁿ Jacobo jnda Alfeo , ndoˈ ñˈeⁿ Simón na cwiluena cananista ,

text: And Judas the brother of James , and Judas Iscariot , which also was the traitor .
text2: ñˈeⁿ Judas jnda Jacobo ñequio Judas Iscariote , tsˈaⁿ na tquiaa cwenta Jesús .

text: And he came down with them , and stood in the plain , and the company of his disciples , and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem , and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon , which came to hear him , and to be healed of their diseases ;
text2: Jndyocue Jesús ñequio chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê . Tyˈemeintyjeeˈna cwii su . Joˈ joˈ jnda ̱ tquieˈcañom ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ ñequio jndyendye nnˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ chaˈwaa Judea ñequio Jerusalén ñequio ˈndyoo ndaaluee na nndyooˈ tsjoom Tiro ñˈeⁿ Sidón . Naⁿˈñeeⁿ tquiona na nndyena ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ , ndoˈ na nntseinˈmaaⁿ joona ntycu na cwitjoomna .

text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed .
text2: Mati seinˈmaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jeeⁿ cwajndii tyoleichuu jndyetia .

text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him : for there went virtue out of him , and healed them all .
text2: Chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tyolˈueeˈndyena chiuu ya cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nñeˈquioˈna jom , ee waa najneiⁿ na nnˈmaⁿ tsˈaⁿ xeⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ nñequiuuˈ jom . Joˈ chii chaˈtsondyena nˈmaaⁿna .

text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples , and said , Blessed be ye poor : for yours is the kingdom of God .
text2: Quia joˈ ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO nnˈaⁿ na ntyˈiaandyoˈ , mañequiaanaˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ , ee cwilaxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Blessed are ye that hunger now : for ye shall be filled . Blessed are ye that weep now : for ye shall laugh .
text2: ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ na cwiweˈjndoˈyoˈ jeˈ , mañequiaanaˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ ee quia nñequiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom chaˈcwijom na jnda ̱ tjacjoˈyoˈ . ’ ˈO nnˈaⁿ na cwityueeˈyoˈ jeˈ , mañequiaanaˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ ee macwjiˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na chjooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall hate you , and when they shall separate you from their company , and shall reproach you , and cast out your name as evil , for the Son of man ' s sake .
