text2: Ndoˈ meiiⁿ matseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñê njomˈ ntquieeˈ ndiiˈ na cwii xuee , ndoˈ cwii cwii ndiiˈ nncjaacatsoom njomˈ : “ Catseitˈmaⁿ tsˈomˈ ja , cwilcweˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ” , maxjeⁿ ñequiiˈcheⁿ catseitˈmaⁿ tsˈomˈ jom .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Apóstoles jluena nnom Ta Jesús : — Quiaaˈ na tˈmaⁿti nlayuˈya nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Meiiⁿ na jeeⁿ cachjoo cwilayuˈya nˈomˈyoˈ cweˈ chaˈna cachjoo cwii tsˈom lqueeⁿ mostaza , nnda ̱ a ̱ nnduˈyoˈ nnom tsˈoom sicómorowaaˈ : “ Catyendyuˈ ndoˈ coˈnaˈ ˈu tsˈom ndaaluee . ” Ndoˈ maxjeⁿ nntseicanda ̱ naˈ ñˈomndyueˈyoˈ .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: ’ Calˈuu cwiindyoˈ ˈo mˈaaⁿ mosooˈ na matseindyaa oo na machˈee cwenta quiooˈ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ , ndoˈ quia jnda ̱ tyjeeˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na jnaⁿ jnda ̱ a ̱ , ¿ aa mantyja nntsuˈ nnom : “ Cwinoomˈ luaa , cajmaⁿˈ na nlcwaˈ ” ?

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: ¿ Aa nchii najndyee nntsuˈ nnoom ? : “ Cwa catseijndaaˈndyuˈ jeˈ , catseiñˈoomˈndyuˈ na nlcwaaˈa . Xeⁿ jnda ̱ tcwaaˈa ndoˈ jnda ̱ tˈua , quia ljoˈcheⁿ nlcwaˈ ndoˈ nncˈuaˈ . ”

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na nñequiaaˈ na quianlˈuaaˈ mosoˈ ncˈe na seicana ̱ a ̱ ⁿ ñˈoom na sa ̱ ˈntjomˈ jom ? Matseitiuu xocatsaˈ na ljoˈ .

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Mati ˈo , quia na jnda ̱ lˈaˈyoˈ chaˈtso na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ na calˈaˈyoˈ , quia joˈ canduˈyoˈ : “ Jâ cwiluiindyô ̱ moso na tjaa yuu lˈuendye . Ee cweˈ tomti na laxmaaⁿyâ na calˈaayâ jnda ̱ ñelˈaayâ . ”

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Quia joˈ tjatjati Jesús na mawjaⁿ Jerusalén , teinoom tyencooˈ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Samaria ñequio tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: Chaˈna tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ cwii tsjoom chjoo , jluiˈnom qui nnˈaⁿ na cho tycu lepra , tquia tyˈemeiˈntyjeeˈna .

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: Jndeii jlaˈxuaana , jluena : — ˈU Jesús na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , cˈoomˈ na wiˈ tsˈomˈ jâ .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Quia na ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús joona , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catsalaˈcaˈmo ̱ ⁿndyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee . Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na cwiˈoona , jliuna cwa jnda ̱ ljuuˈndyena tycuˈñeeⁿ .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Ndoˈ cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , quia na ljeiiⁿ na jnda ̱ nˈmaaⁿ , tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ , cˈuaa ˈñom na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Tcoomˈm xtyeeⁿ jo nnom Jesús , tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ . Tsˈaⁿ samaritano tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús : — ¿ Aa nchii quindye nnˈaⁿ na ljuuˈndye ? Ndoˈ ntˈomcheⁿ ñjeeⁿ jeˈ ¿ yuu mˈaⁿ ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Macanda ̱ juu tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ na nchii tsˈaⁿ judío , jndyotseitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nnom : — Quicantyjaˈ , cjaˈtoˈ . Ncˈe na matseiˈyuˈya tsˈomˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿˈ .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Tyotaˈxˈee nnˈaⁿ fariseos nnom Jesús cwaaⁿ nncwjeeˈcañoom juu na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Xocalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ aa jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ juunaˈ cweˈ cwii ˈnaaⁿ na nleitquiooˈ .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Tjaa ˈñeeⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ nntso : “ Luaaˈ mˈaaⁿ ” , oo “ Laˈñeeⁿ mˈaaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom ” , ee jnda ̱ mamatsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoomˈm : — Manncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nntseiqueeⁿnaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na ñeˈcantyˈiaˈnndaˈyoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , sa ̱ a ̱ taxocantyˈiaˈyoˈ ja .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Nluena nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : “ Luaaˈ jom ” , oo “ Luaa . ” Sa ̱ a ̱ tintsantyjaˈyoˈ . Meiⁿ tintsantyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Ee chaˈxjeⁿ na macoˈ tsueechom matseixueenaˈ cwii ntyjaaˈ tsjo ̱ ˈluee xjeⁿ cwiicheⁿ ntyjaaˈnaˈ , maluaaˈ nntseijomnaˈ quia na nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ najndyee macaⁿnaˈ na tˈmaⁿ nawiˈ catjo ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ mati calˈa nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ jeˈ na ticueeˈ nˈomna ja .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: Chaˈxjeⁿ na tyolˈa nnˈaⁿ xjeⁿ na tyomˈaaⁿ Noé , maluaaˈ nntseijomnaˈ nlˈa nnˈaⁿ xjeⁿ na manndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Ee quia ljoˈcheⁿ tyocwaˈna , tyowena . Tyoˈuncona , tyoñequiana ndana na nncˈunco hasta xuee quia na tuo ̱ Noé tsˈom wˈaandaa . Quia joˈ jnaⁿnaˈ na tuaˈntyˈa , tja ̱ chaˈtsondye naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: Ndoˈ majoˈti tuii quia na tyomˈaaⁿ Lot , tyocwaˈna , tyowena . Tyolaˈjndana , tyonda ̱ a ̱ na . Tyonomna ntjom , tyolˈana lˈaa .

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu xuee na tjeiˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom Lot tsjoom Sodoma , tuaˈ ndaaluaaˈ chom ñequio ljo ̱ ˈ sufra ̱ na jnaⁿnaˈ tsjo ̱ ˈluee . Ndoˈ seicwjeenaˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ tsjoomˈ ñeeⁿ .

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: Maluaaˈ nntsˈaanaˈ xuee na nleitquiooˈndyo ̱ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: ’ Majuu xueeˈñeeⁿ , tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ chˈeⁿ , tintseicandyaˈ tsˈoom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na nncjaaqueⁿˈeⁿ naquii wˈaa na nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ joonaˈ . Ndoˈ majoˈti tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ tindyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ na nndyochoom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Cjaañjoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ scuuˈ Lot .

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ñeˈcwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe cheⁿnquii , majoˈto joˈ nntsuuñe . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿnquia tsˈaⁿ na mañequiaañe na catjom ljoˈ na nntjom , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿñê .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: ’ Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , juu teijaaⁿˈñeeⁿ quia na nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa , we nnˈaⁿ maⁿˈ cjooˈ jnduu , cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na mˈaaⁿya , ndoˈ cwiicheⁿ maˈndiinaˈ .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: We yolcu ñeˈnaaⁿˈ cwitua , cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na mˈaaⁿya , ndoˈ cwiicheⁿ maˈndiinaˈ .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: We nnˈaⁿ mˈaⁿ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ na cwilˈa tsˈiaaⁿ , cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaañˈoomnaˈ jom na mˈaaⁿya , ndoˈ cwiicheⁿ maˈndiinaˈ .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê , taˈxˈeena nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Yuu cwii jom joˈ , Ta ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ndyueena cwii ñˈoom na tjañoomˈ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na maxjeⁿ nntuˈxeⁿndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Tsoom : — Yuu na meindyuaa ˈnaⁿ to ̱ ˈ , joˈ joˈ nntjomndye cantˈeiⁿ .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Mati seineiⁿ Jesús cwiicheⁿ ñˈoom na tjañoomˈ . Maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na ñeˈquiiˈcheⁿ calaˈneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tincwintqueeⁿna .

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii jwe cwii tsjoom . Juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ meiⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tinquiaⁿˈaⁿ , meiⁿ nnˈaⁿ tiquitseitˈmaaⁿˈñê .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: Mati tyomˈaaⁿ cwii yuscu tsjoomˈñeeⁿ na jnda ̱ ljoñe na tueˈ saaˈ . Juu yuscuˈñeeⁿ ñequiiˈcheⁿ na tyocaa na mˈaaⁿ jweˈñeeⁿ na catseijndaaˈñe ñˈoom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Tyotsoom nnom : “ Cwañomˈ ja ñˈoom cantu na sˈaa tsˈaⁿ nacjoya . ”

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: Jndye xuee tîcatseinˈoomˈñe jwe yuscuˈñeeⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ jnda ̱ joˈ seitioom naquiiˈ tsˈoom : “ Meiiⁿ na tinquiaya Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ meiiⁿ na ticatseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ ,

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ee na jeeⁿ matseiliooˈ yuscumˈaaⁿˈ ja , nncwaño ̱ ⁿˈto ̱ jom cwitjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ nntycwii na tˈmaⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ñˈeⁿñê . ”

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Tso Ta Jesús : — Jweˈñeeⁿ meiiⁿ na wiˈñe sa ̱ a ̱ ¿ aa cwiqueⁿˈyoˈ cwenta na tsoom na nncwañomˈtoom yuscuˈñeeⁿ ?

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Majndeiiticheⁿ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ¿ aa nchii nncwañomˈm nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjeiiˈñê cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ , na cwilcwiiˈna jom naxuee ndoˈ natsjom ? Xocatsˈaaⁿ na mayo ticatseiñˈoomˈñê joona .

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , jom mantyja nntseiñˈoomˈñê . Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa , ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , ¿ aa ndyaˈ cwii nljei na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈyuˈya nˈom ñˈeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ?

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Mati seineiⁿ Jesús ñˈoom tjañoomˈwaa nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwitjeiiˈ cheⁿnquiee cwenta na jeeⁿ ya cwilˈa , sa ̱ a ̱ mˈaⁿna na ticueeˈ nˈomna ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Tsoom :

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: — Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ fariseo ndoˈ mati tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿquiñom sˈom cwentaaˈ gobiernom . We naⁿˈñeeⁿ mañejuu xjeⁿ tyˈena watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na nlaˈneiⁿna nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Juu fariseo teintyjeeⁿˈeⁿ , luaa waa ñˈoom na tsoom nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom : “ ˈU Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , mañequiaya na quianlˈuaˈ na ticatseixmaⁿya chaˈna ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ , chaˈna nnˈaⁿ na cantyˈuendye , nnˈaⁿ na quilˈa yuu na ticatyˈiomyanaˈ , nnˈaⁿ na cweˈ mˈaⁿya ñˈeⁿ ncˈiaa , mati meiiⁿ nchii chaˈ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ , tsaⁿquiñom sˈom .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Ja we ndiiˈ matseicwejndoˈndyo ̱ na cwii smaⁿna , ndoˈ chaˈtso na mawantjo ̱ ⁿ mañequiaya diezmo . ”

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsaⁿquiñom sˈom , tquia tjameintyjeeⁿˈeⁿ , meiⁿ na nluˈnda ̱ a ̱ ñê tsjo ̱ ˈluee . Macanda ̱ tyomeiiⁿˈeⁿ ndaˈ tseiˈjñaaⁿ na tyotseintyˈiaaˈñê , tsoom : “ ˈU Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , cˈoomˈ na wiˈ tsˈomˈ ja tsˈaⁿjnaⁿ . ”

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , tsaⁿquiñoom sˈom tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ seitˈmaⁿ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom , nchiiti cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ee meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiwendyeñe cheⁿnquii , maxjeⁿ nntseiquioo Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu . Ndoˈ tsˈaⁿ na majuˈcjeñe , maxjeⁿ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Tquiocho nnˈaⁿ yocanchˈu na mˈaaⁿ Jesús na nntioom lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nacjoona . Ndoˈ quia na ntyˈiaa nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê na luaaˈ , jlaˈtiaˈna nnˈaⁿ na tquiocho yocanchˈuˈñeeⁿ .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Quia joˈ tqueeⁿˈñe Jesús yocanchˈu ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ : — Caˈndyeˈyoˈ na nñequio yocanchˈu na mˈaaⁿya , tilaˈntycwiˈyoˈ joona ee yuu na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , juunaˈ matseixmaⁿnaˈ cwentaa nnˈaⁿ na ntyjaandye ja chaˈna quilˈa yosanchˈumˈaⁿ .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ticantyjaaˈ tsˈom na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu chaˈna ntyjaaˈ tsˈom cwii yucachjoo , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ xocanda ̱ a ̱ nncjaaquieeˈñe joˈ joˈ .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Cwii tsˈaⁿ judío na cwiluiitquieñe taxˈee nnoom : — ˈU Ta na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na ya tsˈaⁿndyuˈ , ¿ chiuu ya nntsˈaa cha nndaya na ticantycwii na nncwaˈndo ̱ ˈa ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom : — Matsuˈ na ja ya tsˈaⁿndyo ̱ , macanda ̱ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñê na ljoˈ .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: ˈU mantyjiˈ ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom na matsonaˈ : “ Tincˈoomˈyaˈ ñˈeⁿ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ . Tintseicueˈ tsˈaⁿ . Tinchˈueeˈ ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈaⁿ . Tintseineiⁿˈ cantu nacjooˈ tsˈaⁿ . Catseitˈmaaⁿˈndyuˈ tsotyeˈ ñˈeⁿ tsoˈndyoˈ . ”

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Tso tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Chaˈtso ñˈoommeiⁿˈ matseicanda ̱ xjeⁿ na cachjoondyo ̱ .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Quia na jndii Jesús na luaaˈ , tsoom nnom : — Cwii waa na cwii matseiˈtjo ̱ o ̱ ˈ . Cajnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ chaˈtso na maleichuˈ ndoˈ quiaaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ndyeñeeⁿˈ . Quia joˈ nncˈoomˈ na tyandyuˈ cañoomˈluee . Jnda ̱ joˈ candyotseijomndyuˈ ñequiondyo ̱ .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na jndii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na luaaˈ , seichjooˈnaˈ tsˈoom ee jeeⁿ tyañê .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Quia na ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús na jeeⁿ chjooˈ tsˈoom , tso : — Jeeⁿ ndyaˈ jndeiˈnaˈ na nñeˈquiandye naⁿtya na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joona .

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Tijndeiˈtinaˈ na nncwicandiiˈñe quiooˈ camello tsueˈ xˈee tseiˈnchquia nchiiti na nncjaaquieeˈ cwii tsaⁿtya ntyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na jndye ñˈoomwaaˈ , tyolue : — ¿ Quia joˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu nnda ̱ a ̱ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿñe ?

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Yuu na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nlˈa nnˈaⁿ , nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: Tso Pedro : — Cantyˈiaˈ , jâ jnda ̱ ˈndya ̱ a ̱ yâ chaˈtso ˈnaaⁿyâ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na maˈndii waaˈ oo scuuˈ , ntyjee , tsotye , tsondyee , oo ntseinda ncˈe na matseijomñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ,

text: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time , and in the world to come life everlasting .
text2: tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jndyeti nmeiⁿˈ nncoˈñoom tiempomeiiⁿ , ndoˈ xuee na cwii nndyotinaˈ nncˈoom na ticantycwii na wanoomˈm .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Quia joˈ tjeiˈndyo ̱ Jesús nnˈaⁿ canchooˈwendye . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , jeˈ macwitsaawaaya Jerusalén . Joˈ joˈ nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ chaˈtso ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na jlaˈljeii profetas cantyja ˈnaⁿya na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Ee nñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ gentiles , nlaˈjnaaⁿˈna ja , cwajndii ñˈoom na nluena cjoya ndoˈ njñomna ndaajnaⁿˈ ja .

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Mati nntjaaˈna ja , ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ nlaˈcueeˈna ja , sa ̱ a ̱ xuee jnda ̱ ndyee nncwando ̱ ˈxco ̱ .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ljoˈ cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ ee tyootseicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Joˈ chii tîleicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Luaa tuii . Quia na tyˈewindyoona tsjoom Jericó , joˈ wacatyeeⁿ cwii tsaⁿnchjaaⁿˈ ˈndyoo nato , macaaⁿ ljoˈ tjo ̱ o ̱ ñê nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Quia na jñeeⁿ na jndyendye nnˈaⁿ cawiˈnom , taxˈeeⁿ ljoˈ cwiluii .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Jluena nnoom : — Jesús na jnaⁿ Nazaret jom luaaˈ mawinoom .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Quia joˈ seixuaⁿ , tsoom : — Jesús , ˈu na cwiluiindyuˈ tsjaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ , cˈoomˈ na wiˈ tsˈomˈ ja .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na ˈoojndyee jlaˈtiaˈna jom , jluena catseicheeⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ jom yacheⁿ jndeii seixuaⁿ : — ˈU na cwiluiindyuˈ tsjaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ , cˈoomˈ na wiˈ tsˈomˈ ja .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Quia joˈ tjameintyjeeˈ Jesús , sa ̱ ˈntjoom na quioñˈomna tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na mˈaaⁿ . Quia tueeˈcañoom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , taxˈeeⁿ nnom , matsoom :

text: Saying , What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee ? And he said , Lord , that I may receive my sight .
text2: — ¿ Ljoˈ lˈue tsˈomˈ na catsˈaa ñˈeⁿndyuˈ ? Tˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na nleitquioya .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom : — Cwitquioˈ . Ncˈe na matseiˈyuˈya tsˈomˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , joˈ na jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿˈ .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Mañoomˈ teitquioomˈm . Tjantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naxeⁿˈ Jesús , tyotseitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ mati nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye , quia ntyˈiaana na luaaˈ , tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ tjaquieeˈ Jesús tsjoom Jericó , tjawinoom quiiˈ tsjoom .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Joˈ joˈ tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿtya na jndyu Zaqueo . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwiluiitquieñê jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwitoˈñoom sˈom cwentaaˈ gobiernom .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Tyoqueⁿñê na nncwajnaⁿˈaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ joˈ na Jesús , sa ̱ a ̱ tileicanda ̱ a ̱ ee jeeⁿ jndye nnˈaⁿ ndoˈ na catˈa ̱ a ̱ ˈñê .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Joˈ chii jleinoom , tjañetyeeⁿ , tjawaaⁿ cwii tsˈoom sicómoro na nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ Jesús ee na joˈ joˈ nncwinom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Quia na tueˈcañoom Jesús joˈ joˈ , jlunda ̱ a ̱ ñê , tsoom nnom : — Zaqueo , catseityuaaˈ , candyoˈcueˈ ee xuee jeˈ macaⁿnaˈ na caljooˈndyo ̱ waˈ .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Quia joˈ seityuaaⁿˈaⁿ jndyocueeⁿ . Ñequio na neiiⁿˈeⁿ seiljoom Jesús waⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na ntyˈiaa nnˈaⁿ na luaaˈ , chaˈtsondyena tyolaˈncjooˈndyena , jluena : — Cwa jndaaˈ tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ na nljooˈñê waaˈ tsˈaⁿ na matseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñe nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: Ndoˈ teintyjeeˈ Zaqueo , tsoom nnom Jesús : — Aa ndiˈ , Ta , xcwe ˈnaⁿya na niom manñequiaya nda ̱ a ̱ ndyeñeeⁿˈ ndoˈ xeⁿ na xˈua ̱ ya ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈaⁿ , jeˈ manntseilcwa ̱ ˈa ñequiee ndiiˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na tjeiiˈa .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Tso Jesús nnoom : — Xuee jeˈ juu na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ , jnda ̱ tyjeeˈnaˈ wˈaawaa . Ee mati tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ tsjaaⁿ Abraham .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Ee ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee jndyo ̱ calˈua ̱ ndoˈ jndyo ̱ cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwitsuundye añmaaⁿ .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na tyondye ñˈoommeiⁿˈ jlaˈtiuuna tyuaaˈ nleitquiooˈ cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ee manndyooˈ mˈaaⁿ Jesús tsjoom Jerusalén . Joˈ chii , tsotyeeⁿ ñˈoom na tjañoomˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Tsoom : — Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na tˈmaⁿ cwiluiiñe . Tjaaⁿ tquia cwiicheⁿ ndyuaa na nncoˈñoom tsˈiaaⁿ na nntseixmaaⁿ rey , ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ nndyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nncjaⁿ , tqueeⁿˈñê qui nnˈaⁿ na cwindyeˈntjomtyeⁿ nnoom . Tˈmaⁿ sˈom teijndeiiyaaⁿ nnom cwii cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : “ Calˈueendyoˈ chiuu nlˈaˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na nntantjomˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿ joonaˈ yocheⁿ na ja nncwja ̱ . ”

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ ndyuaa tsjomˈm , jndoona jom . Joˈ jñoomna nnˈaⁿ ndyuaa yuu na tjaaⁿ , tyˈecalue naⁿˈñeeⁿ : “ Jâ ticalˈue nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ nluiiñê rey cwentaaya . ”

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: Jnda ̱ na toˈñom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nˈiaaⁿ na nncˈoom , jndyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ . Tqueeⁿˈñê nnˈaⁿ na tquiaaⁿ sˈom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ . Ee ñeˈcaljeiiⁿ cwanti jnda ̱ taˈntjom cwii cwiindye naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: Tyjeeˈ tsaⁿ najndyee , tso nnoom : “ Nmeiiⁿ sˈom ˈnaⁿˈ , ta , qui ndiiˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na toˈño ̱ ⁿ jnda ̱ tantjo ̱ ⁿ ñˈeⁿ juunaˈ . ”

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nnom : “ Ya saˈ , ˈu mosoya , meiiⁿ cachjoo na toˈñomˈ sa ̱ a ̱ seicanda ̱ ˈ . Joˈ chii jeˈ maqua ̱ ⁿya ˈu nncˈoomˈ tsˈiaaⁿ , nntsa ̱ ˈntjomˈ qui tsjoom . ”

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: Ndoˈ tyjeeˈ tsaⁿ na jnda ̱ we , tso nnoom : “ Nmeiiⁿ sˈom ˈnaⁿˈ , ta , ˈom ndiiˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na toˈño ̱ ⁿ jnda ̱ tantjo ̱ ⁿya ñˈeⁿ juunaˈ . ”

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: Quia joˈ majoˈti tsoom nnom : “ Jeˈ maqua ̱ ⁿya ˈu nncˈoomˈ tsˈiaaⁿ , nntsa ̱ ˈntjomˈ ˈom tsjoom tˈmaⁿ . ”

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: Tyjeeˈ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ , tso nnoom : “ Luaa sˈom ˈnaⁿˈ , ta , na seiwa ̱ naquiiˈ payom .

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Ee ja jeeⁿ nquiaya ˈu na jeeⁿ jnda ̱ ñˈoom tseineiⁿˈ . Ee ˈu macoˈñomˈ yuu na nchii cwentaˈ , ndoˈ quitseiˈweˈ yuu na nchii ˈu jnomˈ . ”

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nnom : “ ˈU moso ˈnaⁿya na tia matseitiuuˈ , majuuti ñˈoom ˈndyoˈ nntsˈaaya na nncuˈxeⁿnaˈ ˈu . Xeⁿ ntyjiˈ na ja tsˈaⁿ na jeeⁿ jnda ̱ ñˈoom tseineiⁿ ndoˈ na macoˈño ̱ ⁿ yuu na nchii cwentaya ndoˈ na quitseiwa ̱ ya yuu na nchii nnco ̱ jno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈa ,

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: quia joˈ ¿ chiuu na tîcjaˈcaˈndiiˈ sˈom ˈnaⁿya banco yuu na nncwantjomnaˈ cha quia na nndyo ̱ o ̱ nndaˈa , nncoño ̱ ⁿ sˈom ˈnaⁿya mandiñˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ naˈ ? ”

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: Ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nacañomˈm : “ Catjeiˈyoˈ sˈom ˈnaⁿya lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ quiaˈyoˈ juunaˈ nnom tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na tantjom qui ndiiˈ . ”

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , jluena : “ Ta , ¿ chiuu ndoˈ mamaleiñˈoom qui ndiiˈ na laaˈtiˈ ? ”

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na maniom na maleichuu , nloˈñomti . Sa ̱ a ̱ tsˈaⁿ na tjaaˈnaⁿ na cuaa lˈo ̱ , nluiˈñˈeⁿ cwanti na maleiñˈoom .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: Mati joo nnˈaⁿ na jndoo ja , na ticalˈue nˈom na nntsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya joo , quiochoˈyoˈ joona ñjaaⁿñe ndoˈ ñequio na ndo ̱ o ̱ ˈa catyjeˈyoˈ cantyoˈna .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Jnda ̱ seineiⁿ Jesús ñˈoomwaaˈ , tjatjatyeeⁿ na nncueⁿˈeⁿ Jerusalén .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Ndoˈ quia na tjawiñoomˈm tsjoom Betfagé ñequio tsjoom Betania nndyooˈ yuu waa ta na jndyu Olivos , jñoom we nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê na cˈoona lˈaa .

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catsaˈyoˈ juu tsjoom chjoo na mˈaaⁿ ndyeyu jo nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ndoˈ chaˈna nntsaaquieˈyoˈ joˈ , nliuˈyoˈ cwii snom chjoo na ñjom . Juu quiooˈñeeⁿ meiⁿcwii ndiiˈ tyoowaˈljoo tsˈaⁿ . Calacanaⁿˈyoˈ , nquioñˈomˈyoˈ juuyoˈ ñjaaⁿ .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Ndoˈ xeⁿ mˈaaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ juu na nncwaxˈee nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ chiuu na cwilacanaⁿˈyoˈ juuyoˈ , luaa canduˈyoˈ nnom : “ Nquii Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom jâ tjo ̱ o ̱ ñê juuyoˈ . ”

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Quia joˈ tyˈena lˈaa na jñoom joona ndoˈ jliuna chaˈxjeⁿ na tsoom .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Yocheⁿ na cwilaˈcanaⁿˈna snom , jlue nnˈaⁿ na njmeiⁿˈ juuyoˈ : — ¿ Chiuu na cwilacanaⁿˈyoˈ snommˈaaⁿˈ ?

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ na : — Nquii Ta tjo ̱ o ̱ ñê juuyoˈ .

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: Mana tyˈeñˈomna snomˈñeeⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Jesús . Jnda ̱ tioona liaana naxeⁿˈyoˈ , teiˈcaljoona jom .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Yocheⁿ na mawjaawinoom , tyotsa ̱ ˈ nnˈaⁿ liaateincoo ˈnaaⁿna tsˈom nato .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ ˈoowindyoona tsjoom Jerusalén yuu na wjaacue nato ta na jndyu Olivos , chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoomˈm , to ̱ ˈna na jndeii tyolaˈxuaana . Tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja chaˈtso tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ na ntyˈiaana na tyochˈee Jesús .

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: Jluena : — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ cwiluiiñê Rey na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom jaa . Macwjeˈcañoom ñequio xueeˈ nquii na tjacantyja cwiluii tˈmaⁿñe . Jom catioˈnaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Cwiljoya tsˈoom ñequio nnˈaⁿ . Catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ nqueⁿ na mˈaaⁿ nandyeticheⁿ .

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Ntˈom nnˈaⁿ fariseos na ñˈeeⁿˈndye quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye jluena : — ˈU na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , catseitiaˈ naⁿmˈaⁿˈ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈomˈ .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , xeⁿ naⁿmˈaⁿ nlaˈcheⁿna , quia joˈ joo ljo ̱ ˈ nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyenaˈ ja .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Quia tueⁿˈeⁿ nnom tsjoomˈñeeⁿ , ndoˈ quia ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ juunaˈ , tyˈioom cantyja ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ .

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: Tyotseineiiⁿ chaˈcwijom nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom : — Toom cweˈ xuee jeˈ cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ljoˈ na macaⁿnaˈ cha nnda ̱ a ̱ ljoya tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ cweˈ wantyˈiuuˈ mˈaaⁿnaˈ jo nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Ee nncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na joo nnˈaⁿ na jndoo ˈo nlˈana tiomtsjo ̱ ˈ ndiocheⁿ nnom tsjomˈyoˈ na nncwañoomˈnaˈ joona . Ndoˈ nnta ̱ ˈna ˈo meiⁿnquia ntyja .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: Nlaˈtyuiiˈñˈeⁿna ˈo ndoˈ nlaˈcwjeena ndaˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ nlaˈtyuiiˈna niaⁿljo ̱ ˈ tsjomˈyoˈ . Meiⁿcwii tsjo ̱ ˈ taxocaˈndyena nacjooˈ xˈiaaˈnaˈ , cweˈ ncˈe na ticalañˈoomˈndyoˈ ja na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿndyoˈ .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tjaquieeˈ Jesús watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ chˈeⁿ , joo nnˈaⁿ na cwinda ̱ a ̱ ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjnda joˈ joˈ .

text: Saying unto them , It is written , My house is the house of prayer : but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Waa ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsonaˈ : “ Wˈaya cwiluiiñenaˈ wˈaa yuu na cwilaˈneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . ” Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo cwilˈaˈyoˈ juunaˈ chaˈcwijom tsueˈtsjo ̱ ˈ yuu na cwicatooˈndye naⁿcantyˈue .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Ndoˈ ticwii xuee tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom , tyolˈueeˈndyena chiuu ya nlˈana na nlaˈcueeˈna jom .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿchjoo tileicaliuna chiuu ya nlˈana ee chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ tyocantyjaaˈ nˈom ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Tjuˈnaˈ cwii xueeˈñeeⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Mañequiaaⁿ ñˈoom naya na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tquieˈcañom ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye quiiˈ tsjoom .

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: Jlue naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Catsuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , ¿ yuu tyˈomˈ najnduˈ na macheˈ nmeiiⁿˈ ? Ndoˈ ¿ ˈñeeⁿ tquiaa na matseixmaⁿˈ na luaaˈ ?

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mati ja mawaxˈa ̱ cwii ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Catˈo ̱ ˈyoˈ nndii .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: Na tyotseitsˈoomñe Juan nnˈaⁿ , ¿ yuu jnaⁿ najneiⁿ ? ¿ Aa namˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom oo aa cweˈ ñˈom ndyuee nnˈaⁿ ?

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Quia joˈ tyolaˈneiⁿ cheⁿnquieena ñˈeⁿ ncˈiaana , tyoluena : — Xeⁿ nlˈuuya na mˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jnaⁿnaˈ , quia joˈ nntsoom : “ ¿ Chiuu na tîcalaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿñê ? ”

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ nlˈuuya namˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ jnaⁿnaˈ , nlaˈcwjee nnˈaⁿ jaa ñˈeⁿ ljo ̱ ˈ , ee cwilayuˈyana na Juan cwiluiiñê profeta .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Joˈ chii tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom : — Jâ ticaliuuyâ yuu jnaⁿyuu najndeii Juan na tyotseitsˈoomñê nnˈaⁿ .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Meiⁿ ja , xocatsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ˈñeeⁿ mañequiaa najndo ̱ na matsˈaa nmeiiⁿˈ .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: To ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na tyotseineiiⁿ ñˈoom tjañoomˈwaa nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , tsoom : — Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ . Tcoomˈm lˈo ̱ o ̱ uva tyuaaⁿˈaⁿ . Jnda ̱ joˈ teijndeiiyaaⁿ joonaˈ nnˈaⁿ na nlˈa tsˈiaaⁿ joˈ joˈ ndoˈ jndye xuee tjaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ ntyja .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Quia na tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na tquie ntjomˈñeeⁿ , jñoom cwii mosoomˈm na mˈaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ na nñeˈquiana na tseixmaⁿ cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tyotjaaˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ juu , jñoomna juu na tjaa ljoˈ tjachuu .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Joˈ chii jñomnnaaⁿˈaⁿ cwiicheⁿ mosoomˈm . Mati tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tyotjaaˈna ndoˈ tyolajnaaⁿˈna juu , jnda ̱ chii jñoomna juu na tjaa ljoˈ tjachuu .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Jñomnnaaⁿˈaⁿ cwiicheⁿ moso na jnda ̱ ndyee . Juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jlaˈquieeˈndyena , jnda ̱ chii tjeiiˈna juu naquiiˈ ntjomˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: ’ Quia joˈ tso tsˈaⁿ na ntjoomˈ joˈ : “ ¿ Chiuu chiuu nntsˈaayo ̱ ? Luaa nntsˈaa , njño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nquii tiˈjndaa na jeeⁿ candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Nntsˈaacheⁿndyo quia na nntyˈiaana jom , nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena jom . ”

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa tsˈiaaⁿ tyuaaⁿˈaⁿ , quia na ntyˈiaana na nquii jnaaⁿ joˈ , tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : “ Luaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na cwiljo ntjom lˈo ̱ . Cwa nlaˈcua ̱ a ̱ ˈa jom cha jaa nljo ntjom lua ̱ a ̱ ya . ”

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Joˈ chii , tjeiiˈna jom nnom ntjom ndoˈ jlaˈcueeˈna jom . Taxˈee Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , tsoom : — Nquii tsˈaⁿ na ntjoomˈ joˈ , ¿ ljoˈ ntsˈaaⁿ quio naⁿˈñeeⁿ ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Nñoom ndoˈ nntseicwjeⁿ joona . Ndoˈ nñeˈquiaaⁿ ntjom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Jnda ̱ na jndyena na seineiⁿ Jesús ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , jluena : — Tijoom cwancueeˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na caluii na luaaˈ .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Jesús nquiee ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ cwii ñˈoom na seijoomˈñe cheⁿnqueⁿ na tsjo ̱ ˈ na ya jom . Tsoom : — Quia joˈ ¿ ljoˈ ñeˈcaˈmo ̱ ⁿ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mawaa na matsonaˈ ? : Majuu tsjo ̱ ˈ na tîcwilˈueeˈndye luañeⁿ na cwilˈa tsiaⁿtsjo ̱ ˈ , jnda ̱ mameiⁿntyjeeˈnaˈ nqui tsiaⁿtsjo ̱ ˈ .

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na tileicatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , majuˈwiˈnaˈ juu chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na toomñe na tiooñe nacjooˈ tsjo ̱ ˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tsˈaⁿ na tiñeˈcatseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , maxjeⁿ nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ jom . Nntseijomnaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na tioo cwii tsjo ̱ ˈ tˈmaⁿ nacjooˈ , na seitiuujnda ̱ a ̱ naˈ juu .

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Nquiee ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tyolaˈjnda ̱ na na nntˈuena Jesús , ee jlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na nacjoo joona seineiiⁿ ñˈoom na tjañoomˈwaaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nquiaana nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye ,

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: joˈ chii jñoomna nnˈaⁿ na tyˈequeⁿ cwenta ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ . Tyolˈa naⁿˈñeeⁿ na ya nnˈaⁿndyena , cha nntyˈiaana aa nntseineiiⁿ ñˈoom na quio majuutinaˈ nnda ̱ a ̱ nlaˈquioona jom lˈo ̱ gobiernom na cuˈxeⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jom .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: Joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ taˈxˈee nnoom : — ˈU Maestro na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , nquiuuyâ na ndyeyu matseiˈneiⁿˈ ndoˈ ya maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ meiⁿ tyoocheˈ na cweˈ jndaaˈ ˈñeeⁿ neiⁿˈ . Ñeˈquiiˈcheⁿ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ natooˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Ndoˈ jeˈ Ta , ñeˈcandya ̱ a ̱ yâ , ¿ aa matsonaˈ na nñeˈquiaayâ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ yâ nnom César , oo aa ticatsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ ?

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom seiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ cweˈ na ñeˈcˈomna cwenta jom . Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu na ñeˈcalˈaˈyoˈ na catˈuiinaˈ ja ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Catˈmo ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cwii tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ ˈndyoonnom luaa ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ xueeˈ ljeiiwaa ? Jlue naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Nquii César , tsaⁿmaⁿtsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ tsjoom Roma .

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catiomˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ nnom César yuu na tseixmaⁿnaˈ cwentaaⁿˈaⁿ , ndoˈ quiaˈyoˈ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom yuu na tseixmaⁿnaˈ cwentaaˈ nqueⁿ .

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Tîcanda ̱ a ̱ nncˈomna jom ñˈeⁿ ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ . Yacheⁿ jlaˈcheⁿna na tjaweeˈ nˈomna ñˈoom na tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tquieˈcañom ntˈom nnˈaⁿ saduceos namˈaaⁿ Jesús . Joona nnˈaⁿ na cwilue na xocataˈndoˈnndaˈ nnˈaⁿ .

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: Taˈxˈeena nnoom , jluena : — ˈU Maestro na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , ˈndii Moisés ñˈoom lua ̱ a ̱ yâ na matsonaˈ xeⁿ nncueˈ cwii tsaⁿsˈa ndoˈ nljoñe scoomˈm na tjaaˈnaⁿ ntseinda , quia joˈ tyjee tsˈooˈñeeⁿ cocoom ñˈeⁿ scuuˈ xioom . Nncˈom ntseinaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ yuscuˈñeeⁿ cha nntseinoomñê na tjaa ntseinda xioom tˈom .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Luaa tuii . Tyomˈaⁿ ntquieeˈ naⁿnom ñenquii tsˈaⁿ ntseinda . Juu tsaⁿtquiee tocoom ndoˈ tyuaaˈ tueeⁿˈeⁿ , tjaa ndana ñˈeⁿ scoomˈm .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii tsaⁿ na jnda ̱ we tocoom ñˈeⁿ scuuˈ xioom , ndoˈ mati jom tueeⁿˈeⁿ , tjaa ntseinaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ yuscuˈñeeⁿ .

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: Quia joˈ tsaⁿ na jnda ̱ ndyee tocoom ñˈeⁿ yuscuˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ majoˈti chaˈtso ntquieeˈndyena cwii ndoˈ cwiindyena toˈñoomna jom na scuuna ndoˈ tja ̱ na . Meiⁿcwii ndana tjaaˈnaⁿ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Ndoˈ na cwiimacanda ̱ tueˈ yuscuˈñeeⁿ .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Quia joˈ quia na nntaˈndoˈxco nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ cwiindye joona na saaⁿˈaⁿ ? Ee chaˈtso ntquieeˈndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ scuuna jom .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue cwiˈunco ndoˈ cwiñeˈquia nda na cwiˈunco .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na majnda ̱ majndaaˈya na laˈxmaⁿ na nntaˈndoˈxcona na jnda ̱ tja ̱ . Ndoˈ laˈxmaⁿna na nncˈomna tiempo na nncuaaxco tsjoomnancue . Naⁿˈñeeⁿ taxocˈuncona , meiⁿ naⁿnom , ndoˈ meiⁿ naⁿlcu .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Meiⁿ taxocwjenndaˈna ee nntseijomnaˈ joona chaˈna ángeles . Ndoˈ ncˈe na cwicandaana na nntaˈndoˈxcona , joˈ chii matseijomnaˈ na cwitaˈndoˈna chaˈna wandoˈ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na nntaˈndoˈxco nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ , maquiiti Moisés tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na ljoˈ ñequio ñˈoom na seiljeiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈoom nioom zarza . Naquiiˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ tsoom na Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaaˈ Abraham , Isaac , ndoˈ Jacob .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Ee jom nchii cwiluiiñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwentaa lˈoo , jom cwentaa nnˈaⁿ na cwitaˈndoˈ . Joˈ chii maxjeⁿ maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ cwitaˈndoˈna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Cwantindye nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — ˈU Maestro na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ majoˈndyo ñˈoom matsuˈ .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Ndoˈ taticanda ̱ a ̱ ˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ saduceos na cwii nntaˈxˈeetina nnoom .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ : — ¿ Chiuu na cwilue nnˈaⁿ na Cristo cwiluiiñê tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ee naquiiˈ libro na chuu Salmos , maquiiti David tsoom : Nquii Ta Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsoom nnom juu Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom ja : “ Cajmaⁿˈ ntyjaaˈa ntyjaya yuu na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ˈu ,

text: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: hasta xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ tsa ̱ ˈa nnˈaⁿ na jndoo ˈu na cˈomna nacje ˈnaⁿˈ . ”

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: Cweˈ joˈ mawaxˈa ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : — ¿ Chiuu nntsˈaayuunaˈ na cwiluiiñe Cristo tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ ee manquiiti David matsoom na juu cwiluiiñe Ta na matsa ̱ ˈntjom jom ?

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Luaa ñˈoom na tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê , ñequio na ndye chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ :

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: — Queⁿndyoˈ cwenta na tilˈaˈyoˈ chaˈna cwilˈa nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , ee joona jeeⁿ neiiⁿna na nncoˈnomna na cweeˈna liaa na jnda na teiˈncoo . Ndoˈ lˈue nˈomna na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ joona na quia naⁿˈñeeⁿ na xmaⁿndyena ñequio na jndooˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ . Mati na nncwindyuaandyena yuu na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñetinaˈ joona naquiiˈ lanˈom . Ndoˈ na nncwindyuaandyena yuu na yati cwiwiñˈoomˈ na waa xuee .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a shew make long prayers : the same shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Ndoˈ cwintyˈuetyeⁿnquiona ˈnaaⁿ yolcu na jnda ̱ ljondye na tja ̱ noom . Juu xjeⁿ na cwilˈana na ljoˈ , jeeⁿ teincoo ñˈoom cwilaˈneiⁿna nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha tino ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na ljoˈ cwilaˈxmaⁿna . Tˈmaⁿti lcoˈwiˈnaˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ nntsˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Mˈaaⁿ Jesús watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , ndoˈ jleintyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ naⁿtya na cwiñeˈquia ofrendas cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Cwitioomna joonaˈ tsˈom castom .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Mati ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ cwii yuscu na jnda ̱ ljoñe , na jeeⁿ jñeeⁿˈñe . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tjacjoomˈm we tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿ na ticajndanaˈ joˈ joˈ .

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: Tso Jesús : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ nndyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , yuscumˈaaⁿˈ na jnda ̱ ljoñe , ndoˈ jñeeⁿˈñê , sa ̱ a ̱ tˈmaaⁿˈti tquiaaⁿ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , nchiiti na tquia chaˈtsondye ntˈomcheⁿ .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Ee chaˈtso naⁿmˈaⁿˈ cweˈ na waljooˈ tueeˈna na cwiñeˈquiana nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , sa ̱ a ̱ yuscumˈaaⁿ meiiⁿ na jñeeⁿˈñê , tjuˈñˈeeⁿ mandi cantyja na nlcwaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Tyolaˈneiⁿ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na jeeⁿ chjoomnaˈ ñequio ljo ̱ ˈ na neiⁿncooˈ ndoˈ ñequio ˈnaⁿ na ya na cwiñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ .

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Tsoom : — Chaˈtso na cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ nmeiⁿˈ , manncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nntyuiiˈñˈeⁿnaˈ . Taxocaljooˈ cwii tsjo ̱ ˈ nacjooˈ xˈiaaˈnaˈ .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Quia joˈ taˈxˈeena nnoom : — ˈU Maestro na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , ¿ cwaaⁿ nluii na luaaˈ ? Ndoˈ ¿ cwaaⁿ cwii ˈnaaⁿ mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na jnda ̱ teinndyooˈ nluii nmeiⁿˈ ?

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta cha tinquioˈnnˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ ˈo . Ee jndye nnˈaⁿ nlquieˈcañom na nlue na joona cwiluiindyena Cristo . Nluena : “ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ Cristo ” , ndoˈ nluena : “ Jeˈ jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ . ” Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo tilajomndyoˈ ñequio naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Meiⁿ tilaˈcatyuendyoˈ quia na cwindyeˈyoˈ na nndyocwjeˈcañoom ntiaˈ ndoˈ cwilaˈwendye nnˈaⁿ nacjoo gobiernom ˈnaaⁿna . Ee jndeiˈnaˈ na nmeiⁿˈ cwinomjndyee , sa ̱ a ̱ tyooweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntsuu tsjoomnancue .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: Ndoˈ tsotyeeⁿcheⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Nlaˈwendye nnˈaⁿ cwii ndyuaa nacjoo nnˈaⁿ cwiicheⁿ ndyuaa . Ndoˈ cwii tsaⁿmaⁿtsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ nntseiweñê nacjooˈ cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿmaⁿtsˈiaaⁿ .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Jndye joo jndeii nntsˈeii ndoˈ nncˈoom jndoˈ ntˈmaⁿ ñequio ntycu na wjaatcuuñenaˈ . Ndoˈ tˈmaⁿ nlaˈcatyuendye nnˈaⁿ na nntyˈiaana jndye ˈnaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ na nleitquiooˈ tsjo ̱ ˈluee .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: ’ Sa ̱ a ̱ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluii chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ , nntˈue nnˈaⁿ ˈo nawiˈ ndoˈ nleiˈntyjo ̱ na ˈo ndoˈ mati nñeˈquiana cwenta ˈo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ naquiiˈ lanˈom nchˈu ndoˈ nntioomna ˈo lˈaancjo . Ndoˈ nncˈoochona ˈo jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwitsa ̱ ˈntjom ñequio naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ , cweˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ xueya .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Quia na nntjomˈyoˈ nmeiⁿˈ nncjuˈnaaⁿñenaˈ na nntjeiˈyuuˈndyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Calaˈjndaaˈndyoˈyaˈyoˈ na tincˈoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ cwaaⁿ ñˈoom na nntˈo ̱ ˈyoˈ cha nncwañoomˈnaˈ ˈo ,

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: ee xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ nnco ̱ nncwjaaˈndyo ̱ ñˈoom quiiˈ ndyueˈyoˈ ndoˈ nñequia na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈomˈyoˈ hasta meiⁿcwiindye joo nnˈaⁿ na jndoo ˈo xonda ̱ a ̱ nluena na tilˈue ñˈoom na nnduˈyoˈ meiⁿ na nluena na tiyuuˈnaˈ .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Mati lotyeˈyoˈ , londyeeˈyoˈ , ntyjeeˈyoˈ , nnˈaⁿˈyoˈ , nnˈaⁿ na ya ñˈoom ˈo ñˈeⁿndye , nñeˈquiana cwenta ˈo luee nnˈaⁿ ndoˈ ntˈomndyoˈ nlaˈcwjee naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ nncˈomna na ticueeˈ nˈomna ˈo cweˈ ncˈe na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ xueya .

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ xocaˈndiya na nntsuundyoˈ . Hasta meiⁿ cweˈ cwii soonqueⁿˈyoˈ xocatsuunaˈ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Ndoˈ ncˈe na ticaˈndyencˈuaaˈndyoˈ nntoˈñoomˈyoˈ na ticantycwii na nntandoˈyoˈ .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: ’ Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na nntyˈiaˈyoˈ na cwitjaaˈndye sondaro tsei ndiocheⁿ Jerusalén , quia joˈ calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntyuiiˈ tsjoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: Quia ljoˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea , cˈooleinomna , cˈoona quiiˈ ntsjo ̱ . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ quiiˈ tsjoomˈñeeⁿ caluiˈna joˈ joˈ . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ jo jnda ̱ a ̱ tincˈoolcweˈna tsjoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Ee quia joˈ ncuee na cwitioomndye nnˈaⁿ cantyja na wiˈndyena cha nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ chaˈtso ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na jnda ̱ teiljeii .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: Ntyˈiaandye yolcu na ndeiindye joo ncueeˈñeeⁿ ñequio yolcu na ˈndaandye nda . Ee nnquioo cwii nawiˈ tˈmaⁿ nacjoo nnˈaⁿ tyuaawaa ndoˈ jeeⁿ tˈmaⁿ nawiˈ na nntˈuiinaˈ joona .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Nncwjena ñˈeⁿ xjo ndoˈ ntˈom nncˈoocho nnˈaⁿ pra ̱ so na ticwii cwii ndyuaa . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na nchii judíos nlco ̱ ˈna tsjoom Jerusalén jndye xuee , hasta nncueeˈ xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ seijndaaˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nncjaawintyjeeˈ na cwiluii na ljoˈ .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: ’ Tˈmaⁿ ˈnaaⁿ nleitquiooˈ nntyˈiaa nnˈaⁿ nnom ñeˈquioomˈ ñˈeⁿ chiˈ ñˈeⁿ cancjuu . Ndoˈ nnom tsjoomnancue tˈmaⁿ nntseiˈndaaˈnaˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ . Nntseiñˈeeⁿˈnaˈ joona quia na nndyena na jeeⁿ cˈuaa manquiuuˈ nmo ̱ ⁿ ndaaluee , nntseicatyˈuenaˈ joona .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Nntsˈaanaˈ na tajndeiiˈ nˈomna ncˈe na cwicatyuena ñequio na mˈaaⁿˈticheⁿ nˈomna chiuu cwii wjaachˈeetinaˈ nnom tsjoomnancue . Ee nntseicwachuuˈñenaˈ chaˈtso ˈnaⁿ najnda ̱ na matseixmaⁿ tsjo ̱ ˈluee .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: Quia ljoˈcheⁿ nntyˈiaana ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na macwja ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿnndaˈa tsjoomnancue . Nndyo ̱ o ̱ naquiiˈ nchquiu ñequio najndeii na matseixmaⁿya ndoˈ ñequio na neiⁿncooˈ nacaxuee na cwiluiitˈmaⁿndyo ̱ .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ jnaⁿnaˈ na cwiluii chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ , cˈomtˈmaaⁿˈndyoˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ ee jnda ̱ teindyooˈ na nluinˈmaaⁿndyoˈ .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Mati seineiiⁿ ñˈoom na tjañoomˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈoom higuera ndoˈ chaˈtso ntˈomcheⁿ nˈoom .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Quia cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ macwicaluiˈ tscooˈnaˈ , cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ teindyooˈ ncueesuaˈ .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Mati quia na cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na cwiluii chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ , calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ teindyooˈ mˈaaⁿnaˈ na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: ’ Candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , mayuuˈcheⁿ na xocwjeñˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ jeˈ hasta xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ seicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ chaˈtso ñˈoommeiⁿˈ .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Tsjo ̱ ˈluee ñˈeⁿ tsjoomnancue nntycwiiñˈeⁿnaˈ sa ̱ a ̱ juu ñˈoom ˈnaⁿya tijoom cwinomˈnaˈ juunaˈ .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: ’ Calˈandyoˈ cwenta na tincjaachunaˈ ˈo na ñoomñoom na nlˈaˈyoˈ , oo na nncˈomˈyoˈ na candyeˈyoˈ , oo na nncuaa ñˈomtiuu ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ˈnaⁿ na macaⁿnaˈ ˈo . Cha tintsˈaanaˈ na ticˈomcˈeendyoˈ ndoˈ majndeiito nncwjeeˈcañoom xueeˈñeeⁿ ˈo .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Tintjomˈyoˈ chaˈcwijom na nnquioo cwii teincoˈ ee nntˈuiinaˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ chaˈwaa nnom tsjoomnancue .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Joˈ chii cˈomˈcˈeendyoˈ chaˈwaa xuee na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ calatyˈoondyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha nncˈoom jndeiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nnaⁿndyoˈ nawiˈ na quia nndyo , ndoˈ nnda ̱ a ̱ nncwintyjeˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ jo no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Naxuee tyoˈmo ̱ ⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Ndoˈ quia tmaaⁿ tyocalueeⁿˈeⁿ , tyocaⁿ ta na jndyu Olivos .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ cwitsjoom tyoquiena watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na nndyena ñˈoom na nñequiaaⁿ .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Majnda ̱ jaawindyooˈ nncueeˈ xuee pascua na cwicwaˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos tyooˈ na tjaa ndaaljoˈ tjaquieeˈ .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Ndoˈ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , cweˈ ntyˈiu tyolˈueendyena chiuu ya cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nlaˈcueeˈna Jesús , ee nquiaana nnˈaⁿ na neiiⁿ jom .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tuo ̱ Satanás naquiiˈ tsˈom Judas , tsaⁿ na mati jndyu Iscariote . Jom cwii joo nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwendye .

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Tjaaⁿ na mˈaⁿ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos , ñˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwijndooˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na cwiluii watsˈom . Tjatseijndaaˈñê chiuu ya nntsˈaaⁿ na nñequiaaⁿ cwenta Jesús lueena .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Ndoˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ jeeⁿ jlaˈneiiⁿˈndyena , tjoomˈ tˈmaⁿna na nñeˈquiana sˈom nnoom .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: Mati jom seijomñê na ljoˈ . Tyolˈueeⁿ cwaaⁿ nncjuˈnaaⁿñenaˈ na nñequiaaⁿ cwenta Jesús lueena xjeⁿ na ticajndooˈ nnˈaⁿ .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Tueˈntyjo ̱ ncuee na cwicwaˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos tyooˈ na tjaa ndaaljoˈ tjaquieeˈ . Ncueeˈñeeⁿ macaⁿnaˈ na calaˈcwjeena canmaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ncuee pascua .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: Ndoˈ jñom Jesús Pedro ñequio Juan , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catsaˈyoˈ , nlajndaaˈndyoˈ yuu na nlcwaaˈa cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ncuee pascua .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Taˈxˈeena nnoom : — ¿ Yuu lˈue tsˈomˈ na nlajndaaˈndyô ̱ ?

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Quia na jnda ̱ saaquieˈyoˈ naquiiˈ tsjoomwaˈñeⁿ , nntjomndyoˈ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na ñˈoom tsjoo na ñjom ndaa . Catsaantyjo ̱ ˈyoˈ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ hasta na nncueⁿˈeⁿ wˈaa yuu na nncjaaqueⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Joˈ joˈ canduˈyoˈ nnom tsˈaⁿ na waaˈ wˈaaˈñeeⁿ : “ Nquii tsˈaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ya mawaxˈeeⁿ : ¿ Yuu waa cuarto na nlcwaaˈâ cwentaaˈ xuee pascua ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ? ”

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Quia joˈ juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cwii cuarto tˈmaⁿ , wˈaa nandye na maniomcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈ ˈnaⁿ . Joˈ joˈ calajndaaˈndyoˈyaˈyoˈ .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Tyˈena ndoˈ jliuna chaˈxjeⁿ na tsoom . Ndoˈ jlaˈjndaaˈndyena na nlcwaˈna , nntquiina catsmaⁿ .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ tmaaⁿ , tueˈcañoom Jesús , tjacjom nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñequio canchooˈwe nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jeeⁿ ntyjaaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na nlcwaaˈa nantquie pascuawaa ñˈeⁿndyoˈ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nncˈio ̱ .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Ee candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , taxocwaˈnndaˈa juunaˈ hasta xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ seicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ yuu na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ toˈñoom cwii waso , jnda ̱ chii tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Catoˈñoomˈyoˈ wasowaa , caluiˈ cjaanaˈ cwii ndoˈ cwiindyoˈ , cweˈyoˈ .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Ee candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , jeˈ na cwii wjaatinaˈ , taxocˈua ndaawinom hasta quia nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Ndoˈ toˈñoom tyooˈ , tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , jnda ̱ chii tyjeeⁿ juunaˈ , tquiaaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Tsoom : — Tyooˈwaa cwiluiiñenaˈ seiiˈa na mañequiaandyo ̱ na nncˈio ̱ . Luaaˈ nntsaalˈaˈyoˈ na cwicañjom nˈomˈyoˈ ja .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tcwaˈna tyooˈñeeⁿ , majoˈti sˈaaⁿ , toˈñoom waso . Tsoom : — Juu ndaa winom na ñjom wasowaa tseixmaⁿnaˈ ñˈoom xco na maqua ̱ ⁿtya ̱ ⁿ ñequio nioomˈa na nnquioo cwentaˈyoˈ .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: ’ Sa ̱ a ̱ queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , ñeˈcwii meiⁿsa na cañomˈ meindyuaandyo ̱ ñequio tsˈaⁿ na mañequiaa cwenta ja .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Ndoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , mayuuˈcheⁿ manntjo ̱ ⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ na jnda ̱ teijndaaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , sa ̱ a ̱ nntˈuiiwiˈnaˈ juu tsˈaⁿ na mañequiaa cwenta ja .

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Quia joˈ to ̱ ˈna na tyotaˈxˈeendyena nda ̱ a ̱ na , ˈñeeⁿ cwiindye joona na nntsˈaa na ljoˈ .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Mati jlaˈñˈeeⁿˈ ndyueena ˈñeeⁿ cwiindye joona na nncˈoom na tˈmaⁿñeti .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ tsjoomnancuewaa ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitsa ̱ ˈntjom , cwinchjeena nnˈaⁿ na cwindyeˈntjom nda ̱ a ̱ na , sa ̱ a ̱ cwilaˈcajndyu yoˈñeeⁿ joona nnˈaⁿ na ya cwilˈa .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quiiˈntaaⁿˈ ˈo nchii luaaˈ nncuaa . Ee juu tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquieñeti cˈoom chaˈna tsˈaⁿ na cje tseixmaⁿ . Ndoˈ tsˈaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom cˈoom chaˈna tsˈaⁿ na mandiˈntjom .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Ee ¿ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiitˈmaⁿñeti , aa juu tsˈaⁿ na wacatyeeⁿ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa , oo aa juu tsˈaⁿ na mandiˈntjom joˈ joˈ ? ¿ Aa nchii maxjeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na wacatyeeⁿ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ? Sa ̱ a ̱ queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , ja mˈaaⁿya quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ na mandiˈntjo ̱ ⁿ .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: ’ ˈO ñequiiˈcheⁿ ñˈeⁿˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ chaˈtsoti na maqueⁿnaˈ xjeⁿ ja .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: Joˈ chii chaˈxjeⁿ na tqueⁿtyeⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya ñˈoom na ja nntsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿ , malaaˈtiˈ maqua ̱ ⁿ na ˈo nntsa ̱ ˈntjomˈyoˈ .

text: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom , and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
text2: Yuu na nntsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya , joˈ nñequiaya na nlcwaˈyoˈ ndoˈ nncweˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ cañoomˈ meiⁿsa ˈnaⁿya . Ndoˈ nncwindyuaandyoˈ ntio yuu na nntuˈxeⁿˈyoˈ canchooˈwe ntmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ Israel .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Tso ta Jesús : — ˈU Simón , queⁿˈ cwenta , jnda ̱ tcaⁿ Satanás ñˈoom na nntseiteiˈncweeⁿˈeⁿ ˈo chaˈna matseicueeñe tsˈaⁿ lqueeⁿ trigo ,

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: sa ̱ a ̱ ja jnda ̱ ñesˈaa tyˈoo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja ˈnaⁿˈ cha tintseintycwiinaˈ na matseiˈyuˈyaˈ tsˈomˈ . Ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ tcoˈndyuˈxcweˈnndaˈ , quiaaˈ ñˈoom tˈmaⁿ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿˈ nmeiiⁿ na cwilaˈyuˈ .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Simón nnoom , matso : — Ta , mˈaaⁿcˈeendyo ̱ na nncjo ̱ wˈaancjo ñˈeⁿndyuˈ . Ndoˈ tintsˈaa meiiⁿ na nncˈio ̱ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ .

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: Tso Jesús nnoom : — Aa ndiˈ , Pedro , njomˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ , cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseixuaa caxtijndyo jeˈjeˈcheⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ macwjiˈndyuˈ na ticwajnaⁿˈ ja .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Quia na jño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo na saanquiaˈyoˈ ñˈoom ˈnaⁿya , tsjo ̱ o ̱ na tîcatsañˈomˈyoˈ tsjo ̱ ˈñjeeⁿ , meiⁿ chetsjaˈ , meiⁿ lcoom , ¿ aa waa na seitjo ̱ o ̱ naˈ ˈo ? Jluena nnoom : — Meiⁿcwii tjaaˈnaⁿ .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Tsotyeeⁿcheⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ , ˈñeeⁿ juu na maleiñˈoom ˈnaⁿ na cwicañjom sˈom , cjaañˈoom juunaˈ ndoˈ mati chetsjaˈ . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na tjaaˈnaⁿ xjo espada , cajnda ̱ a ̱ liaatco ˈnaaⁿˈ , chii cˈoom xjooˈ .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Ee candyeˈyoˈ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ , maxjeⁿ jndeiˈnaˈ na catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ljeii na mawaa cantyja ˈnaⁿya na matsonaˈ : “ Tjeiiˈna cwenta na ljoˈyu wiˈñê chaˈxjeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na wiˈndye . ”

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
text2: Jluena nnoom : — Ta , cantyˈiaˈ , luaa mawaa we xjo espadas . Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Maleiˈtyeⁿ luaaˈ .

text: And he came out , and went , as he was wont , to the mount of Olives ; and his disciples also followed him .
text2: Quia joˈ jlueeⁿˈeⁿ wˈaa yuu na tcwaˈna , tjaaⁿ ta na jndyu Olivos yuu na maxjeⁿ quicaⁿ . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoomˈm , mandiˈntyjo ̱ na naxeeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And when he was at the place , he said unto them , Pray that ye enter not into temptation .
text2: Quia na tquiena joˈ joˈ , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Calaneiⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha juu na ñequeⁿnaˈ xjeⁿ ˈo tincwantjomnaˈ ˈo .

text: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone ' s cast , and kneeled down , and prayed ,
text2: Ndoˈ teiño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nacañoomna , tjaaⁿ chaˈna tquia na nncjuˈ tsˈaⁿ cwii tsjo ̱ ˈ . Tcoomˈm xtyeeⁿ ndoˈ seineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Saying , Father , if thou be willing , remove this cup from me : nevertheless not my will , but thine , be done .
text2: Tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya , xeⁿ ˈu lˈue tsˈomˈ , catseicandyaandyuˈ ja nawiˈwaa . Sa ̱ a ̱ ticaluii ljoˈ na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ja , caluii ljoˈ na lˈue tsˈomˈ nncuˈ .

text: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven , strengthening him .
text2: Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tyjeˈcañoom cwii ángel nacañomˈm na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na tyoñequiaa najneiⁿ .

text: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly : and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground .
text2: Yocheⁿ na tyotseiˈndaaˈnaˈ tsˈoom , tyoqueⁿñetyeeⁿ na tyotseineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñequio chaˈwaa najneiⁿ . Ndoˈ ndaatmeiiⁿˈeⁿ tyotseijomnaˈ chaˈna tˈmaⁿ ndaateiⁿ niomˈ , ñecwii ndiiˈ cwiˈiuunaˈ xjeⁿ nomtyuaacheⁿ .

text: And when he rose up from prayer , and was come to his disciples , he found them sleeping for sorrow ,
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ teicantyjaaⁿ na seineiiⁿ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tjantyjaaⁿˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿñê ndoˈ ljeiiⁿ na cwindana . Ee tîcanaⁿndyena na jeeⁿ chjooˈ nˈomna .

text: And said unto them , Why sleep ye ? rise and pray , lest ye enter into temptation .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu na cwindaˈyoˈ ? Quicantyjaˈyoˈ , calaneiⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha juu na ñeˈqueⁿnaˈ xjeⁿ ˈo , tincjaachuunaˈ ˈo .

text: And while he yet spake , behold a multitude , and he that was called Judas , one of the twelve , went before them , and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him .
text2: Ndicwaⁿ matseineiⁿ Jesús ndoˈ tquieˈcañom nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye . Jo nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ wjaajndyee Judas , cwii joo nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwe . Seicandyooˈñê nacañoomˈ Jesús na nncˈom ntsmaⁿˈ .

text: But Jesus said unto him , Judas , betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss ?
text2: Tso Jesús nnoom : — ˈU Judas , ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , ¿ aa maˈtiooˈ cwenta ja luee nnˈaⁿ ñequio na maˈuaˈ ntsmaaⁿˈa ?

text: When they which were about him saw what would follow , they said unto him , Lord , shall we smite with the sword ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na ñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿñê , quia na ntyˈiaana chiuu wjaachˈeenaˈ , jluena nnoom : — Ta , ¿ aa mañejom nntua ̱ a ̱ ˈa xjo ?

text: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest , and cut off his right ear .
text2: Ndoˈ cwii joona mañoomˈ seiquieeˈñe mosooˈ tyee na cwiluiitquieñe . Tyjee tsuaˈqui tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ntyjaya .

text: And Jesus answered and said , Suffer ye thus far . And he touched his ear , and healed him .
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Maya , caˈndyeˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ tyenquioomˈm tsuaˈqui tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , seinˈmaaⁿ juu .

text: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests , and captains of the temple , and the elders , which were come to him , Be ye come out , as against a thief , with swords and staves ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na tquio nacjoomˈm , joo ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwijndooˈ tsˈiaaⁿ cwentaaˈ watsˈom , ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye naquiiˈ tsjoom , tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Jndaˈjom ñequio ncjo espadas ndoˈ ñˈeⁿ nˈoom nchˈio na tquioˈyoˈ nacjoya . Ndooˈ na tquiocˈomˈyoˈ cwii tsaⁿcanchˈue .

text: When I was daily with you in the temple , ye stretched forth no hands against me : but this is your hour , and the power of darkness .
text2: ˈIo ndii ˈio tyomˈaaⁿya quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ meiⁿ tîcatˈueˈyoˈ ja . Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ jeˈ jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ na juu na jaaⁿñe maqueⁿnaˈ xjeⁿ .

text: Then took they him , and led him , and brought him into the high priest ' s house . And Peter followed afar off .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tˈue naⁿˈñeeⁿ jom , tyˈeñˈomna jom waaˈ tyee na cwiluiitquieñe . Ndoˈ Pedro tjantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ tquiacheⁿ tquia .

text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall , and were set down together , Peter sat down among them .
text2: Joˈ joˈ jlaˈntjoomndye nnˈaⁿ chom tachˈeⁿ , tyomeindyuaandyena ndiocheⁿ nacañoomˈ chom . Ndoˈ mati Pedro tjacjom quiiˈntaaⁿna .

text: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire , and earnestly looked upon him , and said , This man was also with him .
text2: Cwii yuscu na mandiˈntjom ljeii jom na wacatyeeⁿ ˈndyoo chom , jeeⁿ nquiee ntyˈiaaˈ nnoom ndoˈ tso : — Mati tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ ñeñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ .

text: And he denied him , saying , Woman , I know him not .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jom tjeiˈñê , tsoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu yuscu ticwajnaⁿˈa tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ .

text: And after a little while another saw him , and said , Thou art also of them . And Peter said , Man , I am not .
text2: Tyoowiquiuuˈ ljeii cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ jom , tso nnoom : — ˈU , maxjeⁿ cwiindye joona . Sa ̱ a ̱ tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ : — Nchii joˈ ja .

text: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed , saying , Of a truth this fellow also was with him : for he is a Galilaean .
text2: Jnda ̱ tjawiquiuuˈticheⁿ , chaˈna cwii hora , cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ tyotseijndeiiˈ ˈndyoo , tso : — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿ , mayuuˈcheⁿ ñeñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ ee tsˈaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea jom .

text: And Peter said , Man , I know not what thou sayest . And immediately , while he yet spake , the cock crew .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Pedro nnom : — Ja re , meiⁿchjoo ticaljeii ñˈoom na matsuˈ . Ndicwaⁿ matseineiiⁿ ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ seixuaa caxtijndyo .

text: And the Lord turned , and looked upon Peter . And Peter remembered the word of the Lord , how he had said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice .
text2: Quia joˈ taqueⁿ Ta Jesús ndyeyu jo ndoˈ na mˈaaⁿ Pedro ndoˈ ntyˈiaaˈ nnoom . Ndoˈ mañoomˈ tjañjoomˈ tsˈoom ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tso nnoom : “ Cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseixuaa caxtijndyo jeˈjeˈcheⁿ sa ̱ a ̱ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ ˈu jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ macwjiˈndyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . ”

text: And Peter went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Quia joˈ mana jluiˈ Pedro quiiˈntaaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaˈ tyotyˈioom na jnda ntyjeeⁿ .

text: And the men that held Jesus mocked him , and smote him .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na tyolˈa cwenta Jesús , tyolaˈjnaaⁿˈna ndoˈ tyotjaaˈna jom .

text: And when they had blindfolded him , they struck him on the face , and asked him , saying , Prophesy , who is it that smote thee ?
text2: Mati tyolaˈtyeⁿna liaa nnoom , tyotmeiiⁿˈna ndaˈ nnoom ndoˈ tyoluena : — Cjaaweeˈ ˈndyoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu macwjaˈ ˈu .

text: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him .
text2: Ndoˈ jndye ñˈoom ticueeˈ tsˈom tyoluena nacjoomˈm .

text: And as soon as it was day , the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together , and led him into their council , saying ,
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ teixuee , tjomndye ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwijndooˈ tsˈiaaⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés . Tyˈeñˈomna Jesús na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiindyena nˈiaaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Jlue naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom :

text: Art thou the Christ ? tell us . And he said unto them , If I tell you , ye will not believe :
text2: — Catsuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , ¿ aa ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Cristo ? Jom tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Meiiⁿ xeⁿ na nntsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ xocalaˈyuˈyoˈ .

text: And if I also ask you , ye will not answer me , nor let me go .
text2: Ndoˈ meiiⁿ xeⁿ na cwaxˈa ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ˈo xocatˈo ̱ ˈyoˈ ˈndyo ̱ , xocalacandyaandyoˈ ja .

text: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ xuee na cwii wjaanaˈ , ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee nncjo ̱ cajmaⁿ ntyjaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ntyjaya yuu na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñetinaˈ ja . Joˈ joˈ nntseijomndyo ̱ ñˈeⁿñê chaˈtso najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ .

text: Then said they all , Art thou then the Son of God ? And he said unto them , Ye say that I am .
text2: Chaˈtsondyena taˈxˈeena : — Quia joˈ ¿ aa ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Mancjoˈtiˈyoˈ jnda ̱ macwinduˈyoˈ .

text: And they said , What need we any further witness ? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth .
text2: Quia joˈ jluena : — ¿ Ljoˈ cwii macaⁿtinaˈ na nluiˈyuuˈ nacjoomˈm ? Ee mancjo ̱ o ̱ tya ̱ a ̱ jnda ̱ jndya ̱ a ̱ ya ñˈoom ˈñom .

text: And the whole multitude of them arose , and led him unto Pilate .
text2: Quia joˈ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na tjomndye joˈ joˈ , teiˈcantyjana , tyˈeñˈomna Jesús na mˈaaⁿ Pilato .
