text: And they began to accuse him , saying , We found this fellow perverting the nation , and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar , saying that he himself is Christ a King .
text2: To ̱ ˈna na tyoñequiana jnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Jluena : — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ jnda ̱ jliuuyâ na matseiˈnaⁿˈaⁿ nˈom nnˈaⁿ ndyuaayâ . Ee quitsoom na ticwanaaⁿ na nñeˈquiaayâ tsˈiaaⁿnda ̱ a ̱ yâ nnom César . Ndoˈ manquiityeeⁿ matsoom na cwiluiiñê Cristo ndoˈ rey jom .

text: And Pilate asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And he answered him and said , Thou sayest it .
text2: Quia joˈ taˈxˈee Pilato nnoom , tso : — ¿ Aa ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ rey na catsa ̱ ˈntjom nnˈaⁿ judíos ? Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom : — Maxjeⁿ joˈ ja , chaˈxjeⁿ na matsuˈ .

text: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people , I find no fault in this man .
text2: Ndoˈ tso Pilato nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye : — Ja meiⁿcwii jnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ ticaljeiya .

text: And they were the more fierce , saying , He stirreth up the people , teaching throughout all Jewry , beginning from Galilee to this place .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ jlaˈjndeiiˈ ndyueena , jluena : — Ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ matseijmeiⁿˈnaˈ nnˈaⁿ chaˈwaa tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea . Tyochˈeeⁿ na ljoˈ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea , ndoˈ mati ñjaaⁿ .

text: When Pilate heard of Galilee , he asked whether the man were a Galilaean .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii Pilato ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Galilea , taxˈeeⁿ : — ¿ Aa tsˈaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ ?

text: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod ' s jurisdiction , he sent him to Herod , who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time .
text2: Quia na ljeiijndaaˈñê na jnaⁿ Jesús tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea yuu na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Herodes , quia joˈ seicwanoom Jesús na mˈaaⁿ Herodesˈñeeⁿ na tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cuˈxeeⁿ Jesús . Ee tyjeeˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ Jerusalén quia joˈ .

text: And when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceeding glad : for he was desirous to see him of a long season , because he had heard many things of him ; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him .
text2: Ndoˈ jeeⁿ neiiⁿˈeⁿ quia na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ Jesús ee jaachˈee xuee na jeeⁿ ñeˈcwajnaⁿˈaⁿ juu ndoˈ na jndye ñˈoom jnda ̱ jñeeⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ . Joˈ jeeⁿ queeⁿ tsˈoom na nntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na nntsˈaa Jesús cwii tsˈiaaⁿ na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa na cweˈ cwii tsˈaⁿ .

text: Then he questioned with him in many words ; but he answered him nothing .
text2: Ndoˈ jndye ñˈoom tyowaxˈeeⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwii ñˈoom ticˈo ̱ Jesús .

text: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him .
text2: Ndoˈ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés , mati tyˈena na mˈaaⁿ . Tyoqueⁿya nˈomna na tyoñequiana jnaaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought , and mocked him , and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe , and sent him again to Pilate .
text2: Ndoˈ mati Herodes ñequio sondaro ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , cweˈ tyoncona Jesús ndoˈ tyolaˈjnaaⁿˈna jom . Jlaˈcweena jom cwii liaa na jnda , jnda ̱ chii jlaˈcwanomnndaˈna jom na mˈaaⁿ Pilato .

text: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together : for before they were at enmity between themselves .
text2: Juu xueeˈñeeⁿ ljoyaañe Pilato ñˈeⁿ Herodes , ee ñetˈomntiaaˈndyena .

text: And Pilate , when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
text2: Quia joˈ seitjom Pilato ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio nnˈaⁿ na laˈxmaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye .

text: Said unto them , Ye have brought this man unto me , as one that perverteth the people : and , behold , I , having examined him before you , have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him :
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO tquioñˈomˈyoˈ tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿ na cwinduˈyoˈ matseijmeiiⁿˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Sa ̱ a ̱ queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , jo nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtsondyoˈ jnda ̱ tcaaⁿˈa ñˈoom nnoom , ndoˈ meiⁿcwii jnaaⁿˈaⁿ tîcaljei na chaˈtso ñˈoom na cwiqueⁿˈyoˈ nacjoomˈm .

text: No , nor yet Herod : for I sent you to him ; and , lo , nothing worthy of death is done unto him .
text2: Meiⁿ Herodes tîcaljeii jnaaⁿˈaⁿ , joˈ na seicwanomnndaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jom na mˈaaⁿya . Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , meiⁿcwii tyootseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñê na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ na cueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: I will therefore chastise him , and release him .
text2: Joˈ chii nnchuuˈjñeeⁿ xeⁿ jnda ̱ nntseicandyaandyo ̱ jom .

text: ( For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast . )
text2: Ndoˈ waa costumbre na jndeiˈnaˈ na catseicandyaañe Pilato cwii pra ̱ so jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ xcwe na waa xuee .

text: And they cried out all at once , saying , Away with this man , and release unto us Barabbas :
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye , ñeˈcwii ñˈoom jlaˈxuaana , jluena : — Quindyo ̱ o ̱ ˈ luaaˈ ñjaaⁿñe ndoˈ catseicandyaandyuˈ Barrabás .

text: ( Who for a certain sedition made in the city , and for murder , was cast into prison . )
text2: Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tueeˈna jom wˈaancjo ee teijndaaˈ jnaaⁿˈaⁿ na seiweñê nacjooˈ gobiernom . Ndoˈ seicueⁿˈeⁿ tsˈaⁿ .

text: Pilate therefore , willing to release Jesus , spake again to them .
text2: Ndoˈ Pilato ncˈe na ñeˈcatseicandyaañê Jesús , seineiⁿnnaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ .

text: But they cried , saying , Crucify him , crucify him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ jndeiiti jlaˈxuaanndaˈna , jluena : — Catyˈiomˈ jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ . Catyˈiomˈ jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ .

text: And he said unto them the third time , Why , what evil hath he done ? I have found no cause of death in him : I will therefore chastise him , and let him go .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na na jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ : — ¿ Ljoˈ jeeⁿcheⁿ tisˈa sˈaaⁿ ? Meiⁿcwii jnaaⁿˈaⁿ tîcaljeiya na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ na cueeⁿˈeⁿ . Joˈ chii nnchuuˈ jñeeⁿ , xeⁿ jnda ̱ nntseicandyaandyo ̱ jom .

text: And they were instant with loud voices , requiring that he might be crucified . And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ jndeiiˈ ndyueena , jndeii tyolaˈxuaana , tyotaⁿna na cañoom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ na tyoluena ñequio ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee jnaⁿjndeiinaˈ .

text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required .
text2: Joˈ chii Pilato tquiaañetoom ñˈoom na caluii chaˈxjeⁿ na cwitaⁿna .

text: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison , whom they had desired ; but he delivered Jesus to their will .
text2: Seicandyaañê tsˈaⁿ na tyotaⁿna na mˈaaⁿ wˈaancjo , meiiⁿ na tyotseiweñe nacjooˈ gobiernom ndoˈ seicueeˈ tsˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ Jesús lueena na calˈana chiuu na lˈue nˈomna .

text: And as they led him away , they laid hold upon one Simon , a Cyrenian , coming out of the country , and on him they laid the cross , that he might bear it after Jesus .
text2: Xjeⁿ na tyˈeñˈom sondaro Jesús na nntyˈioomna jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ , tˈuena cwii tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ jnda ̱ a ̱ , tsˈaⁿ tsjoom Cirene na jndyu Simón . Jlaˈcachuuna jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ tyojaantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naxeⁿˈ Jesús ñˈeⁿ juunaˈ .

text: And there followed him a great company of people , and of women , which also bewailed and lamented him .
text2: Ndoˈ cwii tmaaⁿˈ tˈmaⁿ nnˈaⁿ tyˈentyjo ̱ naxeⁿˈ Jesús , ndii ñˈeeⁿ yolcu na jeeⁿ cwityuee ndoˈ cwilaˈxuaa na matseiˈndaaˈnaˈ nˈom na cwintyˈiaa na luaaˈ matjoom .

text: But Jesus turning unto them said , Daughters of Jerusalem , weep not for me , but weep for yourselves , and for your children .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ taqueⁿ Jesús , tsoom : — ˈO yolcu Jerusalén , tandyueeˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿ ja luaa , catyueeˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈ ncjoˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿ ndaˈyoˈ .

text: For , behold , the days are coming , in the which they shall say , Blessed are the barren , and the wombs that never bare , and the paps which never gave suck .
text2: Ee queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , manncueˈntyjo ̱ xuee na nlue nnˈaⁿ : “ Jeeⁿ teijnoom yolcu na tileicˈom nda , na tîcandeiindye , meiⁿ tjaa yoˈndaa jlaˈcanteiˈ . ”

text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ; and to the hills , Cover us .
text2: Ncueeˈñeeⁿ nnto ̱ ˈ nnˈaⁿ na nluena nda ̱ a ̱ ntsjo ̱ : “ Catquiaandyoˈ nacjooyâ ” , ndoˈ nluena nda ̱ a ̱ nta : “ Calaˈcata ̱ ˈyoˈ jâ . ”

text: For if they do these things in a green tree , what shall be done in the dry ?
text2: Ee xeⁿ nmeiiⁿ macwilˈa nnˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja na tjaa jnaⁿ tseixmaⁿya , cwanti na tˈmaⁿti nawiˈ nntjoom naⁿˈñeeⁿ na waa jnaaⁿna .

text: And there were also two other , malefactors , led with him to be put to death .
text2: Ndoˈ mati tyˈechona we nnˈaⁿ na wiˈndye na nntyˈioomna nˈomˈnaaⁿ .

text: And when they were come to the place , which is called Calvary , there they crucified him , and the malefactors , one on the right hand , and the other on the left .
text2: Quia na tquiena cwii joo na jndyu Ta Tseiˈxqueⁿ Tsˈoo , tyˈioomna jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ joˈ joˈ ñequio naⁿˈñeeⁿ na wiˈndye , cwii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ntyjaaⁿˈaⁿ ntyjaya ndoˈ cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ntyjaaⁿˈaⁿ ntyjatymaaⁿˈ .

text: Then said Jesus , Father , forgive them ; for they know not what they do . And they parted his raiment , and cast lots .
text2: Tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya , catseitˈmaⁿ tsˈomˈ joona , ee ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ljoˈ cwilˈana ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Ndoˈ tyoˈoo sondaro xˈiaa na nntyˈiaana ˈñeeⁿ nleijnoomˈ cwii cwii liaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And the people stood beholding . And the rulers also with them derided him , saying , He saved others ; let him save himself , if he be Christ , the chosen of God .
text2: Joˈ joˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ na cweˈ tyˈecantyˈiaa na luaaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ jeeⁿ ticueeˈ nˈomna jom , tyoluena : — Jeeⁿ ya tjeiˈnˈmaaⁿñê ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ , jeˈ cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe cheⁿnqueⁿ xeⁿ mayuuˈ cwiluiiñê nquii Cristo tsaⁿ na tjeiiˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na catsa ̱ ˈntjom .

text: And the soldiers also mocked him , coming to him , and offering him vinegar ,
text2: Mati tyolaˈjnaaⁿˈ sondaro Jesús . Tyˈentyjaaˈna na nñeˈquiana winom na ta ̱ na nncˈom .

text: And saying , If thou be the king of the Jews , save thyself .
text2: Jluena : — Xeⁿ ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Rey na catsa ̱ ˈntjomˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos , cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyuˈ cheⁿnncuˈ .

text: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek , and Latin , and Hebrew , THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Ndoˈ jo ndyeyu tsˈom xqueeⁿ tyˈioomna ljeii ñˈoom griego , latyeⁿ , ñˈeⁿ hebreo . Matsonaˈ : “ Luaañe Rey cwentaa nnˈaⁿ judíos . ”

text: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him , saying , If thou be Christ , save thyself and us .
text2: Cwii joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ na wiˈndye na ñoom ñˈeⁿñê , seijnaaⁿˈ jom . Tso : — ¿ Aa nchii Cristo cwiluiindyuˈ ? Cwa cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyuˈ cheⁿnncuˈ ndoˈ mati jâ .

text: But the other answering rebuked him , saying , Dost not thou fear God , seeing thou art in the same condemnation ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tˈo ̱ cwiicheⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , seitiaaⁿˈaⁿ xˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ , tsoom : — Cwa tinquiaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ ˈu jnda ̱ tˈuiityeⁿnaˈ na maxjeⁿ nncˈioˈ . ¿ Aa ticandoˈ mañejoˈti matjomˈ chaˈxjeⁿ matjom jom ?

text: And we indeed justly ; for we receive the due reward of our deeds : but this man hath done nothing amiss .
text2: Ndoˈ wendyo ̱ jaa nmeiiⁿ mayuuˈcheⁿ matyˈiomyanaˈ na catjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na luaa ee cwitio ̱ o ̱ ⁿndyo ̱ cantyja na ñelˈaaya . Sa ̱ a ̱ juu Tamˈaaⁿˈ meiⁿcwii nawiˈ tîcatsˈaaⁿ .

text: And he said unto Jesus , Lord , remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom .
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nnom Jesús : — ˈU Ta , cjaañjoomˈ tsˈomˈ ja quia na nndyoˈ na nntsa ̱ ˈntjomˈ .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Verily I say unto thee , To day shalt thou be with me in paradise .
text2: Tso Jesús nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ , xuee jeˈ nncˈoomˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ jo paraíso yuu na mˈaaⁿ nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And it was about the sixth hour , and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour .
text2: Xjeⁿ na tueeˈ quiajmeiⁿˈ , teijaaⁿ chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue hasta na ndyee na matmaaⁿ .

text: And the sun was darkened , and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst .
text2: Ee na teijaaⁿ ñeˈquioomˈ . Ndoˈ juu liaa tco na ntyjatyˈio naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ tyˈiooˈxcwenaˈ .

text: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice , he said , Father , into thy hands I commend my spirit : and having said thus , he gave up the ghost .
text2: Quia joˈ jndeii seixuaa Jesús , tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya , maˈndiya cantyja na wando ̱ ˈa naquiiˈ lˈo ̱ ˈ . Jnda ̱ tsoom na luaaˈ , mana tueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: Now when the centurion saw what was done , he glorified God , saying , Certainly this was a righteous man .
text2: Quia na ntyˈiaaˈ tyo na matsa ̱ ˈntjom sondaro chiuu waa na tuii , seitˈmaaⁿˈñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tsoom : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ matseixmaaⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ljuˈ cwiluiiñe .

text: And all the people that came together to that sight , beholding the things which were done , smote their breasts , and returned .
text2: Ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na tjomndye na ntyˈiaa na ljoˈ tuii , quia tyˈelcweeˈna lˈaana , tyotmeiiⁿˈna ndaˈ ndeiˈcandyaana na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿna na matseiˈndaaˈnaˈ nquiuna .

text: And all his acquaintance , and the women that followed him from Galilee , stood afar off , beholding these things .
text2: Ndoˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na taˈjnaaⁿˈna Jesús ñequio yolcu na tyˈentyjo ̱ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ na jnaⁿ Galilea , tyontyˈiaa tquiana na luaaˈ tjom Jesús .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Joseph , a counseller ; and he was a good man , and a just :
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na jndyu José na jnaⁿ tsjoom Arimatea tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwii joo nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ cwentaa nnˈaⁿ judíos . Jom ya tsˈaⁿñê ndoˈ machˈeeⁿ na matyˈiomyanaˈ .

text: ( The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them ; ) he was of Arimathaea , a city of the Jews : who also himself waited for the kingdom of God .
text2: Mati tyomeinomˈm juu na nntsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Tîcatseijomñê ñˈoom na tˈmaⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ ncˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na cueˈ Jesús .

text: This man went unto Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus .
text2: Tjaaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Pilato ndoˈ tcaaⁿ tsˈoo Jesús .

text: And he took it down , and wrapped it in linen , and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone , wherein never man before was laid .
text2: Jnda ̱ chii tjacatyjeeñê juu . Seityjooñê liaa sábana tsaⁿ lino ndoˈ tjaaˈñê juu naquiiˈ tsueˈtsjo ̱ ˈ na tuiiya . Joˈ joˈ meiⁿcwii tjaaˈnaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ cojaaquieeˈ .

text: And that day was the preparation , and the sabbath drew on .
text2: Juu xueeˈñeeⁿ , maxuee na cwilaˈjndaaˈndye nnˈaⁿ na nntaˈjndyeena xuee sábado . Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ majaaweeˈya xjeⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ .

text: And the women also , which came with him from Galilee , followed after , and beheld the sepulchre , and how his body was laid .
text2: Yolcu na tquio ñˈeⁿñê na jnaⁿna Galilea , tyˈentyˈiaana tseiˈtsuaa , tqueⁿna cwenta chiuu waa na tjacantyˈiuuˈñê .

text: And they returned , and prepared spices and ointments ; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tyˈelcweeˈna Jerusalén , tyˈelaˈjndaaˈndyena nasei cachi ndoˈ ncheⁿˈ . Ndoˈ taˈjndyeena juu xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ matsa ̱ ˈntjom ljeii naqui .

text: Now upon the first day of the week , very early in the morning , they came unto the sepulchre , bringing the spices which they had prepared , and certain others with them .
text2: Cwitsjoomya xuee najndyee smanaⁿ , tyˈena yuu waa tseiˈtsuaa . Tyˈechona nasei cachi na jnda ̱ jlaˈjndaaˈndyena .

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tquiena jliuna na jnda ̱ teindyo ̱ tsjo ̱ ˈ na ta ̱ ˈ ˈndyoo tsueˈtsjo ̱ ˈ .

text: And they entered in , and found not the body of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Quia na tyˈequieˈna joˈ joˈ , taticaliuna seiˈtsˈo ˈnaaⁿˈ Ta Jesús .

text: And it came to pass , as they were much perplexed thereabout , behold , two men stood by them in shining garments :
text2: Xcwe na matseiñˈeeⁿˈñenaˈ joona na cwicatyuena , ndoˈ teitquiooˈndye we nnˈaⁿ nacañoomna na jeeⁿ canchiiˈ , caxuee liaa .

text: And as they were afraid , and bowed down their faces to the earth , they said unto them , Why seek ye the living among the dead ?
text2: Jeeⁿ ndyaˈ tyuena , jlaˈntyjanquioondyena nqueⁿna nomtyuaa . Jlue naⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu quiiˈntaaⁿ lˈoo cwilˈueˈyoˈ tsˈaⁿ na wandoˈ ?

text: He is not here , but is risen : remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee ,
text2: Tacˈoomñê ñjaaⁿ , jnda ̱ wandoˈxcoom . Cjaañjoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ñˈoom na seineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ quia na ndi mˈaaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea .

text: Saying , The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men , and be crucified , and the third day rise again .
text2: Tsoom na nqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , nñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ cwenta jom luee nnˈaⁿjnaⁿ . Ndoˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ nntyˈioomna jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ xuee jnda ̱ ndyee ncwandoˈxcoom .

text: And they remembered his words ,
text2: Quia joˈ tjañjoomˈ nˈomna ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ .

text: And returned from the sepulchre , and told all these things unto the eleven , and to all the rest .
text2: Jnaⁿna yuu na waa tseiˈtsuaa , tyˈelcweeˈna ndoˈ jlaˈcandiina nnˈaⁿ canchooˈcwii ñequio chaˈtso ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ chiuu waa na tuii .

text: It was Mary Magdalene , and Joanna , and Mary the mother of James , and other women that were with them , which told these things unto the apostles .
text2: María Magdalena , ñˈeⁿ Juana , ñˈeⁿ María tsondyee Jacobo , ñˈeeⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ yolcu na ñˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena , joona jlaˈcandiina nnˈaⁿ canchooˈcwii ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales , and they believed them not .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ apóstoles ndooˈ nquiuna cweˈ ñˈomnco joˈ . Tîcalaˈyuˈna .

text: Then arose Peter , and ran unto the sepulchre ; and stooping down , he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves , and departed , wondering in himself at that which was come to pass .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Pedro teicantyjaaⁿ , jleinoom , tjaaⁿ yuu waa tseiˈtsuaa . Quia na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ naquiiˈ tseiˈtsuaa , cweˈ liaa canchiiˈ ljeiiⁿ . Ndoˈ tjalcweˈnnaaⁿˈaⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ , jaawa jaacue tyomˈaaⁿˈ tsˈoom chaˈtso na jnda ̱ tuii .

text: And , behold , two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus , which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs .
text2: Majuuti xueeˈñeeⁿ we nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿ Jesús cwiˈoona cwii tsjoom chjoo na jndyu Emaús na mˈaaⁿ naˈ canchooˈcwii kilómetros na tquianaˈ ñˈeⁿ Jerusalén .

text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened .
text2: Ndoˈ cheⁿnquieena cantyja chaˈtso na nmeiiⁿˈ tuii .

text: And it came to pass , that , while they communed together and reasoned , Jesus himself drew near , and went with them .
text2: Yocheⁿ na luaaˈ jeeⁿ cwilaˈneiⁿna , manquiiti Jesús tueˈntyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ joona . Ñeˈcwi tjaaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena .

text: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tîcataˈjnaaⁿˈna jom ee sˈaanaˈ nˈomnda ̱ a ̱ na chaˈcwijom na titquioona .

text: And he said unto them , What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another , as ye walk , and are sad ?
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Ljoˈ ñˈoom jeeⁿ cwilaneiⁿˈyoˈ na tsaˈyoˈ nato ? Quia joˈ tyˈemeintyjeeˈna na chjooˈ nˈomna .

text: And the one of them , whose name was Cleopas , answering said unto him , Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem , and hast not known the things which are come to pass therein these days ?
text2: Ndoˈ cwiindye joona na jndyu Cleofas tˈo ̱ nnoom , tso : — ¿ Aa ˈu cwii tsˈaⁿ na cweˈ tyjeˈya Jerusalén , joˈ chii ticaljeiˈ chiuu waa na tuii wja mawenaˈ ?

text: And he said unto them , What things ? And they said unto him , Concerning Jesus of Nazareth , which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people :
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Ljoˈ tuii ? Joona tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom : — Aa , waa na tuii cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús , tsˈaⁿ tsjoom Nazaret na tyotseixmaⁿ profeta . Tˈmaⁿ najneiⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na tyochˈeeⁿ ñequio ñˈoom na tyotseineiiⁿ jo nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ ndoˈ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death , and have crucified him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nquiee ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee ñequio naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ cwentaayâ tquiana cwenta jom na catˈuiityeⁿnaˈ jom na cueeⁿˈeⁿ , ndoˈ tyˈioom nnˈaⁿ jom tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ .

text: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel : and beside all this , to day is the third day since these things were done .
text2: Ndoˈ jâ jeeⁿ ñentyjaaˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na jom nluiiñê nquii na nntseicandyaañe nnˈaⁿ Israel . Ndoˈ waa cwiicheⁿ , jeˈ jnda ̱ ndyee xuee na tuii na nmeiiⁿˈ .

text: Yea , and certain women also of our company made us astonished , which were early at the sepulchre ;
text2: Ndoˈ nchii macanda ̱ joˈ , mati joo yolcu na ñˈeeⁿ tmaaⁿˈ na laxmaaⁿyâ , tquioñˈomna ñˈoom na jeeⁿ seiñˈeeⁿˈnaˈ jâ . Ee mateincooquiuuˈ tyˈena yuu waa tseiˈtsuaⁿˈaⁿ ,

text: And when they found not his body , they came , saying , that they had also seen a vision of angels , which said that he was alive .
text2: sa ̱ a ̱ taticaliuna seiˈtsˈo ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Tquiolcweeˈna , tyoluena na mati tcoˈnaˈ ángeles nda ̱ a ̱ na na jlue yoˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na na jom wanoomˈm .

text: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre , and found it even so as the women had said : but him they saw not .
text2: Joˈ chii tyˈe ntˈom ncˈiaayâ yuu waa tseiˈtsuaa ndoˈ jliuna na mayuuˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na jlue yolcuˈñeeⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ maxjeⁿ tîcantyˈiaana nquii Jesús .

text: Then he said unto them , O fools , and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken :
text2: Quia joˈ tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈO nnˈaⁿ na tileicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ maxjeⁿ tiqueⁿˈyoˈ cwenta ndoˈ ticjooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na nlayuˈyoˈ chaˈtso ñˈoom na tyolue profetas .

text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things , and to enter into his glory ?
text2: Aa nchii maxjeⁿ matsonaˈ na nquii Cristo catjoom chaˈtso nawiˈmeiⁿˈ cwitjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ jom .

text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets , he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself .
text2: Quia joˈ tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naquiiˈ ljeii ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom chaˈtso ñˈoom na matseineiⁿnaˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nqueⁿ . To ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ ñequio ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés ndoˈ tcuu tyˈoomnaˈ hasta xjeⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ chaˈtso profetas .

text: And they drew nigh unto the village , whither they went : and he made as though he would have gone further .
text2: Quia na tyˈewindyoona tsjoom chjoo yuu na cwiˈoona , quia joˈ sˈaaⁿ na ndooˈ wjaatyeeⁿcheⁿ .

text: But they constrained him , saying , Abide with us : for it is toward evening , and the day is far spent . And he went in to tarry with them .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ joona lˈana na jndeiˈnaˈ na caljooˈñê ñˈeⁿndyena . Jluena : — Caljooˈndyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyô ̱ ee jeˈ jnda ̱ tmaaⁿ ndoˈ manleinco ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ . Joˈ chii tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ naquiiˈ wˈaa na nljooˈñê .

text: And it came to pass , as he sat at meat with them , he took bread , and blessed it , and brake , and gave to them .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na tjacjom nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñˈeⁿndyena , toˈñoom tyooˈ , tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ , tyjeeⁿ ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ juunaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And their eyes were opened , and they knew him ; and he vanished out of their sight .
text2: Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ sˈaanaˈ joona chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na ya teitquiooˈnndaˈ ndoˈ taˈjnaaⁿˈna na manquii Jesús joˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jom mana tsuñê jo nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And they said one to another , Did not our heart burn within us , while he talked with us by the way , and while he opened to us the scriptures ?
text2: Tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ntyjeena : — Aa tiyuuˈ sˈaanaˈ jndaˈjom teiiⁿ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya yocheⁿ na matseineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ya xjeⁿ na ñjomndyo ̱ nato quia na seicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chiuu maˈmo ̱ ⁿ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii .

text: And they rose up the same hour , and returned to Jerusalem , and found the eleven gathered together , and them that were with them ,
text2: Ndoˈ mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ teicantyjana , tyˈelcweeˈna Jerusalén . Jliuna nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈcwii ñeˈnaaⁿˈ mˈaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ ñequio ntˈomcheⁿ ncˈiaana .

text: Saying , The Lord is risen indeed , and hath appeared to Simon .
text2: Quia joˈ jlue naⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jeeⁿ sa , mayuuˈcheⁿ jnda ̱ mawandoˈxco Ta Jesús , ee jnda ̱ teitquiooˈñê nnom Simón .

text: And they told what things were done in the way , and how he was known of them in breaking of bread .
text2: Quia joˈ joona tyolaˈneiⁿna chiuu waa na tuii quia na mˈaⁿna nato ndoˈ chiuu waa na taˈjnaaⁿˈna jom quia na tyjeeⁿ tyooˈ .

text: And as they thus spake , Jesus himself stood in the midst of them , and saith unto them , Peace be unto you .
text2: Yocheⁿ na cwilaˈneiⁿna ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , teitquiooˈ meintyjeeˈ Jesús xcwe quiiˈntaaⁿna . Tquiaaⁿ na xmaⁿndyena . Tsoom : — Cˈomˈyoˈ na tjaañomtiuu quiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: But they were terrified and affrighted , and supposed that they had seen a spirit .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ joona nioom tyuena , ee jlaˈtiuuna na cweˈ ncwaaⁿˈaⁿ joˈ cwintyˈiaana .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye troubled ? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts ?
text2: Ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Chiuu na jeeⁿ matseiˈndaaˈnaˈ nquiuˈyoˈ ndoˈ na luaaˈ mˈaaⁿˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ?

text: Behold my hands and my feet , that it is I myself : handle me , and see ; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones , as ye see me have .
text2: Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya ñˈeⁿ ncˈa ̱ ya na mannco ̱ tya ̱ luaa . Ndoˈ nquioˈyoˈ ja , ee ncwaaⁿˈ tsˈaⁿ tjaaˈnaⁿ seiˈ cachuunaˈ , meiⁿ ndeiˈ chaˈna cwintyˈiaˈyoˈ na cho ̱ ja .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he shewed them his hands and his feet .
text2: Jnda ̱ tsoom na luaaˈ , tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ ncˈeeⁿ .

text: And while they yet believed not for joy , and wondered , he said unto them , Have ye here any meat ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ndicwaⁿ cweˈ matseitsaⁿˈtonaˈ joona na jeeⁿ neiiⁿna , jeeⁿ cjaaweeˈ nˈomna , hasta tileicalayuˈna na jom . Quia joˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Aa cwileiˈñˈomˈyoˈ na ya nlcwaˈ tsˈaⁿ ?

text: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish , and of an honeycomb .
text2: Joˈ chii tquiana cwii taⁿˈ catscaa jneiiⁿ ñequio tscuu na ñjom tsiomˈ .

text: And he took it , and did eat before them .
text2: Toˈñoom ndoˈ tcwaaⁿˈaⁿ ñequio na jndooˈna .

text: And he said unto them , These are the words which I spake unto you , while I was yet with you , that all things must be fulfilled , which were written in the law of Moses , and in the prophets , and in the psalms , concerning me .
text2: Ndoˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Chaˈtso ñˈoom na teiljeii cantyja ˈnaⁿya naquiiˈ ñˈoom na tqueⁿ Moisés ñequio profetas , ndoˈ mati naquiiˈ salmos , ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ quia na ndicwaⁿ mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Joonaˈ wjaatseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ , ndoˈ jeˈ macwiluii chaˈxjeⁿ na tsjo ̱ o ̱ .

text: Then opened he their understanding , that they might understand the scriptures ,
text2: Quia joˈcheⁿ tquiaa Jesús na nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeiinaˈ .

text: And said unto them , Thus it is written , and thus it behoved Christ to suffer , and to rise from the dead the third day :
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii , matsonaˈ na nquii na cwiluiiñe Cristo , jndeiˈnaˈ na nntjoom nawiˈ tˈmaⁿ , ndoˈ xuee na jnda ̱ ndyee nncwandoˈxcoom na tueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations , beginning at Jerusalem .
text2: Ñequio xueeˈ jom nñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ ñˈoom na calcweˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ jnaaⁿna cha na nntseitˈmaⁿ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joona . Ñˈoommeiiⁿ nnaⁿnaˈ Jerusalén , nncjaantyˈeenaˈ xjeⁿ chaˈwaa tsjoomnancue .

text: And ye are witnesses of these things .
text2: Ndoˈ ˈo laˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ na catjeiˈyuuˈndyoˈ ñˈoommeiiⁿ .

text: And , behold , I send the promise of my Father upon you : but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem , until ye be endued with power from on high .
text2: Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , ja njño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nquii Espíritu Santo na jnda ̱ tso Tsotya ̱ ya na nñequiaaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Joˈ chii , caljooˈndyoˈ tsjoom Jerusalén hasta na nntoˈñoomˈyoˈ juu na nnaⁿ nandye na nñequiaa najnda ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: And he led them out as far as to Bethany , and he lifted up his hands , and blessed them .
text2: Quia joˈ jluiˈna tsjoomˈñeeⁿ . Tjachom joona nndyooˈ tsjoom Betania . Seintyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nacjoona , tioˈnaaⁿñê joona .

text: And it came to pass , while he blessed them , he was parted from them , and carried up into heaven .
text2: Majuu xjeⁿ na matioˈnaaⁿñê joona to ̱ ⁿˈnaˈ jom ñˈeⁿndyena . Tjañˈoomnaˈ jom nandye cañoomˈluee .

text: And they worshipped him , and returned to Jerusalem with great joy :
text2: Ndoˈ joona , quia jnda ̱ jlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena jom , tyˈelcweeˈna Jerusalén na jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaˈ neiiⁿna .

text: And were continually in the temple , praising and blessing God . Amen .
text2: Ñeˈquiiˈcheⁿ tyomˈaⁿna watsˈom tˈmaⁿ na tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Mantyjati luaaˈndyo .

text: In the beginning was the Word , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God .
text2: Xjeⁿ na to ̱ ˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na tqueeⁿ chaˈtso , juu na cwiluiiñe ñˈoomˈm maxjeⁿ mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿñê . Ndoˈ chaˈtso na cwiluiiñê mati juu canda ̱ a ̱ ˈñˈeⁿ cwiluiiñe .

text: The same was in the beginning with God .
text2: Juu na cwiluiiñe ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿñê xjeⁿ na jnaⁿjndyeecheⁿnaˈ .

text: All things were made by him ; and without him was not any thing made that was made .
text2: Chaˈtso na maniom na tqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ñˈeeⁿ quia tqueⁿna joonaˈ . Cwii cwii nnom na maniom , ñequiiˈcheⁿ na ñˈeeⁿ na tqueⁿna joˈ .

text: In him was life ; and the life was the light of men .
text2: Tseixmaⁿ cheⁿnqueⁿ na ticantycwii na wanoomˈm . Juu joˈ na matseixmaaⁿ matseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom chom na matseixueeñenaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ .

text: And the light shineth in darkness ; and the darkness comprehended it not .
text2: Juu naxuee na matseixmaaⁿ , matseicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿnaˈ chaˈtso na cwiˈoo nacjooˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Sa ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso joo joˈ tîcanda ̱ a ̱ nlqueⁿnaˈ xjeⁿ ˈnaaⁿnaˈ jom .

text: There was a man sent from God , whose name was John .
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Juan jndyu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: The same came for a witness , to bear witness of the Light , that all men through him might believe .
text2: Jñoom na tyˈiom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsˈiaaⁿ jom na nncwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Cristo na cwiluiiñe naxueeñe , tyochˈeeⁿ na ljoˈ cha chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿ Cristo nlaˈyuˈna .

text: He was not that Light , but was sent to bear witness of that Light .
text2: Nchii nqueⁿ cwiluiiñê naxueeñe sa ̱ a ̱ jñoom na nncwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu na cwiluiiñe naxueeñe .

text: That was the true Light , which lighteth every man that cometh into the world .
text2: Cristo cwiluiiñê naxueeñe na mayuuˈcheⁿ , tuiiñê tsjoomnancue . Jom mañequiaaⁿ naxuee nnom ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ .

text: He was in the world , and the world was made by him , and the world knew him not .
text2: Nquii na cwiluiiñe ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , tyomˈaaⁿñe tsjoomnancue , sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na jom tqueeⁿ juunaˈ , maxjeⁿ tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê .

text: He came unto his own , and his own received him not .
text2: Tyjeˈcañoom nnˈaⁿ judíos na mañecwii ndyuaana ñˈeⁿñê , sa ̱ a ̱ tîcatoˈñoomna jom .

text: But as many as received him , to them gave he power to become the sons of God , even to them that believe on his name :
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomndye joona toˈñoomna jom , ndoˈ tyolaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê . Nda ̱ a ̱ joona tquiaaⁿ na cwilaˈxmaⁿna ntseinda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Which were born , not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of God .
text2: Nchii cwiluiindyena ntseinaaⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ na cwiluiindye nda nnˈaⁿ . Meiⁿ nchii cwiluiindyena ntseinaaⁿ ee na queeⁿya tsˈom cwii tsˈaⁿ . Tomti maqueⁿnaˈ joona ntseinaaⁿ ee nqueⁿ lˈue tsˈoom .

text: And the Word was made flesh , and dwelt among us , ( and we beheld his glory , the glory as of the only begotten of the Father , ) full of grace and truth .
text2: Nquii na cwiluiiñe ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tuiiñe na tsˈaⁿ , tyomˈaaⁿñe quiiˈntaaⁿna . Canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya mˈaaⁿ na candyaˈ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ cwiluiiñe na mayuuˈ . Ntyˈiaanda ̱ a ̱ yâ quia seitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu . Quia tuii na ljoˈ saaliuuyâ na ñenquii cwiluiiñe Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: John bare witness of him , and cried , saying , This was he of whom I spake , He that cometh after me is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Juanˈñeeⁿ tyocwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu quia seiweeⁿ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Tsoom : — Nquiuˈyoˈ na jnda ̱ ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ na ˈio cha nleitquiooˈñe cwii tsˈaⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ na meiⁿchjoo ticˈoomˈnaˈ ja ñˈeⁿñê , ee maxjeⁿ mˈaaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluiindyo ̱ . Manquii tsˈaⁿ na mandyowindyooˈ luaaˈ joˈ .

text: And of his fulness have all we received , and grace for grace .
text2: Jom canda ̱ a ̱ ˈñˈeⁿ naya matseixmaaⁿ . Cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ joˈ matioˈnaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom chaˈtsondyo ̱ . Cwii nnom na jnda ̱ toˈño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na matioˈnaaⁿñê jaa , jnda ̱ mañoomcheⁿ na cwitoˈño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya .

text: For the law was given by Moses , but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ .
text2: Lˈo ̱ Moisés tquiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ljeii na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesucristo cwiliuuya na candyaˈ tsˈom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jaa ndoˈ na cwiluiiñê ñˈoom na mayuuˈ .

text: No man hath seen God at any time ; the only begotten Son , which is in the bosom of the Father , he hath declared him .
text2: Tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Macanda ̱ nquii Jnaaⁿ na ñecwiiñe , juu jnda ̱ tˈmo ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ya chiuu cwiluiiñê .

text: And this is the record of John , when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him , Who art thou ?
text2: Nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwiluiitquiendye Jerusalén jñoomna ntyee cwentaana na mˈaaⁿ Juan ñequio ntˈom levitas na cwindyeˈntjom naquiiˈ watsˈom . Tyˈioomna tsˈiaaⁿ ntyeeˈñeeⁿ na cataˈxˈee naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnom Juan ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê .

text: And he confessed , and denied not ; but confessed , I am not the Christ .
text2: Jom ndyeyu tjeiˈyuuˈñê , tsoom : — Ja nchii Cristo cwiluiindyo ̱ .

text: And they asked him , What then ? Art thou Elias ? And he saith , I am not . Art thou that prophet ? And he answered , No .
text2: Joˈ chii taˈxˈeetina nnoom : — ¿ Aa profeta Elías ˈu ? Jom tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ : — Nchii joˈ ja . Taˈxˈeenndaˈna nnoom : — Quia joˈ , ¿ aa cwiluiindyuˈ profetaˈñeeⁿ na matso Moisés na nñequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ya ? Sa ̱ a ̱ tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ : — Nchii joˈ ja .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? that we may give an answer to them that sent us . What sayest thou of thyself ?
text2: Joˈ chii jluena nnoom : — ¿ Quia joˈ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyuˈ ? Catsuˈ cha ya nntˈo ̱ o ̱ yâ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jñoom jâ . ¿ Chiuu matsuˈ cheⁿnncuˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na matseiˈxmaⁿˈ ?

text: He said , I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make straight the way of the Lord , as said the prophet Esaias .
text2: Luaa ñˈoom na seilcweeⁿˈeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Matsoom : — Ja matsˈaa chaˈxjeⁿ na tso profeta Isaías quia tsoom : “ Mˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na matseiwe jndyeeˈ jo ndoˈ ndyuaa yuu tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈoom . Calajndaaˈndyoˈ na nquii na tjacantyja na cwiluiitˈmaⁿñe nntsa ̱ ˈntjom ˈo . ”

text: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na laˈxmaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos jñoomna naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And they asked him , and said unto him , Why baptizest thou then , if thou be not that Christ , nor Elias , neither that prophet ?
text2: Ndoˈ taˈxˈeendyeti naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom . Jluena : — Matsuˈ na ˈu meiⁿ nchii Cristo cwiluiindyuˈ , meiⁿ Elías , meiⁿ nquii profeta na tso Moisés na nñequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ya , quia joˈ ¿ chiuu na matseitsˈoomndyuˈ nnˈaⁿ ?

text: John answered them , saying , I baptize with water : but there standeth one among you , whom ye know not ;
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ Juan nda ̱ a ̱ na . Tsoom : — Ja matseitsˈoomndyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ ñequio ndaatioo , sa ̱ a ̱ quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ mˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ .

text: He it is , who coming after me is preferred before me , whose shoe ' s latchet I am not worthy to unloose .
text2: Majom na nntsˈaaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom quia na jnda ̱ ˈndiinaˈ ja , ee maxjeⁿ mˈaaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluiindyo ̱ . Ja meiⁿ cweˈ na nndiˈntjo ̱ ⁿya nnoom tilˈuendyo ̱ .

text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan , where John was baptizing .
text2: Luaaˈ tuii cwii joo na jndyu Betábara , jo ntyja na macaluiˈ ñeˈquioomˈ xndyaaˈ jndaa Jordán yuu na tyotseitsˈoomñe Juan nnˈaⁿ .

text: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him , and saith , Behold the Lamb of God , which taketh away the sin of the world .
text2: Xuee na jnda ̱ we na tuii na luaaˈ , ntyˈiaaˈ Juan na ndyowindyooˈ Jesús na mˈaaⁿ . Matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ jâ na mˈaaⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê joˈ joˈ : — Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta , luaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiiñe catsmaⁿ tsmeiⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na juu matseicanduuˈ jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ .

text: This is he of whom I said , After me cometh a man which is preferred before me : for he was before me .
text2: Mañejuu tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na ˈio cha nleitquiooˈñe cwii tsˈaⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ na tˈmaⁿti cwiluiiñe , nchiiti ja . Ee mˈaaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluiindyo ̱ .

text: And I knew him not : but that he should be made manifest to Israel , therefore am I come baptizing with water .
text2: Xjeⁿ na to ̱ ˈa na matseitsˈoomndyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ ñequio ndaatioo , meiⁿ ticatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa na jom tsˈiaⁿˈaⁿ na nntseicanoomˈm jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ matsˈaa tsˈiaaⁿmeiiⁿ cha catseicaˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ Israel na ljoˈ cwiluiiñê .

text: And John bare record , saying , I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove , and it abode upon him .
text2: Ndoˈ Juan tjeiˈyuuˈñetyeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ . Matsoom : — Ntyˈiano ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na jnaⁿ Espíritu Santo cañoomˈluee . Jndyocue chaˈcwijom catuˈ , ljooˈñe ñˈeⁿñê .

text: And I knew him not : but he that sent me to baptize with water , the same said unto me , Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending , and remaining on him , the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ meiⁿ tîcatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa ˈñeeⁿ juu na nluiiñe nquii na nntseicanduuˈ jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tjañjoomˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ quia jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ja na catseitsˈoomndyo ̱ nnˈaⁿ , tsoom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ : “ Nntyˈiaˈnjomˈ na nndyocue Espíritu nacjooˈ cwii tsˈaⁿ , ndoˈ nljooˈñe ñˈeⁿñê . Juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ tyˈio ̱ ⁿya tsˈiaaⁿ jom na nntseitsˈoomñê nnˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿ Espíritu Santo . ”

text: And I saw , and bare record that this is the Son of God .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ ntyˈiano ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na tuii na ljoˈ ñˈeⁿñê . Joˈ chii macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ na jom cwiluiiñê Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Again the next day after John stood , and two of his disciples ;
text2: Cwiicheⁿ xuee meintyjeeˈnndaˈ Juan ñequio wendyô ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ .

text: And looking upon Jesus as he walked , he saith , Behold the Lamb of God !
text2: Ndoˈ quia ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ Jesús na mawjaawinom joˈ joˈ , matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ , luaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiiñe catsmaⁿ tsmeiⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And the two disciples heard him speak , and they followed Jesus .
text2: Ndoˈ wendyô ̱ jâ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ , quia na jndya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoomwaaˈ , saantyjo ̱ o ̱ yâ naxeⁿˈ Jesús .

text: Then Jesus turned , and saw them following , and saith unto them , What seek ye ? They said unto him , Rabbi , ( which is to say , being interpreted , Master , ) where dwellest thou ?
text2: Taqueⁿ Jesús ndoˈ ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na cwitsaantyjo ̱ o ̱ yâ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ . Taxˈeeñê nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsoom : — ¿ Aa waa na nlˈaˈyoˈ ja ? Ndoˈ lˈuuyâ nnoom : — Rabí , ¿ cwaaⁿ wˈaa nncjaˈmeintyjeˈ jeˈ ? Ñˈoom rabí matsonaˈ tsˈaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: He saith unto them , Come and see . They came and saw where he dwelt , and abode with him that day : for it was about the tenth hour .
text2: Matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Quioˈyoˈ mana nntyˈiaˈyoˈ . Quia joˈ saayâ ñˈeⁿñê wˈaa na tjameintyjeeⁿˈeⁿ . Ndoˈ chaˈna ñequiee na matmaaⁿ na squia ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈeⁿñê . Ljooˈndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê hasta na jnda ̱ teinco ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ .

text: One of the two which heard John speak , and followed him , was Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother .
text2: Ja Juan ñequio Andrés , tyjee Simón Pedro , jâ jndya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom na tso Juanˈñeeⁿ , ndoˈ saantyjo ̱ o ̱ yâ naxeⁿˈ Jesús .

text: He first findeth his own brother Simon , and saith unto him , We have found the Messias , which is , being interpreted , the Christ .
text2: Juu Andrésˈñeeⁿ tjacalˈueeⁿ xioom Simón . Matsoom nnom : — Jnda ̱ jliuuyâ juu na cwiluiiñe Mesías . ( Ñˈoomwaaˈ matsonaˈ Cristo , nquii na tqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe nnˈaⁿ . )

text: And he brought him to Jesus . And when Jesus beheld him , he said , Thou art Simon the son of Jona : thou shalt be called Cephas , which is by interpretation , A stone .
text2: Quia joˈ tjañˈoom Andrés xioom na mˈaaⁿ Jesús . Ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús juu , ndoˈ matsoom : — ˈU re , Simón , jnda Jonás ˈu . Jeˈ nntseicajndyuya ˈu Cefas . ( Ñˈoomwaaˈ matsonaˈ Pedro . )

text: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee , and findeth Philip , and saith unto him , Follow me .
text2: Cwiicheⁿ xuee seijndaaˈñe Jesús na nncjaⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Quia ljoˈcheⁿ teincwiñê ñˈeⁿ Felipe . Matsoom nnom : — Candyoˈtseijomndyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa .

text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida , the city of Andrew and Peter .
text2: Juu Felipeˈñeeⁿ mañeˈcwii tsjomˈm ñequio Andrés ñˈeⁿ Pedro . Joona nnˈaⁿ tsjoom Betsaida .

text: Philip findeth Nathanael , and saith unto him , We have found him , of whom Moses in the law , and the prophets , did write , Jesus of Nazareth , the son of Joseph .
text2: Ndoˈ tjacalˈue Felipe Natanael . Matsoom nnom : — Jnda ̱ jliuuyâ nquii na cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ seiljeii Moisés nacjooˈ libro na chuunaˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ . Ndoˈ mati ntˈomcheⁿ profetas tyolaˈljeiina cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ . Majuu Jesús joˈ , tsˈaⁿ tsjoom Nazaret , na cwilue nnˈaⁿ na jnda José juu .

text: And Nathanael said unto him , Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth ? Philip saith unto him , Come and see .
text2: Tso Natanael : — Ndooˈ ntyjii na cweˈ Nazaret xocwitquiooˈñe cwii tsˈaⁿ na tˈmaⁿ nnteijneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Tˈo ̱ Felipe nnoom , matso : — Candyoˈ sa . Nntyˈiaˈnjomˈ jom .

text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him , and saith of him , Behold an Israelite indeed , in whom is no guile !
text2: Ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús na ndyocwjeˈcañoom Natanael jom . Matsoom : — Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ tiquinquiuˈnnˈaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . Jom mayuuˈcheⁿ cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ Israel .

text: Nathanael saith unto him , Whence knowest thou me ? Jesus answered and said unto him , Before that Philip called thee , when thou wast under the fig tree , I saw thee .
text2: Taxˈeeñe Natanael nnoom : — ¿ Chiuu ljeiˈyuˈ Ta na ljoˈ matseixmaⁿya ? Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : — Cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nncjaacwaⁿ Felipe ˈu , ntyˈiaya ˈu quia mˈaaⁿˈ waˈ xˈee tsˈoom higuera ˈnaⁿˈ .

text: Nathanael answered and saith unto him , Rabbi , thou art the Son of God ; thou art the King of Israel .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ Natanael , matsoom : — ˈU tsˈaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoom naya nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , ˈu maxjeⁿ cwiluiindyuˈ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . ˈU cwiluiindyuˈ rey cwentaa jâ nnˈaⁿ Israel .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Because I said unto thee , I saw thee under the fig tree , believest thou ? thou shalt see greater things than these .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús : — ¿ Aa cweˈ ncˈe na tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya na ntyˈiaya ˈu xˈee tsˈoom higuera ˈnaⁿˈ , aa cweˈ joˈ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ? Maxjeⁿ maniom na jndati laˈxmaⁿnaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya na quia wjaˈntyˈiaˈ .

text: And he saith unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Hereafter ye shall see heaven open , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man .
text2: Ndoˈ matsotyeeⁿ nnom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . ˈO nntyˈiaˈyoˈ na nnaaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Ndoˈ nntyˈiaˈyoˈ na nnquiocue ángeles na mˈaaⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaaⁿya na mˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ndoˈ na nncˈoowanndaˈna .

text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee ; and the mother of Jesus was there :
text2: Xuee jnda ̱ ndyee na tuii na luaaˈ toco cwii tsˈaⁿ tsjoom Caná , tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Ndoˈ seijomñe tsondyee Jesús .

text: And both Jesus was called , and his disciples , to the marriage .
text2: Ndoˈ joo nnˈaⁿ na tˈunco tˈmaⁿna Jesús ñequio jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê na mati calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿndyena na cwiˈuncona .

text: And when they wanted wine , the mother of Jesus saith unto him , They have no wine .
text2: Jnda ̱ na ntquieˈ winom , tsondyee Jesús tso nnoom : — Ticwijndeii winom .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , what have I to do with thee ? mine hour is not yet come .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , matsoom : — Naⁿ , ¿ ljoˈ nntsaˈ ja ? Tyooweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntsˈaa cwii nnom na tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa .

text: His mother saith unto the servants , Whatsoever he saith unto you , do it .
text2: Matso tsoñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwindyeˈntjom joˈ joˈ : — Calˈaˈyoˈ chaˈtso na nntsa ̱ ˈntjoom ˈo .

text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone , after the manner of the purifying of the Jews , containing two or three firkins apiece .
text2: Maniom ñˈoom na cwiqua ̱ a ̱ ⁿ jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwinndyuuˈa ñequio na cwitmaaⁿya ˈnaⁿ . Wˈaa yuu na toco tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ meintyjeeˈ yom ljoo tˈmaⁿ na tuiinaˈ ñˈeⁿ ljo ̱ ˈ , na quiwilˈueeˈndyena na cwilaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena costumbreˈñeeⁿ . Cwiwijndeii cwii cwii tsjooˈñeeⁿ chaˈna ñequiee hasta yom xjo lata ndaa .

text: Jesus saith unto them , Fill the waterpots with water . And they filled them up to the brim .
text2: Seineiⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwindyeˈntjom joˈ joˈ . Matsoom : — Calacatoˈyoˈ ljoomeiⁿˈ ñequio ndaatioo . Ndoˈ jlaˈcatooˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ joonaˈ hasta tooˈ cwijomnaˈ .

text: And he saith unto them , Draw out now , and bear unto the governor of the feast . And they bare it .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jeˈ catjeiˈyoˈ chjoowiˈ juunaˈ . Catsaañˈomˈyoˈ na mˈaaⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈñˈoomˈndye nantquie . Joˈ chii tyˈeñˈomna juunaˈ na mˈaaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine , and knew not whence it was : ( but the servants which drew the water knew ; ) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom ,
text2: Ndoˈ juu tsˈaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom naⁿˈñeeⁿ tˈuu chjoowiˈ ndaatioo na jnda ̱ seicwaqueⁿ Jesús na winom . Ticaljeii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ yuu jnaⁿnaˈ sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwindyeˈntjom joˈ joˈ nquiucheⁿna yuu tjeiiˈna juunaˈ . Quia joˈ tcwaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tsˈaⁿ na macoco .

text: And saith unto him , Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine ; and when men have well drunk , then that which is worse : but thou hast kept the good wine until now .
text2: Matsoom nnom : — Ticwii cwii joo na ñetjo ̱ na tˈunco nnˈaⁿ , najndyee tyoñeˈquia nnˈaⁿ winom na yaticheⁿ na nncwe ncˈiaana . Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ mawjaacjoo naⁿˈñeeⁿ na cwiwena , quia joˈ cwiñeˈquiana winom na ticueˈntyjo ̱ na yanaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu jeˈ , jnda ̱ seiljoˈ winom na yaticheⁿ na quia jeˈcheⁿ nleilˈuenaˈ .

text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee , and manifested forth his glory ; and his disciples believed on him .
text2: Mˈaaⁿ Jesús Caná tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea quia sˈaajñeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na tixocaluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ sˈaaⁿ tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na tˈmaⁿ cwiluiiñê . Mancˈe joˈ na jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , jnaⁿnaˈ na cwilayuuˈâ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: After this he went down to Capernaum , he , and his mother , and his brethren , and his disciples : and they continued there not many days .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tuii na luaaˈ , quia joˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwindya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ , saayâ Capernaum ñˈeⁿñê , ñequio tsoñeeⁿ ñequio ntyjeeⁿ . Ndoˈ ljooˈndyô ̱ joˈ joˈ cwantindyo xuee .

text: And the Jews ' passover was at hand , and Jesus went up to Jerusalem ,
text2: Juu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ wjaawindyooˈ nncueeˈ ncuee pascua quia jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilacwja ̱ a ̱ canmaⁿ . Joˈ chii saayâ Jerusalén ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves , and the changers of money sitting :
text2: Tachˈeeⁿˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ , joˈ joˈ ljeiiⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwinda ̱ a ̱ quioondyo ñˈeⁿ canmaⁿ ñˈeⁿ cantuˈ . Ndoˈ mati meindyuaandye nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjndyoondye sˈom ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwiˈooquieˈ watsˈom .

text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords , he drove them all out of the temple , and the sheep , and the oxen ; and poured out the changers ' money , and overthrew the tables ;
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ na ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ na luaaˈ , quia joˈ sˈaaⁿ lˈuaa tsjaˈjneiⁿ , jnda ̱ chii jleintyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ chaˈtsondye joona chˈeeⁿˈ tachˈeⁿ watsˈomˈñeeⁿ . Mati canmaⁿ ñˈeⁿ quioondyo . Ndoˈ seicantqueeⁿ meiⁿsa na cwileiˈcho nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjndyoondye sˈom joˈ joˈ . Seiquiaⁿ sˈom ˈnaaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And said unto them that sold doves , Take these things hence ; make not my Father ' s house an house of merchandise .
text2: Ndoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwinda ̱ a ̱ cantuˈ matsoom : — Catjeiˈyoˈ quiooˈmˈaⁿˈ ñjaaⁿñe . Tacalˈaˈyoˈ na waaˈ Tsotya ̱ ya na matseijomnaˈ chaˈna tsˈua .

text: And his disciples remembered that it was written , The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up .
text2: Quia joˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ tjañjoomˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈoom na mawaa cjooˈ libro Salmos . Matsonaˈ : “ Nlaˈcueeˈ nnˈaⁿ ja jnaaⁿˈ na queeⁿ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya na nleilˈueeˈndyena waaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom chaˈxjeⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ . ”

text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him , What sign shewest thou unto us , seeing that thou doest these things ?
text2: Ndoˈ taˈxˈee nnˈaⁿ judíos nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Cwaaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ nntsaˈ na tixocaluii juunaˈ na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa na mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ na waa najndeii na matseixmaⁿˈ na nmeiiⁿˈ macheˈ ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Destroy this temple , and in three days I will raise it up .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Calatyuiˈyoˈ watsˈomwaañe ndoˈ ñeˈndyee xuee nntseiwa ̱ nndaˈa juunaˈ .

text: Then said the Jews , Forty and six years was this temple in building , and wilt thou rear it up in three days ?
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ : — Wenˈaaⁿ nchooˈ yom ntyu tjacaa na tuii watsˈomwaañe , ndoˈ ˈu jeˈ ¿ aa cweˈ ñeˈndyee xuee nntseiweˈ juunaˈ ?

text: But he spake of the temple of his body .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ seijoomˈñê na juu seiiⁿˈeⁿ cwiluiiñenaˈ watsˈom .

text: When therefore he was risen from the dead , his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them ; and they believed the scripture , and the word which Jesus had said .
text2: Joˈ chii jnda ̱ na tquiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na tandoˈxcoom jnda ̱ na tueeⁿˈeⁿ , jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwindya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ tjañjoomˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na ljoˈ tsoom . Ndoˈ jlayuuˈâ ñˈoom na seineiiⁿ ndoˈ mati ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiyo teiljeii .

text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover , in the feast day , many believed in his name , when they saw the miracles which he did .
text2: Yocheⁿ na tyomˈaaⁿ Jesús Jerusalén na tyowaa xuee Pascua quia jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilaˈwja ̱ a ̱ ya canmaⁿ , nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ tyontyˈiaana jndye nnom tsˈiaaⁿ na tyochˈeeⁿ na tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa . Joˈ chii jndyendyena tyolaˈyuˈna na cwiluiiñê Cristo .

text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them , because he knew all men ,
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tînquiaañê ñˈeⁿndyena , ee ntyjeeⁿ chiuu nˈomna .

text: And needed not that any should testify of man : for he knew what was in man .
text2: Meiⁿ ticaⁿnaˈ na cwjiˈyuuˈñe tsˈaⁿ nnoom cantyja ljoˈ laˈxmaⁿ nnˈaⁿ , ee maxjeⁿ mantyjeeⁿ chiuu nˈomna .

text: There was a man of the Pharisees , named Nicodemus , a ruler of the Jews :
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na tyoluiitquieñe quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tyotseijomñê ñˈoom na quitˈmaⁿ nˈom nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos . Jom jñoom Nicodemo .

text: The same came to Jesus by night , and said unto him , Rabbi , we know that thou art a teacher come from God : for no man can do these miracles that thou doest , except God be with him .
text2: Jñoom na mˈaaⁿ Jesús cwii teijaaⁿ . Matsoom nnom : — Maestro , manquiuuyâ na ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ tsˈaⁿ na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na caˈmo ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoom naya ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ . Ee xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsaˈ tsˈiaaⁿmeiⁿˈ xeⁿ nchii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of God .
text2: Jesús tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , matsoom nnom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ , xeⁿ ticaluiixcoñe tsˈaⁿ tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nntseijomñe cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Nicodemus saith unto him , How can a man be born when he is old ? can he enter the second time into his mother ' s womb , and be born ?
text2: Ndoˈ taxˈeeñe Nicodemo nnoom , matso : — ¿ Chiuu nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ na nluiiñennaaⁿˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tquieñê ? Ee tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nncjaaquieeˈnnaaⁿˈaⁿ tsiatsjaaⁿˈ tsoñeeⁿ ndoˈ na nluiiñennaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Jesus answered , Verily , verily , I say unto thee , Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Jesús tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , matsoom nnom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya njomˈ . Xeⁿ ticaluiiñe tsˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ndaatioo ndoˈ ñequio Espíritu , tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nncjaquieeˈñê cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh ; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit .
text2: Ncˈe na nnˈaⁿ jaa , joˈ chii mati ndaaya mannˈaⁿ joona . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ tsˈaⁿ na tuiiñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu Santo . Tseixmaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Marvel not that I said unto thee , Ye must be born again .
text2: Tinntseiñˈeeⁿˈñenaˈ tsˈomˈ juu ñˈoom na matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya : “ Maxjeⁿ jndeiˈnaˈ na caluiindyoˈxcoˈyoˈ . ”

text: The wind bloweth where it listeth , and thou hearest the sound thereof , but canst not tell whence it cometh , and whither it goeth : so is every one that is born of the Spirit .
text2: Ndiˈ na cˈuaa camˈaaⁿ jndye , sa ̱ a ̱ tileicantyjo ̱ ˈ yuu jnaⁿnaˈ , meiⁿ yuu wjaanaˈ . Malaaˈtiˈ matseijomnaˈ na tileicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ chiuu waa na tuiiñe tsˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu .

text: Nicodemus answered and said unto him , How can these things be ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ Nicodemo , tsonnaaⁿˈaⁿ : — Maxjeⁿ ticatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa .

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , Art thou a master of Israel , and knowest not these things ?
text2: Matso Jesús : — Aa ljoˈ , ndoˈ ˈu tˈmaⁿ cwiluiindyuˈ na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ Israel . Joˈ chii ticatseitiuuya na tileicatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoommeiiⁿ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto thee , We speak that we do know , and testify that we have seen ; and ye receive not our witness .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya njomˈ . Matseina ̱ ⁿya cantyja na mantyjiiya , ndoˈ macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ ljoˈ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiano ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: If I have told you earthly things , and ye believe not , how shall ye believe , if I tell you of heavenly things ?
text2: Jnda ̱ mamatseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ ˈnaⁿ na niom tsjoomnancue cha calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ . Quia joˈ , ¿ chiuu ya nntsˈaa cha na nlayuˈyoˈ ñˈoom na mañequia cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ cañoomˈluee ?

text: And no man hath ascended up to heaven , but he that came down from heaven , even the Son of man which is in heaven .
text2: ’ Ee tjaaˈnaⁿ tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjawa cañoomˈluee cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nntseicandii nnˈaⁿ chiuu macaⁿnaˈ na calˈana na nlcoˈxcwenaˈ ntyjii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ñˈeⁿndyena . Macanda ̱ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaaⁿya cañoomˈluee ntyjiiya .

text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness , even so must the Son of man be lifted up :
text2: Quia ñetˈom nnˈaⁿ judíos jo ndoˈ ndyuaa yuu na tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈom , quia joˈ tyˈiom Moisés cwii xjo na tuiinaˈ chaˈna catsuu cjooˈ cwii tsˈoom . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na nntyˈioom nnˈaⁿ ja tsˈoomˈnaaⁿ na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaaⁿya cañoomˈluee .

text: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have eternal life .
text2: Luaaˈ nluii cha meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ nntseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na nncwandoˈ .

text: For God so loved the world , that he gave his only begotten Son , that whosoever believeth in him should not perish , but have everlasting life .
text2: ’ Ncˈe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tˈmaⁿ waa na mˈaaⁿ na candyaˈ tsˈoom nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue , joˈ chii Ja na ñennco ̱ na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ tquiaaⁿ na tuiindyo ̱ cha ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ na nntseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ tixocatsuuñe . Mˈaaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ .

text: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world ; but that the world through him might be saved .
text2: Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nchii jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ cha na catˈuiiya joona cantyja jnaaⁿna . Jom jñoom ja cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿndyena .

text: He that believeth on him is not condemned : but he that believeth not is condemned already , because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God .
text2: ’ Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nntseiyuˈ ñequio ja , ticatˈuii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ jnaaⁿˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿquia tsˈaⁿ na tiñeˈcatseiyuˈ , jeˈ mamatˈuiinaˈ juu cantyja jnaaⁿˈ , ee na tiñeˈcatseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ na macanda ̱ ja cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ .

text: And this is the condemnation , that light is come into the world , and men loved darkness rather than light , because their deeds were evil .
text2: Jnda ̱ mamatˈuiinaˈ nnˈaⁿ na tyoolayuˈ ee ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxuee jnda ̱ tyja ̱ cano ̱ o ̱ ⁿya joona , sa ̱ a ̱ neiiⁿtinaˈ na cwilaˈjomndyena cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na jo ̱ o ̱ ⁿñe , ee cwilˈana yuu na ticatsa ̱ ntjomnaˈ .

text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light , neither cometh to the light , lest his deeds should be reproved .
text2: Ee ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ na machˈee natia , jeeⁿ jnoomˈm ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxueeñe . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tiñeˈcatseijomñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja , ee jeeⁿ nquiaⁿˈaⁿ na nntseicano ̱ o ̱ ⁿya natia na machˈeeⁿ .

text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light , that his deeds may be made manifest , that they are wrought in God .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na machˈee yuu na matyˈiomyanaˈ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ matseijomñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxueeñe . Ndoˈ na ljoˈ cwiwitquiooˈya na chaˈtso na machˈeeⁿ , machˈeeⁿ ncˈe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea ; and there he tarried with them , and baptized .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ jluiˈ Jesús Jerusalén ndoˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ , mati jluiiˈâ ñˈeⁿñê . Tyomaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea . Tyomˈaaⁿyâ joˈ joˈ cwantindyo xuee . Ndoˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ tquieˈcañom jom na nleitsˈoomndye .

text: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim , because there was much water there : and they came , and were baptized .
text2: Mati Juan tyotseitsˈoomñê nnˈaⁿ cwii joo na jndyu Enón , manndyooˈ Salim , ee majndye ndaatioo mˈaaⁿ joˈ . Ndoˈ tyoˈoo nnˈaⁿ na tyotseitsˈoomñê joona .

text: For John was not yet cast into prison .
text2: Ee xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tyoojuˈ Herodes jom wˈaancjo .

text: Then there arose a question between some of John ' s disciples and the Jews about purifying .
text2: Quia joˈ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoom na mañequiaa jom , jlaˈñˈeeⁿˈ ndyueena ñequio ncˈiaana nnˈaⁿ judíos na cweˈ tquieya . Ee cwilaˈntjaˈndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena cwaaⁿ cwii nnom na jndati tseixmaⁿ na cwiwitsˈoomndye nnˈaⁿ . ¿ Aa cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ñˈoom na mañequiaa Juan , oo , aa cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús ?

text: And they came unto John , and said unto him , Rabbi , he that was with thee beyond Jordan , to whom thou barest witness , behold , the same baptizeth , and all men come to him .
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoom na mañequiaa Juan tyˈentyjaaˈna jom . Jluena nnoom : — ˈU ta na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , juu tsˈaⁿ na tyocañˈeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ xndyaaˈ jndaa Jordán , nquii na tjeiˈyuuˈndyuˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , cantyˈiaˈ , cwiwitsˈoomndye nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , ndoˈ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ cwiˈoontyjo ̱ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: John answered and said , A man can receive nothing , except it be given him from heaven .
text2: Juan tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Tjaa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ xeⁿ nchii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom matseijndaaˈñê ljoˈ nntseixmaⁿ tsˈaⁿ .

text: Ye yourselves bear me witness , that I said , I am not the Christ , but that I am sent before him .
text2: Mancjoˈyoˈ nquiuˈyoˈ na ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ja nchii Cristo cwiluiindyo ̱ . Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tyˈioom tsˈiaaⁿ ja na catseijndo ̱ ˈa nˈom nnˈaⁿ na calaˈjndaaˈndyena naquiiˈ nˈomna na calaˈljona Cristo .

text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom : but the friend of the bridegroom , which standeth and heareth him , rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom ' s voice : this my joy therefore is fulfilled .
text2: ˈO cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoom na tjañoomˈ na juu tsaⁿsˈa na macoˈñom yuscu na macoco ñˈeⁿñê , masaaˈ yuscuˈñeeⁿ jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na matseijomñe ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿsˈaˈñeeⁿ , nchii mˈaaⁿ na liooˈ na macoˈñom xˈiaaˈ yuscuˈñeeⁿ . Nchii joˈ . Cwiquioo na neiiⁿˈ na mandiiñe ñˈoom na matseineiⁿ xˈiaaˈ . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na matseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ na neiⁿya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: He must increase , but I must decrease .
text2: Joˈ chii jeeⁿ xcwe na jom cjaaluiitˈmaⁿñetyeeⁿ sa ̱ a ̱ ja catseicjetinaˈ .

text: He that cometh from above is above all : he that is of the earth is earthly , and speaketh of the earth : he that cometh from heaven is above all .
text2: Tsoti Juan : — Ncˈe tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ jnaaⁿ cañoomˈluee , tˈmaⁿti cwiluiiñê , nchiiti chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ . Ja na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ ja , matseixmaⁿya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancue ndoˈ matseina ̱ ⁿya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈnaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nquii tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na jnaaⁿ cañoomˈluee , cwiluiitˈmaⁿñetyeeⁿ na chaˈtso .

text: And what he hath seen and heard , that he testifieth ; and no man receiveth his testimony .
text2: Ndoˈ macwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ ñequio na jnda ̱ jñeeⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ tjaaˈnaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ juu ñeˈcoˈñom ñˈoom na macwjiˈyuuˈñê .

text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true .
text2: Juu tsˈaⁿ na macoˈñom ñˈoom na macwjiˈyuuˈñê , matseijomñe tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñe na mayuuˈ .

text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God : for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him .
text2: Ee nquii na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ , ñˈoomˈm matseineiⁿ , ee canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya mañequiaaⁿ Espíritu na cwiluiiñê naquiiˈ tsˈom .

text: The Father loveth the Son , and hath given all things into his hand .
text2: Nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwiluiiñê Tsotya ̱ a ̱ ya mˈaaⁿ na candyaˈ tsˈoom Jnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ naquiiˈ lˈo ̱ jnda ̱ tqueeⁿ chaˈtsoti na maniom .

text: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life : and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life ; but the wrath of God abideth on him .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñequio Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , matseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ añmaaⁿˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈñeeⁿ juu na ticatseiñˈoomˈñe na nntseiyuˈ ñequio Jnaaⁿ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ xocandaaˈ na nncwandoˈ añmaaⁿˈ . Tyeⁿ waa na matseiwˈii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu .

text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John ,
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiindye tmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ fariseos tyondyena na majndyendyeti nnˈaⁿ teitsˈoomndye cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús , nchiiti cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Juan .

text: ( Though Jesus himself baptized not , but his disciples , )
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ na mayuuˈcheⁿ nquii Jesús tîcatseitsˈoomñê nnˈaⁿ . Macanda ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , jâ lˈaayâ tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: He left Judaea , and departed again into Galilee .
text2: Joˈ chii quia na jñeeⁿ na luaaˈ cwilue fariseosˈñeeⁿ , jlueeⁿˈeⁿ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea ñˈeⁿndyô ̱ na nntsaayâ Galilea .

text: And he must needs go through Samaria .
text2: Ndoˈ na cwitsaayâ joˈ joˈ majndaaˈ na nncwino ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Samaria .

text: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria , which is called Sychar , near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
text2: Joˈ chii squia ̱ a ̱ yâ cwii tsjoom na jndyu Sicar tsˈo ̱ ndaa Samaria . Tsjoomˈñeeⁿ manndyooˈ mˈaaⁿnaˈ yuu waa tyuaa na jndaaˈ José nnom tsotyeeⁿ Jacob .

text: Now Jacob ' s well was there . Jesus therefore , being wearied with his journey , sat thus on the well : and it was about the sixth hour .
text2: Joˈ joˈ tyowaa tsuiˈ na sˈaa Jacob . Ndoˈ Jesús , na teijñaⁿˈaⁿ na jñoom nato , tjacjom nacañoomˈ tsuiˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ jnda ̱ tueeˈ quiajmeiⁿˈ .

text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water : Jesus saith unto her , Give me to drink .
text2: Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tyjeˈcañoom cwii yuscu Samaria joˈ joˈ na nncwjiˈ ndaatioo . Matsoom nnom : — Quiaaˈ ndaatioo nncˈua .

text: ( For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat . )
text2: Ndoˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ saayâ quiiˈ tsjoom . Saalajndaayâ na nlcwaaˈâ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him , How is it that thou , being a Jew , askest drink of me , which am a woman of Samaria ? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans .
text2: Matso yuscu Samaria nnoom : — ¿ Chiuu na macaⁿˈ ndaatioo no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , ee ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ tsˈaⁿ judío ndoˈ ja cwiluiindyo ̱ samaritana ? Luaaˈ tso yuscuˈñeeⁿ ncˈe nnˈaⁿ judíos tiquilaˈtjoomˈndyena ñequio nnˈaⁿ samaritanos .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , If thou knewest the gift of God , and who it is that saith to thee , Give me to drink ; thou wouldest have asked of him , and he would have given thee living water .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , tsoom : — Xeⁿ cweˈ matseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ na jeeⁿ jnda tseixmaⁿ naya na ñeˈcatsˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈu , ndoˈ xeⁿ matseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyo ̱ na macaⁿˈa ndaatioo njomˈ , nntseityˈoondyuˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na cateijndeiya ˈu , ndoˈ ja jnda ̱ tquiaya cwii na matseijomnaˈ ndaatioo na nñequiaanaˈ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , thou hast nothing to draw with , and the well is deep : from whence then hast thou that living water ?
text2: Matso yuscuˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Ta , tjaaˈnaⁿ ˈnaⁿ cˈoomˈ na nncwjiˈ ndaatioo , ndoˈ tsuiˈwaa , jeeⁿ njoomnaˈ . Quia joˈ ¿ yuu nncˈoomˈyuˈ ndaatiooˈñeeⁿ na nntseixmaⁿya na ticantycwii na wando ̱ ˈa ?

text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob , which gave us the well , and drank thereof himself , and his children , and his cattle ?
text2: ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na macheˈ na ˈu cwiluiitˈmaⁿndyuˈtiˈ nchiiti weloo welooya Jacob ? Ee jom tyoˈom ndaa tsuiˈwaa , mati ntseinaaⁿ ñequio quiooˈ ntsmeiiⁿˈeⁿ , ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ juunaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ .

text: Jesus answered and said unto her , Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again :
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , matsoom : — Chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na cwiwe ndaatioomeiiⁿ nndyo na ñeˈcwenndaˈna .

text: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst ; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwiwena ndaa na mañequia tixocatsˈaanaˈ na ñecwetina ee nntsˈaanaˈ naquiiˈ nˈomna chaˈcwijom ndaa na cwileiˈwo ̱ o ̱ naˈ tsˈom xo ̱ ˈ na ticantquieeˈnaˈ na nntsˈaanaˈ na tijoom cantycwii na nntaˈndoˈna .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , give me this water , that I thirst not , neither come hither to draw .
text2: Ndoˈ yuscuˈñeeⁿ matso : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta quiaaˈ ndaatioowaaˈ cha na tacandyo na ñeˈcˈuatya ̱ , meiⁿ tantseicachjuundyo ̱ na ñequiiˈcheⁿ na candyo ̱ cwjiiˈa juunaˈ .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Go , call thy husband , and come hither .
text2: Matso Jesús nnom : — Cjaˈ , cwaaⁿˈ saˈ , ndoˈ jnda ̱ joˈ quioˈyoˈ ñjaaⁿ .

text: The woman answered and said , I have no husband . Jesus said unto her , Thou hast well said , I have no husband :
text2: Tˈo ̱ yuscuˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Ja tjaaˈnaⁿ sˈaya . Matso Jesús nnom : — Majoˈndyo ñˈoom na matsuˈ na ˈu tjaaˈnaⁿ saˈ .

text: For thou hast had five husbands ; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband : in that saidst thou truly .
text2: Ee jnda ̱ ñetˈoom ˈom saˈ ndoˈ juu tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ jeˈ , nchii saˈ jom . Cantyja na luaaˈ waa , mayuuˈ ñˈoom tsuˈ .

text: The woman saith unto him , Sir , I perceive that thou art a prophet .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii yuscuˈñeeⁿ ñˈoomwaaˈ , tsoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , matseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa na ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ profeta .

text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain ; and ye say , that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship .
text2: Weloo weloo jâ nnˈaⁿ samaritanos tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom sjo ̱ waa . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo nnˈaⁿ judíos cwinduˈyoˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ Jerusalén joˈ joˈ calaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ jom .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Woman , believe me , the hour cometh , when ye shall neither in this mountain , nor yet at Jerusalem , worship the Father .
text2: Matso Jesús nnom yuscuˈñeeⁿ : — ˈU yuscu , catseiyuˈ ñˈoom na matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ na manncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya meiⁿquiayuucheⁿ , nchii cweˈ sjo ̱ waa oo Jerusalén .

text: Ye worship ye know not what : we know what we worship : for salvation is of the Jews .
text2: ˈO nnˈaⁿ Samaria jeeⁿ cachjoo cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ndoˈ cweˈ cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyoˈtoˈyoˈ jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈyayâ ˈñeeⁿ cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyô ̱ . Ee cantyja ˈnaaⁿyâ joˈ na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê nnˈaⁿ .

text: But the hour cometh , and now is , when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth : for the Father seeketh such to worship him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ manncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ , ndoˈ jeˈ mamaweˈntyjo ̱ na joo nnˈaⁿ na mayuuˈcheⁿ na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye Tsotya ̱ ya , macaⁿnaˈ na calaˈtmaaⁿˈndyena jom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu na cwiluiiñê ndoˈ ñequio na mayoona . Ee lˈue tsˈom Tsotya ̱ ya na luaaˈ calaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ jom .

text: God is a Spirit : and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth .
text2: Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñê Espíritu . Joˈ chii joo nnˈaⁿ na ñeˈcalaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye jom , macaⁿnaˈ na cˈomna nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu Santo , ndoˈ ñequio na mayoona .

text: The woman saith unto him , I know that Messias cometh , which is called Christ : when he is come , he will tell us all things .
text2: Matso yuscuˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Ja ntyjii na nncwjeˈcañoom Mesías , manqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê Cristo . Jom quia na nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ , nntseinchoomˈm chaˈtso ñˈoommeiⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: Jesus saith unto her , I that speak unto thee am he .
text2: Matso Jesús nnom : — Mannco ̱ na matseina ̱ ⁿya ñˈeⁿndyuˈ cwiluiindyo ̱ nqueⁿ .

text: And upon this came his disciples , and marvelled that he talked with the woman : yet no man said , What seekest thou ? or , Why talkest thou with her ?
text2: Majuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê squieˈcaño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ joona . Ticjaweeˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na matseineiiⁿ ñˈeⁿ cwii yuscu , sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na ljoˈ tjaaˈnaⁿ na taˈxˈa ̱ a ̱ yâ ˈndyoo yuscuˈñeeⁿ : “ ¿ Ljoˈ lˈue tsˈomˈ ? ” oo na lˈuuyâ nnom Ta Jesús : “ ¿ Cwaaⁿ ñˈoom matseineiⁿˈ ñequio yuscumˈaaⁿˈ ? ”

text: The woman then left her waterpot , and went her way into the city , and saith to the men ,
text2: Ndoˈ ˈndii yuscuˈñeeⁿ tsjoo ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ tsjoom . Tjacatsoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ :

text: Come , see a man , which told me all things that ever I did : is not this the Christ ?
text2: — Quioˈyoˈ na nntsaacantyˈiaˈyoˈ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jnda ̱ tso no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chaˈtso na tijoˈndyo na jnda ̱ ñesˈaa . Mˈaaⁿˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na juu cwiluiiñe Mesías .

text: Then they went out of the city , and came unto him .
text2: Ndoˈ jluiˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ tsjoomna , tyˈena yuu na mˈaaⁿyâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him , saying , Master , eat .
text2: Yocheⁿ na tyooquiena , jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê lˈuuyâ nnoom : — ˈU Maestro , cwa sa , cwaˈ .

text: But he said unto them , I have meat to eat that ye know not of .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Ja mañˈo ̱ ⁿ cwii na nlcwaaˈa na ˈo ticaliuˈyoˈ .

text: Therefore said the disciples one to another , Hath any man brought him ought to eat ?
text2: Quia joˈ jâ na cwindya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ jlana ̱ a ̱ ⁿ cheⁿncjo ̱ o ̱ yâ nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaayâ . Lˈuuyâ : — ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na jndyoñˈoom cwii tsˈaⁿ na nlcwaaⁿˈaⁿ ?

text: Jesus saith unto them , My meat is to do the will of him that sent me , and to finish his work .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Luaa waa na matseijomnaˈ nantquie ˈnaⁿya , na catsˈaaya yuu na lˈue tsˈom nqueⁿ na jñoom ja , hasta na jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na tyˈioom ja .

text: Say not ye , There are yet four months , and then cometh harvest ? behold , I say unto you , Lift up your eyes , and look on the fields ; for they are white already to harvest .
text2: ˈO waa ñˈoom tjañoomˈ na cwinduˈyoˈ na ñequiee chiˈ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ ndoˈ nntyjeendye nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ja matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ : Caleityˈiom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ndoˈ cantyˈiaˈyoˈ ndiocheⁿ na mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ chaˈcwijom ntjom na jnda ̱ tmaⁿ na nncwantjom tsˈaⁿ cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Matseijomnaˈ joona na jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na ntyjeeñe tsˈaⁿ .

text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages , and gathereth fruit unto life eternal : that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together .
text2: Juu tsˈaⁿ na matyjee ntjom na jnda ̱ tueˈ waa na mawantjoom ee matseitjoom nnˈaⁿ na nndaana na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ waa , juu tsˈaⁿ na manomˈ ntjom ñecwiixjeⁿ na nñequiaanaˈ na neiiⁿˈeⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na matyjee ntjom .

text: And herein is that saying true , One soweth , and another reapeth .
text2: Ee juu ñˈoom na cwilue nnˈaⁿ na cwii tsˈaⁿ manomˈ sa ̱ a ̱ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ matyjeeñe , ñˈoom na mayuuˈ joˈ .

text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour : other men laboured , and ye are entered into their labours .
text2: Na majño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo naquiiˈ tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaⁿya matseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom na cwitsacatyjeendyoˈ yuu na nchii ncjoˈyoˈ jlaˈcato ̱ ˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿ . Ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ jnda ̱ jlaˈnchuˈna na nncuaa tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom naquiiˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ ndoˈ ˈo jnda ̱ macwitsaquieˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman , which testified , He told me all that ever I did .
text2: Ndoˈ jndyendye nnˈaⁿ samaritanos tsjoomˈñeeⁿ tyolaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿ Jesús , cweˈ ncˈe ñˈoom ˈndyoo yuscuˈñeeⁿ na tjeiˈyuuˈñe nda ̱ a ̱ na na matso : “ Jnda ̱ tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chaˈtso na tijoˈndyo na jnda ̱ ñesˈaa . ”

text: So when the Samaritans were come unto him , they besought him that he would tarry with them : and he abode there two days .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tquieˈcañom nnˈaⁿ samaritanosˈñeeⁿ yuu na mˈaaⁿ Jesús , tyotaⁿna nnoom na caljooˈñê ñˈeⁿndyena , ndoˈ ljooˈñê tsjoomna we xuee .

text: And many more believed because of his own word ;
text2: Ndoˈ quia tyondyena ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ , jndyendyetina tyolaˈyuˈna .

text: And said unto the woman , Now we believe , not because of thy saying : for we have heard him ourselves , and know that this is indeed the Christ , the Saviour of the world .
text2: Ndoˈ tyoluena nnom yuscuˈñeeⁿ : — Jeˈ tachii macanda ̱ cweˈ ñˈoom na tsuˈ , joˈ chii cwilayuuˈâ . Ee mancjo ̱ o ̱ tya ̱ a ̱ yâ jnda ̱ jndya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom ˈñom . Jeˈ cwilaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ na jom mayuuˈcheⁿ cwiluiiñê Cristo na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: Now after two days he departed thence , and went into Galilee .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ teinom we xueeˈñeeⁿ jluiˈ Jesús joˈ joˈ . Saalcwa ̱ a ̱ ˈâ ñˈeⁿñê Galilea .

text: For Jesus himself testified , that a prophet hath no honour in his own country .
text2: Ee manquiityeeⁿ tjeiˈyuuˈñê na ticalaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ cwii profeta na mañeˈcwii ndyuaaⁿˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena .

text: Then when he was come into Galilee , the Galilaeans received him , having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast : for they also went unto the feast .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na squia ̱ a ̱ yâ Galilea ñˈeⁿñê nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ jeeⁿ neiiⁿna jom , jlaˈljona jom . Ee mati joona tyˈena Jerusalén quia tueeˈ ncuee Pascua , ndoˈ ntyˈiaana chaˈtso ˈnaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ na tyochˈeeⁿ joˈ joˈ .

text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee , where he made the water wine . And there was a certain nobleman , whose son was sick at Capernaum .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ saanndaaˈâ ñˈeⁿñê Caná tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea , yuu na seicwaqueeⁿ ndaa na sˈaanaˈ winom . Ndoˈ tsjoom Capernaum tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiitˈmaⁿñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ gobiernom . Tyochjoo , jnda tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , mˈaaⁿ na wiiˈ .

text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee , he went unto him , and besought him that he would come down , and heal his son : for he was at the point of death .
text2: Quia na jndii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na jnda ̱ squia ̱ a ̱ yâ Galilea ñˈeⁿ Jesús na jnaaⁿyâ Judea , tja tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na mˈaaⁿyâ . Sˈaa tyˈoo nnoom na cjaⁿ waaˈ , na catseinˈmaaⁿ tyochjoo jnda , ee juu mañeˈcueˈ .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Except ye see signs and wonders , ye will not believe .
text2: Ndoˈ matso Jesús nnom : — ˈO maxjeⁿ tixocalaˈyuˈyoˈ na waa najndo ̱ xeⁿ ticantyˈiaˈnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ na nntsˈaa yuu na xocanda ̱ a ̱ na nluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa .

text: The nobleman saith unto him , Sir , come down ere my child die .
text2: Nquii tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiitˈmaⁿñe ñˈeⁿ gobiernom tˈo ̱ ˈndyoo Jesús . Tso : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , majeˈndyo cjaˈ wˈaya , cwii tyooweˈ tiˈjndaaya .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Go thy way ; thy son liveth . And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him , and he went his way .
text2: Tso Jesús nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Cjaˈ ee maxjeⁿ nlcoˈyanaˈ tyochjoo jndaˈ . Ndoˈ juu tsaⁿsˈaˈñeeⁿ seiyoomˈm ñˈoom na tso Jesús . Tjalcweeⁿˈeⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And as he was now going down , his servants met him , and told him , saying , Thy son liveth .
text2: Ndoˈ yocheⁿ na mawjaaweⁿˈeⁿ Capernaum , tquiocatjomndye mosoomˈm . Jlaˈcandiina jom , jluena : — Jnda ̱ wjaacoˈyanaˈ tyochjoo jndaˈ .

text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend . And they said unto him , Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him .
text2: Taxˈeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ ljoˈ xjeⁿ jnaⁿnaˈ na tjacoˈyanaˈ jnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Wjacheⁿ chjooti na teinom na quiajmeiⁿˈ ˈndii tycu na matseiconaˈ jom .

text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour , in the which Jesus said unto him , Thy son liveth : and himself believed , and his whole house .
text2: Quia joˈ tsotye tyochjooˈñeeⁿ seiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na mañejuu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tso Jesús nnoom na nlcoˈyanaˈ tyochjoo jnaaⁿ . Ndoˈ seiyoomˈm ñˈeⁿ Jesús , mati chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ waⁿˈaⁿ .

text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did , when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee .
text2: Luaaˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na jnda ̱ we na sˈaa Jesús na tueⁿˈeⁿ Galilea na jnaaⁿ Judea , na juu tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ tixocaluii na cweˈ meiⁿnquia tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa .

text: After this there was a feast of the Jews ; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tuii nmeiⁿˈ , saayâ Jerusalén ñˈeⁿ Jesús ee tyowaa xuee na jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ .

text: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool , which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda , having five porches .
text2: Nnom tsjoom Jerusalén tyowaa cwii ˈndyootsˈa tˈmaⁿ na jlaˈcajndyuna ˈNdyootsˈa Canmaⁿ . Manndyooˈ juunaˈ tyowaa cwii peila tˈmaⁿ na ñequio ñˈoom hebreo jndyunaˈ Betesda . Ndiocheⁿ peilaˈñeeⁿ niom ˈom lˈaa na cweˈ wanaaⁿto .

text: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk , of blind , halt , withered , waiting for the moving of the water .
text2: Naquiiˈ lˈaaˈñeeⁿ tyomaⁿˈ cwii tmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿwii , ñˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿ , ñˈeⁿ nnˈaⁿ na tileicˈoocaˈ , ñequio nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ teintjeiⁿ luee , ncˈeeˈ . Tyomeindooˈna na nleiwo ̱ o ̱ ndaatioo na ñjom peilaˈñeeⁿ .

text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool , and troubled the water : whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had .
