text2: Ee tquiacheⁿ tquia mandyocue cwii ángel na matseitsja ̱ ndaatiooˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ tuii na ljoˈ , juu tsˈaⁿ najndyee na nncuo ̱ joˈ joˈ , nnˈmaⁿ meiⁿquia tycu na matjom .

text: And a certain man was there , which had an infirmity thirty and eight years .
text2: Joˈ joˈ tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa na jnda ̱ ntquiuu nchooˈ quii nchooˈ ñeeⁿ chu na wiiˈ .

text: When Jesus saw him lie , and knew that he had been now a long time in that case , he saith unto him , Wilt thou be made whole ?
text2: Ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús juu na waa . Ndoˈ ncˈe na ntyjeeⁿ na jnda ̱ teijndye xuee na matjom na luaaˈ , matsoom nnom : — ¿ Aa ñeˈcanˈmaⁿˈ ?

text: The impotent man answered him , Sir , I have no man , when the water is troubled , to put me into the pool : but while I am coming , another steppeth down before me .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na wiiˈ nnoom . Matso : — Ta , tjaa ˈñeeⁿ nnchjeeñe ja quiiˈ ndaa quia na cwitsja ̱ naˈ , ee yocheⁿ na matseijndo ̱ , cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ jnda ̱ teinomˈ ja .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Rise , take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Ndoˈ matso Jesús nnom : — Quicantyjaˈ , catseilcwiindyuˈ tsueˈ ndoˈ cjaˈcaˈ .

text: And immediately the man was made whole , and took up his bed , and walked : and on the same day was the sabbath .
text2: Mañoomˈ tcoˈyanaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , nˈmaaⁿ . Jnda ̱ joˈ seilcwiiñê tsuee ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na tjacaⁿ . Ndoˈ xueeˈñeeⁿ xuee na jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured , It is the sabbath day : it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed .
text2: Cweˈ joˈ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ judíos tyoluena nnom juu tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿ : — Jeˈ xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya . Ljeii na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ tinquiaanaˈ na wanaaⁿ na nncjaˈñˈoomˈ tsueˈ .

text: He answered them , He that made me whole , the same said unto me , Take up thy bed , and walk .
text2: Tˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Nquii tsˈaⁿ na seinˈmaⁿ ja matso no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na catseilcwiindyo ̱ tsuee ˈnaⁿya ndoˈ cjo ̱ ñˈo ̱ ⁿya juunaˈ .

text: Then asked they him , What man is that which said unto thee , Take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Taˈxˈee naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom , jluena : — ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na matso njomˈ na catseilcwiindyuˈ tsueˈ ndoˈ cjaˈcaˈ ?

text: And he that was healed wist not who it was : for Jesus had conveyed himself away , a multitude being in that place .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿ ticaljeiiⁿ ˈñeeⁿ seinˈmaⁿ jom . Ee ncˈe jndye nnˈaⁿ tyomˈaⁿ joˈ joˈ , joˈ chii teindyo ̱ o ̱ Jesús .

text: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple , and said unto him , Behold , thou art made whole : sin no more , lest a worse thing come unto thee .
text2: Jnda ̱ nquia ljeii Jesús tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Matsoom nnom : — Jeˈ queⁿˈ cwenta , jnda ̱ nˈmaⁿˈ , cjaˈmeintyjeˈ na matseiˈtjo ̱ o ̱ ndyuˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cha tintjomˈ cwii na cwajndiiticheⁿ .

text: The man departed , and told the Jews that it was Jesus , which had made him whole .
text2: Ndoˈ tsaⁿsˈaˈñeeⁿ tjacatsoom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos na nquii Jesús seinˈmaⁿ jom .

text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus , and sought to slay him , because he had done these things on the sabbath day .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ tyolˈuee nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ na catˈuiinaˈ Jesús . Tyojooˈ nˈomna na nlaˈcueeˈna jom , ee tyochˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿmeiⁿˈ meiiⁿ xuee na cwitaˈjndyeena .

text: But Jesus answered them , My Father worketh hitherto , and I work .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Jesús tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Tsotya ̱ ya ñequiiˈcheⁿ machˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ , ndoˈ mati ja .

text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him , because he not only had broken the sabbath , but said also that God was his Father , making himself equal with God .
text2: Jnaaⁿˈ ñˈoomwaaˈ nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ tyojooˈti nˈomna na nlaˈcueeˈna jom . Ee cantyja na cwitjeiiˈna cwenta nchii macanda ̱ na seitjo ̱ o ̱ ñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ xuee na cwitaˈjndyeena , sa ̱ a ̱ mati nquiuna na seitjo ̱ o ̱ ñê na tsoom na Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñe Tsotyeeⁿ , ee na laaˈtiˈ machˈeeⁿ na ñeˈcwii cwiluiiñê ñˈeⁿñe .

text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , The Son can do nothing of himself , but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth , these also doeth the Son likewise .
text2: Quia joˈ matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ticalatiuuˈyoˈ na ñequiiˈ cantyja na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nntsˈaa . Ja ñequiiˈcheⁿ cantyja na mantyˈia na machˈee Tsotya ̱ , joˈ na matsˈaa . Ee ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ , ñequiiˈcheⁿ matsˈaa chaˈxjeⁿ na mantyˈiaya na machˈeeⁿ .

text: For the Father loveth the Son , and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these , that ye may marvel .
text2: Ee Tsotya ̱ ya mˈaaⁿ na candyaˈ tsˈoom ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ . Maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chaˈtso na machˈeeⁿ . Ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ ⁿtyeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na tˈmaⁿti na catsˈaa cha catsˈaanaˈ na cjaaweeˈticheⁿ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead , and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will .
text2: Ee chaˈxjeⁿ nquii Tsotya ̱ ya mañequiaaⁿ na cwitandoˈ lˈoo , mati ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ meiⁿquia tsˈaⁿ na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ mañequia na tseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ .

text: For the Father judgeth no man , but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
text2: Tsotya ̱ ya meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ ticuˈxeeⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ jnda ̱ tquiaaⁿ chaˈwaati na nntuˈxeⁿndye nnˈaⁿ .

text: That all men should honour the Son , even as they honour the Father . He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him .
text2: Ee lˈue tsˈoom na ñecwii xjeⁿ calaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ , chaˈxjeⁿ cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na tiñeˈcatseitˈmaaⁿˈñe ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ meiⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya ticatseitˈmaaⁿˈñe tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that heareth my word , and believeth on him that sent me , hath everlasting life , and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life .
text2: ’ Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . ˈÑeeⁿ juu na mandii ñˈoom ˈndyo ̱ ndoˈ matseiyuˈ ñequio nqueⁿ na jñoom ja , juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ matseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ , meiⁿ ticatuˈxeⁿñe cantyja jnaaⁿˈ . Ñeseixmaⁿ na tsˈoo juu sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ matseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The hour is coming , and now is , when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ ndoˈ jeˈ maweˈntyjo ̱ naˈ quia na nndye nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ jndye ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ nñequia na nntaˈndoˈna .

text: For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
text2: Ee chaˈxjeⁿ nquii Tsotya ̱ ya matseixmaaⁿ na wanoomˈm cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nqueⁿ , malaaˈtiˈ jnda ̱ tquiaaⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ , na matseixmaⁿya na wando ̱ ˈa cantyja ˈnaⁿ nnco ̱ .

text: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also , because he is the Son of man .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ tquiaaⁿ najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ na ja nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿ nnˈaⁿ cantyja jnaaⁿna , ncˈe cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee .

text: Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming , in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice ,
text2: Tacalˈaˈyoˈ na jeeⁿ cwijaaweeˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na luaaˈ tsjo ̱ o ̱ ee nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na chaˈtso lˈoo na tooˈndye ndeiˈluaa , nndyena jndyeya .

text: And shall come forth ; they that have done good , unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil , unto the resurrection of damnation .
text2: Joo nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ñelˈa na matyˈiomyanaˈ , nntandoˈxcona na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna . Sa ̱ a ̱ joo nnˈaⁿ na tyoolaxmaⁿ na matyˈiomyanaˈ , nntandoˈnndaˈna na nntˈuiityeⁿnaˈ joona .

text: I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear , I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will , but the will of the Father which hath sent me .
text2: ’ Tjaa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa cantyja na matseixmaⁿ nnco ̱ . Chaˈxjeⁿ na matseijndo ̱ ˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , joˈ na macuˈxa ̱ ⁿ . Ndoˈ macuˈxa ̱ ⁿya chaˈxjeⁿ na matyˈiomyanaˈ . Ee nchii malˈueeˈndyo ̱ na nluii yuu na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nnco ̱ . Malˈueeˈndyo ̱ na nntsˈaa yuu na lˈue tsˈom Tsotya ̱ na jñom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: If I bear witness of myself , my witness is not true .
text2: Xeⁿ macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ticajnda ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ .

text: There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ mˈaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ na macwjiˈyuuˈñe cantyja ˈnaⁿya , majuu Juan . Ndoˈ ntyjiiyaya na juu ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ tseixmaⁿnaˈ na mayuuˈ .

text: Ye sent unto John , and he bare witness unto the truth .
text2: Mancjoˈyoˈ jñomˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ ndoˈ ñˈoom na tjeiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ñˈoom na mayuuˈ juunaˈ .

text: But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say , that ye might be saved .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ja ticantyjaaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ñˈoom na cwitjeiˈyuuˈndye nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya . Luaaˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nncwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyo ̱ ˈo .

text: He was a burning and a shining light : and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light .
text2: Juanˈñeeⁿ tyoseixmaaⁿ chaˈcwijom lámpara na matseixueenaˈ jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ ˈo xjeⁿ na ñetˈoom tˈomˈyoˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ ee nquiuˈyoˈ ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ chaˈcwijom seixueeñenaˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish , the same works that I do , bear witness of me , that the Father hath sent me .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ waa ñˈoom na macwjiˈyuuˈñenaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya na tˈmaⁿti cwiluiiñenaˈ , nchiiti ñˈoom na tjeiˈyuuˈñe Juan . Joo tsˈiaaⁿ na tquiaa Tsotya ̱ ya na catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyo ̱ na matsˈaa , joonaˈ cwitjeiˈyuuˈndyenaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya na nqueⁿ jñoom ja .

text: And the Father himself , which hath sent me , hath borne witness of me . Ye have neither heard his voice at any time , nor seen his shape .
text2: Ndoˈ nqueⁿ na jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ macwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaⁿya naquiiˈ ñˈoomˈm . ˈO meiⁿjom ndiiˈ tyoondyeˈyoˈ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ , meiⁿ na nntyˈiaˈyoˈ chiuu waaⁿ .

text: And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent , him ye believe not .
text2: Meiⁿ ñˈoomˈm ticˈoomnaˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , ee ˈo tiñeˈcalaˈyuˈyoˈ ñequio ja na jñoom .

text: Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me .
text2: Tcuu tcuu cwilaˈnaⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii teiyo ee cwilaˈtiuuˈyoˈ cweˈ na cwilˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ , joˈ na nndaˈyoˈ na ticantycwii na cwitandoˈyoˈ jo nnoom . Ndoˈ joonaˈ cwitjeiˈyuuˈndyenaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: And ye will not come to me , that ye might have life .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tiñeˈcalaˈjomndyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nlaxmaⁿˈyoˈ na ticantycwii na cwitandoˈyoˈ .

text: I receive not honour from men .
text2: ’ Ja ticantyjaaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ ja .

text: But I know you , that ye have not the love of God in you .
text2: Ee matseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa cantyja ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ na juu na mˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na candyaˈ tsˈoom nnˈaⁿ , ticalaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ joˈ .

text: I am come in my Father ' s name , and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name , him ye will receive .
text2: Mˈaaⁿya quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ ñequio xueeˈ Tsotya ̱ ya , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo ticalaˈljoˈyoˈ ja . Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ nncwjeeˈ ñequio xueeˈ nquii , maxjeⁿ nlaˈljoˈyoˈ juu .

text: How can ye believe , which receive honour one of another , and seek not the honour that cometh from God only ?
text2: ˈO cwilˈueˈyoˈ na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye ncˈiaˈyoˈ ˈo , sa ̱ a ̱ ticalˈueˈyoˈ na ntseitˈmaaⁿˈñe nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈo . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ cwilˈaˈyoˈ , tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nlaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you , even Moses , in whom ye trust .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ticalaˈtiuuˈyoˈ na mannco ̱ tya ̱ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ jnaⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tsotya ̱ . Mˈaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ na mañequiaa jnaⁿˈyoˈ , manquiiti Moisés , tsaⁿ na jeeⁿ cwicantyjaaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: For had ye believed Moses , ye would have believed me : for he wrote of me .
text2: Xeⁿ cwilaˈyuˈyoˈ ñequio Moisés , quia joˈ mati nlaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ee seiljeiⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: But if ye believe not his writings , how shall ye believe my words ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ ˈo tiñeˈcalaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈoom na seiljeiⁿ , quia joˈ ¿ chiuu ya nlˈaˈyoˈ na nlaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈoom na matseina ̱ ⁿ ?

text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee , which is the sea of Tiberias .
text2: Jnda ̱ teinom na nmeiiⁿˈ , teityˈio ̱ o ̱ ˈâ ndaaluee Galilea ñˈeⁿ Jesús na mati jndyu juunaˈ Tiberias .

text: And a great multitude followed him , because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased .
text2: Ndoˈ cwii tmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye tyˈentyjo ̱ na naxeeⁿˈeⁿ ee jnda ̱ ntyˈiaanda ̱ a ̱ na tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ na tyochˈeeⁿ na tyotseinˈmaaⁿ nnˈaⁿwii .

text: And Jesus went up into a mountain , and there he sat with his disciples .
text2: Quia joˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ , saawaayâ cwii sjo ̱ ñˈeⁿñê . Joˈ joˈ saawindyuaandyô ̱ .

text: And the passover , a feast of the Jews , was nigh .
text2: Ndoˈ quia ljoˈ manndyooˈ nncueeˈ xuee pascua na jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilacwja ̱ a ̱ ya canmaⁿ .

text: When Jesus then lifted up his eyes , and saw a great company come unto him , he saith unto Philip , Whence shall we buy bread , that these may eat ?
text2: Ndoˈ Jesús jleityˈiom nnoom , mantyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ jnda ̱ manquioquie cwii tmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye . Quia joˈ matsoom nnom Felipe : — ¿ Yuu nlaˈjndaaya nantquie cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nlcwaˈ chaˈtsondye naⁿmˈaⁿˈ ?

text: And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do .
text2: Luaaˈ matsoom cha nleitquiooˈ chiuu mˈaaⁿˈ tsˈom Felipe . Ee nqueⁿ mantyjiicheeⁿ ljoˈ nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: Philip answered him , Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them , that every one of them may take a little .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Felipe nnoom , matso : — Meiⁿ xeⁿ we siaⁿnto sˈom denarios na nlacatsuuya na nlaˈjndaaya ntyooˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ maxjeⁿ xocwijndeii juunaˈ na nlcwaˈ cwii cwii joona meiiⁿ ñeˈchjoowiˈ .

text: One of his disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter ' s brother , saith unto him ,
text2: Cwii ncjo ̱ o ̱ ndyô ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwindya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ , tsaⁿ na jndyu Andrés , tyjee Simón Pedro , matso nnom Jesús :

text: There is a lad here , which hath five barley loaves , and two small fishes : but what are they among so many ?
text2: — Ñjaaⁿ mˈaaⁿ cwii tyochjoo na maleiñˈoom ˈom taⁿˈ tyooˈ na tuiinaˈ ñequio jnda ̱ a ̱ tyooˈ lqueeⁿ cebada ñˈeⁿ we catscaa chjoo na jnda ̱ jneiiⁿ sa ̱ a ̱ ¿ cwaaⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ nmeiⁿˈ na jndyendye nnˈaⁿ ?

text: And Jesus said , Make the men sit down . Now there was much grass in the place . So the men sat down , in number about five thousand .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Canduˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwindyuaandyena . Ndoˈ joˈ joˈ jndye jnda ̱ nchˈu niom . Quia joˈ teindyuaandye nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ tueeˈ chaˈna ˈom meiⁿndye naⁿnom .

text: And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks , he distributed to the disciples , and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would .
text2: Quia joˈ toˈñom Jesús ntyooˈñeeⁿ . Tquiaaⁿ na quianlˈuaaˈ Tsotyeeⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ joonaˈ . Jnda ̱ joˈ tyocˈoom joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê . Ndoˈ jâ tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na meindyuaandye . Ndoˈ malaaˈtiˈ sˈaaⁿ ñequio calcaa nchˈu , cwanti na ñeˈcatquiina na cwii cwiindyena .

text: When they were filled , he said unto his disciples , Gather up the fragments that remain , that nothing be lost .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tjacjoona , quia joˈ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tsoom : — Calaˈtjomˈyoˈ ntaⁿˈ cajnda ̱ a ̱ na ˈndiinaˈ cha tintsˈaanaˈ na cweˈ nleiˈndaaˈnaˈ .

text: Therefore they gathered them together , and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves , which remained over and above unto them that had eaten .
text2: Ndoˈ jlatjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ntaⁿˈ ntyooˈ na ˈndiinaˈ na tcwaˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ na tuiinaˈ ñˈeⁿ jnda ̱ a ̱ tyooˈ cebada . Jlaˈcato ̱ o ̱ ˈâ canchooˈwe tsquiee ñˈeⁿ joonaˈ .

text: Then those men , when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did , said , This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world .
text2: Ndoˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , jnda ̱ na ntyˈiaana tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ na sˈaaⁿ na maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na waa najndeii na cwiluiiñê , tyoluena : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ cwiluiiñê nquii profeta na mawaa ljeii na matsonaˈ na nncwjeˈcañoom tsjoomnancue na nñequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force , to make him a king , he departed again into a mountain himself alone .
text2: Ndoˈ seiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ Jesús na mawaa xjeⁿ na nnquiocˈom naⁿˈñeeⁿ jom ndoˈ ñequio najndeiˈnaˈ na nlqueⁿna jom na nluiiñê rey . Cweˈ joˈ cwiicheⁿ cwii ndiiˈ tjannaaⁿˈaⁿ na ñenqueⁿ jo sjo ̱ .

text: And when even was now come , his disciples went down unto the sea ,
text2: Ndoˈ quia na tueeˈ na jnda ̱ tmaaⁿ , jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaⁿ Jesús na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , saacua ̱ a ̱ yâ , squia ̱ a ̱ yâ ˈndyoo ndaaluee .

text: And entered into a ship , and went over the sea toward Capernaum . And it was now dark , and Jesus was not come to them .
text2: Joˈ joˈ tuo ̱ o ̱ yâ cwii wˈaandaa , na nncwityˈio ̱ o ̱ ˈâ ndaaluee na nntsquia ̱ a ̱ yâ Capernaum . Ndoˈ quia tueeˈ na teijaaⁿ , ticandoˈ na nncwjeˈcañoom jâ .

text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew .
text2: Ndoˈ ncˈe na jndeii tioo jndye tyotseiwenaˈ ndaalueeˈñeeⁿ .

text: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs , they see Jesus walking on the sea , and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid .
text2: Joˈ chii ñeˈom oo yom kilómetros jnda ̱ tjacaa wˈaandaaˈñeeⁿ na cwicantyjaandyô ̱ nˈoom palaˈ . Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ ntyˈiaayâ na mandyocaa Jesús nnom ndaaluee na matseicandyooˈñê na mˈaaⁿyâ . Jeeⁿ ndyaˈ jlaˈcatyuendyô ̱ .

text: But he saith unto them , It is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Mannco ̱ luaañe , tilacatyuendyoˈ .

text: Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went .
text2: Jeeⁿ ndyaˈ neiiⁿyâ sˈaanaˈ na toˈño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ jom tsˈom wˈaandaa . Ndoˈ mantyjacheⁿ tueˈcañoom juunaˈ yuu na cwitsaayâ .

text: The day following , when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there , save that one whereinto his disciples were entered , and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat , but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
text2: Ndoˈ teincoo cwiicheⁿ xuee , nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye na ljooˈndye xndyaaˈ ndaaluee yuu na tquiaa Jesús na tcwaˈna , tyoqueⁿna cwenta na ñeˈcwii wˈaandaa chjoo ñetuaa . Tjañjoomˈ nˈomna na tîcuo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ juunaˈ ñequiondyô ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ .

text: ( Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread , after that the Lord had given thanks : )
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ lˈaandaa nchˈu na jnaⁿ Tiberias , tquieˈcañomnaˈ yuu na tcwaˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ ntyooˈñeeⁿ na jnda ̱ tquiaa Ta Jesús na quianlˈuaaˈ Tsotyeeⁿ .

text: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there , neither his disciples , they also took shipping , and came to Capernaum , seeking for Jesus .
text2: Quia joˈ tuo ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ lˈaandaa nchˈuˈñeeⁿ . Tyˈena tquiena Capernaum na tyˈecalˈueena Jesús . Ee jlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na tacˈoomñê yuu na tquiaaⁿ na tcwaˈna , meiⁿ jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ .

text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea , they said unto him , Rabbi , when camest thou hither ?
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ jliuna Jesús cwiicheⁿ xndyaaˈ ndaaluee , tyoluena nnoom : — Maestro , ¿ ljoˈ xjeⁿ jndyoˈ luaa ?

text: Jesus answered them and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Ye seek me , not because ye saw the miracles , but because ye did eat of the loaves , and were filled .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ na matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . ˈO cwilˈueˈyaˈyoˈ ja nchii ncˈe na ntyˈiaˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na sˈaa na tixocanda ̱ a ̱ ntsˈaa cweˈ meiⁿquia tsˈaⁿ sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ncˈe na tcwaˈyoˈ tyooˈ na tquiaanaˈ na tjacjoˈyoˈ .

text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth , but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life , which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed .
text2: ˈO cwijooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na nleijndaaˈ nantquie , ndoˈ joonaˈ ˈnaⁿ na cwileiˈndaaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ticatyˈiomnaˈ na cwilˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ . Calajnda ̱ ˈyoˈ na nliuˈyoˈ cwii na chaˈcwijom nantquie na cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu joˈ nlaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ na ticantycwii na cwitandoˈyoˈ . Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee nñequia juu na matseijomnaˈ nantquie naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ee Tsotya ̱ ya Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na jnda ̱ tqueeⁿ ja tsˈiaaⁿmeiiⁿ .

text: Then said they unto him , What shall we do , that we might work the works of God ?
text2: Quia joˈ ntˈomndyena jluena nnoom : — ¿ Ljoˈ macaⁿnaˈ na calˈaayâ cha na nncjaaweeˈ ntyjii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jâ ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , This is the work of God , that ye believe on him whom he hath sent .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Luaa waa na lˈue tsˈoom ñˈeⁿndyoˈ na calaˈyuˈyoˈ ñequio ja na jñoom .

text: They said therefore unto him , What sign shewest thou then , that we may see , and believe thee ? what dost thou work ?
text2: Joˈ chii tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom : — ¿ Cwaaⁿ cwii nnom na nntsaˈ nntyˈiaayâ na tixocaluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa cha mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ na waa na cwiluiindyuˈ ndoˈ cha na nlaˈyuuˈâ ñˈeⁿndyuˈ ?

text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written , He gave them bread from heaven to eat .
text2: Nquiee weloo welooya tyocwaˈna maná quia tyomˈaⁿna ndyuaa yuu na tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈom , chaˈxjeⁿ na matso ljeii ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiyo teiljeii : “ Tquiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tyooˈ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na tcwaˈna . ”

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Juu maná na tquiaa Moisés nchii cwiluiiñenaˈ tyooˈ na jnaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Sa ̱ a ̱ nquii Tsotya ̱ ya mañequiaaⁿ juu na mayuuˈ na jnaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ cañoomˈluee na matseijomnaˈ juu chaˈna tyooˈ .

text: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven , and giveth life unto the world .
text2: Juu na cwiluiiñe tyooˈ na mañequiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , cañoomˈluee jnaⁿ jndyocue . Juu mañequiaa na laˈxmaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna .

text: Then said they unto him , Lord , evermore give us this bread .
text2: Quia joˈ tyoluena nnoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , ñenquiiˈcheⁿ quiaaˈ tyooˈmeiⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ .

text: And Jesus said unto them , I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tyooˈ na mañequiaya na laˈxmaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna . ˈÑeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na nntioñe lˈo ̱ o ̱ , matseijomnaˈ juu chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tjacjooˈ na macwaˈ . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ nquioo na teiiⁿ naquiiˈ tsˈom chaˈna quia maˈuu tsˈaⁿ ndaa .

text: But I said unto you , That ye also have seen me , and believe not .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ chaˈna ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , meiiⁿ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaˈnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa , maxjeⁿ tîcalaˈyuˈyoˈ .

text: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out .
text2: Chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ na mañequiaa Tsotya ̱ ya lˈo ̱ o ̱ , nntioondyena lˈo ̱ o ̱ . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na nntioñe lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya tijoom nntsˈaa na ticoˈño ̱ ⁿ juu .

text: For I came down from heaven , not to do mine own will , but the will of him that sent me .
text2: Ee ja na jnaaⁿya caáoomˈluee nchii na jndyo ̱ o ̱ na catsˈaa ljoˈ na lˈue tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jndyo ̱ o ̱ na catsˈaaya yuu na lˈue tsˈom nqueⁿ na jñoom ja .

text: And this is the Father ' s will which hath sent me , that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing , but should raise it up again at the last day .
text2: Ndoˈ Tsotya ̱ ya na jñoom ja luaa waa na lˈue tsˈoom na catsˈaa , na chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tquiaaⁿ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya , meiⁿcwiindye joona ticatsuuñe añmaaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ xuee na macanda ̱ nñequia na nntaˈndoˈxco chaˈtsondye joona .

text: And this is the will of him that sent me , that every one which seeth the Son , and believeth on him , may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Ee Tsotya ̱ ya lˈue tsˈoom na chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na cwintyˈiaa ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ na cwilaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ nntoˈñoomna na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna . Ndoˈ xuee na macanda ̱ ja nñequia na nntaˈndoˈxco joo nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ .

text: The Jews then murmured at him , because he said , I am the bread which came down from heaven .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tso Jesús ñˈoomwaaˈ , tyolaˈncjooˈndye nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ ñˈoom na tsoom : “ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tyooˈ na jnaaⁿya cañoomˈluee . ”

text: And they said , Is not this Jesus , the son of Joseph , whose father and mother we know ? how is it then that he saith , I came down from heaven ?
text2: Ee tyoluena : — Jesúsmˈaaⁿˈ ¿ aa nchii jnda José jom ? Cwitaˈjnaaⁿˈa tsotyeeⁿ , tsoñeeⁿ . ¿ Chiuu na tsoom na jnaaⁿ cañoomˈluee , jndyocueeⁿ ?

text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them , Murmur not among yourselves .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Talaˈncjooˈndyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ñˈoomwaaˈ .

text: No man can come to me , except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Ee tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntioñe lˈo ̱ o ̱ xeⁿ nchii Tsotya ̱ na jñoom ja nntsˈaaⁿ na catsˈaa tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na ljoˈ . Ndoˈ xuee na macanda ̱ ja nntsˈaa na nncwandoˈxco tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: It is written in the prophets , And they shall be all taught of God . Every man therefore that hath heard , and hath learned of the Father , cometh unto me .
text2: Ee profetas , waa ñˈoom na jlaˈljeiina na matsonaˈ : “ Mˈmo ̱ ⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ . ” Luaaˈ ñeˈcatsonaˈ na ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ jndii ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ ⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ jnda ̱ seiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ juunaˈ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nntioñe lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya .

text: Not that any man hath seen the Father , save he which is of God , he hath seen the Father .
text2: ’ Ñˈoomwaaˈ ticaˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaˈ tsˈaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Macanda ̱ ja na jñoom quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ , ja jnda ̱ ntyˈiano ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jom .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me hath everlasting life .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ñeeⁿ juu na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ juu matseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ añmaaⁿˈ .

text: I am that bread of life .
text2: Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tyooˈ na mañequiaya na cwitaˈndoˈ nnˈaⁿ .

text: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness , and are dead .
text2: Weloo welooˈyoˈ tcwaˈna maná jo ndyuaa yuu na tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈom , ndoˈ tja ̱ na .

text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven , that a man may eat thereof , and not die .
text2: Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tyooˈ na jnaaⁿya cañoomˈluee . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nlcwaˈ , tixocatsuuñe .

text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread , he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh , which I will give for the life of the world .
text2: Ja na jnaaⁿya cañoomˈluee cwiluiindyo ̱ tyooˈ na mañequiaya na cwitaˈndoˈ nnˈaⁿ . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nlcwaˈ tyooˈwaa mamatseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ . Ndoˈ juu tyooˈ na mañequiaya cha na nntaˈndoˈna jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , seiiˈa cwiluiiñe Joˈ .

text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves , saying , How can this man give us his flesh to eat ?
text2: Ñˈoomwaaˈ sˈaanaˈ na jlaˈncjooˈndye nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ ñequio ncˈiaana . Tyoluena : — Manquiuuya na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nñequiaa tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ seiiⁿˈeⁿ na nntquia ̱ a ̱

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man , and drink his blood , ye have no life in you .
text2: Quia joˈ tsoticheⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , xeⁿ ticatquieˈyoˈ seiiˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee ndoˈ na cweˈyoˈ nioomˈa , ticalaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na tandoˈ añmaaⁿ .

text: Whoso eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day .
text2: Nquii tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tquii seiiˈa ndoˈ jnda ̱ tˈuu nioomˈa tseixmaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ . Ndoˈ xuee na macanda ̱ nntsˈaaya na nncwandoˈxcoom .

text: For my flesh is meat indeed , and my blood is drink indeed .
text2: Ee seiiˈa matseixmaⁿnaˈ nantquie na tjacantyja naya ndoˈ nioomˈa matseixmaⁿnaˈ juu na nncˈuu tsˈaⁿ na tjacantyja naya .

text: He that eateth my flesh , and drinketh my blood , dwelleth in me , and I in him .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na maquii seiiˈa ndoˈ maˈuu nioomˈa , tyeⁿ matseitjoomˈnaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ndoˈ tyeⁿ matseitjoomˈnaˈ ja ñˈeⁿñê .

text: As the living Father hath sent me , and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me , even he shall live by me .
text2: Nquii Tsotya ̱ ya na jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ , jom wanoomˈm ndoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ mati wando ̱ ˈa . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ ñˈeⁿ tsˈaⁿ na maquii seiiˈa , nncwandoˈ añmaaⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna , and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever .
text2: Matseina ̱ ⁿya cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nquii na cwiluiiñe tyooˈ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Tyooˈwaa titseixmaⁿnaˈ chaˈna maná na tcwaˈ weloo weloˈyoˈ ndoˈ tja ̱ na . Sa ̱ a ̱ ticatseijomnaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya chaˈna manáˈñeeⁿ . Ee meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nlcwaˈ tyooˈ na matseixmaⁿya , tijoom nncueˈ , mˈaaⁿ ndoˈ mˈaaⁿ na wandoˈ .

text: These things said he in the synagogue , as he taught in Capernaum .
text2: Ñˈoommeiⁿˈ seineiⁿ Jesús yocheⁿ na tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ quiiˈ watsˈom ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos tsjoom Capernaum .

text: Many therefore of his disciples , when they had heard this , said , This is an hard saying ; who can hear it ?
text2: Majndye nnˈaⁿ na tyolaˈjomndye ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ , quia jndyena ñˈoomwaaˈ jluena : — Jeeⁿ jndeiˈnaˈ ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ , tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nlajomndyo ̱ juunaˈ .

text: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it , he said unto them , Doth this offend you ?
text2: Ntyjii Jesús naquiiˈ tsˈoom na cwilaˈncjooˈndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ cantyja ñˈoom na seineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Joˈ chii tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ¿ Aa cwilaˈlcweˈ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ ˈo ?

text: What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before ?
text2: Quia joˈ cˈoomˈyaya nˈomˈyoˈ chiuu nntsˈaanaˈ ˈo quia nntyˈiaˈnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na nncjo ̱ waanndaˈa nandye yuu na ñetˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿjndya ̱ a ̱ .

text: It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you , they are spirit , and they are life .
text2: Macanda ̱ nquii Espíritu mañequiaaⁿ na cwitaˈndoˈ nnˈaⁿ jo nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Nchii cantyja ˈnaaⁿ seiina na laˈxmaⁿna na ljoˈ . Ñˈoom na mañequiaya cwiluiiñenaˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu ndoˈ ncˈe juunaˈ joˈ na wandoˈ tsˈaⁿ .

text: But there are some of you that believe not . For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not , and who should betray him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ndicwaⁿ ñˈeeⁿˈndyoˈ na ticalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Luaaˈ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na ee cantyjati na to ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na mañequiaaⁿ ñˈoom , mantyjeeⁿ ˈñeeⁿ joo na ticalaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê , ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na nñequiaa cwenta jom .

text: And he said , Therefore said I unto you , that no man can come unto me , except it were given unto him of my Father .
text2: Matsotyeeⁿcheⁿ : — Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ macanda ̱ nnda ̱ a ̱ ntseijomñe tsˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ quia mañequiaa Tsotya ̱ ya na caluii na ljoˈ .

text: From that time many of his disciples went back , and walked no more with him .
text2: Ndoˈ ncˈe ñˈoomwaaˈ , majndye nnˈaⁿ na tyondyejndyeena ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ , tyˈelcweeˈna . Taticalaˈjomndyetina ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then said Jesus unto the twelve , Will ye also go away ?
text2: Joˈ na taxˈeeñê nda ̱ a ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwe na tˈmaaⁿ na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , matsoom : — Ndoˈ ˈo jeˈ ¿ aa mati nnto ̱ ⁿˈndyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ?

text: Then Simon Peter answered him , Lord , to whom shall we go ? thou hast the words of eternal life .
text2: Simón Pedro tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , matsoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , ticatsonaˈ na nlaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ , ee ñˈoom na matseineiⁿˈ mañequiaanaˈ na ticantycwii na cwitando ̱ o ̱ ˈâ .

text: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ , the Son of the living God .
text2: Ndoˈ jâ jnda ̱ macwilaˈyuuˈâ ndoˈ jnda ̱ macwilaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ na ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Cristo , Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na wandoˈ .

text: Jesus answered them , Have not I chosen you twelve , and one of you is a devil ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Ja tjeiiˈa ˈo na canchooˈwendyoˈ . Ndoˈ cwii ˈo mˈaaⁿñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿjndii .

text: He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him , being one of the twelve .
text2: Luaaˈ matsoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ Judas Iscariote , jnda Simón . Ee tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nñequiaa cwenta jom . Mati juu cwii jâ na canchooˈwendyô ̱ .

text: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry , because the Jews sought to kill him .
text2: Jnda ̱ tuii na nmeiiⁿˈ tyomaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea ñˈeⁿ Jesús . Ee jnaaⁿˈ na tyoqueⁿndye nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos na ñeˈcalaˈcueeˈna jom , joˈ chii tiñeˈcjaⁿ Judea .

text: Now the Jews ' feast of tabernacles was at hand .
text2: Ndoˈ jaawindyooˈ na nncueeˈ ncuee na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ judíos quia na quilˈana xeⁿnquieˈ ncwaⁿˈ na cwijaañjoomˈ nˈomna chiuu ñetˈom weloo weloona ndyuˈñeeⁿcheⁿ .

text: His brethren therefore said unto him , Depart hence , and go into Judaea , that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest .
text2: Ndoˈ na manncueeˈ xueeˈñeeⁿ tyolue ntyjeeⁿ nnoom : — Cwa sa , caluiˈ ñjaaⁿñe . Cjaˈ Judea cha nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ laˈñeⁿ na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈoom na mañequiaaˈ mati nntyˈiaana tsˈiaaⁿ na macheˈ .

text: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret , and he himself seeketh to be known openly . If thou do these things , shew thyself to the world .
text2: Ee tsˈaⁿ na matseicantyjaaˈ tsˈom na calaˈyuˈ nnˈaⁿ ñˈeⁿñe , ticatsonaˈ na nljooˈñe jo jnda ̱ a ̱ . Quiaandyuˈ na caliu chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na macheˈ .

text: For neither did his brethren believe in him .
text2: Nmeiiⁿˈ jluena nnoom ee meiⁿ joona tîcalaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then Jesus said unto them , My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready .
text2: Quia joˈ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Tyooweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na caˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye na cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo meiⁿquia xjeⁿ na ñeˈconomˈyoˈ , tjaaˈnaⁿ na teincuuˈ .

text: The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth , because I testify of it , that the works thereof are evil .
text2: Joo nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue tijndoona ˈo . Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿ ja luaañe , ñequiiˈcheⁿ mˈaⁿna na jndoona ja , cweˈ ncˈe na macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ natia na cwilˈana .

text: Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast ; for my time is not yet full come .
text2: Tsaˈyoˈ na ñencjoˈyoˈ xueewaaˈ , ja tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nncjo ̱ xuee . Ee tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseicaˈmo ̱ ⁿndyo ̱ na cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii na macwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñe nnˈaⁿ .

text: When he had said these words unto them , he abode still in Galilee .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ na tsoom na luaaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ na , ljooˈñetyeeⁿ we ndyee xuee Galilea .

text: But when his brethren were gone up , then went he also up unto the feast , not openly , but as it were in secret .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ na tyˈe ntyjeeⁿ na tueeˈ xuee , quia joˈ mati jom tjantyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ tîtseicaˈmo ̱ ⁿñê nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Tjaaⁿ chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na ticalˈue tsˈom na caliu nnˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ .

text: Then the Jews sought him at the feast , and said , Where is he ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos na ticueeˈ nˈomna jom jeeⁿ tyolˈueena jom quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na tquio ncuee . Tyotaˈxˈeena , tyoluena : — ¿ Yuu mˈaaⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ?

text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said , He is a good man : others said , Nay ; but he deceiveth the people .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈmaⁿ waa na ticatjoomˈ na jlaˈneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Ee cwantindye joona tyolue : “ Ya tsˈaⁿñe tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ . ” Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ tyolue : “ Tiyuuˈ , ee manquiuˈnnˈaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ . ”

text: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ncˈe na nquiaana nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ na , joˈ na tîcalaˈneiⁿndyeyuna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple , and taught .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tueeˈ xcwe ncuee , tjaqueⁿˈeⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ndoˈ joˈ joˈ tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ .

text: And the Jews marvelled , saying , How knoweth this man letters , having never learned ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tileicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwiluiitquiendye . Tyoluena : — Nchaaˈ lˈuu na tja tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ scwela . Quia joˈ ¿ chiuu na jeeⁿ ya matseitjoomˈm ñˈoom ?

text: Jesus answered them , and said , My doctrine is not mine , but his that sent me .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Nchii nnco ̱ matseijndaaˈndyo ̱ ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya . Nqueⁿ na jñoom ja seijndaaˈñê chiuu catsjo ̱ o ̱ ya .

text: If any man will do his will , he shall know of the doctrine , whether it be of God , or whether I speak of myself .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ñeˈcatsˈaa cantyja na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , juu nntseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ aa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom seijndaaˈñe ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , oo aa cweˈ ñˈoom na seitiuu nnco ̱ na mañequiaya .

text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him , the same is true , and no unrighteousness is in him .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na macwjiˈ ñˈoom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nquii , matseijndeii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na caluiitˈmaⁿñê nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ tsˈaⁿ na matseijndeii na catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ nquii na jñom jom , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê na mayomˈm . Tiquinquiuˈnnˈaaⁿ .

text: Did not Moses give you the law , and yet none of you keepeth the law ? Why go ye about to kill me ?
text2: ’ Moisés seiljeiⁿ ñˈoom na tqueⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na ljoˈ , meiⁿcwiindyoˈ ˈo tyoolaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyoˈ juunaˈ . Ee xeⁿ cwilaˈcanda ̱ ˈyoˈ juunaˈ xoqueⁿndyoˈ na nlacueˈyoˈ ja .

text: The people answered and said , Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee ?
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — ˈU tsaⁿjndii matseixmaⁿˈ . ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ tsˈaⁿ maqueⁿñe na nntseicueeˈ ˈu ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , I have done one work , and ye all marvel .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya seinˈmaⁿya tsˈaⁿ na leicjacaa , ndoˈ sˈaanaˈ na tjoomˈ ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; ( not because it is of Moses , but of the fathers ; ) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoom na nntsjo ̱ o ̱ . Tso Moisés na calˈaˈyoˈ costumbre yonom ndaˈyoˈ na ˈndaandye . Ndoˈ cwilaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ meiiⁿ xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya . Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii jom seicato ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ costumbreˈñeeⁿ . Nquiee weloo welooya jlaˈcato ̱ o ̱ ˈna juunaˈ .

text: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision , that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me , because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day ?
text2: Nquiuˈyoˈ na mañequiaa ljeii na tqueeⁿ na wanaaⁿ na cwilˈaˈyoˈ costumbreˈñeeⁿ meiⁿ xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ waa , chiuu na cwilaˈwjeeˈyoˈ ja ncˈe na juu xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya seinˈmaⁿya cwii tsˈaⁿ na wiiˈ .

text: Judge not according to the appearance , but judge righteous judgment .
text2: Joˈ chii tintjeiˈyoˈ cwenta na cweˈ tomti cantyja na cwiwitquiooˈ . Catjeiˈyoˈ cwenta cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ .

text: Then said some of them of Jerusalem , Is not this he , whom they seek to kill ?
text2: Quia joˈ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ Jerusalén tyotaˈxˈeena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — ¿ Aa nchii tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ tsˈaⁿ na cwilˈuee naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ na nlaˈcueeˈna ?

text: But , lo , he speaketh boldly , and they say nothing unto him . Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyˈiaˈyoˈ ñequio na jndooˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ matseineiiⁿ , meiⁿ tjaa ljoˈ coluena nnoom . ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na cwilaˈtiuu naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ cwentaaya na tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ mayuuˈcheⁿ cwiluiiñê Cristo ?

text: Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh , no man knoweth whence he is .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nqueⁿ quia nncwjeeⁿˈeⁿ tjaa ˈñeeⁿ juu nntseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ yuu jnaⁿyom . Sa ̱ a ̱ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ manquiuuyaaya yuu jnaaⁿ .

text: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught , saying , Ye both know me , and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself , but he that sent me is true , whom ye know not .
text2: Jnda ̱ jndii Jesús na jluena ñˈoomwaaˈ , seiweeⁿ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ . Matsoom : — Machˈeenaˈ na cwitaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ ja ndoˈ manquiuˈyaˈyoˈ yuu tsˈaⁿ ja . Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii na jndyo ̱ o ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿ nnco ̱ . Nqueⁿ na jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ cwiluiiñê na mayomˈm , sa ̱ a ̱ jom ticataˈnaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: But I know him : for I am from him , and he hath sent me .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ja mawajnaⁿˈa jom , ee jnaaⁿya jo nnoom , ndoˈ manquiityeeⁿ jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him , because his hour was not yet come .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe na tsoom ñˈoomwaaˈ , tyoqueⁿndye naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ na nntˈuena jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe na tyooweˈntyjo ̱ na ntyjii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nncwinoom nawiˈ tˈmaⁿ , joˈ chii meiⁿcwiindyena tîcatˈuii jom .

text: And many of the people believed on him , and said , When Christ cometh , will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done ?
text2: Ndoˈ jndyendye nnˈaⁿ na tyomˈaⁿna joˈ joˈ , jlaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê . Ndoˈ tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — Quia nncwjeeˈ nquii Cristo , ¿ aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ jndyeti tsˈiaaⁿ nntsˈaaⁿ na tixocanda ̱ a ̱ na nluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa nchiiti na machˈee tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ ?

text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos tyondyena na nmeiiⁿˈ ñˈoom tyolaˈneiⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús . Joˈ chii jlaˈjomndyena ñequio ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana nnˈaⁿ judíos . Jñoomna nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta watsˈom na cˈoocatˈue naⁿˈñeeⁿ jom .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Yet a little while am I with you , and then I go unto him that sent me .
text2: Matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye : — Chjootindyo cwii mˈaaⁿtya ̱ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Ndoˈ nda ̱ nquia nncjo ̱ lcwa ̱ ˈnndaˈa na mˈaaⁿ nqueⁿ na jñoom ja na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come .
text2: Quia ljoˈcheⁿ nlˈueˈyoˈ ja sa ̱ a ̱ taxocaliuˈyoˈ ja . Ndoˈ yuu na nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , ˈo xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsquieˈcañomˈyoˈ .

text: Then said the Jews among themselves , Whither will he go , that we shall not find him ? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles , and teach the Gentiles ?
text2: Quia joˈ ntˈom nnˈaaⁿya nnˈaⁿ judíos tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — ¿ Yuu nncjaayuu tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nliuuya jom ? ¿ Aa nncˈoomñê quiiˈntaaⁿ ncˈiaaya nnˈaⁿ judíos na jnda ̱ tˈoomˈndye quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ griegos , cha nnda ̱ a ̱ mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na ?

text: What manner of saying is this that he said , Ye shall seek me , and shall not find me : and where I am , thither ye cannot come ?
text2: ¿ Ljoˈ ñeˈcatso ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ luaaˈ na nlˈua ̱ a ̱ ya jom sa ̱ a ̱ xocaliuuya jom ? Ndoˈ na matsoom yuu na wjaⁿ jaa xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsquia ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jom .

text: In the last day , that great day of the feast , Jesus stood and cried , saying , If any man thirst , let him come unto me , and drink .
text2: Xuee na cwintycwii ncuee cwilˈana na tˈmaⁿti xuee juunaˈ na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena . Juu xueeˈñeeⁿ tjameintyjeeˈ Jesús , seiweeⁿ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ . Tsoom : — ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseiqueeⁿnaˈ tsˈom na ñecˈoomñe nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , candyontyjo ̱ naxa ̱ ⁿˈa , ndoˈ catseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: He that believeth on me , as the scripture hath said , out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water .
text2: Nntsˈaanaˈ ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ matso ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na jnda ̱ teiljeii . Juu tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , nnaaⁿˈ quiiˈ tsˈoom chaˈcwijom candaa na cwiñeˈquia na ticantycwii na wandoˈ tsˈaⁿ .

text: ( But this spake he of the Spirit , which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified . )
text2: Luaaˈ matsoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Espíritu Santo na juu nntoˈñoom nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê . Ee xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nñequiaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom juu naquiiˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ , ee tyooweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñê Jesús .

text: Many of the people therefore , when they heard this saying , said , Of a truth this is the Prophet .
text2: Ndoˈ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye quia tyondyena ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , tyoluena : — Mayuuˈcheⁿ tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ cwiluiiñê nquii tsˈaⁿ na waa ñˈoom na nncwjeˈcañoom tsjoomnancue na nñequiaa ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ya .

text: Others said , This is the Christ . But some said , Shall Christ come out of Galilee ?
text2: Ndoˈ jlue ntˈomcheⁿ : — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ cwiluiiñê Cristo . Ndoˈ ntˈom jlue : — Chiuu sa ˈo , juu Cristo ticatsonaˈ na nnaaⁿ Galilea .

text: Hath not the scripture said , That Christ cometh of the seed of David , and out of the town of Bethlehem , where David was ?
text2: Ee ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii matsonaˈ na juu Cristo cwiluiiñê tsjaaⁿ David na jndyowicantyjooˈ . Ndoˈ mati jom tsˈaⁿ tsjoom chjoo Belén yuu na jnaⁿ David .

text: So there was a division among the people because of him .
text2: Ñˈoomwaaˈ to ̱ ⁿˈnaˈ nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Jesús .

text: And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him .
text2: Ee cwantindye joona ñeˈcatˈuena jom , sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ tîcatˈuii jom .

text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them , Why have ye not brought him ?
text2: Quia joˈ nquiee nnˈaⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta watsˈom tyˈelcweeˈna na mˈaⁿ ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos . Taxˈee naⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈa na cwilˈa cwenta watsˈom : — ¿ Chiuu na tînquioˈñˈomˈyoˈ jom ?

text: The officers answered , Never man spake like this man .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ na cwilˈa cwenta watsˈom , jluena : — Meiⁿjom ndiiˈ tyoondya ̱ a ̱ yâ na nntseineiⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ chaˈna na matseineiⁿ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ .

text: Then answered them the Pharisees , Are ye also deceived ?
text2: Quia joˈ fariseosˈñeeⁿ tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , jluena : — ¿ Aa chaˈ mati ˈo manquiuˈnnˈaⁿnaˈ ?

text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him ?
text2: Tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ na matseixmaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ oo cwii fariseo na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿmˈaⁿˈ na cje cwilˈa , ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ljeii na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Joona laˈxmaⁿna na catsuundyena .

text: Nicodemus saith unto them , ( he that came to Jesus by night , being one of them , )
text2: Tˈo ̱ Nicodemo , tsaⁿ na tyjeˈcañoom na mˈaaⁿ Jesús cwii teijaaⁿ . Jom macañˈeeⁿ ñˈeⁿ naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Doth our law judge any man , before it hear him , and know what he doeth ?
text2: Tsoom : — Ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeiinaˈ na cwileiñˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , manquiuuya na matsonaˈ na ticatyˈiomyanaˈ na nntuˈxa ̱ a ̱ ⁿya cwii tsˈaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nndya ̱ a ̱ ya jnaaⁿˈ , ndoˈ na nliuuya ljoˈ sˈaa .

text: They answered and said unto him , Art thou also of Galilee ? Search , and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Aa maxjeⁿ mati ˈu tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿˈ Galilea ? Tcuu tcuu catseiˈnaⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii , quia joˈ nljeiˈ tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii profeta na nnaⁿ Galilea .

text: And every man went unto his own house .
text2: Ndoˈ cwii ndoˈ cwiindyena tyˈena wˈaana .

text: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ Jesús tjaaⁿ ta na jndyu Olivos .

text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple , and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down , and taught them .
text2: Ndoˈ teincoo cwiicheⁿ xuee , lcweeⁿˈeⁿ , tjaquieeˈnnaaⁿˈaⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ . Ndoˈ jndyendye nnˈaⁿ tquieˈcañomna jom . Quia na jnda ̱ tjacjom , tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst ,
text2: Ndoˈ juu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ joo nnˈaⁿ na cwitˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ ñequio nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos tquioñˈomna cwii yuscu na mˈaaⁿ . Yuscuˈñeeⁿ jliuna juu xcwe na matseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñe na mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa . Tquioqueⁿna juu xcwe quiiˈntaaⁿna .

text: They say unto him , Master , this woman was taken in adultery , in the very act .
text2: Ndoˈ jluena nnom Jesús : — ˈU na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , jliuuyâ yuscumˈaaⁿˈ xcwe na matseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñê ñˈeⁿ cwii tsaⁿsˈa .

text: Now Moses in the law commanded us , that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou ?
text2: Ndoˈ naquiiˈ ljeii na tqueⁿ Moisés matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ na catua ̱ a ̱ ˈa ljo ̱ ˈ cjoo yolcu na cwilˈa na luaaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu jeˈ , ¿ chiuu matsuˈ ?

text: This they said , tempting him , that they might have to accuse him . But Jesus stooped down , and with his finger wrote on the ground , as though he heard them not .
text2: Luaaˈ jluena nnoom cweˈ ee cwilˈueena na catˈuiinaˈ jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ jom jeˈ , seintquieˈñê , seiljeiⁿ nomtyuaa ñequio nomtsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ .

text: So when they continued asking him , he lifted up himself , and said unto them , He that is without sin among you , let him first cast a stone at her .
text2: Ndoˈ cweˈ ncˈe na ticˈoowintyjeeˈna na cwitaˈxˈeena ñˈoomwaaˈ nnoom , teintyjeeˈyuñê . Matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — ˈÑeeⁿ cwiindyoˈ ˈo na tjaa jnaⁿ tseixmaⁿ , juu cjuˈjndyee tsjo ̱ ˈ nacjooˈ yuscumˈaaⁿˈ .

text: And again he stooped down , and wrote on the ground .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ seintquieˈñennaaⁿˈaⁿ nomtyuaa , seiljeiityeeⁿ .

text: And they which heard it , being convicted by their own conscience , went out one by one , beginning at the eldest , even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone , and the woman standing in the midst .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia jndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ ñˈoomwaaˈ , jnaⁿnaˈ na macoˈtianaˈ nquiuna . Quia joˈ to ̱ ˈna na cwii ndoˈ cwiindyena jluiˈna joˈ joˈ . Nnˈaⁿ na tquiendye jluiˈjndyeena , jnda ̱ joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cjeti mˈaⁿ . Na macanda ̱ ˈndiinaˈ nquii Jesús ñequio yuscuˈñeeⁿ na meintyjeeˈ jo nnoom .

text: When Jesus had lifted up himself , and saw none but the woman , he said unto her , Woman , where are those thine accusers ? hath no man condemned thee ?
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ teintyjeeˈyuu Jesús , ndoˈ cweˈ ncˈe meiⁿcwiindye naⁿˈñeeⁿ tacˈoomndyena , macanda ̱ juu yuscuˈñeeⁿ cwii mˈaaⁿ , joˈ chii tsoom nnom : — ˈU yuscu , ¿ yuu mˈaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na tquiocalue jnaⁿˈ ? ¿ Aa meiⁿncwii tsˈaⁿ ticatseijndaaˈñe jnaⁿˈ ?

text: She said , No man , Lord . And Jesus said unto her , Neither do I condemn thee : go , and sin no more .
text2: Tˈo ̱ nnoom , matso : — Mayuuˈ Ta , meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ tjaljoˈ sˈaa . Matso Jesús nnom : — Meiⁿ ja ticatsˈaaya na catˈuiinaˈ ˈu . Cjaˈtoˈ , tantsaˈnndaˈ jnaⁿ .

text: Then spake Jesus again unto them , saying , I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness , but shall have the light of life .
text2: Ndoˈ seineiⁿnndaˈ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Matsoom : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ naxueeñe na mañequia naxuee jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseijomñe ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , nntseixmaⁿ naxuee na mañequia na ticantycwii na wandoˈ tsˈaⁿ . Tijoom nntseixmaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ najaaⁿ .

text: The Pharisees therefore said unto him , Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true .
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ fariseos jluena nnoom : — ˈU macwjiˈyuuˈndyuˈ cheˈnncuˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ meiⁿ tiyuuˈ joonaˈ .

text: Jesus answered and said unto them , Though I bear record of myself , yet my record is true : for I know whence I came , and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come , and whither I go .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Meiiⁿ na macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , sa ̱ a ̱ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ juunaˈ , ncˈe ntyjiiya yuu jnaaⁿya , ndoˈ ntyjiiya yuu jo ̱ yo ̱ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo ticaliuˈyoˈ yuu jnaaⁿya , meiⁿ yuu na jo ̱ .

text: Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man .
text2: ˈO cwilajndaaˈndyoˈ jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ cantyjati na jndo ̱ ˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ sa ̱ a ̱ ja meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ ticatˈuiya juu cantyja jnaaⁿˈ .

text: And yet if I judge , my judgment is true : for I am not alone , but I and the Father that sent me .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿ , nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ na matyˈiomyanaˈ . Ee nchii mˈaaⁿya na ñenco ̱ na nntsˈaa tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Nquii Tsotya ̱ na jñoom ja , mˈaaⁿñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: It is also written in your law , that the testimony of two men is true .
text2: Naquiiˈ ñˈoom na sa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeiinaˈ na cwileiñˈomˈyoˈ , waa ñˈoom na matsonaˈ : “ Quia na cwitjoomˈ ñˈoom na cwitjeiˈyuuˈndye we nnˈaⁿ , maxjeⁿ cwicaluiˈyuuˈ ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ . ”

text: I am one that bear witness of myself , and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me .
text2: Joˈ chii ncˈe na luaaˈ matsonaˈ , ja cwiluiindyo ̱ cwii tsˈaⁿ na macwjiˈyuuˈndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ndoˈ Tsotya ̱ ya cwiluiiñê cwiicheⁿ na jnda ̱ we .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is thy Father ? Jesus answered , Ye neither know me , nor my Father : if ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also .
text2: Quia joˈ taxˈeena nnoom : — ¿ Yuu mˈaaⁿ Tsotyeˈ ? Tˈo ̱ Jesús matsoom : — ˈO ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya meiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tsotya ̱ ya . Ee xeⁿ cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya mati nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ jom .

text: These words spake Jesus in the treasury , as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come .
text2: Ñˈoommeiiⁿ seineiⁿ Jesús yocheⁿ na tyoˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naquiiˈ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos , yuu cwitueeˈ nnˈaⁿ sˈom cwentaaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ tîcatˈuii jom , ee tyooweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntjoom nawiˈ tˈmaⁿ .

text: Then said Jesus again unto them , I go my way , and ye shall seek me , and shall die in your sins : whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Cwiicheⁿ cwii ndiiˈ matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ja majo ̱ , ndoˈ ˈo nlˈueˈyoˈ ja , sa ̱ a ̱ ndicwaⁿ choˈnqueⁿˈyoˈ jnaⁿ ndoˈ nncwjeˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ yuu na jo ̱ ˈo xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsquieˈcañomˈyoˈ .

text: Then said the Jews , Will he kill himself ? because he saith , Whither I go , ye cannot come .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe ñˈoomwaaˈ , jlue nnˈaⁿ judíos : — ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na nntseicueeˈñe cheⁿnqueⁿ , na matsoom yuu na mawjaⁿ jaa xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsquieˈcaño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ?

text: And he said unto them , Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world .
text2: Joˈ chii tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — ˈO ticalaxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ cañoomˈluee sa ̱ a ̱ ja tseixmaⁿya joˈ . ˈO laxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancuewaañe , sa ̱ a ̱ ja nchii joˈ tseixmaⁿya .

text: I said therefore unto you , that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he , ye shall die in your sins .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe ñˈoomwaaˈ joˈ na tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ na ndicwaⁿ choˈnqueⁿˈyoˈ jnaⁿˈyoˈ ndoˈ nncwjeˈyoˈ . Ee xeⁿ ticalayuˈyoˈ na ja cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii na jñom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , quia joˈ meiⁿchiuucheⁿ ndicwaⁿ choˈnqueⁿˈyoˈ jnaⁿˈyoˈ quia na nncwjeˈyoˈ .

text: Then said they unto him , Who art thou ? And Jesus saith unto them , Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning .
text2: Quia joˈ taxˈeenndaˈna nnoom , jluena : — ˈU jeˈ , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyuˈ ? Matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Majoˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na jnda ̱ ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ xjeⁿ na to ̱ ˈa na mañequiaya ñˈoom naya .

text: I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him .
text2: Nqueⁿ na jñoom ja cwiluiiñê na mayomˈm . Jndye ñˈoom tsoom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na catsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ ñequiiˈcheⁿ matseiteinco ̱ o ̱ ˈa joo ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jndye niom na ntyjeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ na macaⁿnaˈ na cuˈxa ̱ ⁿya .

text: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na na Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñe Tsotyeeⁿ .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , When ye have lifted up the Son of man , then shall ye know that I am he , and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me , I speak these things .
text2: Quia joˈ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ nquii tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Quia na jnda ̱ jlaˈweˈyoˈ ja na nlacueˈyoˈ , quia ljoˈcheⁿ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na joˈ cwiluiindyo ̱ , ndoˈ nncjaantyjo ̱ o ̱ ˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii na matsˈaa cantyja na matseixmaⁿ nnco ̱ . Cantyjati na tˈmo ̱ ⁿ Tsotya ̱ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , ntyjati joˈndyo na matsˈaa .

text: And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him .
text2: Ndoˈ Tsotya ̱ na jñoom ja mˈaaⁿñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ . Ticaˈñeeⁿ ja na ñenco ̱ , ee ñequiiˈcheⁿ matsˈaa yuu na cjaweeˈ ntyjeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: As he spake these words , many believed on him .
text2: Jnda ̱ na seineiiⁿ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , jndye nnˈaⁿ jlaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him , If ye continue in my word , then are ye my disciples indeed ;
text2: Ndoˈ matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos na jnda ̱ macwilaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê : — Xeⁿ cwiljooˈndyoˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ ñequio ñˈoom naya quia joˈ mayuuˈcheⁿ na cwiluiindyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyoˈ ñˈoom na mañequiaya .

text: And ye shall know the truth , and the truth shall make you free .
text2: Ndoˈ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cwaaⁿ ñˈoom tseixmaⁿnaˈ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ , ndoˈ juu ñˈoom na mayuuˈñeeⁿ nntseicandyaañenaˈ ˈo .

text: They answered him , We be Abraham ' s seed , and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou , Ye shall be made free ?
text2: Joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — Jâ cwiluiindyô ̱ tsjaaⁿ Abraham na jndyowicantyjooˈ . Meiⁿjom ndiiˈ tyoomˈaaⁿyâ moso nda ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ . ¿ Chiuu na matsuˈ na nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿcandyaaˈndyô ̱ na mˈaaⁿyâ nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ cwiicheⁿ ?

text: Jesus answered them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , matsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseitjo ̱ o ̱ ñe nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ xjeⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ jnaⁿ .

text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever .
text2: Ndoˈ tsˈaⁿ na cweˈ moso mˈaaⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaanaˈ na tixocaljooˈñetyeⁿ na mˈaaⁿ patrom ˈnaaⁿˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ nquii jnda patrom ñenquiicheⁿ mˈaaⁿ .

text: If the Son therefore shall make you free , ye shall be free indeed .
text2: Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ja nntseicandyaandyo ̱ ˈo . Macweˈ ncˈe joˈ nncˈomˈyoˈ na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya na jnda ̱ jndyaandyoˈ .

text: I know that ye are Abraham ' s seed ; but ye seek to kill me , because my word hath no place in you .
text2: Mantyjiiya na ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ tsjaaⁿ Abraham na jndyowicantyjooˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ cwiqueⁿndyoˈ na nlacueˈyoˈ ja jnaaⁿˈ na tileicjo ̱ ñˈoom ˈnaⁿya naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father .
text2: Ljoˈ na jnda ̱ ñentyˈiaya na ñetˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ñequio Tsotya ̱ , joˈ matseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo jeˈ , cantyja na jnda ̱ ñejndyeˈyoˈ ñˈoom ˈndyoo tsotyeˈyoˈ , joˈ cwilˈaˈyoˈ .

text: They answered and said unto him , Abraham is our father . Jesus saith unto them , If ye were Abraham ' s children , ye would do the works of Abraham .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom , jluena : — Abraham cwiluiiñê tsotya ̱ a ̱ ya . Matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Xeⁿ ˈo na mayuuˈcheⁿ cwiluiindyoˈ ntseinda Abraham na jndyowicantyjooˈ , quia joˈ nlˈaˈyoˈ chaˈxjeⁿ sˈaaⁿ .

text: But now ye seek to kill me , a man that hath told you the truth , which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ cwijooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ na ñeˈcalacueˈyoˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na matseina ̱ ⁿya ñˈoom na mayuuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ joo ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ ñequiiˈcheⁿ ñˈoom na jndiiya ˈndyoo Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Nquii Abraham tîcatsˈaaⁿ chaˈna ñeˈcalˈaˈ oˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: Ye do the deeds of your father . Then said they to him , We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
text2: ˈO cwilˈaˈyoˈ chaˈxjeⁿ na machˈee nquii tsotyeˈyoˈ . Jluena nnoom : — Jâ nchii na tuiindyô ̱ na tijndaaˈ tsotya ̱ a ̱ yâ . Jâ laˈxmaaⁿyâ na ñecwii tsotya ̱ a ̱ yâ , nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Jesus said unto them , If God were your Father , ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself , but he sent me .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Xeⁿ na mayuuˈcheⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cwiluiiñê tsotyeˈyoˈ , quia joˈ mati nncˈomˈyoˈ na jnda nquiuˈyoˈ ja ee jnaaⁿya na mˈaaⁿ ndoˈ jndyo ̱ o ̱ ya na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ . Nchii jndyo ̱ o ̱ cantyja ˈnaⁿ nnco ̱ , nqueⁿ jñoom ja .

text: Why do ye not understand my speech ? even because ye cannot hear my word .
text2: ¿ Chiuu na tileicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoom na matseina ̱ ⁿ ? Maxjeⁿ cwitjomˈyoˈ na nmeiiⁿˈ ncˈe na tiñeˈcalañˈoomˈndyoˈ ja .

text: Ye are of your father the devil , and the lusts of your father ye will do . He was a murderer from the beginning , and abode not in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaketh a lie , he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar , and the father of it .
text2: ˈO laxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsotyeˈyoˈ , juu tsaⁿjndii . Yuu na lˈue tsˈom jom , joˈ ñeˈcalacanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyoˈ . Jom cwiluiiñê na matseicwjeⁿ nnˈaⁿ cantyjati xjeⁿ na tuii tsjoomnancue . Jom tjaaˈnaⁿ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ catseixmaaⁿ , ee tjaaˈnaⁿ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ naquiiˈ tsˈoom . Quia matseineiiⁿ cantu , matseineiiⁿ cantyjati na matseixmaaⁿ , cweˈ ncˈe tsaⁿcantu jom , ndoˈ cwiluiiñê tsotye chaˈtso ñˈoom na cantu .

text: And because I tell you the truth , ye believe me not .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ja meiiⁿ na matseina ̱ ⁿya ñˈoom na mayuuˈ maxjeⁿ tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: Which of you convinceth me of sin ? And if I say the truth , why do ye not believe me ?
text2: Tjaa ˈñeeⁿ cwiindyoˈ ˈo nnda ̱ a ̱ nncjuˈ jnaⁿ nacjoya . Ñˈoom na matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cwiluiiñenaˈ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ , quia joˈ ¿ chiuu na tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ?

text: He that is of God heareth God ' s words : ye therefore hear them not , because ye are not of God .
text2: Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿñe cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mandii ñˈoom ˈñom . Sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ncˈe na ticaluiindyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , joˈ chii tiñeˈcandyeˈyoˈ .

text: Then answered the Jews , and said unto him , Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan , and hast a devil ?
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos nnoom . Jluena : — Jeeⁿ xcwe cwilˈuuyâ na ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ tsˈaⁿ Samaria . Mati mˈaaⁿ tsaⁿjndii quiiˈ tsˈomˈ joˈ na matseintjeiⁿnaˈ ˈu .

text: Jesus answered , I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father , and ye do dishonour me .
text2: Jesús tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na . Matsoom : — Ja ticˈoom tsaⁿjndii quiiˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Ja Tsotya ̱ ya matseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo cwilajnaⁿˈyoˈ ja .

text: And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii malˈueeˈndyo ̱ na calatˈmaaⁿˈndyoˈ ja . Mˈaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ na machˈee na nluiitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ , ndoˈ manquii nncuˈxeⁿ aa cwiluii na ljoˈ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , If a man keep my saying , he shall never see death .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ na matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiñˈoomˈñe ñˈoom ˈnaⁿya , tijoom nntsuuñe .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Now we know that thou hast a devil . Abraham is dead , and the prophets ; and thou sayest , If a man keep my saying , he shall never taste of death .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos , jluena : — Jeˈ manquiujndaaˈndyo ̱ na matseiˈxmaⁿˈ tsaⁿjndii quiiˈ tsˈomˈ . Tueˈ Abraham , ndoˈ mati profetas . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu matsuˈ : “ Xeeⁿ mˈaaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ juu na matseiñˈoomˈñe ñˈoom ˈnaⁿˈ , tijoom cueˈ . ”

text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham , which is dead ? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself ?
text2: Chaa lˈuu na cwiluiitˈmaⁿndyuˈtiˈ , nchiiti weloo welooya Abraham tsaⁿ na teiyo tueˈ ndoˈ mati jnda ̱ tja ̱ profetas . ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ juu macheˈ cheⁿnncuˈ na cwiluiindyuˈ ?

text: Jesus answered , If I honour myself , my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say , that he is your God :
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom : — Xeⁿ ñequiiˈcheⁿ na matseitˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ cheⁿnnco ̱ , maxjeⁿ cweˈ tsˈiaaⁿˈndyo . Juu Tsotya ̱ ya cwiluiiñê na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñê ja , nqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyoˈ .

text: Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say , I know him not , I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him , and keep his saying .
text2: Meiⁿ ticataˈjnaaⁿˈyoˈ jom . Ja mayuuˈ mawajnaⁿˈa jom , ndoˈ xeⁿ nntsjo ̱ o ̱ na ticwajnaⁿˈa jom , quia joˈ nntsˈaa cheⁿnnco ̱ na cantundyo ̱ chaˈxjeⁿ ˈo . Sa ̱ a ̱ mayuuˈcheⁿ mawajnaⁿˈa jom , ndoˈ matseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyo ̱ ñˈoomˈm .

text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it , and was glad .
text2: Tioo na neiiⁿˈ tsˈom welooˈyoˈ Abraham tsaⁿ na ñetˈoom teiyo na seiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na nncueeˈ xjeⁿ na nluiindyo ̱ na tsˈaⁿ ja . Ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ joˈ , ndoˈ tquiaanaˈ na jeeⁿ neiiⁿˈeⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na ljoˈ .

text: Then said the Jews unto him , Thou art not yet fifty years old , and hast thou seen Abraham ?
text2: Ndoˈ jlue nnˈaⁿ judíos nnoom : — Nchaa lˈuu mayuuˈ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaˈ Abraham ee ˈu meiⁿ cweˈ wenˈaaⁿ nchooˈ nqui chuˈ tyooweeˈ .

text: Jesus said unto them , Verily , verily , I say unto you , Before Abraham was , I am .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , matsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluiiñe Abraham , sa ̱ a ̱ ja maxjeⁿ mamˈaaⁿya .

text: Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself , and went out of the temple , going through the midst of them , and so passed by .
text2: Quia joˈ jlaˈxcwiina ljo ̱ ˈ na njñomna jom . Meiⁿ tiqueⁿna cwenta teiño ̱ o ̱ ⁿ xcwe quiiˈntaaⁿna . Mana jlueeⁿˈeⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaaⁿna .

text: And as Jesus passed by , he saw a man which was blind from his birth .
text2: Jâ nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwe na tˈmaⁿ Jesús na calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tyomaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê . Yocheⁿ na saawiˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ cwii joo , ntyˈiaayâ cwii tsaⁿsˈa xjeⁿ na tuiiñe na nchjaaⁿˈ .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , Master , who did sin , this man , or his parents , that he was born blind ?
text2: Ndoˈ taxˈa ̱ a ̱ yâ nnoom , lˈuuyâ : — ˈU Maestro , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ juu seitjo ̱ o ̱ ñe nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , joˈ na tuiiñe tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na nchjaaⁿˈaⁿ ? ¿ Aa nqueⁿ oo aa nnˈaⁿ na nda jom ?

text: Jesus answered , Neither hath this man sinned , nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , matsoom : — Meiⁿ nchii jnaaⁿˈ nquii na tuiiñe na nchjaaⁿˈ , meiⁿ nchii jnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na nda juu . Luaaˈ tjom cha cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ caˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom waa najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ .

text: I must work the works of him that sent me , while it is day : the night cometh , when no man can work .
text2: Tseixmaⁿya na catsˈaaya tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ nqueⁿ na jñoom ja yocheⁿ na ndicwaⁿ wando ̱ ˈa . Ee quia nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nncwja ̱ a ̱ ya , quia joˈ xonda ̱ a ̱ nlˈaatya ̱ a ̱ ya tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: As long as I am in the world , I am the light of the world .
text2: Yocheⁿ na mˈaaⁿya quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ , cwiluiindyo ̱ chom na mañequiaa naxuee jo nda ̱ a ̱ na .

text: When he had thus spoken , he spat on the ground , and made clay of the spittle , and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay ,
text2: Jnda ̱ na tsoom na luaaˈ , tjoomˈm ndaajnaⁿˈ nomtyuaa . Sˈaaⁿ tsooˈ ñequio juunaˈ , jnda ̱ joˈ tyˈoomñê tsooˈñeeⁿ luaˈnnom tsaⁿnchjaaⁿˈ .

text: And said unto him , Go , wash in the pool of Siloam , ( which is by interpretation , Sent . ) He went his way therefore , and washed , and came seeing .
text2: Ndoˈ tsoom nnom : — Cjaˈ peila na jndyu Siloé , camaⁿˈ nˈomnjomˈ . Ñˈoom Siloé matsonaˈ jñom tsˈaⁿ xˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ tja tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , tmaaⁿ nnoom . Ndoˈ quia jndyolcweeⁿˈeⁿ xuee mantyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: The neighbours therefore , and they which before had seen him that he was blind , said , Is not this he that sat and begged ?
text2: Ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na nndyooˈ mˈaⁿ yuu na macˈeeⁿ ñequio nnˈaⁿ na ñentyˈiaana jom na ñetcaaⁿ ljoˈ tjo ̱ o ̱ ñê , taˈxˈeena nda ̱ a ̱ ntyjeena : — ¿ Aa nchii luaaˈ tsaⁿnchjaaⁿˈ na tacatyeeⁿ na tcaⁿ ljoˈ tjo ̱ o ̱ ñe ?

text: Some said , This is he : others said , He is like him : but he said , I am he .
text2: Ntˈomndye joona jluena : — Majom luaaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomcheⁿ jlue : — Nchii jom , cweˈ na jeeⁿ tseijomnaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ nqueⁿ matsoom : — Maja luaa .

text: Therefore said they unto him , How were thine eyes opened ?
text2: Joˈ na taˈxˈeena nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Chiuu tuiiyuu na ya teitquioˈ jeˈ ?

text: He answered and said , A man that is called Jesus made clay , and anointed mine eyes , and said unto me , Go to the pool of Siloam , and wash : and I went and washed , and I received sight .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Juu tsˈaⁿ na jndyu Jesús sˈaaⁿ tsooˈ , tyˈoomñê juunaˈ luaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Jnda ̱ joˈ matso na cjo ̱ ya Siloé na cjo ̱ camaaⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Ndoˈ tjo ̱ joˈ , tmaaⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , ndoˈ jeˈ xuee mantyˈiaya .

text: Then said they unto him , Where is he ? He said , I know not .
text2: Quia joˈ taˈxˈeetina nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Ndoˈ juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , yuu mˈaaⁿ ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ticaljeiiya .

text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind .
text2: Quia joˈ tyˈeñˈomna juu tsˈaⁿ na ñetˈoom na nchjaaⁿˈ jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos na laˈxmaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos .

text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay , and opened his eyes .
text2: Ee xuee na cwitaˈjndyee nnˈaⁿ quia sˈaa Jesús tsooˈ na sˈaaⁿ na ya mantyˈiaaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight . He said unto them , He put clay upon mine eyes , and I washed , and do see .
text2: Ndoˈ mati nnˈaⁿ fariseosˈñeeⁿ tyotaˈxˈeena nnoom . Tyoluena : — ¿ Chiuu tuiiyuu na ya mantyˈiaˈ ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , tsoom : — Juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tyˈoomñê tsooˈ luaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , jnda ̱ chii tmaaⁿya luaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , ndoˈ jeˈ ya mantyˈiaya .

text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees , This man is not of God , because he keepeth not the sabbath day . Others said , How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles ? And there was a division among them .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈom fariseosˈñeeⁿ tyoluena : — Tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ nchii mˈaaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ee ticatseitˈmaaⁿˈñê xuee na cwitaˈjndya ̱ a ̱ ya . Ndoˈ ntˈom ncˈiaana jlue : — Tsˈaⁿ na tseixmaⁿ jnaⁿ tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ chaˈna luaaˈ . Ndoˈ laaˈtiˈ tîcwijom ñˈoom na jlaˈneiⁿna .

text: They say unto the blind man again , What sayest thou of him , that he hath opened thine eyes ? He said , He is a prophet .
text2: Joˈ chii taˈxˈeenndaˈna nnom tsˈaⁿ na ñetˈoom na nchjaaⁿˈ . Jluena nnoom : — Ndoˈ ˈu jeˈ , ¿ ljoˈ matsuˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ na sˈaaⁿ na ya mantyˈiaˈ ? Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , matsoom : — Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê profeta .

text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him , that he had been blind , and received his sight , until they called the parents of him that had received his sight .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ maxjeⁿ tiñeˈcalaˈyuˈna na ñetˈoom na nchjaaⁿˈaⁿ ndoˈ jeˈ jnda ̱ ljoya mantyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ . Joˈ chii tqueeⁿˈndyena nnˈaⁿ na nda jom .

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?
text2: Ndoˈ taˈxˈeena nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , jluena : — Tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ , ¿ aa ndaˈyoˈ jom ? Chiuu cwinduˈyoˈ , ¿ aa mayuuˈ na tuiiñê na nchjaaⁿˈaⁿ ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ nnˈaⁿ na nda jom . Jluena : — Manquiuuyâ na ndaayâ jom , ndoˈ manquiuuyâ na tuiiñê na nchjaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: But by what means he now seeth , we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes , we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cantyja chiuu tuiiyuu na ya mantyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ jeˈ , joˈ ticaliuuyâ . Meiⁿ ticaliuuyâ ˈñeeⁿ sˈaa na ya mantyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ choomˈm . Joˈ chii cataˈxˈeeˈyoˈ ˈñom chiuu waa . Manquiityeeⁿ nntsoom chiuu tuii .

text: These words spake his parents , because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already , that if any man did confess that he was Christ , he should be put out of the synagogue .
text2: Luaaˈ ñˈoom tˈo ̱ o ̱ joo nnˈaⁿ na nda jom , ee nquiaana nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaaⁿna . Ee jnda ̱ jlaˈjomndyena xeⁿ na nncwjiˈyuuˈñe meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na Jesús cwiluiiñê Cristo , tixonquiana na wanaaⁿ na nntseijomñe tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ xjeⁿ na cwitjomndye nnˈaⁿ na nlaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Therefore said his parents , He is of age ; ask him .
text2: Cweˈ na luaaˈ waa , joˈ na jlue nnˈaⁿ na nda jom : “ Jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ ñoomˈm . Cataˈxˈeeˈyoˈ ˈñom . ”

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .
text2: Quia joˈ jnda ̱ we ndiiˈ tqueeⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos juu tsaⁿ na ñetˈoom na nchjaaⁿˈ . Tyoluena nnoom : — Ñequio na ndoˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom catseineiⁿˈ ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ . Jâ cwilaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ na juu tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ matseixmaaⁿ jnaⁿ .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Ticaljeiiya , aa jom tsˈaⁿ na matseixmaⁿ jnaⁿ . Ñeˈcwii waa na matseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈa , meiiⁿ na ñetˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na nchjaⁿya , sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ ya mantyˈiaya .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?
text2: Quia joˈ taˈxˈeenndaˈna nnoom . Jluena : — ¿ Ljoˈ sˈaaⁿ ˈu ? ¿ Chiuu sˈaayom na ya mantyˈiaˈ ?

text: He answered them , I have told you already , and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again ? will ye also be his disciples ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ , matsoom : — Majnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ ticalañˈoomˈndyoˈ . Ndoˈ jeˈ ¿ chiuu na ñeˈcandyeˈnndaˈyoˈ ? ¿ Aa mati ˈo ñeˈcalajomndyoˈ ñˈoom na mañequiaaⁿ ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .
text2: Ndoˈ jlaˈjnaaⁿˈ naⁿˈñeeⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ñetˈoom na nchjaaⁿˈ . Jluena : — ˈU cwiluiindyuˈ tsˈaⁿ na matseijomñe ñˈoomˈm , sa ̱ a ̱ jâ cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈoom na tyoñequiaa Moisés .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .
text2: Jâ manquiuuyayâ na seineiⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnom Moisés , sa ̱ a ̱ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ meiⁿ cweˈ ticaliuuyâ yuu jnaⁿyom .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .
text2: Tˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Jeeⁿcheⁿ ndyaˈ cjaaweeˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na luaaˈ , na ˈo ticaliuˈyoˈ yuu jnaⁿyom , ndoˈ jnda ̱ tquiaaⁿ na ya mantyˈiaya .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .
text2: Chaˈtsondyo ̱ manquiuuya na Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom xocañeeⁿ ñˈoom ndyuee nnˈaⁿ na laxmaⁿ jnaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñe jom ndoˈ na machˈee yuu na lˈue tsˈoom , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nñeeⁿ ñˈoom ˈndyoo .

text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind .
text2: Cantyjati xuee na jnaⁿ tsjoomnancue , meiⁿjom ndiiˈ tyoondye nnˈaⁿ na ñetˈoom cwii tsˈaⁿ na sˈaa na ya mantyˈiaaˈ cwii tsˈaⁿ na tuiiñe na nchjaaⁿˈ .

text: If this man were not of God , he could do nothing .
text2: Xeⁿ nchii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom mˈaaⁿ ñˈeⁿ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ , tjaa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: They answered and said unto him , Thou wast altogether born in sins , and dost thou teach us ? And they cast him out .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ na nnoom , jluena : — ˈU chaˈtso na chaˈtso cantyja na tuiindyuˈ matseiˈxmaⁿˈ jnaⁿ . Ndoˈ ¿ aa matseijnduˈ na mˈmo ̱ ⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ ? Quia joˈ tjeiiˈna jom watsˈom chjoo ˈnaaⁿna yuu cwitjomndyena .

text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him , he said unto him , Dost thou believe on the Son of God ?
text2: Jndii Jesús na tjeiiˈna tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿna . Quia ljeiiⁿ juu , matsoom nnom : — ¿ Aa matseiyuˈ ñequio Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ?

text: He answered and said , Who is he , Lord , that I might believe on him ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , matsoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , ¿ cwaaⁿ tsˈaⁿ jom cha ya nntseiyuˈa ñˈeⁿñê ?

text: And Jesus said unto him , Thou hast both seen him , and it is he that talketh with thee .
text2: Matso Jesús nnoom : — Majnda ̱ ntyˈiaˈ jom . Mannco ̱ na matseina ̱ ⁿya njomˈ cwiluiindyo ̱ nqueⁿ .

text: And he said , Lord , I believe . And he worshipped him .
text2: Quia joˈcheⁿ matsoom : — ˈU Ta , matseiyuˈa ñˈeⁿndyuˈ . Ndoˈ seitˈmaaⁿˈñê Jesús .

text: And Jesus said , For judgment I am come into this world , that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind .
text2: Ndoˈ Jesús matsotyeeⁿcheⁿ : — Ja jndyo ̱ o ̱ tsjoomnancuewaañe na nnto ̱ ⁿˈa nnˈaⁿ . Nquiee nnˈaⁿ na ndooˈ nquiuna na cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna chiuu waa cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nntsˈaa na nncˈomna chaˈcwijom tsˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿˈ . Ndoˈ joo nnˈaⁿ na ndooˈ nquiuna na mˈaⁿna na nchjaaⁿna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , joona nñequiaya na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words , and said unto him , Are we blind also ?
text2: Nndyooˈ meintyjeeˈ cwantindye nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos , ndoˈ jndyena na luaaˈ tso Jesús . Quia joˈ taˈxˈeena nnoom , jluena : — ¿ Aa mati jâ machˈeenaˈ na nchjaaⁿyâ ?

text: Jesus said unto them , If ye were blind , ye should have no sin : but now ye say , We see ; therefore your sin remaineth .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — Xeⁿ na jeˈ laxmaⁿˈyoˈ chaˈna nnˈaⁿ na ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom quia joˈ tjaaˈnaⁿ jnaⁿ na cwilaxmaⁿˈyoˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe na cwinduˈyoˈ na ˈo laxmaⁿˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , joˈ chii cwilaxmaⁿˈyoˈ na choˈnqueⁿˈyoˈ jnaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold , but climbeth up some other way , the same is a thief and a robber .
