text2: ’ Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ na matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , juu tsˈaⁿ na nchii ˈndyootsˈa tiom wjaaquieeˈ yuu na ñjomndye canmaⁿ , sa ̱ a ̱ cwiicheⁿ joo wjaawaaⁿ juu tiomˈñeeⁿ na nncwincjeeⁿˈeⁿ juunaˈ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwiluiiñê tsaⁿcanchˈue ndoˈ tsaⁿ na mawincjeˈ tiom .

text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nquii tsˈaⁿ na cwiluiiñe na mateixˈee canmaⁿ , xcwe ˈndyootsˈa tiom nncjaaqueⁿˈeⁿ .

text: To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name , and leadeth them out .
text2: Tsˈaⁿ na machˈee cwenta ˈndyootsˈa tiomˈñeeⁿ , matseicanaaⁿñe na nncwinoom . Ndoˈ joo canmaⁿˈñeeⁿ na mateixˈeeⁿ cwitaˈjnaaⁿˈyoˈ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ . Macwjeeⁿˈeⁿ ncueeyoˈ , wjaachom jooyoˈ .

text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep , he goeth before them , and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ chaˈtso canmaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ cwenta , wjaajñeeⁿ jo nda ̱ a ̱ yoˈ , ˈoontyjo ̱ yoˈ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ ee cwitaˈjnaaⁿˈyoˈ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: And a stranger will they not follow , but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers .
text2: Cwii tsˈaⁿ na ticataˈjnaaⁿˈyoˈ na nchii tyˈoyoˈ , xocˈoontyjo ̱ yoˈ naxeⁿˈ , hasta nleiˈnomyoˈ juu . Ee ticataˈjnaaⁿˈyoˈ jndyeeˈ cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nchii tyˈoyoˈ .

text: This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them .
text2: Luaaˈ ñˈoom na cweˈ tjañoomˈ na seineiⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na . Sa ̱ a ̱ tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna ljoˈ ñeˈcatsonaˈ .

text: Then said Jesus unto them again , Verily , verily , I say unto you , I am the door of the sheep .
text2: Ndoˈ seineiⁿticheⁿ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ . Tsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ja cwiluiindyo ̱ ˈndyootsˈa tiom na cwiˈooquieˈ canmaⁿ .

text: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them .
text2: Chaˈtso ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tquiocalue na cwiluiindye na nnteiˈxˈee canmaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na jndyo ̱ o ̱ , joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ laˈxmaⁿna naⁿcantyˈue ndoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwiwincjeˈ tiom . Sa ̱ a ̱ joo canmaⁿ na mayuuˈcheⁿ cwiluiindye cwentaya tînquiandyena cantyja ˈnaaⁿ naⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: I am the door : by me if any man enter in , he shall be saved , and shall go in and out , and find pasture .
text2: Ja ˈndyootsˈa tiom cwiluiindyo ̱ . Meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na nncjaaquieeˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nluiˈnˈmaaⁿñê . Nntseijomnaˈ jom chaˈcwijom cwii catsmaⁿ na maljeiiyoˈ na nlcwaˈ na macaluiˈyoˈ tiomˈñeeⁿ ndoˈ na macwjeeˈnndaˈyoˈ .

text: The thief cometh not , but for to steal , and to kill , and to destroy : I am come that they might have life , and that they might have it more abundantly .
text2: ’ Tsaⁿcanchˈue ñequiiˈcheⁿ na macwjeeⁿˈeⁿ na nnchˈueeⁿ nntseicueⁿˈeⁿ ndoˈ na nntseiˈnaⁿˈaⁿ . Ja jndyo ̱ o ̱ na nñequia na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈ nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ cha na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya na nlaˈxmaⁿna juu joˈ .

text: I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep .
text2: Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya mateixˈee canmaⁿ . Juu tsˈaⁿ na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya na mateixˈee canmaⁿ ntsmeiⁿˈ , mañequiaañe na cueˈ cwentaayoˈ .

text: But he that is an hireling , and not the shepherd , whose own the sheep are not , seeth the wolf coming , and leaveth the sheep , and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them , and scattereth the sheep .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsaⁿntjom na nchii cwiluiiñê tyˈoyoˈ ee cweˈ machˈeeⁿ cwenta jooyoˈ , noomˈm na ndyocwjeeˈcañoom lobo . Quia joˈ maˈñeeⁿ canmaⁿˈñeeⁿ , maleinoom . Ndoˈ juu loboˈñeeⁿ mantyjo ̱ ndoˈ matˈuii jooyoˈ .

text: The hireling fleeth , because he is an hireling , and careth not for the sheep .
text2: Maleinom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ee cweˈ tsaⁿntjom jom , joˈ chii ticajnda ntyjeeⁿ canmaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: I am the good shepherd , and know my sheep , and am known of mine .
text2: ’ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya mateixˈa ̱ ya canmaⁿ . Ndoˈ chaˈxjeⁿ wajnaaⁿˈ Tsotya ̱ ja , mati ja mawajnaⁿˈa jom . Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ na wajnaⁿˈa canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa , ndoˈ quiooˈ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa cwitajnaaⁿˈyoˈ ja . Ndoˈ mañequiaandyo ̱ na cˈio ̱ cwentaa canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa .

text: And other sheep I have , which are not of this fold : them also I must bring , and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold , and one shepherd .
text2: Mati mamˈaⁿ ntˈomcheⁿ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiindyena canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa na ticˈomna tmaaⁿˈwaa . Mati joona cwiluiindyo ̱ na cjo ̱ cacho ̱ o ̱ ya , ndoˈ nnquiontyjo ̱ na na nncwaⁿya joona . Ndoˈ nncuaa na ñeˈcwii tmaaⁿˈ , ndoˈ ñeˈcwii tsˈaⁿ na nnteixˈee joona .

text: Therefore doth my Father love me , because I lay down my life , that I might take it again .
text2: ’ Nquii Tsotya ̱ jeeⁿ candyaˈ tsˈoom ja , ee mañequiaandyo ̱ na cˈio ̱ cwentaa nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiindye canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa cha nñequiaaⁿ na nncwando ̱ ˈnndaˈa .

text: No man taketh it from me , but I lay it down of myself . I have power to lay it down , and I have power to take it again . This commandment have I received of my Father .
text2: Tjaaˈnaⁿ ˈñeeⁿ juu na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntseicueeˈ ja na nchii ñˈoomya . Mannco ̱ tya ̱ mañequiaandyo ̱ na ljoˈ catjo ̱ ⁿ . Waa najndo ̱ na cwiluiindyo ̱ na catsˈaa na ljoˈ , ndoˈ mati waa na jndo ̱ na nncwando ̱ ˈxco ̱ . Luaaˈ ñˈoom na sa ̱ ˈntjom Tsotya ̱ ya na catseixmaⁿya .

text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndye nnˈaⁿ judíos ñˈoommeiⁿˈ sˈaanaˈ na tîcatjoomˈnndaˈ na jlaˈneiⁿna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: And many of them said , He hath a devil , and is mad ; why hear ye him ?
text2: Ee jndyendye joona jluena : — Tsaⁿjndii matseixmaaⁿ , ndoˈ jnda ̱ teintjeiⁿñê . ¿ Chiuu na cwindyeˈyoˈ ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ ?

text: Others said , These are not the words of him that hath a devil . Can a devil open the eyes of the blind ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomndye joona jlue : — Nchaa lˈuu ñˈoommeiⁿˈ laˈxmaⁿnaˈ ñˈoom na nntseineiⁿ tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿjndii . ¿ Aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ cwii tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿjndii nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa na nntyˈiaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿˈ ?

text: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication , and it was winter .
text2: Tsjoom Jerusalén tueeˈ xuee quia cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndye nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwijaañjoomˈ nˈomna xjeⁿ na tiooxconndaˈ weloo weloona cwenta watsˈom tˈmaⁿ lˈo ̱ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: Ndoˈ xcwe ncueesuaˈ quia tueeˈ xueeˈñeeⁿ . Jesús mˈaaⁿ watsˈom tˈmaⁿ ˈnaaⁿna . Manoom naquiiˈ cwii wˈaa cwentaaˈ watsˈomˈñeeⁿ na cweˈ wanaaⁿ ndiocheⁿ na sˈaa Salomón .

text: Then came the Jews round about him , and said unto him , How long dost thou make us to doubt ? If thou be the Christ , tell us plainly .
text2: Quia joˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos tjaaˈndyena tsei Jesús . Taˈxˈeena nnoom jluena : — ¿ Cwanti yo na maleichuˈ jâ na matseiñˈeeⁿˈndyuˈ jâ ? Xeⁿ na mayuuˈ cwiluiindyuˈ Cristo , ntyjayu catsuˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ .

text: Jesus answered them , I told you , and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father ' s name , they bear witness of me .
text2: Matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ na ljoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ maxjeⁿ tîcalayuˈyoˈ . Majoo tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa ñequio najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Tsotya ̱ , joonaˈ cwitjeiˈyuuˈndyenaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: But ye believe not , because ye are not of my sheep , as I said unto you .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ cweˈ ncˈe nchii cwiluiindyoˈ canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa .

text: My sheep hear my voice , and I know them , and they follow me :
text2: Ee nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiindye canmaⁿ ntsma ̱ a ̱ ⁿˈa cwindyena jndyeya , ndoˈ ja mawajnaⁿˈa joona , ndoˈ joona cwinquiontyjo ̱ na naxa ̱ ⁿˈa .

text: And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish , neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand .
text2: Ja mañequia na ticantycwii na cwitaˈndoˈna , meiⁿ tajom catsuundyena . Ndoˈ tjaa meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nncwjiˈ joona lˈo ̱ o ̱ .

text: My Father , which gave them me , is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father ' s hand .
text2: Ee nquii Tsotya ̱ na tquiaaⁿ joona lˈo ̱ o ̱ , jom cwiluiitˈmaⁿñetyeeⁿ na chaˈtso , ndoˈ meiⁿcwii tjaa ˈñeeⁿ juu nnda ̱ a ̱ nncwjiˈ joona lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ .

text: I and my Father are one .
text2: Ja ñequio Tsotya ̱ ñeˈcwii cwiluiindyo ̱ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndye nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ na luaaˈ ñˈoom tso Jesús , jlaˈxcwiinndaˈna ljo ̱ ˈ na nntueeˈna nacjoomˈm .

text: Jesus answered them , Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me ?
text2: Quia joˈ tsoom nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Majndye tsˈiaaⁿ na ya jnda ̱ sˈaaya jo nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ñequio najndeii na matseixmaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya . ¿ Cwaaⁿ cwii juunaˈ na machˈeenaˈ na ñeˈcajñomˈyoˈ ljo ̱ ˈ ja ?

text: The Jews answered him , saying , For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou , being a man , makest thyself God .
text2: Ndoˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ judíosˈñeeⁿ nnoom , jluena : — Nchii ñeˈcajño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ljo ̱ ˈ ˈu cweˈ cwii tsˈiaaⁿ na ya macheˈ . Nlˈaayâ na luaaˈ ˈu ee matseiˈjnaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ee ˈu cweˈ tsˈaⁿ ˈu , sa ̱ a ̱ macheˈ na cwiluiindyuˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Jesus answered them , Is it not written in your law , I said , Ye are gods ?
text2: Jesús tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , tsoom : — Naquiiˈ ljeii ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na cwileiñˈomˈyoˈ , manquiuˈyoˈ na nquii Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom matsoom : “ Nda ̱ a ̱ ˈ ˈo na cwiluiitquiendyoˈ jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ na matseijomnaˈ ˈo chaˈna nnco ̱ . ”

text: If he called them gods , unto whom the word of God came , and the scripture cannot be broken ;
text2: Matsoticheⁿ Jesús : — Tso Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos na matseijomnaˈ joona chaˈna nqueⁿ . Ndoˈ manquiuuya na tixocatsˈaanaˈ na cweˈ cantu ñˈoom na tsoom .

text: Say ye of him , whom the Father hath sanctified , and sent into the world , Thou blasphemest ; because I said , I am the Son of God ?
text2: Joˈ chii tixcwe na cwinduˈyoˈ na matseijnaaⁿˈa jom ncˈe na tsjo ̱ o ̱ na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ . Ee nqueⁿ tyˈioom tsˈiaaⁿ ja , ndoˈ sa ̱ ˈntjoom ja na candyocˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿndyo ̱ quiiˈntaaⁿˈ ˈo nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue .

text: If I do not the works of my Father , believe me not .
text2: Joˈ chii xeⁿ nchii tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈ Tsotya ̱ matsˈaa , ticalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: But if I do , though ye believe not me , believe the works : that ye may know , and believe , that the Father is in me , and I in him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe na matsˈaa tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , joˈ chii calayuˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ mañejoo tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ meiiⁿ na tiñeˈcalayuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja . Ee cantyja ˈnaaⁿ joonaˈ nliuˈyoˈ ndoˈ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na nquii Tsotya ̱ ñeˈcwii cwiluiiñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ndoˈ ja ñeˈcwii cwiluiindyo ̱ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand ,
text2: Quia joˈ cwiicheⁿ cwii ndiiˈ jlaˈjndaaˈndyena na nntˈuena jom , sa ̱ a ̱ tîcanda ̱ a ̱ lˈana , tjaaⁿ .

text: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode .
text2: Quia joˈ teiˈtyˈio ̱ o ̱ nndaaˈâ jndaa Jordán ñˈeⁿ Jesús yuu ñetˈoomjndyee Juan na tyotseitsˈoomñê nnˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ majndye xuee ñetˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ joˈ joˈ ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: And many resorted unto him , and said , John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true .
text2: Ndoˈ jndye nnˈaⁿ tquieˈcañom na mˈaaⁿyâ na ñeˈcandyena ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ . Tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — Juan meiⁿcwii tsˈiaaⁿ tyoochˈeeⁿ na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nluiinaˈ na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa . Sa ̱ a ̱ chaˈtso ñˈoom na tyoñequiaaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ , ñequiiˈcheⁿ na mayuuˈ joonaˈ .

text: And many believed on him there .
text2: Ndoˈ majndye nnˈaⁿ tyolaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿ Jesús joˈ joˈ .

text: Now a certain man was sick , named Lazarus , of Bethany , the town of Mary and her sister Martha .
text2: Tyomˈaaⁿ cwii tsˈaⁿ wiiˈ na jndyu Lázaro . Juu tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tyomˈaaⁿ tsjoom Betania ñequio María ñequio xjoom Marta .

text: ( It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment , and wiped his feet with her hair , whose brother Lazarus was sick . )
text2: Majuu María , xjo Lázaroˈñeeⁿ , tsaⁿ na tuˈnquio ncheⁿˈ ncˈee Jesús , ndoˈ ñequio sooxqueeⁿ tyueeˈñê ncˈee .

text: Therefore his sisters sent unto him , saying , Lord , behold , he whom thou lovest is sick .
text2: Ndoˈ joo yolcuˈñeeⁿ jlaˈcwanomna ñˈoom na mˈaaⁿ Jesús . Jluena : — ˈU Ta , juu tsˈaⁿ na jeeⁿ candyaˈ tsˈomˈ , weeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: When Jesus heard that , he said , This sickness is not unto death , but for the glory of God , that the Son of God might be glorified thereby .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii Jesús ñˈoomwaaˈ , matsoom : — Tycuwaaˈ nchii macanda ̱ na cweˈ nntseicueeˈnaˈ jom . Matjoom na luaaˈ cha caluiitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Ndoˈ mati nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñê ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ .

text: Now Jesus loved Martha , and her sister , and Lazarus .
text2: Jeeⁿ wiˈ tsˈom Jesús Marta ñequio tyjee tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ ñequio nquii Lázaro .

text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick , he abode two days still in the same place where he was .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jñeeⁿ na wiiˈ Lázaroˈñeeⁿ , ljooˈñetyeeⁿ we xuee joˈ joˈ yuu na mˈaaⁿ .

text: Then after that saith he to his disciples , Let us go into Judaea again .
text2: Jnda ̱ teinom we xueeˈñeeⁿ , jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaaⁿ na calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ , matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Tsaanndaaˈa Judea .

text: His disciples say unto him , Master , the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again ?
text2: Joˈ chii lˈuuyâ nnoom : — ˈU ta na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tyoowijndye xuee na jlaˈjndaaˈndye nnˈaⁿ judíos na njñomna ljo ̱ ˈ ˈu , ndoˈ ¿ aa joˈ wjaˈnndaˈ ?

text: Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? If any man walk in the day , he stumbleth not , because he seeth the light of this world .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , matsoom : — Ndicwaⁿ waa xjeⁿ na nntsˈaatya ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntˈue nnˈaⁿ judíos ja . Ndoˈ na luaaˈ waa matseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom na cwii xuee na canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya canchooˈwe horas na nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ . Quia naxuee manom tsˈaⁿ , xocwityˈueeⁿ , ee ya tquioomˈm ncˈe na mantyˈiaaˈ ñeˈquioomˈ tsjoomnancuewaañe .

text: But if a man walk in the night , he stumbleth , because there is no light in him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa tsˈaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ natsjom . Xeⁿ nntsˈaaⁿ na ljoˈ nncwityˈueeⁿ , ee tjaaˈnaⁿ naxuee cˈoom ñˈeⁿñê .

text: These things said he : and after that he saith unto them , Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go , that I may awake him out of sleep .
text2: Jnda ̱ tsoom na luaaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , tsotyeeⁿcheⁿ : — Juu tiˈxˈiaaya Lázaro watsom , sa ̱ a ̱ jo ̱ na nntseilcwiya jom .

text: Then said his disciples , Lord , if he sleep , he shall do well .
text2: Quia joˈ tˈo ̱ o ̱ yâ , lˈuuyâ : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , xeⁿ na cweˈ watsom , maxjeⁿ nlcoˈyanaˈ jom .

text: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep .
text2: Seineiⁿ Jesús ñˈoomwaaˈ ee na mˈaaⁿ tsˈooñe Lázaro , sa ̱ a ̱ jâ jlatiuuyâ na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na watsoo tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then said Jesus unto them plainly , Lazarus is dead .
text2: Quia joˈ tsondyeyoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Jnda ̱ tueˈ Lázaro .

text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there , to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him .
text2: Ndoˈ neiⁿya na ticˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya joˈ joˈ quia na tueeⁿˈeⁿ cha na nlayuˈyoˈ . Jeˈ cjaaya na mˈaaⁿ .

text: Then said Thomas , which is called Didymus , unto his fellowdisciples , Let us also go , that we may die with him .
text2: Tomás , tsaⁿ na cwilacajndyuuyâ catyeⁿnquiee , juu cwii jâ nnˈaⁿ na canchooˈwendyô ̱ na tˈmaⁿ Jesús na calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , matso tiˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Mati cjaaya cha mañejom cwja ̱ a ̱ ya ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Then when Jesus came , he found that he had lain in the grave four days already .
text2: Quia joˈ saayâ , squia ̱ a ̱ yâ Betania . Jnda ̱ na squia ̱ a ̱ yâ joˈ joˈ tyolue nnˈaⁿ nnom Jesús na jnda ̱ ñequiee xuee na ndiiˈ Lázaro tseiˈtsuaa .

text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem , about fifteen furlongs off :
text2: Tsjoomˈñeeⁿ chaˈna we kilómetros waljooˈ xcwe na tquia mˈaaⁿnaˈ ñˈeⁿ Jerusalén .

text: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary , to comfort them concerning their brother .
text2: Ndoˈ majndye nnˈaⁿ judíos jnda ̱ tquieˈcañom Marta ñequio María . Tquiolaˈjomndyena na cwiñeˈquiana na tˈmaⁿ nˈom naⁿˈñeeⁿ na tueˈ Lázaro .

text: Then Martha , as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming , went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jndii Marta na jnda ̱ wjaawindyo ̱ o ̱ ˈâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús , jlueeⁿˈeⁿ na jndyocatjomñê juu yuu na mˈaaⁿyâ . Sa ̱ a ̱ María ljooˈñê na waa wˈaa .

text: Then said Martha unto Jesus , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Matso Marta nnom Jesús : — ˈU Ta , toom cweˈ mˈaaⁿˈ ñjaaⁿ , tîcueˈ ñetyjo ̱ .

text: But I know , that even now , whatsoever thou wilt ask of God , God will give it thee .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na jnda ̱ tueeⁿˈeⁿ ntyjiiyaya na meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ ñˈoom na nlcaⁿˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , nñequiaaⁿ .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Thy brother shall rise again .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : — Ncwandoˈnndaˈ tiˈtyˈiuˈ meiiⁿ na jnda ̱ tueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: Martha saith unto him , I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Marta nnoom , matso : — Ntyjiiya na nncwandoˈnndaˈ ñetyjo ̱ xuee na macanda ̱ quia na nntseinlcwi Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ tja ̱ .

text: Jesus said unto her , I am the resurrection , and the life : he that believeth in me , though he were dead , yet shall he live :
text2: Matso Jesús nnom : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ na mañequia na cwitaˈndoˈxco nnˈaⁿ , ndoˈ ja mañequia na ticantycwii na mawandoˈ tsˈaⁿ . ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , meiiⁿ na cueˈ , maxjeⁿ nncwandoˈxco .

text: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die . Believest thou this ?
text2: Ndoˈ ticwii cwii tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ticantycwii na nncwandoˈ , ndoˈ meiⁿ tijoom nntsuuñe . ¿ Aa matseiyuˈ na ljoˈ ?

text: She saith unto him , Yea , Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ , the Son of God , which should come into the world .
text2: Matsoom nnom Jesús : — Mayuuˈ Ta , matseiyuˈa na ˈu cwiluiindyuˈ Cristo , Jnda Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Maˈu joˈ na tseixmaⁿˈ na nncwjeˈcañoomˈ tsjoomnancue .

text: And when she had so said , she went her way , and called Mary her sister secretly , saying , The Master is come , and calleth for thee .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tso Marta na luaaˈ , quia joˈ tjaaⁿ , tjacwaaⁿ tyjeeⁿ María . Ñemaaⁿˈ matsoom nnom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Jnda ̱ tyjeeˈ nquii Maestro ndoˈ maqueeⁿˈñê ˈu .

text: As soon as she heard that , she arose quickly , and came unto him .
text2: Quia na jndii María na ljoˈ , seityuaaⁿˈaⁿ , jndyocatjomñê Jesús yuu na mˈaaⁿyâ .

text: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town , but was in that place where Martha met him .
text2: Ee xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ tyootsaaquia ̱ a ̱ ˈâ quiiˈ tsjoom ñˈeⁿ Jesús . Ndi mˈaaⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê yuu na tjacatjomñe Marta jâ .

text: The Jews then which were with her in the house , and comforted her , when they saw Mary , that she rose up hastily and went out , followed her , saying , She goeth unto the grave to weep there .
text2: Ndoˈ joo nnˈaⁿ judíos na cwilaˈjomndye ñˈeⁿ María na cwiñeˈquia na tˈmaⁿ tsˈoom , quia ntyˈiaana na seityuaaⁿˈaⁿ , teicantyjaaⁿ , jlueeⁿˈeⁿ quiiˈ wˈaa , tyˈentyjo ̱ na naxeeⁿˈeⁿ . Ee jlaˈtiuuna na wjaacatyˈioom yuu waa tseiˈtsuaa .

text: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was , and saw him , she fell down at his feet , saying unto him , Lord , if thou hadst been here , my brother had not died .
text2: Quia na tueⁿˈeⁿ na mˈaaⁿyâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús , tcoomˈm xtyeeⁿ jo ncˈee . Matsoom nnom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , toom cweˈ mˈaaⁿˈ ñjaaⁿñe , quia joˈ tîcueˈ ñetyjo ̱ .

text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping , and the Jews also weeping which came with her , he groaned in the spirit , and was troubled ,
text2: Ntyˈiaaˈ Jesús na jeeⁿ matyˈioo María , ndoˈ jeeⁿ cwityuee nnˈaⁿ judíos na tquiontyjo ̱ naxeeⁿˈeⁿ . Quia joˈ jeeⁿ seichjooˈnaˈ tsˈom Jesús , ndoˈ seiˈndaaˈna ntyjeeⁿ .

text: And said , Where have ye laid him ? They said unto him , Lord , come and see .
text2: Taxˈeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ na , matsoom : — ¿ Yuu cwijom tyˈiuˈyoˈ jom ? Jluena nnoom : — Ta , candyoˈ cantyˈiaˈ .

text: Jesus wept .
text2: Ndoˈ Jesús tyˈioom .

text: Then said the Jews , Behold how he loved him !
text2: Quia joˈ joo nnˈaⁿ judíos jlue : — Queⁿˈyoˈ cwenta na jeeⁿ wiˈ tsˈoom tiˈtsˈoo .

text: And some of them said , Could not this man , which opened the eyes of the blind , have caused that even this man should not have died ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cwantindye joona jluena : — Tsaⁿsˈamˈaaⁿˈ sˈaaⁿ na ya ntyˈiaaˈ tsaⁿnchjaaⁿˈ . ¿ Aa nchii mati nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaaⁿ na tîcueˈ Lázaro ?

text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave . It was a cave , and a stone lay upon it .
text2: Seiˈndaaˈnndaˈnaˈ ntyjii Jesús . Saayâ ñˈeⁿñê yuu na waa tsueˈtsjo ̱ ˈ na tuii tseiˈtsuaa juunaˈ . Cwita ̱ ˈ tsjo ̱ ˈ ˈndyootsˈaaˈnaˈ .

text: Jesus said , Take ye away the stone . Martha , the sister of him that was dead , saith unto him , Lord , by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Quindyo ̱ ˈyoˈ tsjo ̱ ˈwaa . Juu Marta , xjo tsˈoo , matsoom : — Jeeⁿ ˈu Ta , jeˈ jnda ̱ teicˈeeñê ee jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ ñequiee xuee na tueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: Jesus saith unto her , Said I not unto thee , that , if thou wouldest believe , thou shouldest see the glory of God ?
text2: Matso Jesús nnom : — ¿ Aa nchii jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ , xeⁿ nntseiyuˈ nntyˈiaˈnjomˈ na nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ?

text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid . And Jesus lifted up his eyes , and said , Father , I thank thee that thou hast heard me .
text2: Quia ljoˈcheⁿ teiˈndyo ̱ o ̱ na tsjo ̱ ˈ yuu na tjaaˈndyena tsˈoo . Ndoˈ jlunda ̱ a ̱ ñê , matsoom : — Jeeⁿ quianlˈuaˈ ˈu Tsotya ̱ ya na mandiˈ ñˈoom ˈndyo ̱ ya .

text: And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it , that they may believe that thou hast sent me .
text2: Ee mantyjiiya na ñequiiˈcheⁿ mandiˈ ñˈoom na matseina ̱ ⁿya njomˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ncˈe nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye na mˈaⁿna na cañomya joˈ chii tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya ñˈoomwaaˈ cha calaˈyuˈna na ˈu jñomˈ ja .

text: And when he thus had spoken , he cried with a loud voice , Lazarus , come forth .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ tsoom na luaaˈ , seiweeⁿ jñeeⁿˈeⁿ , tsoom : — Lázaro , caluiˈ .

text: And he that was dead came forth , bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin . Jesus saith unto them , Loose him , and let him go .
text2: Ndoˈ juu tsˈoo Lázaro , jlueeⁿˈeⁿ na chuˈtyjoo liaa na tintmeiⁿ ncˈeeⁿ ndoˈ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Ndoˈ ta ̱ ˈ nnoom payom . Matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — Calacano ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ liaameiⁿˈ cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nncjaⁿ .

text: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary , and had seen the things which Jesus did , believed on him .
text2: Ndoˈ majndye nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ quia na ntyˈiaana na luaaˈ sˈaa Jesús , jlaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê .

text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees , and told them what things Jesus had done .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈomndye joona tyˈentyjaaˈna nnˈaⁿ fariseos . Tyoluena chiuu ntyˈiaana na sˈaa Jesús .

text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council , and said , What do we ? for this man doeth many miracles .
text2: Joˈ chii tjomndye nquiee ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye ñequio nnˈaⁿ fariseos ñequio ntˈomcheⁿ ncˈiaana na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ . Tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — ¿ Chiuu nlˈaayo ̱ o ̱ ? Ee teijndye tsˈiaaⁿ tˈmaⁿ machˈee tsaⁿmˈaaⁿˈ na tixocaluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa .

text: If we let him thus alone , all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation .
text2: Ndoˈ xeⁿ cweˈ nˈndya ̱ a ̱ to ̱ o ̱ na ncjaachˈeetyeeⁿ na luaaˈ , quia joˈ chaˈtso nnˈaⁿ nlaˈyuˈ ñˈeⁿñê . Ndoˈ na ljoˈ nquiee naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ romanos nlaˈtyuiiˈna watsˈom ˈnaaⁿ jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos ñequio ndaandyuaa ˈnaaⁿya .

text: And one of them , named Caiaphas , being the high priest that same year , said unto them , Ye know nothing at all ,
text2: Caifás jndyu cwiindye joo naⁿˈñeeⁿ na luaaˈ tso . Juu cwiluiitquieñê chuˈñeeⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ntyee cwentaa jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos . Matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ naⁿˈñeeⁿ : — ˈO meiⁿchjoo ticalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Nor consider that it is expedient for us , that one man should die for the people , and that the whole nation perish not .
text2: Meiⁿ ticaliuˈyoˈ na yati xeⁿ na cueˈ cwii tsaⁿsˈa cwentaa chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ ndyuaaya , cha tintsˈaa gobiernom na cwja ̱ a ̱ ya na chaˈtsondyo ̱ .

text: And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii cantyja na jndo ̱ ˈ tsˈom nqueⁿ na luaaˈ ñˈoom tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ . Jom ncˈe na cwiluiiñê tyee na cwiluiitˈmaⁿñê nda ̱ a ̱ jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos chuˈñeeⁿ , joˈ chii seijndo ̱ ˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom tsˈoom na nncueˈ Jesús cwentaa nnˈaⁿ judíos .

text: And not for that nation only , but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad .
text2: Ndoˈ nchii macanda ̱ cweˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos , mati nntjoom na ljoˈ cha chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na meiⁿquiayuucheⁿ na mˈaⁿ na quitˈmaⁿ nˈom jom nntseitjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joona cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death .
text2: Joˈ chii ncˈe na luaaˈ tso Caifás , cantyjati xueeˈñeeⁿ jnaⁿnaˈ na jlaˈjomndye naⁿmaⁿnˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ na nlaˈcueeˈna Jesús .

text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness , into a city called Ephraim , and there continued with his disciples .
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ , tîconom xcweyaaⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos . Joˈ chii jluiiˈâ tsˈo ̱ ndaa Judea ñˈeⁿñê , saayâ cwii tsjoom chjoo na jndyu Efraín . Tsjoomˈñeeⁿ candyooˈ mˈaaⁿnaˈ ñequio ndyuaa na tjaa nnˈaⁿ cˈoom . Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñê joˈ joˈ cwantindyo xuee .

text: And the Jews ' passover was nigh at hand : and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover , to purify themselves .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ jaawindyooˈ na nncueeˈ xuee pascua na jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos cwilacwja ̱ a ̱ ya canmaⁿ . Cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nncueeˈ xuee pascuaˈñeeⁿ , jndyendye nnˈaⁿ jluiˈna njoomna , tyˈena Jerusalén cha nnda ̱ a ̱ nntjeiˈljuuˈndyena cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ñˈoom na cwilaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyo ̱ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: Then sought they for Jesus , and spake among themselves , as they stood in the temple , What think ye , that he will not come to the feast ?
text2: Joo nnˈaⁿ na tyˈe xuee tyolˈueena Jesús . Yocheⁿ na tyomˈaⁿna watsˈom , tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — ¿ Chiuu mˈaaⁿˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , aa nntsˈaacheⁿnaˈ na ticañoom ncuee ?

text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment , that , if any man knew where he were , he should shew it , that they might take him .
text2: Ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos ñequio nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos tqueⁿna ñˈoom na jndeiˈnaˈ . Sa ̱ ˈntjomna xeⁿ mˈaaⁿ meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ntyjii yuu mˈaaⁿ Jesús , catseicandii tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ joona , cha na nnda ̱ a ̱ nntˈuena jom .

text: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany , where Lazarus was which had been dead , whom he raised from the dead .
text2: Yom xuee cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ na nlaˈtyeⁿ nnˈaⁿ judíos xuee pascua quia cwilaˈcwjeena canmaⁿ , ndoˈ squia ̱ a ̱ yâ tsjoom Betania ñˈeⁿ Jesús . Squia ̱ a ̱ yâ na mˈaaⁿ Lázaro , tsaⁿ na tquiaaⁿ na wandoˈ xco jnda ̱ na tueˈ .

text: There they made him a supper ; and Martha served : but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him .
text2: Tyolaˈtˈmaaⁿˈndyena Jesús joˈ joˈ . Jlaˈjndaaˈndyena cwii nantquie na tcwaaˈâ . Marta tyondiˈntjoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ ndoˈ juu Lázaroˈñeeⁿ tacatyeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyô ̱ na meindyuaandyô ̱ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard , very costly , and anointed the feet of Jesus , and wiped his feet with her hair : and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment .
text2: Ndoˈ juu María maleiñˈoom cwii tsuaˈ xjo ncheⁿˈ na ñequiiˈcheⁿ nardo . Juunaˈ jeeⁿ jndanaˈ . Tuˈnquioom ncheⁿˈñeeⁿ ncˈee Jesús , jnda ̱ joˈ tyoweeˈñê ncˈee ñequio sooxqueeⁿ . Na sˈaaⁿ na ljoˈ tjuˈnaˈ jndye cachi chaˈwaa quiiˈ wˈaa .

text: Then saith one of his disciples , Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , which should betray him ,
text2: Mañˈeⁿ Judas Iscariote , jnda Simón , juu mawaa xjeⁿ na nñequiaa cwenta Jesús . Tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwii jâ na tˈmaⁿ Jesús na calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê .

text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence , and given to the poor ?
text2: Matso : — Cwa nchii na teilˈua ncheⁿˈwaaˈ na cwii ndyee siaⁿnto sˈom denario . Ñequio sˈomˈñeeⁿ nnda ̱ a ̱ nnteijndeii tsˈaⁿ ndyeñeeⁿˈ .

text: This he said , not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief , and had the bag , and bare what was put therein .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ nchii tsoom na luaaˈ ncˈe na jeeⁿ wiˈ tsˈoom ndyeñeeⁿˈ sa ̱ a ̱ ee na jeeⁿ canchˈueñe ndoˈ ncˈe na jom maleiñˈoom tjaⁿche na ñjom sˈom na cwileilˈueeˈndyô ̱ na chaˈtsondyô ̱ , ndoˈ xjeⁿto jom macwjeeⁿˈeⁿ sˈom joˈ joˈ .

text: Then said Jesus , Let her alone : against the day of my burying hath she kept this .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ matso Jesús : — Caˈndiiˈ yuscumˈaaⁿˈ na luaaˈ machˈeeⁿ . Matseijndaaˈñê cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ xuee na nncjaantyˈiuuˈndyo ̱ .

text: For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always .
text2: Ee ndyeñeeⁿˈ ñequiiˈcheⁿ na mˈaⁿna ñˈeⁿndyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ ja nchii ñequiiˈcheⁿ na nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there : and they came not for Jesus ' sake only , but that they might see Lazarus also , whom he had raised from the dead .
text2: Joˈ chii quia na jndye nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye na joˈ joˈ mˈaaⁿ Jesús , tquieˈcañomna na mˈaaⁿyâ . Ee nchii macanda ̱ ncˈe na ñeˈcantyˈiaana Jesús , sa ̱ a ̱ mati ñeˈcantyˈiaana Lázaro , tsˈaⁿ na tueˈ na tquiaa Jesús na tandoˈxco .

text: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
text2: Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ , ntyee na cwiluiitquiendye nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos , mati jlaˈjndaaˈndyena na nlaˈcueeˈna Lázaro .

text: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away , and believed on Jesus .
text2: Ee cweˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ jom majndye nnˈaⁿ judíosˈñeeⁿ to ̱ ⁿˈndye cantyja ˈnaaⁿ ntyee , jlaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: On the next day much people that were come to the feast , when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem ,
text2: Teincoo cwiicheⁿ xuee nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye na tquio ncuee , jndyena na manndyooˈ na nntsquia ̱ a ̱ yâ Jerusalén ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: Took branches of palm trees , and went forth to meet him , and cried , Hosanna : Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord .
text2: Joˈ chii tyˈechona njom , tyˈecatjomndyena jâ ñˈeⁿñê . Tyolaˈxuaana tyoluena : — Caluiitˈmaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Catioˈnaaⁿñê nquii tsˈaⁿ na mandyo ñequio xueeˈ nquii na cwiluiiñe Rey cwentaa jaa nnˈaⁿ Israel .

text: And Jesus , when he had found a young ass , sat thereon ; as it is written ,
text2: Ndoˈ ljeii Jesús cwii snom chjoo . Tjaljoom juuyoˈ . Ndoˈ na ljoˈ sˈaaⁿ seicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiyo teiljeii .

text: Fear not , daughter of Sion : behold , thy King cometh , sitting on an ass ' s colt .
text2: Matsonaˈ : ˈO nnˈaⁿ tsjoom Jerusalén , tilaˈcatyuendyoˈ . Cantyˈiaˈyoˈ macwjeeˈcañoom nqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê Rey cwentaˈ ˈo , na waljoom snom .

text: These things understood not his disciples at the first : but when Jesus was glorified , then remembered they that these things were written of him , and that they had done these things unto him .
text2: Jâ nnˈaⁿ na tˈmaⁿ Jesús na calaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tîcalaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ najndyee . Sa ̱ a ̱ nda ̱ nquia quia na jnda ̱ seitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom jom , tjañjoomˈ nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na teiljeii ñˈoommeiⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , ndoˈ maxjeⁿ tuii na ljoˈ .

text: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave , and raised him from the dead , bare record .
text2: Mˈaⁿ cwii tmaaⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos quia tˈmaⁿ Jesús Lázaro na ñejndiiˈ quiiˈ tseiˈtsuaa . Jnda ̱ na tquiaaⁿ na wandoˈxco Lázaroˈñeeⁿ , quia joˈ tyotjeiiˈyuuˈndye naⁿˈñeeⁿ chiuu ntyˈiaana na tuii .

text: For this cause the people also met him , for that they heard that he had done this miracle .
text2: Macweˈ juu tsˈiaaⁿˈñeeⁿ na sˈaa Jesús na tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa , joˈ na tyˈecatjomndye nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye jom quia jnda ̱ jndyena na ljoˈ sˈaaⁿ .

text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves , Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing ? behold , the world is gone after him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ joo fariseosˈñeeⁿ tyoluena nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaana : — ¿ Aa jndoˈyoˈ jeˈ ? Maxjeⁿ tjaa na nnda ̱ a ̱ nlˈaaya . Chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ cwilajomndye ñˈeⁿñê .

text: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
text2: Ndoˈ tyomˈaⁿ cwantindye nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈneiⁿ ñˈoom griego quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ na tyˈe ncuee quia cwilaˈcwjee nnˈaⁿ judíos canmaⁿ .

text: The same came therefore to Philip , which was of Bethsaida of Galilee , and desired him , saying , Sir , we would see Jesus .
text2: Tquieˈcañom naⁿˈñeeⁿ Felipe . Jom tsˈaⁿ tsjoom Betsaida , tsˈo ̱ ndaa Galilea . Nnˈaⁿ griegosˈñeeⁿ tyˈecataⁿna cwii nayaˈñeeⁿ nnoom , jluena : — Aa re sa , lˈue nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ na nlana ̱ a ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús .

text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew : and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus .
text2: Quia joˈ tja Felipe , matsoom na ljoˈ nnom Andrés , ndoˈ wendye joona tyˈecaluena na ljoˈ nnom Jesús .

text: And Jesus answered them , saying , The hour is come , that the Son of man should be glorified .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee . Jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na tˈmaⁿ nlcoˈwiˈnaˈ ja , ndoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ joˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñê ja .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die , it abideth alone : but if it die , it bringeth forth much fruit .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , cwii lqueeⁿ na cwiquioo , xeⁿ ticjaaquieeˈnaˈ quiiˈ tsˈo yuu na nntseijomnaˈ chaˈcwijom na nncueˈnaˈ , cwiljonaˈ na ñenquiinaˈ . Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ nnomˈ tsˈaⁿ juunaˈ quiiˈ tsˈo yuu na matseijomnaˈ na nncueˈnaˈ , quia joˈ majndye nncueˈ nntsˈaanaˈ .

text: He that loveth his life shall lose it ; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseicandyaˈ tsˈom cantyja na matseijndaaˈñe nquii na nncwandoˈ , jnaaⁿˈ joˈ nntsuuñe . Sa ̱ a ̱ juu tsˈaⁿ na machˈee na jndooˈ cantyja na wjaamˈaaⁿ , nndaaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ na ticantycwii na nncwanoomˈm .

text: If any man serve me , let him follow me ; and where I am , there shall also my servant be : if any man serve me , him will my Father honour .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na ñeˈcandiˈntjom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , candyontyjo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ naxa ̱ ⁿˈa . Ndoˈ yuu na nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya majoˈ joˈ nncˈoom tsˈaⁿ na mandiˈntjom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na nndiˈntjom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tsotya ̱ ya tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ .

text: Now is my soul troubled ; and what shall I say ? Father , save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour .
text2: ’ Jeˈ mamatseiˈndaaˈnaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , ndoˈ ¿ chiuu nntsjo ̱ o ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ joˈ ? ¿ Aa nntsjo ̱ o ̱ : “ Tsotya ̱ ya , cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyuˈ ja juu xjeⁿ na nntjo ̱ ⁿya nawiˈwaañe ” ? Sa ̱ a ̱ xocatsjo ̱ o ̱ na ljoˈ ee jnda ̱ jndyo ̱ o ̱ cha na nncˈio ̱ cwentaa nnˈaⁿ .

text: Father , glorify thy name . Then came there a voice from heaven , saying , I have both glorified it , and will glorify it again .
text2: ˈU Tsotya ̱ ya , quiaaˈ na catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ˈu . Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ teicˈuaa jndyeeˈ Tsotyeeⁿ cañoomˈluee . Tˈo ̱ : — Jnda ̱ tquia na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ja ndoˈ wjaatseitˈmaaⁿˈñetinaˈ ja .

text: The people therefore , that stood by , and heard it , said that it thundered : others said , An angel spake to him .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye na meintyjeeˈ nacañoomyâ joˈ joˈ , jndyena na ljoˈ . Jluena nda ̱ a ̱ ntyjeena na seixuaa tsuee . Sa ̱ a ̱ ntˈom nnˈaⁿ jlue : — Cwii ángel seineiⁿ nnoom .

text: Jesus answered and said , This voice came not because of me , but for your sakes .
text2: Tso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Jndyeˈyoˈ na teicˈuaa na seineiiⁿ cha cateijndeiinaˈ ˈo , nchii cha cateijndeiinaˈ ja .

text: Now is the judgment of this world : now shall the prince of this world be cast out .
text2: Ee jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nncuˈxeⁿnaˈ nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue . Ndoˈ mati nntyuiiˈ na matseixmaⁿ tsaⁿjndii na matsa ̱ ˈntjom quiiˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ .

text: And I , if I be lifted up from the earth , will draw all men unto me .
text2: Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ jlaˈwe nnˈaⁿ ja na nlaˈcueeˈna ja , quia joˈ nntsˈaa na nntseitjomnaˈ nnˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: This he said , signifying what death he should die .
text2: Ñˈoomwaaˈ matsoom cha caˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ cwaaⁿ cwii nnom na nntjoom na nncueeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: The people answered him , We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever : and how sayest thou , The Son of man must be lifted up ? who is this Son of man ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ nnˈaⁿ na jndyendye , jluena : — Majnda ̱ macwindya ̱ a ̱ ya na matso ñˈoom na sa ̱ ˈntjom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeiinaˈ na juu Cristo xocantycwii na mˈaaⁿñê . Quia joˈ ¿ chiuu na matsuˈ na matsonaˈ na nlaˈwe nnˈaⁿ juu na cwiluiiñe tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee na nlaˈcueeˈna juu ? ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ juu luaaˈ na matsuˈ na cwiluiiñe tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee ?

text: Then Jesus said unto them , Yet a little while is the light with you . Walk while ye have the light , lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth .
text2: Quia joˈ matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ na : — Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxuee quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ ndicwaⁿ mˈaaⁿtya ̱ ya quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ . Joˈ chii ñequiiˈcheⁿ cˈomˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya yocheⁿ na cwii mˈaaⁿtya ̱ ya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ , cha tincwinomˈ natia ˈo . Ee tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿñe nacje ˈnaaⁿˈ natia , ticaljeii yuu wjaañˈoomnaˈ juu .

text: While ye have light , believe in the light , that ye may be the children of light . These things spake Jesus , and departed , and did hide himself from them .
text2: Yocheⁿ na mˈaaⁿya na mañequia naxuee quiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , calayuˈyoˈ ñequiondyo ̱ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxueeñe . Ee na nlˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ nlaxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na nqueⁿ cwiluiiñê naxueeñe . Jnda ̱ na seineiⁿ Jesús ñˈoommeiⁿˈ , tjaaⁿ yuu na xocaliu naⁿˈñeeⁿ jom .

text: But though he had done so many miracles before them , yet they believed not on him :
text2: Meiiⁿ jndye tsˈiaaⁿ na tyochˈeeⁿ jo nda ̱ a ̱ na na tixocaluii na cweˈ tsˈaⁿ nntsˈaa , sa ̱ a ̱ tiñeˈcalaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿñê .

text: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled , which he spake , Lord , who hath believed our report ? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed ?
text2: Luaaˈ tuii cha catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoom na tyotseiljeii profeta Isaías , matso : Ta , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ juu na matseiyuˈ ñˈoom na cwiñeˈquiaayâ ? Ndoˈ tsotyeeⁿ cwiicheⁿ ñˈoom : ¿ ˈÑeeⁿ juu na jnda ̱ tˈmo ̱ ⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnom najndeii na matseixmaaⁿ ?

text: Therefore they could not believe , because that Esaias said again ,
text2: Tˈmo ̱ ⁿ Isaías chiuu waa na tileicanda ̱ a ̱ nlaˈyuˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos , ee waa cwiicheⁿ ñˈoom na matsoom :

text: He hath blinded their eyes , and hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes , nor understand with their heart , and be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Chaˈxjeⁿ tileicantyˈiaaˈ tsˈaⁿ na nchjaaⁿˈ , maluaaˈ sˈaa Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom quiiˈ nˈomna , ndoˈ tquiaaⁿ na jlaˈquieˈ nˈomna jo nnoom . Nmeiiⁿˈ tuii cha tixocaliuna chiuu lˈue tsˈoom ñˈeⁿndyena , meiⁿ na nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna quiiˈ nˈomna . Ee xeⁿ nncˈooliuna chiuu lˈue tsˈoom ndoˈ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna , maxjeⁿ nlcweˈ nˈomna ndoˈ nncwjiˈnˈmaaⁿñê joona .

text: These things said Esaias , when he saw his glory , and spake of him .
text2: Seineiⁿ Isaías ñˈoommeiⁿˈ quia na tcoˈnaˈ nnoom na seitˈmaaⁿˈñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom Jesús , ndoˈ seineiiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ juu .

text: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him , lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiiⁿ na luaaˈ tso Isaías , majndyendye nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ nˈiaaⁿ jo nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ judíos , tyolaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿ Jesús . Sa ̱ a ̱ jnaaⁿˈ na nquiaana nnˈaⁿ tmaaⁿˈ fariseos , joˈ chii ticatjeiˈyuuˈndyena na ljoˈ . Ee xeⁿ nlˈana na ljoˈ tixonquia fariseosˈñeeⁿ na wanaaⁿ na nlaˈjomndyena xjeⁿ na cwiˈoona watsˈom .

text: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God .
text2: Ee joona neiiⁿtina na calue ncˈiaana na ya cwilˈana , nchiiti na ntyjaaˈ nˈomna na catso Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na ya ntyjeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyena .

text: Jesus cried and said , He that believeth on me , believeth not on me , but on him that sent me .
text2: Jndeii seineiⁿ Jesús . Matsoom : — ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , nchii macanda ̱ ñequio ja matseiyuˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Mati matseiyuˈ ñequio nquii Tsotya ̱ na jñom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
text2: Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na mantyˈiaaˈ ja , mati mantyˈiaaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nquii na jñom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: I am come a light into the world , that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness .
text2: Ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ naxuee , jndyo ̱ o ̱ tsjoomnancue , cha meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ nncwjiˈnaˈ juu naquiiˈ natia .

text: And if any man hear my words , and believe not , I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world , but to save the world .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ cweˈ na mandii tsˈaⁿ ñˈoom na mañequiaya , meiⁿ ticatseinda ̱ joonaˈ , nchii ja tseixmaⁿya na nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ee nchii tyˈiom Tsotya ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ ja na nncuˈxa ̱ ⁿya nnˈaⁿ , tyˈioom tsˈiaaⁿ ja na cwjiˈnˈmaaⁿndyo ̱ joona .

text: He that rejecteth me , and receiveth not my words , hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken , the same shall judge him in the last day .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu na ticueeˈ tsˈom ja , meiⁿ ticoˈñom ñˈoom na mañequiaya , waa cwii na nncuˈxeⁿnaˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ee xuee na macanda ̱ majooti ñˈoom na jnda ̱ seina ̱ ⁿya , joonaˈ nntuˈxeⁿnaˈ jom .

text: For I have not spoken of myself ; but the Father which sent me , he gave me a commandment , what I should say , and what I should speak .
text2: Ticalatiuuˈyoˈ na cweˈ na jndeiiˈ ˈndyo ̱ nnco ̱ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ na matseina ̱ ⁿ . Nquii Tsotya ̱ na jñom ja , nqueⁿ sa ̱ ˈntjoom na nmeiiⁿˈ catseina ̱ ⁿya ndoˈ na caˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore , even as the Father said unto me , so I speak .
text2: Ndoˈ ntyjiiya ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom mañequiaanaˈ na nntseixmaⁿ tsˈaⁿ na ticantycwii na wandoˈ . Joˈ chii matseina ̱ ⁿya chaˈxjeⁿ ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tsoom no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ .

text: Now before the feast of the passover , when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father , having loved his own which were in the world , he loved them unto the end .
text2: Cantyjati na jnaⁿnaˈ na tˈmaⁿ Jesús jâ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , tˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na jeeⁿ candyaˈ tsˈoom jâ . Ntyjeeⁿ na jnda ̱ jaaweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nlueeⁿˈeⁿ tsjoomnancuewaañe na nncjaalcweˈnnaaⁿˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotyeeⁿ . Joˈ chii quia majaaweˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nlatya ̱ a ̱ ⁿ jaa nnˈaⁿ judíos xuee pascua quia cwilacwja ̱ a ̱ ya canmaⁿ , tˈmo ̱ ⁿtyeeⁿ na jeeⁿ tˈmaⁿ waa na candyaˈ tsˈoom jâ .

text: And supper being ended , the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot , Simon ' s son , to betray him ;
text2: Cwicwaaˈâ ñˈeⁿ Jesús natmaaⁿ . Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ seijndo ̱ ˈ tsaⁿjndii tsˈom xˈiaayâ Judas Iscariote , jnda Simón , na quiaa tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ cwenta jom .

text: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands , and that he was come from God , and went to God ;
text2: Ndoˈ jom majndaaˈya ntyjeeⁿ na lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ jnda ̱ tquiaa Tsotyeeⁿ na meiⁿcwii tintjoom na nchii ñˈoomˈ nquii . Mantyjeeⁿ na jnaaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom , ndoˈ na majoˈ wjaalcweeⁿˈeⁿ .

text: He riseth from supper , and laid aside his garments ; and took a towel , and girded himself .
text2: Teicantyjaaⁿ yocheⁿ na cwicwaaˈâ natmaaⁿ . Tjeiiⁿˈeⁿ liaatco na cweⁿ , toˈñoom cwii liaa na cwityueeˈ lua ̱ a ̱ yâ , seityeeⁿ juunaˈ tsiaⁿˈaⁿ .

text: After that he poureth water into a bason , and began to wash the disciples ' feet , and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded .
text2: Jnda ̱ joˈ tioom ndaatioo tsˈom ˈnaⁿ na cwicandyuuˈâ . To ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈo ̱ ⁿ na mamaaⁿ ncˈa ̱ a ̱ ˈâ na tˈmaaⁿ na calajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê , jnda ̱ chii maweeˈñê ncˈa ̱ a ̱ ˈâ ñequio liaaˈñeeⁿ .

text: Then cometh he to Simon Peter : and Peter saith unto him , Lord , dost thou wash my feet ?
text2: Ndoˈ quia na tueˈcañoom yuu na wacatyeeⁿ Simón Pedro , matso tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nnoom : — Ta , ¿ aa mmaⁿˈ ncˈa ̱ ya ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nnom , matsoom : — Tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa tileicatseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ na majeˈndyo , sa ̱ a ̱ nda ̱ quiacheⁿ nntseiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ .

text: Peter saith unto him , Thou shalt never wash my feet . Jesus answered him , If I wash thee not , thou hast no part with me .
text2: Matso Pedro nnoom : — Xoya na mmaⁿˈ ncˈa ̱ ya . Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : — Xeⁿ ticamaaⁿya ncˈeˈ ticatseixmaⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: Simon Peter saith unto him , Lord , not my feet only , but also my hands and my head .
text2: Matso Simón Pedro nnoom : — Xeⁿ luaaˈwaa Ta , nchii macanda ̱ ncˈa ̱ . Mati camaⁿˈ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ya ñequio xqua ̱ a ̱ ⁿya .

text: Jesus saith to him , He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet , but is clean every whit : and ye are clean , but not all .
text2: Matso Jesús nnom : — Cwii tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ jnda ̱ a ̱ ˈ , ticaⁿnaˈ na nntmaⁿñe na chaˈwaañe ee jnda ̱ ljuˈñe , manda ̱ ncˈee macaⁿnaˈ na nntmaⁿ . ˈO laxmaⁿˈyoˈ na ljuˈ nˈomˈyoˈ sa ̱ a ̱ tichaˈtsondyoˈ .

text: For he knew who should betray him ; therefore said he , Ye are not all clean .
text2: Ee ntyjeeⁿ ˈñeeⁿ juu nñequiaa cwenta jom luee ntyee . Macweˈ joˈ na matsoom : “ Sa ̱ a ̱ tichaˈtsondyoˈ laxmaⁿˈyoˈ na ljuˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . ”

text: So after he had washed their feet , and had taken his garments , and was set down again , he said unto them , Know ye what I have done to you ?
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ tmaaⁿ ncˈa ̱ a ̱ ˈâ , ndoˈ tcweennaaⁿˈaⁿ liaatco ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ , jnda ̱ joˈ tjacjoonnaaⁿˈaⁿ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa . Matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — ¿ Aa cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja na sˈaaya ˈo ?

text: Ye call me Master and Lord : and ye say well ; for so I am .
text2: ˈO cwilacajndyuˈyoˈ ja Maestro ndoˈ na cwiluiindyo ̱ na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo . Ndoˈ matyˈiomyanaˈ na ljoˈ cwinduˈyoˈ , ee maxjeⁿ joˈ ja .

text: If I then , your Lord and Master , have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another ' s feet .
text2: Ndoˈ na jnda ̱ tmaaⁿya ncˈeeˈyoˈ na cwiluiindyo ̱ na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo ndoˈ na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ñˈoom naya ˈnaaⁿˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , mati ˈo matsonaˈ na nntueˈndyoˈcjeˈyoˈ na nndyeˈntjomˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ .

text: For I have given you an example , that ye should do as I have done to you .
text2: Ee jnda ̱ sˈaaya cwii nnom na maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cha mati calˈaˈyoˈ ñequio ntˈomcheⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ jnda ̱ sˈaaya ˈo .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , juu tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ moso ticaluiitˈmaⁿñe chaˈna nquii tsˈaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom juu . Mati tsˈaⁿ na mawjaa tsˈiaaⁿ na jñom tsˈaⁿ juu , ticaluiitˈmaⁿñeti chaˈxjeⁿ nquii tsˈaⁿ na jñom juu .

text: If ye know these things , happy are ye if ye do them .
text2: Xeⁿ cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ ndoˈ cwilˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ , nntioˈnaaⁿñe Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ˈo .

text: I speak not of you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled , He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me .
text2: ’ Nchii matsjo ̱ o ̱ ñˈoomwaaˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ na chaˈtsondyoˈ . Mantyjiiya chiuu nˈomˈ ˈo na jnda ̱ tjeiiˈndyo ̱ . Ee maxjeⁿ macaⁿnaˈ na catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoomˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na teiljeii . Matsonaˈ : “ Manquii na macwaˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ malcweˈ nacjoya . ”

text: Now I tell you before it come , that , when it is come to pass , ye may believe that I am he .
text2: Jeˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya ñˈoomwaaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluii na ljoˈ , cha quia na nntseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ nlayuˈyoˈ na ja cwiluiindyo ̱ manquiiti na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me ; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseiljo tsˈaⁿ na majño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , ja matseiljo tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na matseiljo ja , matseiljo tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nqueⁿ na jñoom ja .

text: When Jesus had thus said , he was troubled in spirit , and testified , and said , Verily , verily , I say unto you , that one of you shall betray me .
text2: Jnda ̱ na tso Jesús ñˈoomwaaˈ , seiˈndaaˈnaˈ ntyjeeⁿ , ndoˈ ndyeyu tjeiˈyuuˈñê nda ̱ a ̱ yâ . Tsoom : — Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , cwiindyoˈ ˈo nñequiaa cwenta ja .

text: Then the disciples looked one on another , doubting of whom he spake .
text2: Quia joˈ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tyontyˈiaa ntyja ̱ a ̱ yâ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ . Ee ticalaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ ˈñeeⁿ cwiindyo ̱ jâ na matsoom na luaaˈ nntsˈaa .

text: Now there was leaning on Jesus ' bosom one of his disciples , whom Jesus loved .
text2: Xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ ja Juan na jeeⁿ candyaˈ tsˈom Jesús , mawacatya ̱ ⁿ nacañomˈm na cwicwaaˈâ .

text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him , that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake .
text2: Ndoˈ Simón Pedro sˈo ̱ o ̱ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na cwaxˈa ̱ ˈndyoo Jesús cwaaⁿ cwiindyo ̱ jâ na nñequiaa cwenta jom .

text: He then lying on Jesus ' breast saith unto him , Lord , who is it ?
text2: Joˈ chii seintyjo ̱ ndyo ̱ jo ndoˈ jndya Jesús , taxˈa ̱ ya nnoom , tsjo ̱ o ̱ : — Aa ndiˈ Ta , ¿ ˈñeeⁿ cwii jâ na nntsˈaa na ljoˈ ?

text: Jesus answered , He it is , to whom I shall give a sop , when I have dipped it . And when he had dipped the sop , he gave it to Judas Iscariot , the son of Simon .
text2: Tˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ , tsoom : — Majuu tsˈaⁿ na nnom nñequiaya cwii taⁿˈ tyooˈ xjeⁿ na jnda ̱ seicandaˈa juunaˈ . Ndoˈ quia na jnda ̱ seicanaⁿˈaⁿ tyooˈñeeⁿ tquiaaⁿ juunaˈ nnom Judas Iscariote , jnda Simón .

text: And after the sop Satan entered into him . Then said Jesus unto him , That thou doest , do quickly .
text2: Ndoˈ Judas , jnda ̱ na toˈñoom taⁿˈ tyooˈñeeⁿ , mana tuo ̱ Satanás quiiˈ tsˈoom . Ndoˈ tso Jesús nnoom : — Queⁿndyuˈ tsˈiaaⁿ na nntsaˈ .

text: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ meiⁿcwiindyo ̱ jâ na meindyuaandyô ̱ nacañoomˈ meiⁿsa ñˈeⁿñê tîcalaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ chiuu na luaaˈ ñˈoom tsoom .

text: For some of them thought , because Judas had the bag , that Jesus had said unto him , Buy those things that we have need of against the feast ; or , that he should give something to the poor .
text2: Ndoˈ ee na manquiuuyâ na Judas maleiñˈoom tjaⁿche na ñjom sˈom na cwiwilˈueeˈndyô ̱ , joˈ chii ntˈomndyo ̱ jâ jlaˈtiuuyâ na ñeˈcatso Jesús nnoom na catseijnaaⁿ ljoˈtindyo na macaⁿnaˈ na nleilˈueeˈndyô ̱ na waa xuee , oo quiaaⁿ cwantindyo nda ̱ a ̱ ndyeñeeⁿˈ .

text: He then having received the sop went immediately out : and it was night .
text2: Ndoˈ jnda ̱ na tcwaˈ Judas tyooˈñeeⁿ , mañoomˈ jlueeⁿˈeⁿ . Juu xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ̱ teijaaⁿ .

text: Therefore , when he was gone out , Jesus said , Now is the Son of man glorified , and God is glorified in him .
text2: Jnda ̱ na jluiˈ Judas quiiˈntaaⁿyâ , matso Jesús nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Jeˈ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , manntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ ja . Ndoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ ljoˈ na manntjo ̱ ⁿya nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom .

text: If God be glorified in him , God shall also glorify him in himself , and shall straightway glorify him .
text2: Ndoˈ xeⁿ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ jom cantyja na manntjo ̱ ⁿ , quia joˈ mati cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ joˈ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñê ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈaⁿ na jnaⁿ cañoomˈluee , ndoˈ tyuaaˈ nntsˈaaⁿ na ljoˈ .

text: Little children , yet a little while I am with you . Ye shall seek me : and as I said unto the Jews , Whither I go , ye cannot come ; so now I say to you .
text2: ˈO ntseindaaya na jeeⁿ wiˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , chjootindyo cwii mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Nlˈueˈyoˈ ja , ndoˈ chaˈxjeⁿ tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos , jeˈ mati matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈ ˈo : ˈO xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntsquieˈcañomˈyoˈ yuu na nncjo ̱ .

text: A new commandment I give unto you , That ye love one another ; as I have loved you , that ye also love one another .
text2: Cwii ñˈoom xco na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ mañequiaya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , na cˈomˈyoˈ na wiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ . Chaˈxjeⁿ na mˈaaⁿya na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo , malaaˈtiˈ cˈomˈ ˈo na wiˈ nˈomˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ .

text: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples , if ye have love one to another .
text2: Na nlˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈ chaˈtsondye nnˈaⁿ na ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilajomndyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , xeⁿ mˈaⁿˈyoˈ na wiˈ nˈomˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ .

text: Simon Peter said unto him , Lord , whither goest thou ? Jesus answered him , Whither I go , thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards .
text2: Taxˈeeñe Simón Pedro nnoom . Matso : — Ta , ¿ yuu wjaˈyuˈ ? Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : — Cantyja na nntjo ̱ ⁿ jeˈ ˈu xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntseijomndyuˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ mati ˈu nncueˈntyjo ̱ nntjomˈ na ljoˈ .

text: Peter said unto him , Lord , why cannot I follow thee now ? I will lay down my life for thy sake .
text2: Matso Pedro nnoom : — Ta , ¿ chiuu na xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntseijomndyo ̱ jeˈ ljoˈ na nntjomˈ ? Tintsˈaa meiiⁿ quio joˈ cˈio ̱ .

text: Jesus answered him , Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake ? Verily , verily , I say unto thee , The cock shall not crow , till thou hast denied me thrice .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : ˈU matseiˈtiuuˈ na nñequiaandyuˈ na nncˈioˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya . Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ njomˈ , cwii tjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nntseixuaa caxtijndyo na jaawixuee , sa ̱ a ̱ ˈu jnda ̱ ndyee ndiiˈ macwjiˈndyuˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in God , believe also in me .
text2: Tiñeˈquiandyoˈ na nntseiñˈeeⁿˈñenaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . Calaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom ndoˈ mati calaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja .

text: In my Father ' s house are many mansions : if it were not so , I would have told you . I go to prepare a place for you .
text2: Naquiiˈ waaˈ Tsotya ̱ ya jndye joo niom yuu na ya nncˈom nnˈaⁿ . Xeⁿ nchii na luaaˈ waa , jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . Manncjo ̱ na nntseijndaaˈndyo ̱ joonaˈ na nleilˈueeˈndyoˈ .

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you , I will come again , and receive you unto myself ; that where I am , there ye may be also .
text2: Ndoˈ na jo ̱ na nntseijndaaˈndyo ̱ yuu na nncˈomˈyoˈ , nndyo ̱ lcwa ̱ ˈnndaˈa na nncjo ̱ cho ̱ ˈo yuu na mˈaaⁿya , cha yuu na macˈa ̱ ⁿya , majoˈ nncˈomˈyoˈ .

text: And whither I go ye know , and the way ye know .
text2: Ndoˈ ˈo manquiuˈyoˈ yuu na majo ̱ ndoˈ mati cwitaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ nato .

text: Thomas saith unto him , Lord , we know not whither thou goest ; and how can we know the way ?
text2: Matso Tomás nnoom : — ˈU Ta , ticaliuuyâ yuu wjaˈ , joˈ chii ¿ chiuu ya na nlaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ yuu waa natoˈñeeⁿ ?

text: Jesus saith unto him , I am the way , the truth , and the life : no man cometh unto the Father , but by me .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús , matsoom nnom : — Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ nato , ndoˈ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ , ndoˈ na tijoom cwintycwii na wandoˈ tsˈaⁿ . Ñequiiˈcheⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿ ja joˈ na nnda ̱ a ̱ nncueeˈ tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya .

text: If ye had known me , ye should have known my Father also : and from henceforth ye know him , and have seen him .
text2: Xeⁿ na cwilaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ ˈñeeⁿ cwiluiindyo ̱ , quia joˈ mati nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tsotya ̱ . Na jeˈ na cwii wjaatinaˈ ncˈe na cwitaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ ja , mati cwitaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ jom , ndoˈ jnda ̱ ntyˈiaˈnda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ jom .

text: Philip saith unto him , Lord , shew us the Father , and it sufficeth us .
text2: Matso Felipe nnoom : — Ta , quiaaˈ na nntyˈiaanda ̱ a ̱ yâ Tsotyeˈ , quialjoˈcheⁿ nljoya nˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ .

text: Jesus saith unto him , Have I been so long time with you , and yet hast thou not known me , Philip ? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; and how sayest thou then , Shew us the Father ?
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom : — Chiuu sa ˈu Felipe , jaachˈee xuee mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ , ¿ aa maxjeⁿ ticwajnaⁿˈ ja ? Tsˈaⁿ na jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaˈ ja , mati jnda ̱ ntyˈiaaⁿˈaⁿ Tsotya ̱ . ¿ Chiuu na matsuˈ : “ Quiaaˈ na nntyˈiaanda ̱ a ̱ yâ Tsotyeˈ ” ?

text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father , and the Father in me ? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me , he doeth the works .
text2: ¿ Aa ticatseiyuˈ na ljoˈyu cwiluiindyo ̱ ñequio Tsotya ̱ ya , ndoˈ jom ljoˈyu cwiluiiñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja ? Ñˈoom na matseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , nchii matseina ̱ ⁿya joonaˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ na jndo ̱ ˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nnco ̱ . Nquii Tsotya ̱ na ñequiiˈcheⁿ mˈaaⁿñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , nqueⁿ machˈeeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: Believe me that I am in the Father , and the Father in me : or else believe me for the very works ' sake .
text2: Calaˈyuˈyoˈ na ljoˈyu cwiluiindyo ̱ ñequio Tsotya ̱ , ndoˈ Tsotya ̱ ya ljoˈyu cwiluiiñê ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ja . Xeⁿ tileicalaˈyuˈyoˈ na ljoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ quiandyoˈ na nlaˈyuˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ cantyja ˈnaaⁿ mañejoo tsˈiaaⁿmeiiⁿ na matsˈaa .

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , He that believeth on me , the works that I do shall he do also ; and greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , ˈñeeⁿ juu tsˈaⁿ na matseiyuˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , mañejoo tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa nntsˈaaⁿ . Hasta jndaticheⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ nntsˈaaⁿ , ncˈe na majo ̱ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya .

text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name , that will I do , that the Father may be glorified in the Son .
text2: Ndoˈ meiⁿcwiˈñeeⁿcheⁿ ñˈoom na nntaⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tsotya ̱ ñequio xueya , joˈ joˈ nñequia cha na catseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ jom cantyja ˈnaⁿ ja na cwiluiindyo ̱ Jnaaⁿ .

text: If ye shall ask any thing in my name , I will do it .
text2: Chaˈtso na cwitaⁿˈyoˈ ñequio xueya , joˈ joˈ nntsˈaa .

text: If ye love me , keep my commandments .
text2: ’ Xeⁿ mˈaⁿˈyoˈ na jnda nquiuˈyoˈ ja , quia joˈ calaˈcanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿ .

text: And I will pray the Father , and he shall give you another Comforter , that he may abide with you for ever ;
text2: Ndoˈ ja nlcaaⁿˈa nnom Tsotya ̱ ya na nñequiaaⁿ cwiicheⁿ na nnteijndeii ˈo , nquii Espíritu na cwiluiiñe na mayuuˈ na ñequiiˈcheⁿ nncˈoomñe ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: Even the Spirit of truth ; whom the world cannot receive , because it seeth him not , neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you , and shall be in you .
text2: Nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancue xocanda ̱ a ̱ nntoˈñoomna jom , ee tyoontyˈiaana jom , meiⁿ ticataˈjnaaⁿˈna jom . Sa ̱ a ̱ ˈo cwitaˈjnaⁿˈyoˈ jom , ee mˈaaⁿñê naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , ndoˈ ñequiiˈcheⁿ nncˈoomñê ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you .
text2: Tixocaˈndiya ˈo na macanda ̱ , maxjeⁿ nncwja ̱ nndaˈa na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: Yet a little while , and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .
text2: Mawaa xjeⁿ na nlaˈcueeˈ nnˈaⁿ ja , ndoˈ jnda ̱ joˈ taxocantyˈiaana ja . Sa ̱ a ̱ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ ˈo ñequiiˈcheⁿ na nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya , ee ncˈe na nncwando ̱ ˈxco ̱ , joˈ chii mati ˈo nlaxmaⁿˈyoˈ na ticantycwii na nntandoˈyoˈ .

text: At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father , and ye in me , and I in you .
text2: Quia na jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ nlaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿ Tsotya ̱ , ndoˈ ˈo mˈaⁿˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ndoˈ ja mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: He that hath my commandments , and keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father , and I will love him , and will manifest myself to him .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu na matseiljo ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿ ndoˈ matseicanda ̱ joonaˈ , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jnda ntyjeeⁿ ja . Ndoˈ ˈñeeⁿ juu na jnda ntyjii ja , nquii Tsotya ̱ ya candyaˈ tsˈoom juu . Ndoˈ mati ja candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya juu , ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya cantyja ˈnaⁿya nnom .

text: Judas saith unto him , not Iscariot , Lord , how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us , and not unto the world ?
text2: Tsaⁿ na jndyu Judas , sa ̱ a ̱ nchii Judas Iscariote , matso : — Ta , ¿ chiuu na cweˈ nda ̱ a ̱ jâ mˈmo ̱ ⁿˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿˈ sa ̱ a ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue xocatsaˈ na ljoˈ ?

text: Jesus answered and said unto him , If a man love me , he will keep my words : and my Father will love him , and we will come unto him , and make our abode with him .
text2: Tˈo ̱ Jesús nnom , matsoom : — ˈÑeeⁿ juu na jnda ntyjii ja maxjeⁿ nntseiñˈoomˈñe ñˈoom na maqua ̱ ⁿ . Nncˈoom Tsotya ̱ na candyaˈ tsˈoom tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ , ndoˈ nntsquia ̱ caño ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ juu . Nncˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿyâ ñˈeⁿñe .

text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : and the word which ye hear is not mine , but the Father ' s which sent me .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu na ticajnda ntyjii ja , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ tiñeˈcatseicana ̱ a ̱ ⁿ ñˈoom na mañequiaya . Ndoˈ ñˈoom na matseina ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ nchii ñˈoom ˈndyo ̱ nnco ̱ ya . Matseixmaⁿnaˈ ñˈoom ˈndyoo Tsotya ̱ ya ee jom jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , being yet present with you .
text2: ’ Ñˈoommeiⁿˈ matseina ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ yocheⁿ na ndicwaⁿ mˈaaⁿndyo ̱ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: But the Comforter , which is the Holy Ghost , whom the Father will send in my name , he shall teach you all things , and bring all things to your remembrance , whatsoever I have said unto you .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ja nlcaaⁿˈa nnom Tsotya ̱ ya na njñoom Espíritu Santo na nnteijndeii ˈo . Juu mˈmo ̱ ⁿti ñˈoom nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ na macaⁿnaˈ na nliuˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ nntsˈaa na nncjaañjoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ chaˈtso ñˈoom na jnda ̱ ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: Peace I leave with you , my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth , give I unto you . Let not your heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid .
text2: ’ Ja tjaaˈnaⁿ ñomtiuu tseixmaⁿya . Mañequiaya na calaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ juunaˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . Juu na mañequia na cwicandaˈyoˈ tˈmaⁿti tseixmaⁿnaˈ , nchiiti juu na tjaa ñomtiuu cˈom nnˈaⁿ na mañequiaa tsjoomnancue . Tiñeˈquiandyoˈ na nntseiñˈeeⁿˈñenaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ljoˈ cwii nntjomˈyoˈ meiⁿ tilaˈcatyuendyoˈ .

text: Ye have heard how I said unto you , I go away , and come again unto you . If ye loved me , ye would rejoice , because I said , I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I .
text2: Jnda ̱ jndyeˈyoˈ na tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , majo ̱ , sa ̱ a ̱ nndyo ̱ nndaˈa na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ . Xeⁿ na mayuuˈ jnda nqiuˈyoˈ ja , quia joˈ nñequiaanaˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ meiiⁿ na tsjo ̱ o ̱ na majo ̱ ee na mˈaaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ya jo ̱ . Jom tˈmaⁿti cwiluiiñê , nchiiti ja .

text: And now I have told you before it come to pass , that , when it is come to pass , ye might believe .
text2: Ndoˈ jeˈ cwitjo ̱ o ̱ cheⁿ na nluii na ljoˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , cha quia na jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ juunaˈ quia joˈ nlaˈyuˈyoˈ .

text: Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince of this world cometh , and hath nothing in me .
text2: ’ Tajndye cwimatseina ̱ ⁿtya ̱ ya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ , ee mandyo nquii na cwiluiitquieñe quiiˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancuewaañe . Sa ̱ a ̱ tjaa meiⁿcwii na matseixmaⁿya na juu joˈ nnda ̱ a ̱ nleilˈueeˈñe na catˈuiinaˈ ja .

text: But that the world may know that I love the Father ; and as the Father gave me commandment , even so I do . Arise , let us go hence .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cha nncˈooliu nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue na mˈaaⁿya na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya Tsotya ̱ , ndoˈ na matseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyo ̱ chaˈtso na matsa ̱ ˈntjoom ja , mañequiaandyo ̱ na nncˈio ̱ . Quicantyjaˈyoˈ , cjaaya , caluiiˈa ñjaaⁿñe .

text: I am the true vine , and my Father is the husbandman .
text2: ’ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ntjom na mayuuˈ ndoˈ Tsotya ̱ ya cwiluiiñê tsˈaⁿ na mateixˈee juunaˈ .

text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : and every branch that beareth fruit , he purgeth it , that it may bring forth more fruit .
text2: Matyjeeⁿ meiⁿnquia lˈo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ˈñeeⁿ na tyoolˈanaˈ ta ̱ . Sa ̱ a ̱ ticwii lˈo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ˈñeeⁿ na cwilˈanaˈ ta ̱ , matyjeeⁿ nqueⁿnaˈ cha majndyeti ta ̱ calˈanaˈ .

text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you .
text2: Mati joo ñˈoom na maˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ maqueⁿljuˈnaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ cha ya nlˈaˈyoˈ tsˈiaaⁿ ˈnaⁿya .

text: Abide in me , and I in you . As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself , except it abide in the vine ; no more can ye , except ye abide in me .
text2: Joˈ chii caljooˈndyoˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , chaˈxjeⁿ macwiljooˈndyo ̱ tya ̱ ⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ . Ee chaˈxjeⁿ tsˈo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ xonda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa cheⁿnquiinaˈ ta ̱ xeⁿ ticatˈuiinaˈ nquii tsˈo ̱ o ̱ , majoˈti cantyja ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ , meiⁿ xocatsˈaanaˈ na nncueˈ ta ̱ nlˈaˈyoˈ xeⁿ ticaljooˈndyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: I am the vine , ye are the branches : He that abideth in me , and I in him , the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me ye can do nothing .
text2: ’ Ja cwiluiindyo ̱ xˈee tsˈo ̱ o ̱ , ndoˈ ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ lˈo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ . ˈÑeeⁿ cwii ˈo na tyeⁿ matseijomñe cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ndoˈ na cwiljooˈndyo ̱ ñˈeⁿñe , tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ jndye chaˈcwijom ta ̱ nncueˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ xeⁿ na nnto ̱ ⁿˈñe cantyja ˈnaⁿya , tjaaˈnaⁿ ljoˈ cwii nnda ̱ a ̱ nntsˈaa .

text: If a man abide not in me , he is cast forth as a branch , and is withered ; and men gather them , and cast them into the fire , and they are burned .
text2: ˈÑeeⁿ juu na ticaljooˈñe cantyja ˈnaⁿya , nntquieˈnaˈ juu chaˈxjeⁿ cwityeⁿnquieˈ lˈo ̱ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ , ndoˈ joˈ joˈ cwicaaⁿnaˈ . Jnda ̱ chii cwicajñeeⁿˈ nnˈaⁿ lˈo ̱ o ̱ ˈñeeⁿ , cwitioomna joonaˈ quiiˈ chom .

text: If ye abide in me , and my words abide in you , ye shall ask what ye will , and it shall be done unto you .
text2: ’ Xeⁿ cwilaˈjomndyoˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , meiⁿ ticatsuuˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ñˈoom na mañequiaya , quia joˈ cataⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom chaˈtso na lˈue nˈomˈyoˈ , ndoˈ nñequiaaⁿ .

text: Herein is my Father glorified , that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my disciples .
text2: Luaa waa na matseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ Tsotya ̱ ya , na cantyja ˈnaⁿˈyoˈ jndye ta ̱ nncueˈ . Ee laaˈtiˈ mˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na mayuuˈcheⁿ cwilaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyoˈ ñequio ñˈoom na mañequia .

text: As the Father hath loved me , so have I loved you : continue ye in my love .
text2: Chaˈxjeⁿ juu Tsotya ̱ ya candyaˈ tsˈoom ja , mati ja candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo . Joˈ chii caljooˈndyoˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ cantyja na mˈaaⁿya na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo .

text: If ye keep my commandments , ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father ' s commandments , and abide in his love .
text2: Ja matseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyo ̱ ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjom Tsotya ̱ , ndoˈ cwiljooˈndyo ̱ cantyja na candyaˈ tsˈoom ja . Ñequiiˈcheⁿ calaˈcanda ̱ ˈyoˈ ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo , ee na nlˈaˈyoˈ na ljoˈ , nljooˈndyoˈtyeⁿˈyoˈ cantyja na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that my joy might remain in you , and that your joy might be full .
text2: ’ Ñˈoommeiiⁿ matseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cha nlaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ndoˈ cha canda ̱ a ̱ ˈya nncˈomˈyoˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ . Hasta quiaanaˈ na waljooˈcheⁿ na neiⁿˈyoˈ na cwilaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyoˈ yuu na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya .

text: This is my commandment , That ye love one another , as I have loved you .
text2: Luaa waa ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿ : Cˈomˈyoˈ na wiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ , chaˈxjeⁿ mˈaaⁿya na candyaˈ tsˈo ̱ o ̱ ⁿya ˈo .

text: Greater love hath no man than this , that a man lay down his life for his friends .
text2: Tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii na tˈmaⁿti na maˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ na wiˈ tsˈom tsˈaⁿ ncˈiaaˈ chaˈna juu tsˈaⁿ na nñequiaañe na cueˈ cwentaa ncˈiaaˈ .

text: Ye are my friends , if ye do whatsoever I command you .
text2: ˈO cwiluiindyoˈ ncˈiaya xeⁿ cwilaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyoˈ na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo .

text: Henceforth I call you not servants ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you .
text2: Jeˈ tacatsjo ̱ o ̱ tya ̱ ya na ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ moso . Ee tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ moso ticaljeiiⁿ ljoˈ matseijndaaˈñe patrom ˈnaaⁿˈaⁿ . Jeˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya na ˈo cwiluiindyoˈ nnˈaⁿ na ya ñˈoom ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ ee jnda ̱ tquiaya na caliuˈyoˈ chaˈtso ñˈoom na jnda ̱ jndiiya ˈndyoo Tsotya ̱ ya .

text: Ye have not chosen me , but I have chosen you , and ordained you , that ye should go and bring forth fruit , and that your fruit should remain : that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name , he may give it you .
text2: ˈO nchii tjeiiˈndyoˈ na nlaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , nnco ̱ tjeiiˈndyo ̱ ˈo , ndoˈ jnda ̱ tyˈio ̱ ⁿya tsˈiaaⁿ ˈo na catsaˈyoˈ ndoˈ calˈaˈyoˈ yuu na ñenquiiˈcheⁿ nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñenaˈ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ee na ljoˈ nlˈaˈyoˈ meiⁿquia ñˈoom na ntaⁿˈyoˈ nnom Tsotya ̱ ñequio xueya , jom nñequiaaⁿ .

text: These things I command you , that ye love one another .
text2: Luaa ñˈoom na matsa ̱ ˈntjo ̱ ⁿya ˈo : Cˈomˈyoˈ na wiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ncˈiaaˈyoˈ .

text: If the world hate you , ye know that it hated me before it hated you .
text2: ’ Quia ticueeˈ nˈom nnˈaⁿ tsjoomnancue ˈo , calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ na ja tyuaaˈti tˈomna na ticueeˈ nˈomna .

text: If ye were of the world , the world would love his own : but because ye are not of the world , but I have chosen you out of the world , therefore the world hateth you .
text2: Xeⁿ cwilaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancue , nnˈaⁿ cwentaaˈnaˈ nncˈomna na neiiⁿna ˈo chaˈxjeⁿ na neiiⁿna ncˈiaana , sa ̱ a ̱ ncˈe jnda ̱ tjeiiˈa ˈo quiiˈntaaⁿna , joˈ chii ticalaˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancue , ndoˈ joˈ na jndoo nnˈaⁿ ˈo .

text: Remember the word that I said unto you , The servant is not greater than his lord . If they have persecuted me , they will also persecute you ; if they have kept my saying , they will keep yours also .
text2: Cjaañjoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ñˈoom na jnda ̱ ñetsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , na juu tsˈaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ moso ticaluiitˈmaⁿñê chaˈxjeⁿ nquii tsˈaⁿ na matsa ̱ ˈntjom jom . Ncˈe na cwitaˈwiˈ nnˈaⁿ ja , mati nntaˈwiˈna ˈo . Ndoˈ xeⁿ cwilaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena ñˈoom na mañequiaya , quia joˈ mati nlaˈcanda ̱ a ̱ ˈndyena ñˈoom na nñeˈquiaˈyoˈ .

text: But all these things will they do unto you for my name ' s sake , because they know not him that sent me .
text2: Chaˈtso nmeiⁿˈ nlˈana ˈo cweˈ ncˈe na laˈxmaⁿˈyoˈ cwentaya ee ticataˈjnaaⁿˈna nqueⁿ na jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿna .

text: If I had not come and spoken unto them , they had not had sin : but now they have no cloke for their sin .
text2: ’ Xeⁿ nchii na jndyotseina ̱ ⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ na , quia joˈ tixocwijndaaˈ na laˈxmaⁿna jnaⁿ . Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ tixocanda ̱ a ̱ nluena na ticaliuna na cwilaˈtjo ̱ o ̱ ndyena nnoom .

text: He that hateth me hateth my Father also .
text2: Ee ˈñeeⁿ juu na jndooˈ ja , mati jndooˈ tsaⁿˈñeeⁿ nqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê Tsotya ̱ .

text: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did , they had not had sin : but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father .
text2: Tijoom ñesˈaa cwiicheⁿ tsˈaⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ quiiˈntaaⁿ nnˈaⁿ chaˈxjeⁿ tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa . Xeⁿ na nchii tsˈiaaⁿmeiⁿˈ matsˈaa , quia joˈ tixocwijndaaˈ na cwilaˈtjo ̱ o ̱ ndyena nnoom , sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ meiiⁿ na jnda ̱ ñentyˈiaana tsˈiaaⁿ na matsˈaa cantyjati xjeⁿ na to ̱ ˈa , mˈaⁿna na jndoona ja ndoˈ mati nqueⁿ na cwiluiiñê Tsotya ̱ .

text: But this cometh to pass , that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law , They hated me without a cause .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ luaaˈ waa cha catseicanda ̱ a ̱ ˈñenaˈ ñˈoom na teiljeii naquiiˈ ljeii na cwileiˈñˈomna na matsa ̱ ˈntjomnaˈ , na matsonaˈ : “ Jndoona ja meiiⁿ tjaaˈnaⁿ cwii nnom cantyja ˈnaⁿya na matseijndaaˈñenaˈ na nlˈana na ljoˈ . ”

text: But when the Comforter is come , whom I will send unto you from the Father , even the Spirit of truth , which proceedeth from the Father , he shall testify of me :
text2: ’ Ja nlcaaⁿˈa nnom Tsotya ̱ na cajñoom Espíritu na cwiluiiñe na mayuuˈ naquiiˈ nˈomˈyoˈ . Quia na jnda ̱ tyjeeⁿˈeⁿ nncwjiˈyuuˈñê cantyja ˈnaⁿya .

text: And ye also shall bear witness , because ye have been with me from the beginning .
text2: Ndoˈ mati ˈo nntjeiˈyuuˈndyoˈ cantyja ˈnaⁿya , ee mˈaⁿˈyoˈ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ xjeⁿ na to ̱ ˈjndya ̱ a ̱ tsˈiaaⁿmeiiⁿ .

text: These things have I spoken unto you , that ye should not be offended .
text2: Matso Jesús : — Ñˈoommeiⁿˈ jnda ̱ seina ̱ ⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cha tintseiquiaanaˈ ˈo .

text: They shall put you out of the synagogues : yea , the time cometh , that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service .
text2: Ee nntjeiiˈ nnˈaⁿ judíos ˈo naquiiˈ lanˈom ˈnaaⁿna . Ndoˈ manncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na meiⁿquiandyo tsˈaⁿ na nntseicueeˈ cwii ˈo nntseitiuutoom na mandiˈntjoom nnom Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom na ljoˈ nntsˈaaⁿ .

text: And these things will they do unto you , because they have not known the Father , nor me .
text2: Nmeiiⁿˈ nlˈana cweˈ ncˈe tîcalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ Tsotya ̱ , meiⁿ cantyja ˈnaⁿ ja .

text: But these things have I told you , that when the time shall come , ye may remember that I told you of them . And these things I said not unto you at the beginning , because I was with you .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ ya ñˈoommeiⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ cha quia na nncueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ nncjaañjoomˈ nˈomˈyoˈ ñˈoom na jnda ̱ tsjo ̱ o ̱ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ . ’ Tîcatsjo ̱ o ̱ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ quia na to ̱ ˈjndya ̱ a ̱ tsˈiaaⁿ na maleiñˈo ̱ ⁿya ncˈe mˈaaⁿya ñˈeⁿndyoˈ .

text: But now I go my way to him that sent me ; and none of you asketh me , Whither goest thou ?
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ jeˈ majo ̱ lcwa ̱ ˈa na mˈaaⁿ nqueⁿ na jñoom ja quiiˈntaaⁿˈyoˈ , ndoˈ meiⁿcwii ˈo tyoowaxeˈ no ̱ o ̱ ⁿ yuu jo ̱ .

text: But because I have said these things unto you , sorrow hath filled your heart .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ cweˈ ee na tsjo ̱ o ̱ ñˈoommeiⁿˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , joˈ na jeeⁿ ndyaˈ chjooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ .

text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth ; It is expedient for you that I go away : for if I go not away , the Comforter will not come unto you ; but if I depart , I will send him unto you .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ ñˈoom na mayuuˈ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , maxjeⁿ nnteijndeiitinaˈ ˈo xeⁿ jo ̱ ya . Ee xeⁿ ticjo ̱ , nqueⁿ na nnteijneiⁿ ˈo ndoˈ na nñequiaaⁿ na tˈmaⁿ nˈomˈyoˈ tixocwjeeˈcañoom ˈo . Ndoˈ na nncjo ̱ , njño ̱ o ̱ ⁿya jom na nñoom na mˈaⁿˈyoˈ .

text: And when he is come , he will reprove the world of sin , and of righteousness , and of judgment :
text2: Ee quia na jnda ̱ tyjeeˈcañoom , nntsˈaaⁿ na nlcoˈtianaˈ nquiu nnˈaⁿ na laˈxmaⁿna jnaⁿ ndoˈ na calaˈno ̱ ⁿˈna na cˈomna cantyja na matyˈiomyanaˈ ndoˈ na nncuˈxeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom joona .

text: Of sin , because they believe not on me ;
text2: Mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ na laˈxmaⁿ nnˈaⁿ jnaⁿ cweˈ ncˈe na tiñeˈcalaˈyuˈna ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ .

text: Of righteousness , because I go to my Father , and ye see me no more ;
text2: Ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chiuu waa na matyˈiomyanaˈ na cˈomna ncˈe jo ̱ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotya ̱ ndoˈ taxocantyˈiaatina ja .

text: Of judgment , because the prince of this world is judged .
text2: Mˈmo ̱ o ̱ ⁿ chiuu na nncuˈxeⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom nnˈaⁿ ee na jnda ̱ tuˈxeⁿñe nquii na cwiluiitquieñe tsjoomnancuewaañe .

text: I have yet many things to say unto you , but ye cannot bear them now .
text2: ’ Ndoˈ niom jndye ntˈomcheⁿ ñˈoom na macaⁿnaˈ na catsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ tileicalaˈno ̱ ⁿˈyoˈ joo ñˈoomˈñeeⁿ jeˈ .

text: Howbeit when he , the Spirit of truth , is come , he will guide you into all truth : for he shall not speak of himself ; but whatsoever he shall hear , that shall he speak : and he will shew you things to come .
text2: Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na nncwjeeˈcañoom juu Espíritu na cwiluiiñe na mayuuˈ , juu nncjaaˈmo ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ chaˈtso ñˈoom na mayuuˈ ee nchii nntseineiⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ nquii , nntseineiⁿ ticwii cwii ñˈoom na mandii na matseineiⁿ Tyˈo ̱ o ̱ tsˈom . Ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ ⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ ˈnaⁿ na quia nluii .

text: He shall glorify me : for he shall receive of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Juu nntseitˈmaaⁿˈñe ja , ee nncoˈñom chaˈtso ñˈoom na ñeˈcatseicandiiya ˈo , ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ ⁿ joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: All things that the Father hath are mine : therefore said I , that he shall take of mine , and shall shew it unto you .
text2: Chaˈtso na matseixmaⁿ cwentaaˈ Tsotya ̱ ya macwentaya joonaˈ . Cweˈ ncˈe joˈ na tsjo ̱ o ̱ na nncoˈñom juu Espíritu chaˈtso ñˈoom na ñeˈcatseicandiiya ˈo ndoˈ mˈmo ̱ ⁿ joonaˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ .

text: A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me , because I go to the Father .
text2: ’ Chjootindyo cwii ñˈa ̱ ⁿtya ̱ ñˈeⁿndyoˈ , ndoˈ jnda ̱ joˈ taxocantyˈiaˈyoˈ ja . Ndoˈ nda ̱ nquia chjootindyo cwii nntyˈiaˈtiˈyoˈ ja , cweˈ ncˈe nncjo ̱ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotya ̱ .

text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves , What is this that he saith unto us , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me : and , Because I go to the Father ?
text2: Jnda ̱ tsoom ñˈoommeiⁿˈ cwantindyô ̱ jâ nnˈaⁿ na cwilaˈjomndyô ̱ ñˈeⁿñê tsˈiaaⁿ na machˈeeⁿ lˈuuyâ nda ̱ a ̱ ntyja ̱ a ̱ yâ : — ¿ Chiuu ñecaˈmo ̱ ⁿ ñˈoomwaaˈ na matseineiiⁿ nda ̱ a ̱ yâ , na chjootindyo cwii ñˈeⁿtyeeⁿ ñˈeⁿndyo ̱ , ndoˈ xeⁿ jnda ̱ cheⁿ taxocantyˈiaaˈya jom , ndoˈ nda ̱ nquia joˈ chjootindyo cwii nntyˈianndaˈa jom ? Ndoˈ na tsoom cweˈ ncˈe na wjaⁿ na mˈaaⁿ Tsotyeeⁿ .

text: They said therefore , What is this that he saith , A little while ? we cannot tell what he saith .
text2: Lˈuutya ̱ a ̱ yâ : — Juu ñˈoomwaaˈ na chjootindyo na tsoom , ¿ ljoˈ ñeˈcaˈmo ̱ ⁿnaˈ ? Ticalaˈno ̱ o ̱ ⁿˈâ ñˈoom na matseineiiⁿ .

text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him , and said unto them , Do ye inquire among yourselves of that I said , A little while , and ye shall not see me : and again , a little while , and ye shall see me ?
text2: Ndoˈ seiˈno ̱ ⁿˈ Jesús na ñeˈcataˈxˈeendyo ̱ tya ̱ a ̱ yâ ñˈoomwaaˈ nnoom . Quia joˈ matsoom nda ̱ a ̱ yâ : — ¿ Aa cwitaˈxeˈyoˈ nda ̱ a ̱ ntyjeeˈyoˈ cantyja ñˈoommeiⁿˈ na matsjo ̱ o ̱ na chjootindyo meiⁿ taxocantyˈiaˈyoˈ ja , ndoˈ nda ̱ nquiacheⁿ na chjootindyo quia joˈ nntyˈiaˈnndaˈyoˈ ja ?

text: Verily , verily , I say unto you , That ye shall weep and lament , but the world shall rejoice : and ye shall be sorrowful , but your sorrow shall be turned into joy .
text2: Ñˈoom na mayuuˈcheⁿ matsjo ̱ o ̱ ya nda ̱ a ̱ ˈyoˈ , joo nnˈaⁿ na mˈaⁿ cantyja ˈnaaⁿˈ tsjoomnancue , ñequio na neiiⁿna nntyˈiaana ljoˈ nntjo ̱ ⁿ . ˈNaⁿ na nntjo ̱ ⁿ nntsˈaanaˈ na ˈo nntyueeˈyoˈ na matseichjooˈnaˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ juu na chjooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , xeⁿ jnda ̱ cheⁿ nntseicwaqueⁿnaˈ na nncˈoomˈyoˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ .

text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow , because her hour is come : but as soon as she is delivered of the child , she remembereth no more the anguish , for joy that a man is born into the world .
text2: Manquiuˈyoˈ cwii yuscu quia manntseincuii , maquiinaˈ juu , cweˈ ee jnda ̱ tueˈntyjo ̱ xjeⁿ na nntseincuii . Sa ̱ a ̱ quia na jnda ̱ tuiiñe yuˈndaa , cwitsuuˈ tsˈoom na tquiinaˈ jom , ee mˈaaⁿ na neiiⁿˈeⁿ na jnda ̱ tuiiñe yuˈndaa .

text: And ye now therefore have sorrow : but I will see you again , and your heart shall rejoice , and your joy no man taketh from you .
text2: Maluaaˈ matseijomnaˈ ˈo . Jeˈ mˈaⁿˈyoˈ na chjooˈ nˈomˈyoˈ , sa ̱ a ̱ quia na nntyˈianndaˈa ˈo , quia ljoˈcheⁿ nñequiaanaˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ . Ndoˈ xjeⁿˈñeeⁿ meiⁿcwii tsˈaⁿ xocanda ̱ a ̱ nncwjiˈ na neiⁿˈyoˈ .
